Just a single cable and my power bank is ready to go again. No more fumbling with multiple cables or searching for an elusive wall outlet. This feature alone has saved me from countless moments of despair when I've forgotten to charge my power bank overnight.One of the key aspects I appreciate about Anker is their commitment to safety. The PowerCore Slim 10K comes with multiple safety features, including surge protection, short circuit prevention, and overcharge protection. This gives me peace of mind knowing that my precious devices are safeguarded against any potential mishaps.But let's get to the fun part—the funny moments that this power bank has helped me navigate. Picture this: I'm in the middle of a breathtaking hike, capturing stunning photos of nature's beauty when suddenly, my phone dies. Panic sets in, but then I remember my trusty Anker PowerCore Slim 10K. With a quick connection, my phone starts charging, and I'm back in action, saving the day (and the photos)!Or how about the time I was stuck at an airport during a long layover? I found myself a cozy corner, plugged in my phone to the Anker Portable Charger, and binge-watched my favorite TV series without worrying about draining my battery. The power bank kept me entertained and kept my phone alive throughout the entire layover. It was like having my own personal entertainment station in my backpack.In conclusion, the Anker Portable Charger, 313 Power Bank (PowerCore Slim 10K), is an absolute game-changer. With its massive battery capacity, sleek design, fast charging capabilities, and emphasis on safety, it has become an indispensable companion for all my adventures. From surviving unexpected power outages to ensuring I capture every precious moment, this power bank has proven itself time and time again.So, if you're tired of being at the mercy of low battery warnings and are ready to unleash your inner superhero, I highly recommend the Anker Portable Charger, 313 Power Bank (PowerCore Slim 10K). Say goodbye to battery anxiety and hello to worry-free exploration! Get yours today and experience the magic for yourself.

product_name: Anker Power Bank (PowerCore 10K), Compact Travel-Ready 10,000mAh Battery Pack with PowerIQ Charging Technology, 5V/3A High-Speed Charging, USB-C (In and Out) for iPhone, iPad, Samsung, Pixel, and More
description: Pro: Holds a lot of charge. Was able to fully recharge my iPhone multiple times while camping. Reasonably sized. No issues as a carry-on for flights.Con: Longevity might be an issue. One older unit has failed. All lights continuously illuminated blue, even days after disconnecting from a charging source, until it eventually runs out of power - refuses to charge attached devices.I’ve had a few of these since 2021, purchasing more after a good initial experience. Unfortunately, they might not last. Troubleshooting attempts (long press and loop back) didn’t seem to resolve issue.

product_name: Anker Power Bank (PowerCore 10K), Compact Travel-Ready 10,000mAh Battery Pack with PowerIQ Charging Technology, 5V/3A High-Speed Charging, USB-C (In and Out) for iPhone, iPad, Samsung, Pixel, and More
description: It charges my device for a long time, it's nice and compact and can fit in my pockets. It works really well, and the durability is going well so far too.

product_name: Anker Power Bank (PowerCore 10K), Compact Travel-Ready 10,000mAh Battery Pack with PowerIQ Charging Technology, 5V/3A High-Speed Charging, USB-C (In and Out) for iPhone, iPad, Samsung, Pixel, and More
description: I bought this thing a little while ago now and hadn't yet run into a moment where I had to use it, but I'm thankful to have bought it when I finally needed it. It takes a while to charge the first time, but it holds that charge for a long time. It's super portable and makes it easy to just put it in your purse or bag plugged into your phone and forget about it. A little heavy and roughly the size of my phone (Galaxy Note 9 for reference). It feels solidly constructed. It doesn't support fast charging, but it's not slow either. I highly recommend this, especially for people with older phones, students, and travelers. Even if that isn't you, it's great in case of an emergency or power outage because of how long it stays charged.

product_name: Anker Power Bank (PowerCore 10K), Compact Travel-Ready 10,000mAh Battery Pack with PowerIQ Charging Technology, 5V/3A High-Speed Charging, USB-C (In and Out) for iPhone, iPad, Samsung, Pixel, and More
description: I've been using the Anker Portable Charger with a 10,000 mAh battery pack for several months now, and it has truly exceeded my expectations. Here’s why I think it’s a fantastic choice for anyone looking for reliable portable power:Design and Build Quality:The Anker Power Bank is sleek and compact, fitting comfortably in my pocket or bag without adding too much bulk. The matte finish not only looks stylish but also provides a good grip, which is essential when you're on the move.Capacity and Performance:With a 10,000 mAh capacity, this power bank can charge my smartphone multiple times over. I've found it especially useful during long commutes or when traveling, ensuring I never run out of battery unexpectedly. It charges my devices quickly and efficiently, which is crucial when you're relying on it to keep your devices running.Port Options and Compatibility:I appreciate the inclusion of USB-A and USB-C ports, allowing me to charge multiple devices simultaneously. The USB-C port supports Power Delivery (PD) for fast-charging compatible devices, a huge plus for modern smartphones and tablets.Durability and Reliability:Anker is known for its quality, and this power bank lives up to that reputation. It feels solidly built and has held up well through regular use. I've dropped it a few times (accidentally, of course!), and it hasn't shown any signs of damage.Additional Features:One feature I particularly like is the trickle-charging mode for low-power devices like Bluetooth headphones or fitness trackers. It ensures that smaller devices are charged safely without overloading them.Conclusion:Overall, the Anker Portable Charger Power Bank with a 10,000 mAh battery pack is a fantastic investment for anyone who needs reliable portable power on the go. Its compact design, fast charging capabilities, and solid build quality make it a standout choice in the crowded market of power banks. Whether you're a frequent traveler, a commuter, or just someone who likes to be prepared, this power bank won’t disappoint.

product_name: Anker Power Bank (PowerCore 10K), Compact Travel-Ready 10,000mAh Battery Pack with PowerIQ Charging Technology, 5V/3A High-Speed Charging, USB-C (In and Out) for iPhone, iPad, Samsung, Pixel, and More
description: I recently bought the Anker Portable Charger, and it's been a great asset during my travels. With a 10,000 mAh capacity, this power bank offers substantial power while remaining sleek and lightweight, making it easy to carry around.Battery Life and Charging Capability: The charger’s battery life is commendable, providing multiple recharges for various devices, including android/apple phones and tablets. This makes it a reliable option for long trips when you may not have immediate access to a power source.Size and Portability: The Anker PowerCore Slim 10000 is among one of the slimmest and lightest 10,000mAh chargers available. Its compact design is perfect for travel, ensuring it won’t weigh you down.Charging Speed: While the charger uses Anker’s PowerIQ and VoltageBoost technology for efficient power delivery, it may not charge as quickly as some fast wall chargers. You might find the charging speed a bit slower compared to those high-speed wall chargers, especially if you're accustomed to their rapid performance.Value for Money: This power bank provides solid value for its price. It’s well-built, with useful safety features like overcharge protection and temperature control. However, keep in mind that the USB-C port is for input only, and you can’t use both input ports simultaneously.Final Thoughts: Overall, the Anker Portable Charger is a reliable and portable option for keeping your devices charged while on the move. Its compact size, decent battery life, and efficient charging make it a valuable travel companion. Just be aware that while it offers good performance, it might not match the speed of high-wattage wall chargers.

product_name: Anker Power Bank (PowerCore 10K), Compact Travel-Ready 10,000mAh Battery Pack with PowerIQ Charging Technology, 5V/3A High-Speed Charging, USB-C (In and Out) for iPhone, iPad, Samsung, Pixel, and More
description: It’s a decent power bank for the price for sure, and while I haven’t used it yet, the build quality seems good. However. There is no included instruction manual despite the safety sheet being included (which is required I’m sure), instead the safety sheet has a QR code to go to the manual. I have no real issues with this except I usually ignore the safety sheet.I attempted to charge the bank all day and noticed it didn’t increase at all in charge. Extremely weird. So I found the safety sheet after retrieving it from the trash, looked at the manual and noticed an oddity; the instructions for charging shows a usb-a to usb-c/micro-usb cable. I was using a usb-c to usb-c cable. I also came to the reviews to find some people saying the usb-c is output only (this is false) and they had to use the micro-usb so first I tested a usb-a to micro-usb cable and just like that it worked. But the instructions state that it charges at lower amperage using micro-usb so I wanted to test a usb-a to usb-c cable, and sure enough that worked as well.It’s bonkers to me that it not only doesn’t fast charge, but it outright refuses to charge unless it’s a 5V usb-a to usb-c/micro-usb cable. In a world where micro-usb is on the way out the door, and usb-c to usb-c is used a lot more due to fast charging and it’s just a better interface. None of this should prevent you from buying this, however, as they give you an appropriate cable to charge with and it’s good for what you pay for. I’ve always found Anker products to be respectable as I’ve never had to replace them. I just wish this charged faster and didn’t have this weird restriction on it for charging.Should I have any use problems I’ll be sure to update this or repost it or what-have-you. But I very much doubt that’ll be necessary.

product_name: Anker Power Bank (PowerCore 10K), Compact Travel-Ready 10,000mAh Battery Pack with PowerIQ Charging Technology, 5V/3A High-Speed Charging, USB-C (In and Out) for iPhone, iPad, Samsung, Pixel, and More
description: I bought 2 of these, white and black for my husband and myself for a trip to Europe. I originally had (still have) a Clutch charger which is great for emergencies but we needed something more powerful. Where the Clutch charger gets very hot, these did not, and they were both easy to charge and did a great job of charging our phones. I have an android and my husband has an iPhone so it was a bit of a challenge to make sure we had the correct cables. While they are heavier than the Clutch and they don't fit in a wallet, I was able to keep mine side by side w my phone in my travel purse.  All all in all we definitely would recommend these chargers.

product_name: Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K streaming device, more than 1.5 million movies and TV episodes, supports Wi-Fi 6, watch free & live TV
description: 1st gen remote was better.  pulling up episodes and accessing other content within a show.I find some of my services: the navigation button no longer prompts  certain content*. or short cuts or screenfreeze.This also comes with  shortcut button of Prime  | Netflix  | Directv  | Peacock  = not a sub.  I wish i got a remote that i can personalized more.TV GUIDE = not me either , im already in the habit of barking orders to Alexa. Im heavily voiced-prompt user. not buttons.OVERALL the  remote looks like it was planned to be more efficient;  but Im not that type of users.  so all the additional buttons for shortcut is irrelevant to me.*I went into PRIME to watch a show:  I left off at Season 6, but  I wanted to rewatch Season 2.  } It would not prompt the  episode; only where i left off several months back.I had to come out of all the way out and  Selected the show as thought its my 1st time.: then Seasons + episode is a choice.

product_name: Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K streaming device, more than 1.5 million movies and TV episodes, supports Wi-Fi 6, watch free & live TV
description: UPDATE: so maybe it is a bit worse than my previous 4K stick, network wise. I get 150-170 Mbps during network test. So why during Thursday Night Football I get pixelization and buffering? I’ve cleared cache but I rarely did that before. This stick is supposed to be better. Maybe there will be some updates soon to improve this otherwise I will have to rollback to the older stick. So if you’re thinking about upgrading, think hard as to whether you need to.So, I just got the NEW 4K Firestick today. I had the older yet same named 4K Firestick. Upgraded because this NEW one is supposed to be faster and better.First impressions. Is it faster? Well that is subjective in my experience. 30%? That would be noticeable, but I really couldn’t see that. There are no real objective ways to test.So out of the box, how did the installation go. Well, plugged it in and it immediately wanted to update which understandable based on reviews that said it need them. Well that was the first update. It rebooted itself only to launch into more updates. About 10 minutes worth. Then finally it pops a screen that says it recognizes me and if I wanted to restore settings from a backup. Why of course. I read a review that said it restored his settings to his previous Firestick. Well I guess my backup didn’t remember mine. The Home Screen was filled with all the latest bloatware and free trials imaginable. It didn’t remember any of my apps or any logins and passwords. After 30 minutes of cleaning that up I decided to test network speeds. I have a new Deco X60 mesh system that supports WiFi 6. It wasn’t any better than the OLD Firestick. Sadly, the Deco isn’t as sophisticated as most true routers so it doesn’t tell you detailed information about your network. How do I know? Spent an hour with TPlink. Another story.I have my 4K TV set up with an AVR system and the only thing the NEW stick recognized was the TV. Didn’t remember the receiver. Had to set that up. Not a big deal since it only controls power on/off and volume control.One last thing is the preprogrammed buttons. I appreciate Prime Video and Netflix but DIRECTV and Peacock. Seriously who uses those? At least let me reprogram them to something more useful.I did get an email from Amazon explaining what setup would entail. It wasn’t as detailed as you would expect for setting up an existing account. But it did say to have all your app info handy. It didn’t explain the lengthy update instructions either. But it was a forewarning. I was inspired by the one reviewers comments. Just didn’t happen for me.So do I keep it? Yes because it is their latest product and will likely get the most attention for upgrades and enhancements. And it wasn’t worse or downgraded from the OLD stick. Don’t want to lag too far in technology. I thought about the Max but don’t have any 6e capabilities. The ambient feature looked cool.

product_name: Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K streaming device, more than 1.5 million movies and TV episodes, supports Wi-Fi 6, watch free & live TV
description: I like that the product works for what I want to use it for - to watch YouTube, YouTube TV, Max, and Plex. Unfortunately, Amazon tries to force you into using Disney+, Netflix, Hulu or Prime. I don’t want to use any of those and don’t subscribe to them, but one light accidental touch of a button causes whatever you’re doing to stop abruptly and open whatever app you accidentally clicked. Sucks that Amazon doesn’t make these programmable for other apps. Thankfully a knife works at removing these.

product_name: Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K streaming device, more than 1.5 million movies and TV episodes, supports Wi-Fi 6, watch free & live TV
description: I love the firestick, but I don’t love how they’re very glitchy.  I have an older tv that isn’t smart, so I need the stick to stream shows.  And they don’t last long.  I buy a new one each year.  Kinda of a pain to reprogram everything.  Short of buying a new smart tv I don’t have much choice.  BTW still a better product than a Roku streaming device.

product_name: Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K streaming device, more than 1.5 million movies and TV episodes, supports Wi-Fi 6, watch free & live TV
description: Bought this and the Roku Streaming Stick 4K this week. Firestick hangs on the login step (whether it's entering the password, entering a validation code, or open the Disney Plus app on the phone). I have tried deleting cache, uninstalling and reinstalling Disney Plus, and restarting the Firestick to no avail. The disney app works perfectly fine on the Roku stick. Other apps on the Firestick work fine. Only Disney is acting up

product_name: Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K streaming device, more than 1.5 million movies and TV episodes, supports Wi-Fi 6, watch free & live TV
description: and the other half of the time, I have to unplug it and plug it back in.  I am using dedicated power for this, so it shouldn't be happening, but it seems to be going bad.  Terrible reliability, but nice functionality to allow the Home Stereo echo dot speaker pairing.  Firestick has to be 4K model or better to allow that.

product_name: Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K streaming device, more than 1.5 million movies and TV episodes, supports Wi-Fi 6, watch free & live TV
description: Used for a week before the FireTV device got in a endless reboot loop. Put my iPad power brick on it and haven't had a issue sense. Tried the original brick on my phone and it keep going on and off charging. Replace your brick with something nice. Other than that, it seems fine.

product_name: Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K streaming device, more than 1.5 million movies and TV episodes, supports Wi-Fi 6, watch free & live TV
description: EVERY button on the remote makes a very LOUD click.  I've had every previous generation model and none made these loud clicks.  Other than that, it works well, the menus and downloads are reasonably fast, and provides a nice picture.  The matte texture is nicer to grip than older models.

product_name: Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K streaming device, more than 1.5 million movies and TV episodes, supports Wi-Fi 6, watch free & live TV
description: Still isn't worth a damn to watch 5-10 year old content. You still have to pay for streaming services as this does not offer local channels for anything! Nothing is free on this... You want something current? Get your payment method ready.... Period!!!

product_name: Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K streaming device, more than 1.5 million movies and TV episodes, supports Wi-Fi 6, watch free & live TV
description: Summary: it’s too big to fit behind some TVs (compared it to the old fire stick, about 1” longer). But more importantly I have a fully functional device that is just an older model and I don’t know what to do with! Amazon- start a recycling♻️ program for your fire sticks, tablets etc.The long story:Likes: easy to install being some TVs, the new remote control also controls the TVIssues:  Nothing, absolutely nothing is wrong with my old fire stick except it mustn’t have some graphic component that causes it to give me an error when I go to play some movies on a particular app. Well, Fridays are movie nights and it became increasingly annoying to not be able to watch the movies we want on a particular app. Since my bestie and I have the same subscription and hers worked just fine…the difference is that she has newer fire sticks and the TVs that come with the inbuilt fire stick so I figured that was my problem! I’ve had my fire sticks since the inception (+\-2 years) of the fire stick. Since they’ve always worked for the past 6-7 years, I never bothered.Well, thankfully there was a sale and I bought this fire stick. Now, to install it behind my TV…it did not fit into the space between the cable outlet and the raised part of the TV. This is a 55” Samsung TV. I tried it behind my 75” Samsung…it made it in but it was a snug fit. Thankfully, my LG is built completely differently from the Samsung TVs and there’s no restriction.Secondly, I’m frustrated because this means I need to replace my second fire stick that is just as old but works fine and I’ll be stuck with these 2 devices because I cannot in good faith, chuck them in the trash. 🚮 I need an alternative to disposing these!

product_name: Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K streaming device, more than 1.5 million movies and TV episodes, supports Wi-Fi 6, watch free & live TV
description: I have been using a fire stick I got in early 2019. Now (Sept 2024) i got this one. It’s been great. My old one got very hot and I’ve noticed this new one also gets hot but they’ve always worked. Must be normal operating temps. My old stick still works. I believe it's worth the update every 3-5 years. I also replaced my internet provider at the same time. When I 1st used this fire stick, my network was not the one I had saved on Amazon. (I had to change or rather add the new network to save on Amazon). The setup still went very smoothly. I stream at 1080 (on a 1080p tv)  but this  is 4K ready. The interface is much the same but a few UI changes are noticeable. I can tell the new one has more processing power. Well worth what I paid for the device. I have used Apple TV, MAX, Netflix, Hulu, MGM+, and YouTube. (Prime video) and others in the 1st week. All of these work well. People claim the Fire stick is for Amazon users, but it’s a cheap and easy way to use pretty much all streaming services.Amazon gets the concept of providing a low cost device that doesn’t overlook quality...to get business...however you can still easily use other services. These low cost devices like fire sticks, kindle readers, Echo dot, tablets, all Amazon devices I’ve used….high quality for a low cost. Do be aware that a lot of people have different education and views about tech than you or I might. I can still easily buy goods and services from almost anyone thorough this fire stick. Not just Amazon.Highly recommended by me !FYI - At the time of this review Hulu live tv does not work with T-mobile (or any) 5G home internet. That’s not the fault of the Amazon fire stick. It’s complicated but not a problem with fire stick (and I don’t even use Hulu live, so just the information for you)

product_name: Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K streaming device, more than 1.5 million movies and TV episodes, supports Wi-Fi 6, watch free & live TV
description: I own an XBOX One and Nvidia Shield TV Pro, so I purchased a Firestick TV 4k on Prime Day for $30 to compare cloud gaming capabiliies. I never thought I'd say this about a piece of Amazon Tech, but for numerous reasons, the Firestick TV 4k has quickly become my favorite cloud gaming console, and here's why:1. I bought it on Prime Day for $29. It's $59 full price. And even at full price, it is by far the cheapest device capable of cloud gaming.2. Fire TV has apps for Playstation, XBOX and Luna, which support MOST popular games. Sadly, Rocket League and Minecraft have not made the cut. But the free games included with Luna are still better than the free games on most other platforms I've used.3. The Firestick 4k's interface is much smoother and faster than my other consoles. My Nvidia Shield in particular has a clunky, slow interface. The Firestick puts other interfaces to shame.4. The firestick 4k boots games faster than my other consoles. It appears to perform better than the XBOX One during gameplay, but not quite on par with the Nvidia Shield TV Pro (which is to be expected).4. XBOX, Playstation, Switch Pro, Luna, 8BitDo, and almost every 3rd Part controller will pair to the Firestick easily from the settings menu. Connected controllers automatically turn on when turning on the TV using the Firestick remote which is another cool little feature.The Firestick 4k is proof that cloud gaming can be fast, easy, and incredibly affordable. For under $100, you can get this streaming stick and a top notch controller. That's nuts. If Amazon scores more developers and more popular titles to add to the Luna library, I can easily see Amazon becoming a real competitor in cloud gaming.

product_name: Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K streaming device, more than 1.5 million movies and TV episodes, supports Wi-Fi 6, watch free & live TV
description: The Amazon Fire Stick is the digital Swiss Army knife I never knew I needed. It arrived at my door, and I honestly thought I had accidentally ordered a wand from Hogwarts. I unboxed it, and instead of magical spells, it delivered a whole new realm of TV possibilities.Setup was so simple it felt like the universe was conspiring to make my life easier. Plug it into your TV’s HDMI port, and it’s like the TV just woke up from a nap, stretching and saying, “Wow, I’ve been waiting for this my whole life!” The Fire Stick doesn’t just find your favorite shows; it practically rolls out the red carpet for them.The voice control is like having a personal assistant who’s never sassy. Say “Play the latest episode of ‘Stranger Things’,” and it responds faster than a caffeinated squirrel. No more hunting for the remote or awkwardly reaching behind the TV—just smooth, effortless access to all your streaming needs.Navigating the interface is akin to gliding through a futuristic cityscape where every channel is a neon sign beckoning you to dive into a new binge. You’ll find yourself marveling at how many different ways you can waste time—err, I mean, enjoy high-quality content.And here’s the kicker: the Fire Stick’s magic extends beyond just streaming. It makes you the grandmaster of your TV domain. Whether you’re ordering pizza or checking the weather, the Fire Stick has an app for that. It’s like it’s trying to be your best friend, but one who won’t judge you for your 3 a.m. rom-com marathons.In conclusion, if you’re tired of your TV’s old-school ways and want a device that turns every night into an entertainment extravaganza, the Amazon Fire Stick is your golden ticket. Just be prepared for the inevitable, “Can I borrow your Fire Stick?” from every friend who discovers it.

product_name: Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K streaming device, more than 1.5 million movies and TV episodes, supports Wi-Fi 6, watch free & live TV
description: I upgraded from my last fire stick that was bought in 2018. This new fire stick is amazing. It’s very fast and really easy to use. I really love that it comes with an HDMI adapter extender. My ports are right next to each other and I would struggle to use them with another device. This is a clear advantage over my last Roku stick. Plus I can run my vpn on this stick for extra protection.

product_name: Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K streaming device, more than 1.5 million movies and TV episodes, supports Wi-Fi 6, watch free & live TV
description: I recently purchased the Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K (newest generation) to replace my old Firestick, which had been in use for about 6 or 7 years before it stopped working properly. Initially, I thought the issue might be with my internet connection, but it soon became clear that the old Firestick needed to be replaced.The new Fire TV Stick 4K has been a great upgrade. Setting it up was straightforward, and it has seamlessly integrated into my viewing routine. It's become a reliable option for when broadcast programming doesn't offer what I'm looking for.The only minor drawback is the time it takes for the home screen to appear when switching from broadcast TV to the Firestick. It can take a few minutes for the screen to display, but once it's up and running, the device performs exceptionally well. The 4K streaming quality is impressive, and navigating through apps and content is smooth and efficient.Overall, I'm very satisfied with this purchase. It has enhanced my streaming experience and offers a noticeable improvement over the old model.

product_name: Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K streaming device, more than 1.5 million movies and TV episodes, supports Wi-Fi 6, watch free & live TV
description: Great quality, good price and easy to use.  I used it to connect my projector to a bluetooth speakers and technology works great.

product_name: Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K streaming device, more than 1.5 million movies and TV episodes, supports Wi-Fi 6, watch free & live TV
description: I ordered this new Firestick yesterday, delivered today and installed easily.  This one replaces one that was 5 1/2 years old and quit working a few days.  Tried all the suggested "fixes" and it was just dead.  I sure cannot complain for that much service from the old one for the small price I paid.  This new one is updated and seems to have a brighter, clearer picture and better sound.  Best of all, it was on Prime Day special! Funny thing - not related - but my other older Firestick in another TV is still going strong.  It was at least a year older than the one I replaced, but it hasn't had as much use.  I will remain a big fan of Firestick for streaming.

product_name: Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K streaming device, more than 1.5 million movies and TV episodes, supports Wi-Fi 6, watch free & live TV
description: I was a little skeptical at first. I went through two other appliances to get a good quality streaming system. This hit the spot. Works flawless. Wish I had done this long ago.Easy to setup. Goes hand in glove with Amazon prime.No buffering that I have seen so far. Voice control is a plus for sure.  Saves a lot of searching.If you want the convenience of a smart TV, and don't have one, this is the next best thing

product_name: Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K streaming device, more than 1.5 million movies and TV episodes, supports Wi-Fi 6, watch free & live TV
description: Transformed an older smart TV that wasn't at all user friendly into an amazing TV. My older Samsung was great when I had cable but not so great for streaming. I turned it on and the home screen just had a couple app icons. When Id try to go to Netflix or Prime, I had to wait and come back later as the TV would give me a "please try back later, preparing TV..." And I was always getting a weak or no signal message. It was super annoying. I bought a small fire TV for another room and love the ease of use and all of options for watching, so I thought this might make my bigger TV the same. It did; like magic, it transformed my annoying TV into an enjoyable TV. The only this I would caution is that when you click on a movie or show, the first option you land on (that you would normally click to watch) defaults to "purchase" if the item is available to purchase through prime. I inadvertently purchased a show I can get through another streaming service for free because I assumed the default would be play free to me. It was not. You have to scroll over to "more ways to watch" to view other places. That was a bit annoying and a VERY easy mistake to make it not paying attention.It's still an awesome product, though.

product_name: Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K streaming device, more than 1.5 million movies and TV episodes, supports Wi-Fi 6, watch free & live TV
description: I really have to say I really glad I got new because it works better than the one I had an! The volume is good the an picture is great!  Had little bit of buffering issues after we lost power but it was fine after I restarted it love the remote it seems to be better quality than the old ones! The design I don't really see any difference in the design of it, the only other thing I hope this one doesn't do compared to the old ones is the constant updates and so far I haven't had any trouble with that. I have programmed the remote to control the Bluetooth sound bar yet so I don't know it it will work on it . But I do appreciate the that it got way to watch some TV shows an Movie's.

product_name: Apple AirTag
description: So, when looking up info on these tags, I heard that they weren’t meant to be used to track pets. However, I had no other option, and others were using it for that, so it seemed worth a shot. I did check to see if any other company made something like this, but found nothing at the time. Since then, I heard that Samsung makes a better tag. Sad, but it is what it is.Anyway, I got a collar for my cat which holds it, put it on her, and let her out. It showed her bouncing around randomly all around the house even though she was sitting still under the porch not even 10 feet from me. I’m okay with the large circle representing the area she could potentially be in, but I feel like the closer I am to her, the more accurate it should be. Instead, it never seems accurate. She isn’t even in that circle 50% of the time.I would have given the tag 1 star if not for the fact that we moved, I let her out, and she got lost for most of the day, but it did help me get her back inside (only) after she found her way back home. I was extremely annoyed that the only way to find her beyond my yard was if she got close to an iPhone or iPad. It appears that only maybe one person in my neighborhood has either. I’m not mad at them. I’m mad at Apple because how exactly does this help find anything without others having Apple devices? If we didn’t waste money on Apple devices, this tag wouldn’t be worthwhile even if you gave it to me for free.The only reason this was helpful at all was because I turned on lost mode and it notified me when she was outside because she was close enough to be picked up by my iPad. She kept passing the house in confusion, but the last time it notified me as I was looking at Find My, and so I was able to catch her before she ran too far away again. I’ve noticed that if I’m not looking at Find My, it doesn’t update. Again, that doesn’t help find a lost item unless you take the device with you, keep the screen on and the app open.I’m away from home now and a friend stops by to check on her. My friend has an iPhone, my cat tends to stay in my bedroom, yet if I don’t have Find My open while she’s there, it won’t update. The Apple name means less and less every year since Steve Jobs left us. So sad. Maybe they should focus more on the quality of their products than lip service. (Someone gifted us Air Pods and they’re absolute trash. My $30 earbuds are much better.)

product_name: Apple AirTag
description: The device works as advertised.  Except Apple has made it really really annoying by telling anyone with an iPhone that comes near you or to your home or anywhere near by the air tag owner that they are being followed !!! I bought this for my bag.  Yes I carry a man purse, an expensive one and would like to track it if left behind.  I always had an extra iPhone that did a great job of doing just that and notifying me if it behind.  But I lost that phone to a nice thief that needed it more than I, it’s safe to guess,  with the unbeatable security they got through security and disabled my phone and my lost mode. Nothing to track it or get it back.  The police well , filled out beautiful paper report that I may use I guess as junk paper.  No one went to look or get it while lost and actively sending a signal.  The air tags work well , great gps location tracking , great battery life.  I like the sound it emits if lost to find it and makes it much easier with a loud and audible high pitch tone.  Here is my big problem with the air tag, all good Except if you travel with someone for couple days or hang out with a friend everyone becomes paranoid because everyone will get the darn warning : you are being tracked by an AirTag.  Even though all you doing is commuting together.  I feel like it puts my friend at a heightened level for no good reason.  But one has to wonder what are they so worried about or  hiding ! Why is everyone so afraid of being followed and receiving the dreaded msg that an Air Tag has travelled with u last couple days.  When that happened to me, to be honest, I freaked the heck out couple years ago.  I searched all over my car never got it figured out or got it to ring. Nothing just an annoying and freaky message saying you are being followed.  But the message was popping up daily for four days while I was moving to my new home.  and now I’m making others freaked out about being followed when all we are doing is commuting together or grabbing a beer.  Friends don’t spy each other right? … lol, I don’t really think if someone is being a spy the Air Tag is a good tool of the trade for them.  It tells on you in a heart beat.  It tells on you when u have one to protect your hand bag for god sake.  Not cool don’t like it don’t use it.  Not worth the embarrassment

product_name: Apple AirTag
description: I bought one of these to use for my dog when he gets out. I bought a water proof device to hold the tag for his collar. It was easy to put on and set up. I live in a small town but, everyone today usually having a cell (iPhone being most popular) I thought it might work well to be able to find him. AirTags use Bluetooth signals to connect to nearby devices in Apple's Find My network to locate your AirTag. When an AirTag connects to a device, its location is triangulated and sent to iCloud, where you can view it on a map in the Find My app. He has gotten out twice since I purchased it, and both times it has taken a long time to find him. The alerts take a long time in between, sometimes taking 30minutes. It’s not the phone network as we have very good single here in town. I thought with living in town that the alerts would work more frequently, but I think the population with the find my network must be pretty small. It still worked better than blindly searching, and does help us find him, I was just hoping it would be a little quicker and easier to use. I also was frustrated that both my husband and myself could not both search for the tag. It only allows one individual at a time to utilizes it in the find my network. The tag can be transferred back and forth but not used at the same time, so you can not separate and search. I think this would probably be a great device if you lived in a larger town, but not amazing for smaller rural areas.

product_name: Apple AirTag
description: I bought this for my preschooler to track her as she goes on the bus. Unfortunately, it doesn’t track real time. It is also quite bulky. However, super easy set up and can share with other families (cannot share with others who are also kids so that was a downer). I was hoping to be able to share with my tweens but doesn’t allow.

product_name: Apple AirTag
description: Although it is an Apple product, I still want to complain. The position must be very close to be very accurate. If it is a little far away, it is not very accurate. It is a little blurry. It is also a little heavy. It is not very convenient to carry out. I feel that the effect is average.

product_name: Apple AirTag
description: Had these for about a week. Very easy to set up. I put them in my boys backpacks for school. I assumed this would be similar to the luggage posts I saw where everyone felt great about knowing where the luggage was when traveling. However when I check the app the data doesn’t update timely. Sometimes it takes hours for it to update a location. The location is also not accurate it will show them in the parking lot when I know they’re in class. So not as accurate as I was hoping or timely with updates. Finally after a week one of them had a low battery notification when it says it would be good for 21 days. With all the other great reviews I read, I have a feeling I may have received used/out of date old tags. They aren’t meeting any expectations that appealed from this product. Boooooo

product_name: Apple AirTag
description: I got this for my cat. The only time the location is current is when he is with me when I don’t need it. When he runs out the door the location is never current. It says “an hour ago he was..” I need to know where he is currently not an hour ago

product_name: Apple AirTag
description: The first one I bought didn’t work. I do love Apple products so I bought another one. Works great! Make sure you test it when you purchase otherwise you can’t return it if you wait too long and it doesn’t work. Now I’m stuck with one that doesn’t work. :(

product_name: Apple AirTag
description: I purchased this at a great price but was not satisfied with the usage.  It did not give me step by step details of trips taken (I put it in the car).  I only received final destinations and it also took a while to update.

product_name: Apple AirTag
description: I put this on my dog's collar. The iPad app shows the dog to be next door when she's right here by my side. So, it's good enough if she gets lost in the neighborhood or further but not so good if within about 300ft.

product_name: Apple AirTag
description: I recently purchased 10 Apple AirTags, and they’ve genuinely transformed how I keep track of everything—from my kids' bookbags and water bottles to my everyday necessities. These little gadgets work flawlessly within the Apple ecosystem, just as expected. Setting them up was a breeze, and the precision of their location tracking was impressive.One of the standout features is the ability to share the location of items with my wife through the app. This has made it much easier for us both to stay organized, especially with the kids' busy schedules. We can quickly check where their bookbags are or if their water bottles returned home after school.The convenience of having everything in one app is fantastic. I love knowing that, at home or on the go, I can quickly locate my items with a tap on my phone. The AirTags are not just functional; they’ve also become essential to our daily routine. I highly recommend them to anyone looking to stay organized and keep track of their belongings!

product_name: Apple AirTag
description: Fast shipping. Package great! Description is accurate. Fits perfect in my key chain holder. Durable; accurate; great sound quality; great connectivity. Functional and these things are a life saver!!! Very durable.

product_name: Apple AirTag
description: I lived that I could track my suitcases and know they were on the plane and heading to Europe with me. Also great to track coming off the plane, stayed connected the whole time my phone was on. Accurate.Range was as I hoped, functioned as I hoped, easy to store in suitcase.Would make a great gift.

product_name: Apple AirTag
description: White air tagI purchased this to track my dog encase he goes missing. It fit inside a case that is water proof and screwed onto collar. He can’t chew on it at all.I have tested walking away from it and got the notification quickly that I was away from him. Then I used just the map to go back to him. It put me within 10 ft of him. It was quite accurate.Once I had it loaded into the FindMy app it made ease of finding the location very simple. It also does beep as well.It can be used for many purposes and functions. I just decided to put on my dog. I can see it being good to put in a secret pocket on a backpack or anything else.I will definitely be buying more not just for me but gifts for others. This would be great for so many things.

product_name: Apple AirTag
description: My husband and I bought these the place in different pieces of furniture and the two pods we used to move cross country. We used a large well-known company, but wanted to keep our things safe and know where they were. I was impressed with the ease of setting these up as I am not completely tech savvy. My only complaint was the high price, but they are lightweight, safe and easy to use.

product_name: Apple AirTag
description: I recently started using the Apple AirTag, and I couldn’t be happier with its performance!**Ease of Use**: Setting up the AirTag was a breeze. I simply pulled it out of the box, held it near my iPhone, and it was instantly recognized. The entire process took just a minute, making it super user-friendly.**Precision Tracking**: The tracking capabilities are impressive. With the Find My app, I can easily see the location of my items. The precision finding feature is particularly helpful, as it uses ultra-wideband technology to guide me directly to my lost belongings.**Design**: The AirTag has a sleek and minimalist design that fits seamlessly with my belongings. It’s small and lightweight, so it doesn’t add bulk to my keys or bags. Plus, the ability to personalize it with engravings is a nice touch!**Battery Life**: The battery life is excellent. The replaceable CR2032 battery lasts about a year, which means I don’t have to worry about frequent replacements.**Community Find Feature**: I love the community aspect of the AirTag. If I misplace something, other iPhone users can help locate it, increasing the chances of finding my lost items. It’s comforting to know that I have that extra layer of security.**Overall Experience**: I highly recommend the Apple AirTag to anyone looking for a reliable way to keep track of their belongings. It’s a smart investment that provides peace of mind and makes everyday life a little easier. Whether you’re prone to misplacing items or just want to keep tabs on your valuables, the AirTag is a fantastic solution!

product_name: Apple AirTag
description: You need to be pretty close for the AirTag to work.Apple says this is NOT an animal tracker and they don’t lie, but I saw people state it works. Well if your pet stays close it works, but if you have a pet that takes off farther than across the street this does NOT work at all.If you need to find keys in the house then it’s great but nothing outside the house.

product_name: Apple AirTag
description: I got this for my wallet and I do not regret. So  easy to set up, ima have to get more for other things.

product_name: Apple AirTag
description: When Apple first introduced the AirTag I was skeptical about their use case. After reading story after story about how people were using and abusing the use of this device, I remained uncertain about how I might use it. That is no longer the case. After losing my mailbox key for the umpteenth time, I bought an AirTag and a silicone case and attached the whole shebang to my mailbox key. I haven't lost the key since. Not only can I find the key when I forget to put it back in its "home," the bright yellow silicone case makes it easier to spot visually. Now I think maybe I'll add one to my EDC bag, camera bag, car keys, etc. so I can recover them should they "grow legs and walk away." I am no longer a skeptic.

product_name: Apple AirTag
description: We have put Air Tags in our luggage for both domestic and international travel to help keep track of our bags. It has already come in handy when a bag went on a different plane by accident. We have also purchased Air Tags for our dogs.  While the dogs are chipped finding them that way is dependent on someone bringing them to the vets. In the meantime, the tags were easily placed on their collars in little holders that slid onto the collars. Linked to our phones we can find them much quicker if they escape.

product_name: Apple AirPods (3rd Generation) Wireless Ear Buds, Bluetooth Headphones, Personalized Spatial Audio, Sweat and Water Resistant, Lightning Charging Case Included, Up to 30 Hours of Battery Life
description: I’ve used Apple AirPods before, and I got my previous pair directly from Apple, which worked flawlessly until my dog chewed one of them. That’s why I decided to buy these on Amazon. However, I’m not sure if it’s because the seller wasn’t directly affiliated with Apple, but these AirPods seemed used when I received them. There was dust inside the box, and one of the AirPods even had earwax or something on it. That was a big letdown for what was supposed to be a brand-new product.As for the AirPods themselves, they work well. The sound quality and spatial audio are excellent, just like my original pair. However, the battery life hasn’t been as good as expected. For the first two weeks, they held a charge fine, but now, after just about a month, the battery doesn’t last as long as it should. It’s a bit frustrating, especially since I expected the same long-lasting battery performance as my previous pair.Overall, I still love the AirPods, but the condition in which they arrived and the battery issues have me questioning whether this was truly a new product. I’m not sure if this is an issue with the seller, but it’s something to be aware of if you’re purchasing from a non-Apple source.

product_name: Apple AirPods (3rd Generation) Wireless Ear Buds, Bluetooth Headphones, Personalized Spatial Audio, Sweat and Water Resistant, Lightning Charging Case Included, Up to 30 Hours of Battery Life
description: I purchased these the intention of using them with my iPhone 15 Pro. I have to say that I’ve never been able to keep the ear phones supplied with any of my Apple products in my ears. These AirPods proved to be an expensive mistake. The sound quality is not just superb. It’s fabulous, but that’s of no use when you can’t wear them in your ears they simply fall out immediately. I even purchased a little device that attaches to them in case they fall out of your ears or I should say when they fall out of your ears so that they don’t get lost in an airlines seat . Unfortunately, if I keep fussing with them, I can push them into my ears twist them in various directions and they may stay for 10 or 15 seconds. As much as I would like to keep them because the spatial sound feature is unbelievably great they are useless because they won’t allow me to keep them in my ! I mentioned earlier that I am an Apple stockholder. It’s a great concern to me that Apple makes products that sell. I don’t want my stock to lose value, but if they make ear phones that won’t stay in somebody’s head, then those sales are gonna plummet and if they plummet, they won’t make Apple any money and my stock will be worthless.i intend to write Tim Cook and complain about thesw. Yes, i know some folks can wear them, but EVERYONE should be able to. Now, to add insult to injury, I find I am not able to return them as my trip to Europe exceeded the return window.

product_name: Apple AirPods (3rd Generation) Wireless Ear Buds, Bluetooth Headphones, Personalized Spatial Audio, Sweat and Water Resistant, Lightning Charging Case Included, Up to 30 Hours of Battery Life
description: I've loved my previous Airpod versions, but the one thing we all complained about was not being able to control the volume from the airpods themselves. Still seems to be the case still with the 3rd generation witth advancements in every other area, but the one we all wanted. Sound is awesome and connects instantly. They've also changed the design in how it fits in your ear and I'm not a fan of the new design. Glad I didn't spend extra for the Pro model. i got mine during Prime Day deal, so I'm okay with it. Just not a fan anymore of how it fits in your ear and still no volume control.

product_name: Apple AirPods (3rd Generation) Wireless Ear Buds, Bluetooth Headphones, Personalized Spatial Audio, Sweat and Water Resistant, Lightning Charging Case Included, Up to 30 Hours of Battery Life
description: These are my first set of AirPods ( AirPod Gen 3)and I am amazed at how easily they connected to my iPhone. They pick up my voice so well with calls and Siri.  The sound is fantastic. The first time I was watching a show from my phone, I had to take one earbud off just to double check that the sound was coming out from the AirPods and not through my phone’s speakers. As I listened to music through the AirPods Gen 3,  I kept asking my husband (who sat next to me) if he was sure that he couldn’t hear my music. He couldn’t.Con - The AirPods are too bubbly and round for my ears and keep falling out. They also hurt my ear after having them in for a while. Perhaps a different model is better for me.

product_name: Apple AirPods (3rd Generation) Wireless Ear Buds, Bluetooth Headphones, Personalized Spatial Audio, Sweat and Water Resistant, Lightning Charging Case Included, Up to 30 Hours of Battery Life
description: These work so well with the iPhone with seamless connection and functionality.  The smooth hard plastic surface makes these slip out of my ears continually.  It's even worse when there is any sweat, so I can only use these in very limited situations.  I have other very inexpensive ear buds that stay put, are more comfortable and have better sound quality.  I want them to work for me, but they just do not work well.  I tried to make them work for too long, and lost my return window, so I am keeping them, but I am not satisfied with them.

product_name: Apple AirPods (3rd Generation) Wireless Ear Buds, Bluetooth Headphones, Personalized Spatial Audio, Sweat and Water Resistant, Lightning Charging Case Included, Up to 30 Hours of Battery Life
description: Sound quality and battery life is excellent!  The fit is horrible.  The earbuds are constantly falling out of my ears, making them difficult to use.  The rating could increase with a better fit.

product_name: Apple AirPods (3rd Generation) Wireless Ear Buds, Bluetooth Headphones, Personalized Spatial Audio, Sweat and Water Resistant, Lightning Charging Case Included, Up to 30 Hours of Battery Life
description: The sound quality and battery life are good, but the fit is not great and they fall out of my ears easily.  I would be hesitant to do any moderate exercise wearing these.

product_name: Apple AirPods (3rd Generation) Wireless Ear Buds, Bluetooth Headphones, Personalized Spatial Audio, Sweat and Water Resistant, Lightning Charging Case Included, Up to 30 Hours of Battery Life
description: These are great except they will not stay in my ears!!!  They fall out so easily and constantly I'm afraid I'll end losing one or both!!

product_name: Apple AirPods (3rd Generation) Wireless Ear Buds, Bluetooth Headphones, Personalized Spatial Audio, Sweat and Water Resistant, Lightning Charging Case Included, Up to 30 Hours of Battery Life
description: If you’re use to normal headphones this is gonna be so uncomfortable for you, they don’t fit in my ear, I had to buy another ones

product_name: Apple AirPods (3rd Generation) Wireless Ear Buds, Bluetooth Headphones, Personalized Spatial Audio, Sweat and Water Resistant, Lightning Charging Case Included, Up to 30 Hours of Battery Life
description: They fall out. Perfect sound but I have to keep my hands in my ears all the time to keep them in place.

product_name: Apple AirPods (3rd Generation) Wireless Ear Buds, Bluetooth Headphones, Personalized Spatial Audio, Sweat and Water Resistant, Lightning Charging Case Included, Up to 30 Hours of Battery Life
description: I've been using the Apple AirPods (3rd Generation) for a few weeks now, and they’ve exceeded my expectations. The sound quality is fantastic, with well-balanced bass and crisp highs. The spatial audio feature adds a whole new dimension to music and movies, making the experience more immersive.Comfort-wise, these earbuds fit securely in my ears without causing any discomfort, even during extended use. The battery life is also impressive—I've been able to get a full day’s use on a single charge with room to spare. The case is compact and easy to carry, and the MagSafe charging is a nice touch for convenience.

product_name: Apple AirPods (3rd Generation) Wireless Ear Buds, Bluetooth Headphones, Personalized Spatial Audio, Sweat and Water Resistant, Lightning Charging Case Included, Up to 30 Hours of Battery Life
description: The Apple AirPods (3rd Generation) have quickly become my go-to wireless earbuds, offering a fantastic blend of immersive sound quality, comfort, and convenience. The personalized spatial audio feature is a standout, creating an immersive listening experience that makes music and podcasts feel more engaging. The sound is crisp and well-balanced, with impressive bass that doesn’t overpower the mids and highs.One of the best aspects is the comfort. The redesigned shape fits snugly in my ears, and I can wear them for hours without any discomfort. They’re also sweat and water resistant, which is perfect for my workouts and outdoor activities. I don’t have to worry about them getting damaged by a bit of moisture, making them a reliable choice for various situations.However, there are a few things to consider. While the sound quality is excellent, audiophiles might find it lacking compared to high-end, over-ear headphones. Additionally, the price is on the higher side, which might be a concern for those looking for more budget-friendly options.

product_name: Apple AirPods (3rd Generation) Wireless Ear Buds, Bluetooth Headphones, Personalized Spatial Audio, Sweat and Water Resistant, Lightning Charging Case Included, Up to 30 Hours of Battery Life
description: I got this for my wife and she’s in love with it. She takes them everywhere, sometimes she forgets about me but NEVER her AirPods. I do wanna say that the mic is not even close to being great but the active noise cancellation uhhhhhh that’s awesome. Battery last the whole day, apple quality so not too much to say about it, buttons feels good and very responsive,

product_name: Apple AirPods (3rd Generation) Wireless Ear Buds, Bluetooth Headphones, Personalized Spatial Audio, Sweat and Water Resistant, Lightning Charging Case Included, Up to 30 Hours of Battery Life
description: They work really well, the sound quality is amazing, I can listen to my music with such clarity. I prefer this generation rather from the other ones because the other ones are always falling off from. I never struggle when it comes to charging since their battery life last really long. They are amazing for the price they’re selling at.

product_name: Apple AirPods (3rd Generation) Wireless Ear Buds, Bluetooth Headphones, Personalized Spatial Audio, Sweat and Water Resistant, Lightning Charging Case Included, Up to 30 Hours of Battery Life
description: Got the Apple AirPods Gen 3 recently.  I like the improved sound the spatial awareness surround sound feature is nice.  I like that compared to the gen1, you can hear what is going on around you sound wise at the appropriate volumes.  The bass is rich, highs are good.  The controls work well, pods are well built of quality material.  Connectivity is good and does drop audio.I will say the only thing that I have a problem with the fit of the AirPods.  Unlike the gen 1 and 2 that just hangs well on my ears they’d seem a little loose.  When I smile I can feel them dislodging.  The smaller size makes it hard to handle if you have bigger hands.  While controls are responsive, depending on size of your hands it may be difficult to find the little indentation to control them.This model did not come with the wireless MagSafe charger case.  Spend the extra $10 to get that feature.  Definitely worth it.Looking back I would have gotten the AirPod pros 2 for a more secure fit.  But that is just me.

product_name: Apple AirPods (3rd Generation) Wireless Ear Buds, Bluetooth Headphones, Personalized Spatial Audio, Sweat and Water Resistant, Lightning Charging Case Included, Up to 30 Hours of Battery Life
description: work great so far. only issue is the case isn’t wireless charging which is what i really wanted but i guess it’s my fault for not reading the description close enough, just be aware that the case is lightning charging only if that’s an issue for you. otherwise they paired instantly and work great.

product_name: Apple AirPods (3rd Generation) Wireless Ear Buds, Bluetooth Headphones, Personalized Spatial Audio, Sweat and Water Resistant, Lightning Charging Case Included, Up to 30 Hours of Battery Life
description: This is my 2nd pair, I bought the first one more than 5 years ago and lost it last week. The quality is unmatched

product_name: Apple AirPods (3rd Generation) Wireless Ear Buds, Bluetooth Headphones, Personalized Spatial Audio, Sweat and Water Resistant, Lightning Charging Case Included, Up to 30 Hours of Battery Life
description: These ones hurt my ears physically. I guess my ears are too small. So if you don’t have small ears then they should fit fine. I have sores on the ridges on my ears. Similar to getting new shoes and you have sores on your lower ankles. You have to break them in I guess?However the physical durability is outstanding! The bad news is they fell out of my case somehow. I don’t know how that happened as they magnetically connect to close. Lost them at work. I was able to track them and they in the gutter. It must have happened when I was loading my car up to leave. Found the next day. They were ran over BUT they still work! They still charge and the mute buttons work. Amazing! Even though I can’t use them because it’s just too painful. The size/shape doesn’t bother my teen. It still puzzles me how they got bumped out of the charging case and lost to begin with but thrilled it’s not a total loss.⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ for durability

product_name: Apple AirPods (3rd Generation) Wireless Ear Buds, Bluetooth Headphones, Personalized Spatial Audio, Sweat and Water Resistant, Lightning Charging Case Included, Up to 30 Hours of Battery Life
description: First things first, I succumbed to Prime Day & couldn’t pass up the deal on these AirPods. Especially since with my current AirPods starting to crap out. However, I’m going to be giving this review from the perspective of going from the 2nd gen AirPod pros to the 3rd gen. And it seems like bit of a downgrade.Now, the 2nd gen pros have it all. The extra silicon tips, the noise cancellation & transparency, & the ability to wirelessly charge (the case). And I had them for a good long while (the longest I’ve had any AirPod) & the right bud is just starting to crackle when I play any audio through it and the battery is starting to go bad.Overall, I was honestly a little disappointed with the 3rd gen. Granted, it’s not a pro version so it’s not going to come with the noise cancellation. But the lack of silicon tips for the buds was a little surprising. I have trouble with any earbud staying in my left ear especially, & I’ve used the 3rd gen during a few workouts so far & they’re staying pretty well. But, they still feel just a little off & I ended up buying silicon tips to put over the buds instead - those helped with a bit of noise cancellation and security in my ears. But to go from the 2nd gen pros to the 3rd gen feels like I’m losing a lot when it comes to function & capabilities.Now, if you’re buying a pair of AirPods for the first time & just need the basics - then the 3rd gen is great. The bass sounds really good, overall sound quality is there & the buds without the silicon tips really aren’t that bad. If you’re used to that though, it’s going to take a bit to adjust with the 3rd gen. But, like I did, there are silicon tips you can get to put over the buds to help.

product_name: Apple AirPods (3rd Generation) Wireless Ear Buds, Bluetooth Headphones, Personalized Spatial Audio, Sweat and Water Resistant, Lightning Charging Case Included, Up to 30 Hours of Battery Life
description: I got the Apple AirPods (3rd Generation) Wireless Ear Buds as a birthday gift for my mother, and she absolutely loves them!Excellent Sound Quality:The sound quality of these AirPods is fantastic. My mother appreciates the clear, crisp audio for both music and phone calls. The enhanced bass and detailed sound make her listening experience truly enjoyable.Comfortable Fit:The new design fits comfortably in her ears. She can wear them for extended periods without any discomfort, which is perfect for her daily walks and other activities.Seamless Connectivity:Connecting the AirPods to her iPhone was effortless. The seamless integration with Apple devices is a significant advantage, and she enjoys the convenience of automatic switching between her iPhone and iPad.Impressive Battery Life:The battery life is impressive. She can use the AirPods for hours on end without needing to recharge frequently. The quick charging feature is also a nice bonus, ensuring they're always ready to go.User-Friendly Features:The touch controls are intuitive and user-friendly. She quickly got the hang of adjusting volume, skipping tracks, and answering calls with just a tap. The voice assistant integration is also handy for her daily tasks.Compact and Portable:The compact and sleek design of the charging case makes it easy for her to carry the AirPods everywhere. They fit perfectly in her purse, and she loves the convenience of having them on hand at all times.Overall, the Apple AirPods (3rd Generation) have been a wonderful gift for my mother. She enjoys the excellent sound quality, comfortable fit, and user-friendly features. I highly recommend them as a thoughtful gift for anyone looking to enhance their audio experience!

product_name: Bluetooth Speaker with HD Sound, Portable Wireless, IPX5 Waterproof, Up to 20H Playtime, TWS Pairing, BT5.3, for Home/Party/Outdoor/Beach, Electronic Gadgets, Birthday Gift (Black)
description: I bought this to get more volume from my computer while watching movies. For this it works well, I'm getting a good bit more sound output compared to the standard output from a Dell XPS.That said, the default EQ from the Dell is much more pleasing to listen to. To me, the BolaButty is really biased in the mid- to upper-midrange which gives it a slight "tin-can" sound. Using the equalizer on the VLC app and tweeking the midrange down a bit I was able to get a pleasant sound from the Bolabutty and a good volume boost. The 60Hz slider had no effect, as well as the 14kH and 16kHz. The XPS has no bass down at 60Hz either but it has decent, crisp highs that I couldn't get from the Bolabutty.So mission accomplished with the purchase. It's plenty loud and gives great value for the money. If you want full-spectrum sound where no instrument gets lost, look elsewhere, but plan on spending at least 5x the $.BTW, it has a 1/8" stereo jack for a wired connection in addition to Bluetooth. That feature was kinda glossed-over in the description.

product_name: Beats Solo 4 - Wireless Bluetooth On-Ear Headphones, Apple & Android Compatible, Up to 50 Hours of Battery Life - Slate Blue
description: I love them, that are so comfortable and the sound is great without sucking the air and noise around me (I find headphones that completely cut you off to be uncomfortable).My only, only petty complainy is why o why is the pouch they come with black instead of pink. It seems durable and good quality, but man does it mess with the aesthetic!

product_name: Apple Watch Series 9 [GPS 45mm] Smartwatch with Midnight Aluminum Case with Midnight Sport Band M/L. Fitness Tracker, ECG Apps, Always-On Retina Display, Water Resistant
description: After using a Fitbit versa for 4 years, I was ready to try something new. I did a lot of research and found that the apple watch was good for fitness and health tracking, as well as having lots of extra features that many fitness watches don’t have. Here are my thoughts are one week of using the apple watch 9.The band: Because it is more of a mesh material, I was worried about the band staying wet. I get very sweaty during workouts and I like to rinse the watch off after. I found that it took about two hours of wearing it for the band to dry completely after getting wet. Not great, but also not too bad.The charger: The charger uses a USB c connection. This is a bit of a nuisance because it did not come with a wall adapter. The only place I can plug this in is into my laptop.The watch itself: The watch is sleek; I like the screen size and overall look. The watch controls are easy to use, the haptics/gestures are a nice touch.Watch faces: I was disappointed in the selection of watch faces. There are limited options compared to Fitbit/Garmin, and most are analog which is not my preference. I find digital time to be easier to read at a glance. Half of the watch faces were from Nike - I don’t have any interest in being a walking Nike advertisement. Many of the watch faces are very customizable, which is nice, but the big failure here is that there is no option to see your step count on your watch face. I like to be able to see my daily steps at a glance, but it is not possible unless you download yet another app (more on this later).Health Tracking: The first thing I noticed is that the watch is not constantly reading your heart rate. On my Fitbit, I loved to be able to see my steps and my current heart rate at a glance. The apple watch is not constantly reading heart rate, so it says something like “65 BPM - 8 minutes ago”. It is not super useful to me to know what my heart rate was 8 minutes ago.Exercise Tracking: This is where I was really disappointed in the apple watch. One morning, I performed yoga for 15 minutes. I started a yoga activity before the workout, and it counted as 15 exercise minutes. Great. Later that same day I went to play tennis. 90+ minutes of high-intensity physical activity. I forgot to start the exercise on the watch - not too concerning to me because Fitbit recorded cardio exercise automatically. I was dismayed to find at the end of 90 minutes, my total exercise minutes was only 30. 15 from yoga, 15 from tennis. The watch also did not prompt me to start a workout during tennis, which it sometimes does while walking. It seems like with the apple watch, you have to be extra careful to start an exercise - otherwise the fitness tracking will not record correctly at all. Again, I really liked Fitbit, which automatically recorded exercise for me in an accurate way if I forgot to “start workout”.Health Data: The first thing that annoyed me is that your fitness/health data is spread across multiple apps. You have the Health app, the Fitness app, and the Apple Watch app. I don’t like having a ton of apps on my phone, and don’t see any reason why health/fitness couldn’t be wrapped up into the watch app. For me, the watch app should contain all of the data the watch is collecting. Fitbit/Garmin have a single app that make it easy to view data.Sleep tracking: The apple watch does a pretty good job tracking sleep and includes lots of data like heart rate/respiratory rate. My biggest complaint is that it does not tell me what time I fell asleep and what time I woke up like Fitbit did. I also really like that Fitbit gives you a sleep “score”, and I don’t see anything like that for apple.Battery Life: Obviously the battery life on the watch is not nearly as good as Fitbit/Garmin etc. This didn’t really bother me though, I charged it for 15-20 minutes every day while I showered and this was enough to keep it going.After giving the apple watch a try, I decided to return it and go with something more fitness focused. I was disappointed because I had been really excited about the apple watch. It does have a lot of cool features and technologies, and I really liked the detailed health data that was collected. However, I felt that apple fails to present this data in an accessible way. I was also really disappointed by the exercise tracking. The watch is supposed to auto-detect exercise but after 90 minutes of tennis, it recorded only 15 exercise minutes and did not include an entry in the exercise history at all (within the fitness app). If you care mostly about smart watch technology and phone/watch integration, I think the Apple Watch 9 is a good option. But if you are focused on fitness, I would recommend going with another option.

product_name: Apple Watch Series 9 [GPS 45mm] Smartwatch with Midnight Aluminum Case with Midnight Sport Band M/L. Fitness Tracker, ECG Apps, Always-On Retina Display, Water Resistant
description: I saw so many people wearing Apple Watches, and heard people say they love them, that I decided  to buy one during Amazon's sale.  It has been years since I have worn a watch.  It is easy to pull out my phone.  Yes, it is convenient to look on my wrist.  $300 convenient?  I am just getting used (after 3 weeks) to the short battery life.  Unless I put it on low power mode, which requires multiple button pushes and scrolling, I get less than a full day on a charge.  In its defense, 50 years ago, when I had a wind up watch I did have to wind it every day.  In low power mode I get 2 days/charge unless I do more than 2 hours of exercise.  That was less than one minute of winding vs 1 hour or more of charging, though.  It is nice to be able to check my heart rate anytime.  It has trouble distinguishing lying quietly in bed from sleeping.  The watch will track time/distance/speed/heart rate on my bike rides.  But so does my bike computer.  And my phone.  Same for hiking.  In its strong favor, it makes me look like one of the cool folks.  I have an Apple Watch.

product_name: Apple Watch Series 9 [GPS 45mm] Smartwatch with Midnight Aluminum Case with Midnight Sport Band M/L. Fitness Tracker, ECG Apps, Always-On Retina Display, Water Resistant
description: I bought this when my Versa 2’s battery failed.I thought I’d try Apple as I enjoy many of their other products.  How much you like this will depend upon how you use it.BTW, it does need a daily charge.  The Ultra is twice the price but has double the battery life plus a larger screen.  But twice the price.For fitness tracking only, I prefer the Fitbit as it is more intuitive.  Apple’s graphics are far superior and there may be more sophistication behind the scenes.  But I find it easier to use the Fitbit.  I don’t have to tell Fitbit my sleep schedule.  Fitbit does not vibrate in the mornings when I don’t have an alarm set.  Fitbit gets me to the metrics I care about with fewer steps.BUT, if you want the OTHER features of a smart watch BEYOND fitness tracking, Apple wins every time.  But I use my phone for those functions.  That makes the watch redundant and, with the smaller screen, harder to use vs. the iPhone.My next watch (which I’ll buy in 3-5 years) will augment my phone for tasks better done on the wrist.  And I’ll want a longer battery life.

product_name: Apple Watch Series 9 [GPS 45mm] Smartwatch with Midnight Aluminum Case with Midnight Sport Band M/L. Fitness Tracker, ECG Apps, Always-On Retina Display, Water Resistant
description: Overall an okay watch. Got it bc hubby has it and to track each other’s fitness and health progress. Batter drains extremely fast compared to a Garmin, a Fitbi, and a Huawise Fit. The battery of those ones last for days, between 5-7, even after tracking your exercise. Apple watch last less than 18 hrs. Again, that is a huge con for me as we are trying to be more healthy and fit as a family.

product_name: Apple Watch Series 9 [GPS 45mm] Smartwatch with Midnight Aluminum Case with Midnight Sport Band M/L. Fitness Tracker, ECG Apps, Always-On Retina Display, Water Resistant
description: Perfect watch, cute color, charges fast, feels durable and has held up during workouts. Have bumped it a few times and it didn’t scratch. The shipping took longer than expected that was the only downfall and reason for lower rating.

product_name: Apple Watch Series 9 [GPS 45mm] Smartwatch with Midnight Aluminum Case with Midnight Sport Band M/L. Fitness Tracker, ECG Apps, Always-On Retina Display, Water Resistant
description: Apple, apple, apple...what is this?I came to Apple Watch after owning a Fitbit for several years. I love my Fitbit, but I also ALWAYS wanted to try out the Apple watch. Don't buy this if you are looking forward to a watch that has any focus on health. It's clearly an afterthought for this company that they feel they HAVE to begrudgingly have to be relevant.I didn't realize that the apple watch looks fancy, but it's literally just an iPhone on your wrist. And what is the point of having an iPhone on your wrist if you have an iPhone...and you HAVE TO HAVE an iPhone if you have an apple watch.Here's what this watches original hardware cannot do (you'll have to pay 3rd parties for these things):It CAN'T tell you your overall caloriesIt CAN'T tell you how much you sleep without you setting a sleep timer. It has no auto-tracking for sleep.It CAN'T tell you a sleep scoreIt CAN'T tell you O2 readingsIt CAN'T tell you the meaning of your sleep. It almost can't do anything at all in terms of wellness.It CAN'T tell you when you're in cardio, fat burn, or below heart levelsIt CAN'T tell you anything with ease. Everything is complicated compared to the simple layout of a Fitbit. The charts are almost meaningless. I have to click on 3-10 different pages to find what I want amongst 3 different apps that come with the watch. (Fitbit has ONE app that does it all)You also won't be able to access your designated apple health app through your watch. YOU HAVE TO go through your phone to access it. But you can access other third-party apps on your watch. MAKE IT MAKE SENSE.For this watch to have so many watch faces focusing on health, you'd think they would have incredible health and wellness features, especially since they have so many competitors. But obviously, it's all for show. All you'll ever know from Apple's "genius" three-ring health goals is your "stand hours," your "active calories," and your "workout minutes". That's it. That's all it is. There's not much more to it.My advice is to skip the Apple Watch if you want it for health features and buy a smart ring instead.

product_name: Apple Watch Series 9 [GPS 45mm] Smartwatch with Midnight Aluminum Case with Midnight Sport Band M/L. Fitness Tracker, ECG Apps, Always-On Retina Display, Water Resistant
description: Apple is no longer in top 5 of fitness trackers. Aside from to many updates algorithms are not even best guess estimates. Making data, especially HR, VO2 Max, HRV and RHR unreliable.

product_name: Apple Watch Series 9 [GPS 45mm] Smartwatch with Midnight Aluminum Case with Midnight Sport Band M/L. Fitness Tracker, ECG Apps, Always-On Retina Display, Water Resistant
description: All (a ton) of my iPhone apps mirrored to this new watch.  Because there are so many tiny glumped  together - pages of  icons (one for each app), and my phone is going off a lot from whichever App, it’s just overwhelming AND everytime my phone goes off, it uses the battery, so I’m having to recharge it after about 8 hours.  All I wanted was my heart rate, my steps, time, and day like my past two fitbits (just don’t light up like they once did) then I saw answer your phone, heart rate (later read heart rate issue is not enabled on due to litigation), I figured that’d be okay.  Which they are, it’s all the apps!

product_name: Apple Watch Series 9 [GPS 45mm] Smartwatch with Midnight Aluminum Case with Midnight Sport Band M/L. Fitness Tracker, ECG Apps, Always-On Retina Display, Water Resistant
description: This could be a even better if we could charge it . Followed instructions to reboot watch and still would not charge.

product_name: Apple Watch Series 9 [GPS 45mm] Smartwatch with Midnight Aluminum Case with Midnight Sport Band M/L. Fitness Tracker, ECG Apps, Always-On Retina Display, Water Resistant
description: The battery life on this watch is very low. Constantly have to charge it.

product_name: Apple Watch Series 9 [GPS 45mm] Smartwatch with Midnight Aluminum Case with Midnight Sport Band M/L. Fitness Tracker, ECG Apps, Always-On Retina Display, Water Resistant
Apple Watch Series 9 [GPS 45mm] Smartwatch with Midnight Aluminum Case with Midnight Sport Band M/L. Fitness Tracker, ECG Apps, Always-On Retina Display, Water Resistant
description: The Apple Watch Series 9 stands out as an exceptional fitness companion.
