I'm a software developer by trade as well as a voracious reader and journaler, and let's face it; any first-generation device is going to have bugs.  That's just the way of it.  Overall, I am very pleased with the Scribe and use it for hours every day.  It has replaced paper planners and journals.  The only thing that keeps it from replacing my other Kindles as a reader is that it's a bit big.  However, the size is great for writing, so I'm not complaining.Let's look at it as an e-reader.  It's great.  It's a Kindle.  Amazon has had years to perfect the e-ink reading experience and I expected no less.  Because I read far more PDF's on this device than I did on earlier Kindles,  I have noticed that there seems to be an inconsistency in navigation with PDF's and, more importantly, the writing experience with them.  I address this later in the review.So, the Scribe as an e-writer: it's quite good!  Not perfect, but very good.  Let's look at the three main ways of writing on the Scribe:1) Annotating Kindle books - to the horror of my husband who thinks paper books are sacrosanct and should never be sullied by ink, I underline, highlight and annotate books.  I love buying a used book that someone before me has annotated.  I was initially disappointed that the Scribe does not allow annotating in the margins.  However, I quickly fell for adding handwritten notes to highlights (and the highlight can be minuscule).  It does keep the page clean and the notes can be rather copious.  It also creates a file of notes and their references.  Finally!  I can write in a library book!!2) Using native Scribe notebooks - based on my experience with the Mobiscribe, I thought that I'd use this the most.  I use it hardly at all.  It works quite well, but my beef with it is that, unlike the Mobiscribe, you cannot create your own templates or change page formats in the middle of a notebook.  (Ahem!  Amazon developers!!  I'm looking at you!)3) Annotating PDF's - Oh boy, do I use this extensively!  I buy a PDF notebook from an Etsy seller and happily scribble notes to my heart's content.  Sadly, this area is where the Scribe is the most buggy.  Sometimes (as mentioned above) PDF's simply can't be written on.  This appears to arise from three reasons.  1) the PDF wasn't uploaded correctly, 2) the PDF is in a format that the Scribe doesn't know how to handle, 3) the Scribe locks up.  So, how to fix these issues?First, just get into the habit of sending PDF's to the Scribe correctly.  There are a couple of ways to accomplish this.  1) Use the Send To Kindle web link: https://www.amazon.com/sendtokindle or 2) use the plug-in for Windows or Mac, a link to which can be found on the Send to Kindle page.  I'm lazy and prefer the plug-in.  I right-click on the file I want uploaded in Windows Explorer -> Send to -> Kindle.  It opens a little dialog box which, after the initial log in and choosing Scribe, sends it right to my Scribe.  Done.  Send via the email address?  No.  Send via a USB cable?  No.  Either use the web link or the plug-in and be done with it.2) PDF formatting issues.  I'd love to tell you exactly what the issue is here.  I've seen a couple of potential explanations on Reddit, and mistrust them.  I'm not sure anyone knows for sure right now.  I ran into the issue with a reading journal I bought on Etsy and the seller worked with me until he got it.  I didn't ask him what he changed.  I'm thinking that, at the moment, the Scribe is so new we're all rattling bones at it, hoping to stumble on the magic.  I'm hoping this will be fixed in future software releases.  (Yes, Amazon developers, I'm looking at you!)3) The Scribe simply locks up.  This seems to be an issue for those of us who extensively annotate PDFs.  I suspect a memory leak issue in the software that  gets fixed in a future software release (Yep, one more time, I'm looking at you, Amazon developers).  It could be a hardware issue if the processor chip needs to be more powerful.  The workarounds I've found depend on how badly the thing has locked up.  If the PDF either suddenly can't be written on or if the Scribe throws an error when trying to open a PDF, what frequently works is simply opening a Kindle book and then going back to the PDF.  If that doesn't work, a soft reboot from the top menu will usually clear its little brain and get things going again.  I have had it lock up so hard that the screen doesn't respond to anything.  That means a hard reboot with the switch on the side.  It's irritating to have this happen, but again, this is a first generation device, people!I know this review had gotten to the size of a blog post, and if you've gotten to this point thank you for staying with me.  There's more.There will always be people who complain that it isn't an iPad.  It's not supposed to be an iPad.  You want an iPad, buy an iPad.  The whole point of e-ink devices is that you don't have the distractions of a young full-blown computer.  You read.  You write.  We're done.  To me, the even bigger advantage is that there isn't the eyestrain of a tablet or computer.  You're not staring for hours into light emitted into your eyes.  I'm not knocking tablets.  I was a first generation adopter of the iPad those many years ago and use them happily still.  But for reading and now writing, give me an e-ink device.So, given that I've convinced you that a dedicated reader/writer is a good thing, why the Scribe?  This is trickier.  There are four major brands besides the Scribe, even the cheapest of which has features the Scribe doesn't have.  These four are Remarkable (now on Version2), Boox (and they have several devices to choose from), Ratta Supernote (a few devices), and MobiScribe.  I'd love to say I can review all four brands and compare/contrast.  I've used the Remarkable Version 1 and own both the original MobiScribe and the MobiScribe Origin.  Even the MobiScribe, the cheapest of the four, can do handwriting-to-text which the Scribe can't do (ahem).  So why would I go for the Scribe?  The biggest reason is the Kindle reading experience.  Kindle books can be read on the other devices, but with varying degrees of ease.  Because the Scribe was built by the people who built the Kindle, I expected Kindle books to be far better integrated and they are. At the moment, I'd say the Scribe is a perfect device for dedicated Kindle users.  If, however, you predominantly read PDFs, probably another device would be a better choice.  At least for now.The other reason the Scribe may be a good choice is the power of Amazon behind it.  Let's face it, if Amazon chooses to make the Scribe a success, listens to the early adopters and studies the abilities of the competition, they have the developmental horsepower to make this thing fly.  If, however, this first Scribe is a one-hit-wonder and Amazon decides that the market isn't big enough to justify the development costs, this thing is going to sink like the proverbial stone and I, for one, will be mad as a wet hen.  This is, unfortunately, a real possibility.  The number of consumers who want a dedicated e-ink writer are never going to be as great as those who want a more all-purpose tablet.  Amazon may decide that the e-ink reader market is where they're going to stay.  If that's their decision, I will cry.  Loudly.  Really loudly.If you made it this far, thanks for staying with me.  With all its quirks, I love the Scribe.  I hope you will, too.

product_name: Amazon Kindle Scribe (16 GB) - 10.2” 300 ppi Paperwhite display, a Kindle and a notebook all in one, convert notes to text and share, includes Basic Pen
description: So I had already upgraded my Kindle Paperwhite to the New Paperwhite Edition and then as I'm searching the internet for a digital notebook, I get brought back to Amazon to learn of this wonderful invention called The Kindle Scribe!Holy convenience Bat-Man! Now for anyone who is unsure what exactly the scribe is, let me break it down for you...it's a digital E-Ink Notebook/sketchbook that also allows you to read from your kindle library. This is nothing like the Kindle Fire or the iPad at all, so if you were hoping for a tablet that lets you surf the internet, check emails, and watch movies etc, this is not for you.If you're an avid notebook carrier who fears that one day your stuff might catch on fire and you'll lose all of your precious ideas and/or sketches, then this is for you! I had a close call with a journal of mine and then the dread sank in, bringing back PTSD of my floppy disks being ruined or CDs not writing all of the data properly! I never want to go through those days again. So I decided to give this a try. All my notes are saved, backed up, and easily accessible and if my Scribe somehow gets destroyed I'm confident in knowing purchasing another one will have every single note that I took.Now, if you've stayed with me this long, then you're apparently seriously considering buying it. Let me list below the pro's and con's of this Scribe.BIGGEST PRO -PHENOMENAL PEN!!! I'm not kidding ya'll. At first I was curious how well this "pen" with a built in eraser would work? Would it be super laggy? Would my handwriting look like garbage? The answer is...NO! I found myself often using the pen so naturally that when I erased something I blew on the page and dusted it as if there'd be eraser shavings! IT FEELS THAT LEGIT! No lags, it's lightening fast, and guess what? YOU CAN REST YOUR PALM ON THE SCREEN AND IT DOESN'T INTERRUPT WHAT YOU'RE DRAWING/WRITING! Needless to say it blew my mind. My friends all took a shot at using it and were having a blast while we waited in line at Disneyland - see the image above for their page full of writing fun. The fact that the pen doesn't need to be charged is also great. How does it work? I don't know, but it does! It also comes with several (4-6 I believe) replacement tips and I've only just started to notice the tip was fraying just a smidge but that's after doing light sketches using the "pencil" form of the pen. Have I mentioned how amazing the pen is? I legitimately feel like I am writing on actual paper and I get those lovely little writer tingles when I've finished a page.MORE PROs--You can adjust the number of lines or no lines that you want in each notebook! Wide-ruled, blank pages, normal journal pages, or grid. It also lets you stay organized, easy to go back and forth between notebooks and pickup where I left off.-Brightness is adjustable as well as having blue or orange light! [As someone who often wakes up in the middle of the night with an idea, this has been a great feature for me, so that I can jot the note down without burning my retinas from the blue of the screen]-Feels like paper! Like...I can't explain it. You'd have to try it to understand-You can straight up rest your entire hand on the screen and it won't interrupt your writing or the flow-Eco-friendly! As a writer and as someone who loves this planet, I will say that I often felt bad for buying notebooks because we're just tearing down trees left and right and our planet is suffocating. But nothing beats the feeling of turning a page or running your hands along the spine of a book or journal. But also we should move away from paper made from trees and try some alternatives. I will be using this Scribe until it dies and that will be THOUSANDS of pages later.CONS--Battery life is meh...but I also expected this. My Paperwhite is rarely charged because of how long the battery lasts. So months can go by and I'll pick it up and it'll be at 75%. The scribe is not that reliable. I've had maybe two weeks go by and will notice it drop to 45-ish%. Again, not bad! But not as impressive as other Kindles. But I also use it mainly for writing and not for reading so I'm sure the battery life would last less if I also read on it. Just keep it charged before you travel and you should get at least 2 weeks out of it with light reading and heavy writing.-The screen has frozen about 5 times in the month that I've had it, but NEVER crashed. It would pause, like it was trying to remember what it was doing, but then picks right back up and allows me to keep writing. This isn't a huge issue, but I'm trying to make sure ya'll know everything if you're still considering buying this.-Not a tablet. And I don't want it to be, but I know a lot of people are a wee bit confused as to what the Scribe is and who it's for. The answer is- it's for writers. Would I make an entire presentation on this? Absolutely not. Could I review documents and jot some notes on those for work? Yeah, but also...I have a work computer where I can do that. Will it be useful to have during meetings? YES! Jot down notes quickly and know that you can email them immediately after to everyone else. I believe it has (or if not yet out will have) the function to turn handwriting into typed font and that's just really freaking cool, you guys! I have yet to try it.-It will make you hate your handwriting but encourage you to writer better! I started writing in cursive on this thing because omg it makes my handwriting look so pretty and elegant. Even my friends who tried it out were trying to make their writing look pretty as well and as you can see in the pic above, it's amazing at actually capturing YOUR handwriting. Not something the system tries to match with your pen strokes.OVERALL?This bad boy is a winner ya'll. If  you're serious about switching from paper journaling to digital, you can't go wrong with this scribe. I have weirdly felt MORE creative with it, as I flip to the Kindle Library to look up some quick Mythos references in some of my books and then pop back over into my notes to keep world-building.  Now, once more, I will reiterate: THIS IS NOT A TABLET. This is an E-Notebook. It's a little hefty, but I've never once been afraid of dropping it and it actually makes me hold it like I would a real journal. It's okay to push the pen firmly on the screen and you'll see it reacts exactly like a real pen.If you are able to, I highly recommend getting the Premium Pen which comes with a dedicated eraser. It's much easier to use so I don't have to keep touching the screen to switch from pen to eraser.And...that's all I got. I know it was a lot but I hope it was informative. If ya'll have any questions reach out on here and I'm more than happy to share more of my experiences with the Kindle Scribe. Cheers!

product_name: HP 17 Business Laptop, 17.3” HD+ Display, 11th Gen Intel Core i3-1125G4 Processor, 32GB RAM, 1TB SSD, Wi-Fi, HDMI, Webcam, Windows 11 Pro, Silver
description: I never leave reviews, especially poor reviews, but NEED to share our story in case it helps you avoid what we just experienced.DO NOT buy this laptop. The price is *amazing* for its specs, and it is indeed too good to be true. Do not repeat my mistake.It is true this laptop is on the cheaper side - that was half the draw. While $500 is not much in the grand scheme of computers, it is still a lot of money. And, for that amount, it is fair to expect the machine to work properly right out of the box.I purchased this laptop (new) as a gift for my partner, to replace their old ASUS >10 years old. It was not intended for any intensive purpose. Truly, an Internet machine.We just returned it. My partner is upset, my gift to them ruined. I am despondent.Today is Tuesday. The laptop first arrived last Monday, and I completed initial Windows setup so it would be ready to go upon presentation of the gift later in the week. No issues during Windows setup that I could discern, so I replaced the packaging and wrapped it up pretty. Yay!This is where the joy stops.Within 24 hours of my partner receiving and starting to use the laptop (Thursday), it began to blue screen. Over, and over, and over. Even if nothing was running on the laptop.Countless hours my partner spent between Friday and Monday trying to fix the issue. Interestingly, System File Checker found corruptions on this brand new machine. Odd. Anyway, factory resets and Windows 11 re-installs did not stop the BSOD's, which all but confirms a hardware problem. The dump files (countless .dmp files) suggest power/circuitry malfunction. We did everything we could to fix this problem, short of opening up the laptop itself. Additionally, when the laptop was not BSOD-ing into oblivion, it would freeze entirely. WHY? It is new.Perhaps the CPU (Intel) was faulty. I heard about problems with  recent generations, so I went with this laptop that had an earlier (12th gen) CPU. Perhaps the 32GB RAM, which led me to buy this laptop, is cheaply made and caused the problem. Perhaps some other internal defect exists that we could not identify as we did not open up the machine. We'll never know why this was happening, unfortunately, because... The other half of this quandary is that HP restricts access to advanced BIOS settings so you cannot troubleshoot or fix issues. There is no way around it. Perhaps this is to keep an unsophisticated grandma from bricking her laptop. Perhaps this creates artificial necessity for HP's customer service, for which they charge more money. It is deplorable, regardless of the reason.Beyond the defective product, equally concerning is the return policy which states that a percentage (up to 50% of purchase price!) is withheld from the refund if seller and/or manufacturer decide the problem for which you returned the machine doesn't exist, and/or they dislike having to replace the original packaging. Insult to injury: if the laptop doesn't work, YOU MIGHT NOT GET YOUR MONEY BACK after you return it. My purchase was fulfilled through PCOnline US. I reserve comments until I see whether they choose to wrongly deprive me of a full refund. Even so, the policy should be called out as arbitrary, inconspicuous, and unfair to the consumer. When you buy a good, you are entitled to perfect tender. When you do not receive what you paid for, you are entitled to a refund.IN SHORT: A new laptop with these specs should not run this poorly. Period.

product_name: HP 17 Business Laptop, 17.3” HD+ Display, 11th Gen Intel Core i3-1125G4 Processor, 32GB RAM, 1TB SSD, Wi-Fi, HDMI, Webcam, Windows 11 Pro, Silver
description: I have been an HP customer for many, many years. The most recent purchases however have been somewhat disappointing. As to this laptop, I ordered it with Windows 11 Home and it came with Windows 11 S-mode. Not at all convenient to get out of. Also, I still haven't been able to get Outlook to accept my Gmail account. It didn't make my life easy.

product_name: HP 17 Business Laptop, 17.3” HD+ Display, 11th Gen Intel Core i3-1125G4 Processor, 32GB RAM, 1TB SSD, Wi-Fi, HDMI, Webcam, Windows 11 Pro, Silver
description: The laptop perfirmance could be better on this model. When casting to my smart TV, the quality of the picture is poor. I had to switch to another laptop to fix the problem. When I bought it I didn't realize that the keys didn't light; so I use my phone to see the keys in low lighting. I really do like the size and its relatively light. I didn't pay a lot for it. So the value for the money is ok. But I wish now I'd spent a little more money to get a better laptop. Long story short, if you're able to afford more, pay the extra and get a better laptop.

product_name: HP 17 Business Laptop, 17.3” HD+ Display, 11th Gen Intel Core i3-1125G4 Processor, 32GB RAM, 1TB SSD, Wi-Fi, HDMI, Webcam, Windows 11 Pro, Silver
description: I bought this computer because it has greater processing power and a terabite of storage space but honestly I didnt expect the battery to be so terrible. If youre going to refurbish computers,  shouldnt the battery be the first thing you upgrade? Its like I just bought an old computer. I barely get 2 hours withought having to plug it in. That is significantly less than the laptop I've had for at least 3 years now. Luckily i can still use this laptop for what I bought it for and use my other one for my writing and research. Thats why I didnt give it 1 star. But if i had to rely solely on this one,  I'd send it back.

product_name: HP 17 Business Laptop, 17.3” HD+ Display, 11th Gen Intel Core i3-1125G4 Processor, 32GB RAM, 1TB SSD, Wi-Fi, HDMI, Webcam, Windows 11 Pro, Silver
description: I bought this for my wife for school and the battery didn't last even 6 full hours from 100% until it shut down because she was unable to plug it in. It's not like she was running all kinds of apps all she was doing was reading power points. I bought the PRO lap top so I expected the battery would last a full day I guess I was wrong not I have to see if I can buy an extended life battery. Not 100% happy with purchase

product_name: HP 17 Business Laptop, 17.3” HD+ Display, 11th Gen Intel Core i3-1125G4 Processor, 32GB RAM, 1TB SSD, Wi-Fi, HDMI, Webcam, Windows 11 Pro, Silver
description: First let me say, this was a nice computer - large screen, quick startup - over all nice looking.  Now, I ordered it with Win Home version. It came with Win Pro and would not let me install programs. I had messages that this version was not authentic and I needed to either go buy the correct version or follow the instructions for reloading the correct version. Those directions were not for the average computer user. And where I could have followed the directions, I did not pay to have to reinstall anything on a computer that had been out of the box for 20 mins.  I reset everything to factory settings, boxed it up to send back. I'm ok with the $7 charge to return, but I was also charged $154.20 for restocking fee. This was not stated in the return process, nor any where on the website. So where this computer is a decent price  and had some good features, you might contact the seller to verify the Windows version you want and beware  should you need to return. $154.20 to restock is just ridiculous. I won't do business with them again.

product_name: HP 17 Business Laptop, 17.3” HD+ Display, 11th Gen Intel Core i3-1125G4 Processor, 32GB RAM, 1TB SSD, Wi-Fi, HDMI, Webcam, Windows 11 Pro, Silver
description: I was able to find a phone number for HP through Google search. After being transferred numerous times, I finally got a hold of a wonderful HP employee named Hazel from India who helped me troubleshoot the computer and ensure it wasn't an internal problem but just the cord. It was in fact the cord and they are sending me a replacement.

product_name: HP 17 Business Laptop, 17.3” HD+ Display, 11th Gen Intel Core i3-1125G4 Processor, 32GB RAM, 1TB SSD, Wi-Fi, HDMI, Webcam, Windows 11 Pro, Silver
description: I have trusted and bought from HP for years and not until this purchase have I been as disappointed as with this laptop. It freezes constantly and the size of a webpage is never right, it is so large I have to shrink it in order to see the whole page, or it is so small I can't see it. The taskbar is so tiny you can hardly read it and try to enlarge it is impossible. Can't stand this laptop and not sure if I will buy an HP laptop again.

product_name: HP 17 Business Laptop, 17.3” HD+ Display, 11th Gen Intel Core i3-1125G4 Processor, 32GB RAM, 1TB SSD, Wi-Fi, HDMI, Webcam, Windows 11 Pro, Silver
description: Well constructed and priced. The battery life didn’t meet our son’s expectations. The battery wasn’t getting him through his day in class.

product_name: HP 17 Business Laptop, 17.3” HD+ Display, 11th Gen Intel Core i3-1125G4 Processor, 32GB RAM, 1TB SSD, Wi-Fi, HDMI, Webcam, Windows 11 Pro, Silver
description: I am using the software that comes with this laptop to move my data and apps and settings from my old laptop to this one. This requires that I use Microsoft Backup in both places, and that requires that I purchase a subscription to MS365.  There is nothing in the Amazon webpage that says this is required, nor is there anything that says that all apps have to have been downloaded from the MS store in order for them to transfer. This feels like a deep hole that I have fallen into and while I can climb out of it, it will cost me a subscription of $70 a year minbimum to get out. That's yearly. If you want MS360 or already use it, fine. If not...go elsewhere.

product_name: HP 17 Business Laptop, 17.3” HD+ Display, 11th Gen Intel Core i3-1125G4 Processor, 32GB RAM, 1TB SSD, Wi-Fi, HDMI, Webcam, Windows 11 Pro, Silver
description: i wanted to wait a bit before I reviewed this, but I am going to go ahead and do it.  It is a wonderful product and it was at a great price.  Love the large screen.  It was easy to set up and I have been using almost two months!  I will update if  anything changes, but so far this is a fantastic laptop at a fantastic price.

product_name: HP 17 Business Laptop, 17.3” HD+ Display, 11th Gen Intel Core i3-1125G4 Processor, 32GB RAM, 1TB SSD, Wi-Fi, HDMI, Webcam, Windows 11 Pro, Silver
description: I bought this laptop to replace my old Toshiba. I use this one at work (my personal) basically for e-mail's, video's. It was easy to set up and the pages load really fast. I like the anti-glare screen also. The sound is ok but I already had external speakers that sound really good. For $500 you can not beat this deal! Well worth the money.

product_name: HP 17 Business Laptop, 17.3” HD+ Display, 11th Gen Intel Core i3-1125G4 Processor, 32GB RAM, 1TB SSD, Wi-Fi, HDMI, Webcam, Windows 11 Pro, Silver
description: I was really amazed at the ease at which I was able to unbox the laptop and it was ready to use in less than 30 minutes. The laptop is super fast and video quality. I would definitely recommend if you’re looking for a great business laptop. The size is amazing.

product_name: HP 17 Business Laptop, 17.3” HD+ Display, 11th Gen Intel Core i3-1125G4 Processor, 32GB RAM, 1TB SSD, Wi-Fi, HDMI, Webcam, Windows 11 Pro, Silver
description: SOME WORDS TO THE WISE. Overall, I'm satisfied with these HP17x laptops. BUT!!! There are a couple things to be WELL AWARE of, before buying. First, and FOREMOST. A word of caution! As most everyone knows, Microsoft has, for quite some time, been transitioning truly from a software company into a retail sales company. That fact is abundantly clear! Now, be well aware of what Microsoft has done in its latest versions of WIN11-HOME. Many (perhaps most???, perhaps all???) Windows11-HOME based computers are delivered with the OS in "S-Mode." We run HP desktop and laptop computers exclusively, so I can speak only to my several more recent HP purchases. However, I no longer subscribe to WIN11-HOME. All of my recent purchases have been ordered with the WIN11-PRO OS. My advice to those considering buying any computer preloaded with WIN11-HOME: "stay well away." "S-Mode", does not allow the user to load any 3rd-party software. All software must be obtained (think $$$$$) from the MS Store. While MS claims that the procedure required to exit "S-Mode" is quite simple, in fact, we've found that it is nearly IMPOSSIBLE!!! And, it will require the involvement of MS 'off-shore' tech assistance, which is not necessarily easily obtained. One such call that I received, after HOURS of waiting, arrived at 2AM. If buying an HP17x laptop, order with WIN11-PRO. PRO versions are not restricted by "S-Mode" software. Now, to the computer. Typical of HP products, this laptop is well built, with an excellent display. Ports are somewhat limited, but, for me, that is not a deal-breaker. I like having the 32GB of RAM, and at least 1TB of storage. I expect these laptops to be more than adequate into the foreseeable future. My one complaint with these, and it is critical, is that the integral cooling system is WHOLLY inadequate. When used for long periods of time, especially on mains power, which we do, these computers will run HOT!!! My take on that is, putting an engineer and an accountant together, on any design project, inevitably results in trouble. In an effort to make this laptop as slim and as light-weight as possible, the internal cooling apparatus has suffered for it. In these, the CPU does generate a lot of heat. The air duct is quite small and narrow, and the internal fan is a joke, except that it's not. So!!! Buy a serious laptop cooler, to go along with your laptop purchase. And, I don't mean one of those multi-fan, USB powered units, that generate heat to remove heat. High quality, AC/DC-adapter powered gaming type coolers are available from Amazon. You'll be happy you made the purchase. At first, battery life is quite short, but we've seen that over time (repeated charge/discharge cycles) battery life does improve some. In our case, having to use mains powered coolers, we simply use mains power for our laptops, and we don't rely much on battery power. Of course, bear in mind that having to have access to AC power does diminish the practicability of using a laptop computer, in the first place. The HP17x series are big computers with a healthy display. One minor complaint is the lack of a backlit keyboard. But, for the money (around $500), these were still a good buy.

product_name: HP 17 Business Laptop, 17.3” HD+ Display, 11th Gen Intel Core i3-1125G4 Processor, 32GB RAM, 1TB SSD, Wi-Fi, HDMI, Webcam, Windows 11 Pro, Silver
description: This is a very fast computer and starts up and ready to run in less than a minute.  The only draw back was the listing didn't say it came in S mode which I do not like. I was able to take it out of S mode, but that does affect the way it runs slightly. Overall it runs good.

product_name: HP 17 Business Laptop, 17.3” HD+ Display, 11th Gen Intel Core i3-1125G4 Processor, 32GB RAM, 1TB SSD, Wi-Fi, HDMI, Webcam, Windows 11 Pro, Silver
description: This is an excellent laptop computer!  All of the features you could need. The touchscreen is a great plus. The amount of memory and the processor speed is perfect for home word processing and graphic design. It speeds through the internet and is very fast overall. I highly recommend this laptop!

product_name: HP 17 Business Laptop, 17.3” HD+ Display, 11th Gen Intel Core i3-1125G4 Processor, 32GB RAM, 1TB SSD, Wi-Fi, HDMI, Webcam, Windows 11 Pro, Silver
description: It does what it supposed to do, very fast and lots of storage space. The price is excellent for the specs

product_name: HP 17 Business Laptop, 17.3” HD+ Display, 11th Gen Intel Core i3-1125G4 Processor, 32GB RAM, 1TB SSD, Wi-Fi, HDMI, Webcam, Windows 11 Pro, Silver
description: While looking for a new laptop with more storage I came across this laptop.  Once I received it I set it up, which was easy. Fast forward 5 months, and I get this beautiful (sarcastic) blue screen that stated boot device not found. After a round with HP who said that my warranty was voided because the third party who actually sold my laptop changed the SSD from the original 256 SSD to the 1 TD. That WASN’T mentioned anywhere in the description (at the time of this review).Thanks to Asurion I finally got my laptop fixed, so far so good. Don't get me wrong it worked amazing before it gave me the blue screen, and now as well. I'm not giving a not so good review to the laptop I'm giving it to who sold it and not put what was done in any of the descriptions or that what they did voided the warranty from HP.

product_name: HP 17 Business Laptop, 17.3” HD+ Display, 11th Gen Intel Core i3-1125G4 Processor, 32GB RAM, 1TB SSD, Wi-Fi, HDMI, Webcam, Windows 11 Pro, Silver
description: I purchased this laptop 9 months ago.  In general, it meets all of my needs for a business and personal laptop.  However, my expectation was that I could use a docking station to connect to external monitors like my old Dell did.  However, this HP model does not support graphics via its USB-C port.  So, the monitor ports on the 3rd party docking station that I purchased from Amazon don't work.  All the other ports do work as expected.I was able to connect a second external monitor through the docking station by purchasing a Diamond Mutimedia BVU165LT adaptor ($31.78 from Amazon).  It has a built-in Display Link video card to generate graphics and comes with adaptors for HDMI, DVI, and VGA Monitors.  I now run one monitor via the BVU165LT, one through the laptop's HDMI port, plus the internal display.  You can run more monitors by purchasing BVU165LT adaptors for each one.Other than needing the Diamond adaptor for the third display, I am generally pleased with the HP laptop.  As others have noted, it is a good, solid unit.  The battery life has lasted for at least four hours.  It is lighter than my old Dell, which was a real road warrior.  The graphics are good, but probably not up to intense gaming, which isn't my thing.

product_name: HP 17 Business Laptop, 17.3” HD+ Display, 11th Gen Intel Core i3-1125G4 Processor, 32GB RAM, 1TB SSD, Wi-Fi, HDMI, Webcam, Windows 11 Pro, Silver
description: I bought computer this because it suits my usage needs. I don't need the latest processor, but I do need on-board storage. I don't game or run AI, I just use office programs, mainly to write. The 1 TB SSD and i3 processor suit me just fine.It does have some frustrating downsides, primarily relating to Windows 11 (Pro). I don't know if these are built into the OS or if it's the manufacturer's implementation. The main frustration is that when I change settings like default font, start menu apps, etc., the changes disappear when I restart the computer--sometimes even during use. Also I can find no way to back up onto a hard drive. Win 11 insists that I use OneDrive. Do they not know that there are still many places where internet is not available? Maybe that's an urban bias. There are lots of places in rural America where you can't even get a cell signal!There seem to be many useful features of Win 10 that have vanished in Win 11. When I search for advice, I find instructions supposedly for Win 11 that reference tabs or links that I don't seem to have. That's not the computer's fault, but it is saddled with an OS that frustrates the dickens out of me. I know any computer I buy (unless I assimilate with the Borg) will have Win 11, but it nevertheless affects my satisfaction rating of this computer.

product_name: JBL Flip 6 - Portable Bluetooth Speaker, powerful sound and deep bass, IPX7 waterproof, 12 hours of playtime, JBL PartyBoost for multiple speaker pairing for home, outdoor and travel (Blue)
description: I bought two of the JBL Flip6 speakers in March of 2023.  I keep one upstairs, and one downstairs.  They sound as good as the reviews say they sound.  One works flawlessly, and charges the battery with any USB-C cable.  The second one would only charge with the provided JBL branded USB-C cable, and now, even the JBL branded USB-C cable will not charge the unit.  I've cleaned the Flip6's USB port, inspected it under magnification for flaws(found none), reset the unit software several times, but to no avail.  This second unit will only play if plugged into an AC plug, which defeats the purpose of a shock proof, water resistant, go anywhere speaker.  It's now out of warranty, so I guess I'm out $129 USD.  I like the one that works, but I'm not sure I'll replace the defective one with another JBL.  It's too much money to gamble with.

product_name: JBL Flip 6 - Portable Bluetooth Speaker, powerful sound and deep bass, IPX7 waterproof, 12 hours of playtime, JBL PartyBoost for multiple speaker pairing for home, outdoor and travel (Blue)
description: I bought this speaker because I have another JBL speaker JBl charge 4. I was hoping this one would be as good as that one, but is a notch down. Being JBL, they can do better.

product_name: JBL Flip 6 - Portable Bluetooth Speaker, powerful sound and deep bass, IPX7 waterproof, 12 hours of playtime, JBL PartyBoost for multiple speaker pairing for home, outdoor and travel (Blue)
description: This speaker is touted to last 20hrs on a single charge. However my experience has been closer to eight. It does deliver excellent sound it just doesn't last nearly long enough.

product_name: JBL Flip 6 - Portable Bluetooth Speaker, powerful sound and deep bass, IPX7 waterproof, 12 hours of playtime, JBL PartyBoost for multiple speaker pairing for home, outdoor and travel (Blue)
description: This speaker has a very nice sound for music. I have several flip 4's that support phone calls, so I had no idea they changed their speakers. This speaker will not support phone/zoom calls. This is a huge disappointment. They should have let the consumers know they REMOVED this feature.If you want to listen to music, this is a great portable speaker. IF however you need to listen to a zoom call, you are out of luck.Found this out too late to return it, so I guess I am stuck.

product_name: JBL Flip 6 - Portable Bluetooth Speaker, powerful sound and deep bass, IPX7 waterproof, 12 hours of playtime, JBL PartyBoost for multiple speaker pairing for home, outdoor and travel (Blue)
description: I've had this product just short of a year. Sounds great...sometimes has pairing issues, but still everything was good.Then it fell into a hot tub. I say fell because it was sitting on the side and apparently the base made it bounce right into the hot tub. I was on top of it though and rescued it out of the water within 15 seconds or so. I wasn't too worried though because it is "waterproof" right? Just like it says in the description.Webster's gives us this definition of waterproof: impervious to waterespecially : covered or treated with a material (such as a solution of rubber) to prevent permeation by waterJust to be clear, Webster's defines Impervious as :1: not allowing entrance or passage : impenetrablea coat impervious to rainb: not capable of being damaged or harmeda carpet impervious to rough treatment2: not capable of being affected or disturbedimpervious to criticismWell...apparently JBL doesn't agree with those definitions.I immediately dried it off and then stuck it in a bowl of wice....no joy.First the warranty reporting barriers:I had to register the product first. My bad i should have done that, but almost every product I've seen has some kind of serial and model number SOMEWHERE on the product. The serial number is there (it took customer service to show me where...on a small spindle that holds the wrist strap (see picture). No model number anywhere.But, because they required me to register online before I could go through the warranty, I needed a model and serial number, with the model number ONLY being on the OG box. So I just randomly picked one from the drop down and then randomly put a bunch of numbers in for the serial number.Amazingly, this worked...however it said I needed to call their 800 number for warranty info.When I called the recording said they don't do warranty, I have to go through the website...which was what told me to contact them by phone....Anywho..I finally got someone and explained what the situation was. First, she chastised me for allowing it to fall into the water and said that normally that is NOT covered by the warranty.  I, of course, retorted with the definition of waterproof and she said the exterior was waterproof but the interior was not????I was also told that because I bought from Amazon they don't cover the warranty..I have to go through Amazon, which DOES NOT PROCESS WARRANTY CLAIMS.after a bit of raised voices...she agreed to send me a new unit. She then told me how to find the serial number, which is located UNDER the wrist strap in very small letters (see pic)This is getting 2 stars only because, after an hour of f^%ing around..I finally got a warranty replacement.But for FFS... this is outright false advertisement.The tiniest immersion in water is going to brick it.Maybe they should go with "water resistant".TL;DR: If you intend to use this around water...don't get one. They LIE. It is NOT waterproof.

product_name: JBL Flip 6 - Portable Bluetooth Speaker, powerful sound and deep bass, IPX7 waterproof, 12 hours of playtime, JBL PartyBoost for multiple speaker pairing for home, outdoor and travel (Blue)
description: Finally bit the bullet and had to buy a new speaker after many years of EXEMPLARY performance from my JBL Charge 3. I would have loved to have just bought another one, but of course...planned obsolescence...just keep making newer models when the old ones work perfectly fine. *sigh*Things I like about this speaker:- Sound is ALMOST as good, but maybe only 80%Things I don't like about this speaker:- Smaller size (which I imagine accounts for some of the lack of sound quality/capability.- Battery life seems to be correct to what they claim, HOWEVER it is LESS than the JBL Charge 3 which means more frequent charging, which is a pain.- Doesn't come with a wall plug. USB Cable only. Fortunately, I can use my JBL 3 wall plug with this cable, but this really shouldn't have to be the case.- This speaker has no bottom/base and therefore no way to set it properly when horizontal. I have no interest in the vertical mode, but miss having a bottom, because the thing has literally rolled off the edge of a flat surface. Ridiculous.Won't be buying JBL again if this is the only output coming out of them now.

product_name: JBL Flip 6 - Portable Bluetooth Speaker, powerful sound and deep bass, IPX7 waterproof, 12 hours of playtime, JBL PartyBoost for multiple speaker pairing for home, outdoor and travel (Blue)
description: It’s just so outdated and pricey for what you get compared to brands like Soundcore, Bose, and Ultimate Ears. JBL is living off their reputation right now while the Bluetooth speaker industry passes them by!

product_name: JBL Flip 6 - Portable Bluetooth Speaker, powerful sound and deep bass, IPX7 waterproof, 12 hours of playtime, JBL PartyBoost for multiple speaker pairing for home, outdoor and travel (Blue)
description: Nothing against the seller because they probably weren't aware but the package was delayed in shipping, there is a slight trebble crackling or popping noise coming from the speaker on certain tones. I read that the speaker was refurbished through the manufacturer or checked for QC through the manufacturer? It seems sus that they would allow their product to slip through QC with a crackling speaker just my thoughts anyway. I don't think it's much better than the flip 5 other than battery life for now and the tone is slightly bassier/deeper which is kind of annoying. If it were slightly cheaper it would be worth it but being at $100 after tax it's not worth it, you're paying for a name basically.

product_name: JBL Flip 6 - Portable Bluetooth Speaker, powerful sound and deep bass, IPX7 waterproof, 12 hours of playtime, JBL PartyBoost for multiple speaker pairing for home, outdoor and travel (Blue)
description: I love JBL Flip; I have two others. Maybe it’s just this particular device but the battery life on this model doesn’t last as long as Flip 5.

product_name: JBL Flip 6 - Portable Bluetooth Speaker, powerful sound and deep bass, IPX7 waterproof, 12 hours of playtime, JBL PartyBoost for multiple speaker pairing for home, outdoor and travel (Blue)
description: I feel at this point Bluetooth speakers of this type are more similar than different when it comes to sound quality and overall performance.  So what sets them apart are going to be small idiosyncrasies.  Something I found incredibly annoying about this speaker is every time you turn it on it makes a loud sound that is supposed to mimic a race car starting up or something.  I'm not sure who this feature is for, but it got real old fast.  I also felt the auto shut off was a bit too aggressive, after what felt to me like relatively brief pauses I'd have to go turn it on again and listen to the annoying race car sound again.  Battery life indicator was sort of useless as well.In general this is a decent product but I sense there are better choices.

product_name: JBL Flip 6 - Portable Bluetooth Speaker, powerful sound and deep bass, IPX7 waterproof, 12 hours of playtime, JBL PartyBoost for multiple speaker pairing for home, outdoor and travel (Blue)
description: The JBL Flip 6 Bluetooth speaker is an absolute winner! This speaker delivers exceptional sound quality with deep bass and crystal-clear highs that make my music sound fantastic, whether I’m indoors or out. The 360-degree sound really fills the space and creates an immersive listening experience.One of the best features is its portability. The compact size makes it super easy to take anywhere, and it fits perfectly in my backpack or on a small shelf. Despite its small size, it packs a powerful punch and can get surprisingly loud without any distortion.The Bluetooth connectivity is seamless and has a good range, allowing me to play music from my phone without any interruptions. The battery life is impressive too, lasting for hours on a single charge, which is perfect for long outings or parties.Another big plus is its durability. The Flip 6 is waterproof and rugged, so I never worry about taking it to the beach or poolside. It’s built to withstand splashes and even the occasional drop.Overall, the JBL Flip 6 is a top-notch Bluetooth speaker that combines great sound, portability, and durability. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a reliable and high-quality speaker!

product_name: JBL Flip 6 - Portable Bluetooth Speaker, powerful sound and deep bass, IPX7 waterproof, 12 hours of playtime, JBL PartyBoost for multiple speaker pairing for home, outdoor and travel (Blue)
description: These will always be my favorite speakers. This is the third I have bought of these. After years of one JB Flip, it finally gave out on me and I bought another. I have dropped one of these in a deep sink at work and after a couple days it was right back to playing as clear as before and was functioning just fine. This one was one I bought for my dad for Father’s Day. He loved the Camo color and of course when he tested it out it gave really strong and clear sound. The Bluetooth connected easily, and from my experience with these speakers, for me it was worth the money. I known it will last for years.

product_name: JBL Flip 6 - Portable Bluetooth Speaker, powerful sound and deep bass, IPX7 waterproof, 12 hours of playtime, JBL PartyBoost for multiple speaker pairing for home, outdoor and travel (Blue)
description: I'm no audiophile but I do appreciate a good speaker. This little guy has blown me away in terms of sound quality.Its easy to bring anywhere and connects right away to my phone. Great deal when on sale.

product_name: JBL Flip 6 - Portable Bluetooth Speaker, powerful sound and deep bass, IPX7 waterproof, 12 hours of playtime, JBL PartyBoost for multiple speaker pairing for home, outdoor and travel (Blue)
description: The teal speaker looks just as shown. We threw a party and connected this speaker with another JBL through Bluetooth and it worked out perfectly. Simple buttons and seems very durable. Great value for such a great quality speaker. 10/10 for sure. Way louder then my friends Bose speaker that cost her more.

product_name: JBL Flip 6 - Portable Bluetooth Speaker, powerful sound and deep bass, IPX7 waterproof, 12 hours of playtime, JBL PartyBoost for multiple speaker pairing for home, outdoor and travel (Blue)
description: Amazing sound, great battery life are the top features of the Flip 6. The “JBL Portable” app allows you to dial in EQ settings to your liking, but you can also EQ it, so to speak, by merely rotating the Flip 6; you’ll hear more high frequencies if the large JBL logo is facing you. Portable fun!

product_name: JBL Flip 6 - Portable Bluetooth Speaker, powerful sound and deep bass, IPX7 waterproof, 12 hours of playtime, JBL PartyBoost for multiple speaker pairing for home, outdoor and travel (Blue)
description: I Love This Thing! Powerful Bass, small and still gets the job done…the only thing I'm not happy with is that I paid for over night shipping but didn't get it until a week later...almost canceled order because of this but it had already shipped and then updated...it's OK. Fool me once shame on you, fool me twice, shame on me.

product_name: JBL Flip 6 - Portable Bluetooth Speaker, powerful sound and deep bass, IPX7 waterproof, 12 hours of playtime, JBL PartyBoost for multiple speaker pairing for home, outdoor and travel (Blue)
description: The sound was excellent. Loved the durability and ease of use. After a little more than two years, the device totally died on me. I cannot power it up. I searched online for fixes and tried them. Nothing worked. I now have a very nice, stylish paperweight. Not sure if I am going to buy another one or look to get this repaired.

product_name: JBL Flip 6 - Portable Bluetooth Speaker, powerful sound and deep bass, IPX7 waterproof, 12 hours of playtime, JBL PartyBoost for multiple speaker pairing for home, outdoor and travel (Blue)
description: I bought this as a backup for my beloved flip 5 that’s been awesome both indoors and out in all weather extremes imaginable  (AZ deserts at 116, going under flipping the kayak, ice storms, a tumble down a mountain side, everything) and still working as if new playing nearly all day everyday for 4 years. This one sounds and works just as well and hopefully built with the same “precious durability” that makes these worth every penny (imo).

product_name: JBL Flip 6 - Portable Bluetooth Speaker, powerful sound and deep bass, IPX7 waterproof, 12 hours of playtime, JBL PartyBoost for multiple speaker pairing for home, outdoor and travel (Blue)
description: GREAT speaker and lasts a long time on one charge. The sound is amazing with good range.  Originally bought for my husband to take goling but darn, he forgets it sometimes and I can take it with me outside when I'm gardening, painting, or if we have friends over, it nice to be playing some jazz during happy hour and dinner. Did buy the carrying case and it is a great way to keep track of the cord and use for traveling.

product_name: JBL Flip 6 - Portable Bluetooth Speaker, powerful sound and deep bass, IPX7 waterproof, 12 hours of playtime, JBL PartyBoost for multiple speaker pairing for home, outdoor and travel (Blue)
description: I have been struggling to find a home speaker that will pair easily with my iPhone and play decent quality audio we’ve tried the Sonos which was a nightmare because I had to pair my iPhone with it’s app every other time I used it it would never seamlessly connect with my Spotify or Amazon music  or even my iTunes. It had to be updated constantly and the process was Machiavellian. So I tried the echo and it was a constant trial and really Amazon specific I also hated the latent spying that comes along with it. So we went with this little JBL and I am loving it. I wish it wasn’t just a Bluetooth connection so calls and game sounds go through it but for what I wanted it’s working the best of anything we’ve tried.

product_name: GoPro HERO12 Black - Waterproof Action Camera with 5.3K60 Ultra HD Video, 27MP Photos, HDR, 1/1.9" Image Sensor, Live Streaming, Webcam, Stabilization
description: I graduated first in my medical school class so I'm an intelligent person.  This go pro has very difficult controls.  Mine had no readable instructions;  only microscopic print that I could not read.  Then they insist that you install an app on your cell phone (probably so they can track you). The reason I bought the thing was because I didn't have a phone!  Why buy this thing if you have a phone?  Then they say go to their website, but the website download doesn't work for my computer.  Then the camera doesn't work.  I just wasted a lot of money on this piece of junk.  I will never buy anything from this company again.

product_name: GoPro HERO12 Black - Waterproof Action Camera with 5.3K60 Ultra HD Video, 27MP Photos, HDR, 1/1.9" Image Sensor, Live Streaming, Webcam, Stabilization
description: Bought this to replace my GoPro Hero 4 for motovlogging. I had it for just over a month and had multiple issues. SD card corruption, audio not working, it's annoying and cumbersome to change the batteries, and the icing on the cake was that it will NOT pair with my DJI Mic 2 bluetooth microphone.Just to change the batteries I have to unplug my mic from the media mod, unscrew the camera from the mount, take off the media mod (which is a pain in itself), replace the battery, then put it all back together.I've been a loyal GoPro user for a long time, but I had to end up getting something else for what my intended use is. The camera quality is great and I love the mobile app, it's just not good for my specific application.

product_name: GoPro HERO12 Black - Waterproof Action Camera with 5.3K60 Ultra HD Video, 27MP Photos, HDR, 1/1.9" Image Sensor, Live Streaming, Webcam, Stabilization
description: Tried this camera hard to navigate and set up . There is a learning curve for this GoPro, its not for me. I bought a GoPro 10 easier to navigate, longer battery life.

product_name: GoPro HERO12 Black - Waterproof Action Camera with 5.3K60 Ultra HD Video, 27MP Photos, HDR, 1/1.9" Image Sensor, Live Streaming, Webcam, Stabilization
description: Send back as it is a repackaged unit. Disappointed to open the box and see that all the cables weee unbundled and the camera unit itself was dirty with water spots indicating use.Will buy a replacement direct from GoProReplacing a Hero 12 that is used for auto racing and was damaged to to significant impact, overall happy with the Hero 12, just knowing they are delicate don’t want to start with something someone else returned.

product_name: GoPro HERO12 Black - Waterproof Action Camera with 5.3K60 Ultra HD Video, 27MP Photos, HDR, 1/1.9" Image Sensor, Live Streaming, Webcam, Stabilization
description: I have purchased multiple cameras of different formats over many years. This is my first GoPro. It's my last also. Nearly every time I try to use it, It shuts off and when I turn it back on I get a message saying that it overheated. The first time it happened it complained about my video card. I purchased the appropriate video card... Didn't help a bit. So then went online and searched for why GoPros get too hot, and I found a video on YouTube telling me that if I bought a metal case it would help drain the heat away from the camera. So I spent $45 on that. That doesn't help too much either. 1 out of six times it will work for a while. It shuts off every single time. If I had checked it out before my expiration I would have returned it. Don't waste your money. There's something inherently wrong with the way these cameras function. If it was $45 I could say oh well I lost some money and it was a mistake. This was an expensive purchase and I deeply regret it.

product_name: GoPro HERO12 Black - Waterproof Action Camera with 5.3K60 Ultra HD Video, 27MP Photos, HDR, 1/1.9" Image Sensor, Live Streaming, Webcam, Stabilization
description: I was trying to use it for my sons' baseball games and it would just overheat after about an hour and a half.  It wasn't even very hot (80s), but it was in direct sunlight which I expect was the problem.  However, for a camera that seems most useful outdoors, this is a major issue in my opinion.  We have rigged solutions to it like putting a fan on it or covering it, but it's ridiculous to have to turn to an aftermarket solution for this.

product_name: GoPro HERO12 Black - Waterproof Action Camera with 5.3K60 Ultra HD Video, 27MP Photos, HDR, 1/1.9" Image Sensor, Live Streaming, Webcam, Stabilization
description: Main set back is cloud being ill manageable. Its very difficult to upload videos and photos in the social media. Once it gets uploaded in the app, it should go to the cloud and then download in phone. Only then can post in my social media. It is not user friendly. But has good video and picture quality.

product_name: GoPro HERO12 Black - Waterproof Action Camera with 5.3K60 Ultra HD Video, 27MP Photos, HDR, 1/1.9" Image Sensor, Live Streaming, Webcam, Stabilization
description: An unexpected problem and an unpleasant problem - the camera turns off due to overheating, after 15-20 minutes of work.The main part of the overheating was “removed” by more gentle settings, it only remains to find metal legs that will work as a heat sink, since plastic ones contribute to overheating.

product_name: GoPro HERO12 Black - Waterproof Action Camera with 5.3K60 Ultra HD Video, 27MP Photos, HDR, 1/1.9" Image Sensor, Live Streaming, Webcam, Stabilization
description: Great video quality but once it overheats it shuts off and that happens at around the 15 min mark.

product_name: GoPro HERO12 Black - Waterproof Action Camera with 5.3K60 Ultra HD Video, 27MP Photos, HDR, 1/1.9" Image Sensor, Live Streaming, Webcam, Stabilization
description: Battery life is far too short

product_name: GoPro HERO12 Black - Waterproof Action Camera with 5.3K60 Ultra HD Video, 27MP Photos, HDR, 1/1.9" Image Sensor, Live Streaming, Webcam, Stabilization
description: ### Review: GoPro HERO 12I recently purchased the GoPro HERO 12, and it has exceeded my expectations in every aspect. I managed to get it on sale for $299, which feels like an incredible bargain for such a feature-rich action camera.#### Build and DesignThe HERO 12 maintains the rugged and durable build quality that GoPro is known for. It’s compact, sturdy, and waterproof up to 33 feet without any additional housing. This makes it perfect for all kinds of adventures, from mountain biking to snorkeling.#### PerformanceThe video quality is outstanding. With the capability to shoot 5.3K video at 60fps, the HERO 12 captures stunningly detailed and smooth footage. The color accuracy and low-light performance are also impressive, making it versatile for various shooting conditions.#### Battery LifeOne of the standout features for me has been the battery life. Even during extended shooting sessions, I experienced no overheating issues, and the battery lasted significantly longer than expected. This reliability is crucial for capturing those perfect moments without interruption.#### User InterfaceThe interface is another highlight. It’s incredibly intuitive and user-friendly, with a responsive touch screen that makes navigating the settings a breeze. The voice control feature is also very handy, allowing me to start and stop recording without physically touching the camera.#### FeaturesThe HERO 12 is packed with advanced features. The HyperSmooth 4.0 stabilization technology is phenomenal, providing gimbal-like stability in the most turbulent conditions. Additionally, the TimeWarp 3.0 feature allows for stunning time-lapse videos, and the live streaming capability is a great bonus for sharing adventures in real-time.#### ConnectivityConnecting the camera to my phone via the GoPro app was seamless. The app provides an array of options for editing and sharing footage, making the whole process very convenient. The built-in Wi-Fi and Bluetooth connectivity ensure easy transfer of files.#### ConclusionOverall, the GoPro HERO 12 is an exceptional action camera that delivers on all fronts. Its combination of superior video quality, excellent battery life, robust build, and user-friendly interface makes it a top choice for both amateur and professional users. At the sale price of $299, it’s an unbeatable value. Highly recommended for anyone looking to capture their adventures in stunning detail!

product_name: GoPro HERO12 Black - Waterproof Action Camera with 5.3K60 Ultra HD Video, 27MP Photos, HDR, 1/1.9" Image Sensor, Live Streaming, Webcam, Stabilization
description: Sorry I don't know how to edit videos yet so I can't show you what I will be talking about yet. I recently bought the hero 12 kinda by accident. I wanted to buy one but I didn't want to spend the money though. I had put a camera and a sd card in my cart and forgot about it, well I needed some vacuum bag rolls to freeze something, anyway I bought the go pro with that, oops.I have purchased a few other cameras to mount to my motorcycle, needless to say I was buying the cheapest I could that seemed to be ok. Well they weren't. When I mounted them to my bike the image quality was just terrible. I ride a Harley and I don't know if it was vibrations from that, or the stabilization wasn't up to snuff. I figured because I had the go pro in hand I would at least try it and if it didn't do what I wanted I could send it back.Well it works great. That is all I have to say about it. I haven't even gone into the more advanced set up features; and, I made my first video this morning and I was shocked at how smooth the video capture was. The colors were normal, I mean it looked like it did when I saw it with my own eyes, so I'm good with that. The purpose of the camera is to document if anything happens while I'm riding and it does that very well. I really didn't want to spend that much, but I will be keeping the Hero 12 Black and I am looking forward to learning how to use it better. The 25% off makes it a little easier to swallow buying one. I've looked at them for awhile and the price is reasonable in the end. I have a 256GB micro sd for now but it will take up to a terabyte if I want to spend the money, for long rides.End of the story is basically, I love this camera after one use and look forward to using it more. If I can't get the wife to come with me, I can make her watch the videos of the trip at least. Great camera so far, I'm curious to see how it handles a rain storm but I say buy it! I can't wait to figure out how to bluetooth it to the mic on my helmet for voice commands and to see if I will be able to narrate that way while I am riding. It has so many features that it will take me awhile to learn all of them and get the camera set up to do everything I want, or it is at least capable of. Not unhappy I bought it, still kinda expensive, but with these kinds of things you truly get what you pay for.

product_name: GoPro HERO12 Black - Waterproof Action Camera with 5.3K60 Ultra HD Video, 27MP Photos, HDR, 1/1.9" Image Sensor, Live Streaming, Webcam, Stabilization
description: The GoPro Hero 12 is nothing short of phenomenal! The image quality is breathtaking, with crisp, vibrant colors and exceptional clarity even in challenging conditions. The new features, including enhanced stabilization and advanced low-light performance, make it a game-changer for capturing every detail of my adventures. The intuitive interface and user-friendly design make it easy to navigate, while the robust build ensures it can handle any environment. Whether you're diving deep or scaling heights, the Hero 12 is a must-have for any action enthusiast. Highly recommended for its impressive performance and reliability!

product_name: GoPro HERO12 Black - Waterproof Action Camera with 5.3K60 Ultra HD Video, 27MP Photos, HDR, 1/1.9" Image Sensor, Live Streaming, Webcam, Stabilization
description: I had been using the GoPro 3 for some YouTube video and other projects. I decided it was time to upgrade. And...... WOW! What a huge difference! The video quality and stabilization is amazing in comparison. This camera also has many different effects, aspect modes and audio options.Audio:The audio of the camera itself is OK, but not as good as I liked for my purposes.  I like to do some interview style videos.  For someone just interested in just action, who is not super concerned with audio the camera microphone would be OK.  BUT... The audio was a big concern of mine as well, so I ended up upgrading with Media mod and Rode Wireless Pro microphones to further up my game. Highly recommend if you are looking to up your audio game.Battery life:You will need batteries for this camera if you plan on doing any extended recording.  Especially with a media mod.  It really seems to eat up battery charge with the added mod.  Highly recommend having a few  on hand.Heat:The camera is meant to be moving, hence action camera. IT will heat up if setup stationary on a tripod.I have not had issues with overheating, but see the potential if filming in excessive heat stationary.Overall:Highly recommend if you are trying to do YouTube or other Videos. Enjoy! Have Fun!!Originally I tried to go on a budget and just get the camera.  Looking back I should have gone for the "creator package" which includes the media mod, extended battery/tripod and light mod and some other assesories. For the money it would have worked out better in the end for me.

product_name: GoPro HERO12 Black - Waterproof Action Camera with 5.3K60 Ultra HD Video, 27MP Photos, HDR, 1/1.9" Image Sensor, Live Streaming, Webcam, Stabilization
description: Picture quality is great and it’s easy to use. But the battery life is pretty terrible. Definitely bring lots of extra batteries if you’re gonna be using it for an extended period of time.

product_name: GoPro HERO12 Black - Waterproof Action Camera with 5.3K60 Ultra HD Video, 27MP Photos, HDR, 1/1.9" Image Sensor, Live Streaming, Webcam, Stabilization
description: I've had every GoPro since the hero 9 and can confidently say I am pleasantly pleased with this hero 12. Image quality is good, processing is superior to earlier generations. I wanted the dual mounting methods are absolutely fantastic. With the hero 13 on the horizon, this is at the right price. If you can only buy one camera, this accomplishes just about every mission. All accessories from the hero 9 onward work so there are plenty of batteries and media mods etc that fit. Overheating is not a significant problem like it was in the hero 10, battery life is noticeably longer than the hero 9.

product_name: GoPro HERO12 Black - Waterproof Action Camera with 5.3K60 Ultra HD Video, 27MP Photos, HDR, 1/1.9" Image Sensor, Live Streaming, Webcam, Stabilization
description: This is my second Go Pro (HERO 4).  Very good build quality.  Haven't used it yet.  Nice to have one with a small monitor to review my videos.  Very easy to use.

product_name: GoPro HERO12 Black - Waterproof Action Camera with 5.3K60 Ultra HD Video, 27MP Photos, HDR, 1/1.9" Image Sensor, Live Streaming, Webcam, Stabilization
description: I have several higher end cameras, but this one takes great videos for me ! I have a nerve tremor and it doesn't show up on my GOPRO videos ! That was my main reason for the purchase of this model. My only trouble with it is opening the battery and card compartment ! I still would recommend it !

product_name: GoPro HERO12 Black - Waterproof Action Camera with 5.3K60 Ultra HD Video, 27MP Photos, HDR, 1/1.9" Image Sensor, Live Streaming, Webcam, Stabilization

product_name: GoPro HERO12 Black - Waterproof Action Camera with 5.3K60 Ultra HD Video, 27MP Photos, HDR, 1/1.9" Image Sensor, Live Streaming, Webcam, Stabilization
