description: The phone looks terrific and it works fine, but I was surprised that buying "excellent" renewed came with an 80% battery minimum - I didn't investigate this in advance so mea culpa - just be aware.  I'd have gone with "good" or "acceptable" if I'd known - it's in an Otterbox case with a glass screen protector anyway, no one sees the case.  I do loke the Apple iPhone 13 - the battery life is an improvement over my iPhone 12 Mini - and I didn't want to go with a 14 or 15 as I bought right before the 16 was released so I knew those prices would be dropping - I'll probably upgrade next fall.

product_name: Apple iPhone 13, 128GB, Midnight - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Initially, we got a phone from this vendor that was a dud (for us). We returned it and tried them a 2nd time. The 2nd phone seems a decent deal.For the first phone (iPhone 13) we received:The battery life on the renewed phone was fairly good - at 94% of original capacity. This had been an issue with phones from this vendor per other reviews but was not an issue with ours.  However, this renewed phone had a non-Apple replacement screen that was noticeably low in quality - grainy, with colors dulled, and it cut off part of the display area. Touch responsiveness was bad. Given Amazon pledge that the product was "professionally inspected and tested by Amazon-qualified supplier," I feel the substandard screen should have been spotted and the lower quality disclosed. My family member and my time were wasted by this attempt to pass off a lower quality solution. Return process was easy, although it did require a trip to the UPS store.For the second, replacement (iPhone 13) phone:The replacement for the returned 1st phone arrived quickly. The battery life seems great (100% of original capacity). The screen this time is MUCH better than the low quality screen on the original phone. The case has some scratches and a dent on the ring surrounding one of the camera lenses, but the lens seems unaffected. All in all, a fair price for used phone. Working well after a month of use.

product_name: Apple iPhone 13, 128GB, Midnight - Unlocked (Renewed)
Apple iPhone 13, 128GB, Midnight - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Phone was delivered two days early, which was awesome since i lost my phone and wanted this one as soon as possible. However when it arrived it had a big crack across the top of it on the back side. The sides on the back have dirt in them and in some spots it looks like the back panel is chipped and clearly has been dropped. The package did not have any cushioning, it was in a big box with just a plastic bag around the phone. Other than that I am very happy with this, however I would not have classified this phone as being in excellent condition.

product_name: Apple iPhone 13, 128GB, Midnight - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: I bought the phone in "excellent" condition and the phone looks brand new and feels brand new! The issue I have with my phone is the battery. I received a notification that the battery is not an “Apple verified” battery, which I didn’t think was a problem. However, the battery drains really quickly and only lasts about 3 hours. I am also experiencing overheating issues. Like, the phone easily gets hot, but that could also be a battery-related issue. I’m going to get the battery replaced, but otherwise every other aspect of the phone is perfect and working well!Update: In order to get the battery replaced, I had to get the display replaced as well, as it wasn't a genuine apple display. That costed around $400 at the Apple Store. So, in my opinion, it's safer to get the phone straight from apple and spend a bit more money.

product_name: Apple iPhone 13, 128GB, Midnight - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The phone is in good condition, no scratches or anything but it does  overheats quickly , when I first received the phone the battery life was at 84 % not even one week of usage it went down to 81 % which is very disappointing . The screen is good in general and overall it’s a good phone for the price but if you like a higher quality I’d say buy it at apple .

product_name: Apple iPhone 13, 128GB, Midnight - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: This review is based on the product quality and condition. So this phone came nice and neat. No scratches or visible ware and tear. Easy to program and unlock. The only detail i saw was that the battery life was below 83%, meaning that it wasn’t replaced for a fresher one. So I’m expecting it to be changed sooner. All its functions seem to work fine. Haven’t had issues with Apple (since Apple’s notorious fame of disabling features when phone don’t have genuine parts). I think this is a good vender to buy your phone when budget is tight.

product_name: Apple iPhone 13, 128GB, Midnight - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Very happy with the iphone purchase. It was listed in excellent condition and it was. The iphone 13 was scratch free and arrived with 87% battery. For a used phone that's a few years old I think this is excellent. It came boxed, with a charging cord and wall adapter.  Very impressed with the phone, the condition and the packing. I would buy from this seller again.

product_name: Apple iPhone 13, 128GB, Midnight - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: This was my first time buying a refurbished phone, so I was nervous about what I might get, but a couple of days in, I have to say I'm pretty satisfied.First, shipping was very fast! I had the phone in my hands within 48 hours of placing the order, which surpassed all my expectations. It came with a charger (both the cable and block). The phone was dead when it arrived, so I needed to charge it first, but no big deal. The first thing I noticed was that there are some small chips and scratches around the edges of the device, most noticeable on the top, but with a case on, the damage will barely be visible. I've been using it without a case the last couple of days while waiting for the one I ordered to arrive, and even uncovered, it doesn't look that bad. Screen and cameras are in perfect condition. The phone was perfectly clean on arrival too, no dirt or dust.The max battery capacity is 85%. Since I paid for excellent quality, this was a bit disappointing to me and is the reason for me rating only 4 stars, especially after seeing other reviews of people who got batteries in the 90s, but it's still a major upgrade over what I had before (a 2020 SE with only 72% capacity). Overall, I've been happy with the performance so far, especially for the price. I would buy from MobileSupply again!

product_name: Apple iPhone 13, 128GB, Midnight - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Ordered the iPhone 13 in Midnight for T-Mobile. the phone came in near perfect condition with minor scratches on the camera area (doesn’t affect camera / picture quality at all). the phone came with a preinstalled glass screen protector. i was especially surprised and pleased by the 96% battery health!! definitely a gamble when it comes to buying refurbished / renewed phones but it ended up working out. the second hand seller i purchased through was Synergy, paid $377 (including tax). little more than half the price than a new phone is totally worth it. also did a fair amount of research and apparently the iphone 14 and 13 are the same exact product, so would recommend buying the 13 to save some money!

product_name: Apple iPhone 13, 128GB, Midnight - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: I will say that I was very skeptical while trying to find this phone. I was actually little horrified. But after reading other great reviews it turned great. The phone works like new and there were no visible blemishes or issues. I have a had it for a while now and I love it. Battery was also good! I would definitely purchase from the seller again.

product_name: Apple iPhone 13, 128GB, Midnight - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: My package came yesterday and was worried it wasn’t going to work, but to my surprise it worked well like a brand new phone. The only thing it had was some minor scratches but you can barely see it. Overall the phone works and looks just about right.

product_name: Apple iPhone 13, 128GB, Midnight - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Overall, I am happy with this purchase.  The battery reports 100%, and overall the phone is in good condition.  If you keep your phone in a case, you wouldn't notice the small gouge on the top right.  There is additional minor wear and tear around the metal housing (seems like the prior user didn't use a case).  If you prefer to go caseless, expect that you could receive a device with some minor but noticeable wear and tear.  However, the phone was not sold as "flawless" so some wear and tear is to be expected.  For my use case, the phone met my needs.  I threw it in a case and don't notice the flaws  The phone came with a glass screen protector which was a nice touch.  I haven't pulled off the screen protector  to see if the underlying screen has scratches.  if there is wear-and-tear on the screen (ex. small scratches from keys, etc.) they are minimal and not noticeable thought the screen protector.  Overall satisfied with this purchase for my use case.

product_name: Apple iPhone 13, 128GB, Midnight - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: So let me start out by saying that I am not one to purchased refurbished phones and whenever something would happen to one of mine and I had to turn it into the Phone company and they would send me a refurbished one to replace mine, there was always something wrong with them. So, that has always made me a little bit gunshy regarding that particular situation.With that said, as a full-time caregiver for the last 11 years, I have not been able to work and unfortunately can no longer purchase the best of the best with the flagship phones that I used to get back in the day. Many of my parents doctors do some video visits and some of them actually prefer FaceTime so as a result, having an iPhone was actually partly a necessity for that reason.I have always been an Android girl, )still have that too), so I didn’t quite know what iPhone I needed to get, but after some research, I finally settled on what I thought would be the best choice for me both with regard to the technology inside and with the price as well as the warranty.I had actually considered either an iPhone 11 or an iPhone 13 as my choice. As we are now on the 15 I found the 13 to be the wisest choice of the two.After researching many different sites, some very reputable and actually recommended by people, I decided to land on Amazon‘s renewed program because I’ve always had a nice experience when there have been any issues with a product and I’ve never had any problems with customer service. They’ve always been very helpful and I thought if anything were to happen with the phone, I would be hoping to have the same type of experience.In looking at the options, I chose to actually pay more to have one that was put forth by Amazon themselves because they offered a year warranty as opposed to many of the others who were a bit cheaper and offered maybe 30 days or so etc.And hey, so far, so good! The Phone arrived. It was in perfect cosmetic condition and I have not had any issues with it since. The battery was at 87% and although I would’ve liked to had it higher than that, I was glad to see that it still was pretty snappy when I needed it to be.So I would say that I have been very pleased so far and I would absolutely recommend the renewed program to anyone interested, but can only speak to the actual product provided by Amazon itself, however, I’m sure many of the third-party individuals that sell refurbished items may have some really good product themselves.Ah…there I go again…refurbished…renewed…to-may-toe…to-mah-toe… well you get the jist…

product_name: Apple iPhone 13, 128GB, Midnight - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Phone was in peak condition surprisingly with no scratches on the back, screen, or sides only little scuffs on the camera which i assume is from changing the phone case. the battery was 88% so cant say im angry. Phone got a little warm quickly but other than that screen size is great and i originally wanted white but settled with pink because of the price still love the phone regardless. I tend to break my phones easily but I am switching from iphone xs so I hope this will last longer even with 88% battery life. Havent charged  yet but i plan on using a regular slow charger to preserve battery life as much as possible.

product_name: Apple iPhone 13, 128GB, Midnight - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: This product was good considering it being a refurbished phone the phone was intact other than the side scratches around the phone. I use a case anyways so it’s not noticeable. Phone was sent with a charger and a charging box but the box was the wrong one so I had to purchase a new one since the phone was dead when it arrived and I wanted to make sure it worked. Phone froze once but other than that it was worth it .

product_name: Nelko Label Maker Machine with Tape, P21 Bluetooth Label Printer, Wireless Mini Label Makers with Multiple Templates for Organizing Office Home, White
description: This is a great little label printer, as far as form, and most function. It was easy to setup and use with an Apple phone. The label are a decent size, and the software, although a bit clusmy, allows for flexibility in output.My only real complaint, and the reason for deducting two stars, is the fact that the labels fade over time. A fairly short period of time. One label has faded to an unreadable level in about 8 months.I think this product is great for projects that are reasonably short term uses. If looking to label and archive items for years to come, you might want to look elsewhere.

product_name: Nelko Label Maker Machine with Tape, P21 Bluetooth Label Printer, Wireless Mini Label Makers with Multiple Templates for Organizing Office Home, White
description: I thought this would print in color, but that was too much to expect.  Also, the images that print are very poor, although text is fine.  I do like ability to use this printer with my phone.  This is a small and very portable label printer. Also, like that it's rechargable.

product_name: Nelko Label Maker Machine with Tape, P21 Bluetooth Label Printer, Wireless Mini Label Makers with Multiple Templates for Organizing Office Home, White
description: What directions came with it were confusing and the tutorial films were so tiny the closed captioning was unreadable.Once we got it working, it was great!Still waiting for support to contact us by email. No support phone number.

product_name: Nelko Label Maker Machine with Tape, P21 Bluetooth Label Printer, Wireless Mini Label Makers with Multiple Templates for Organizing Office Home, White
description: "Ugh, this is driving me crazy! I’ll update if the manufacturer comes through with labels that actually stick. I’m obsessed with labeling everything—my remotes, the fuse box, you name it. I took the time to label all of them. I was feeling so accomplished… and now, a week later, they're all peeling off! Please tell me there’s a better label option—because as great as the printer is, it's kind of useless if the labels won’t stay put!"

product_name: Nelko Label Maker Machine with Tape, P21 Bluetooth Label Printer, Wireless Mini Label Makers with Multiple Templates for Organizing Office Home, White
description: Purchased May 2024 and have only charged device twice before. Now the device is no longer accepting a charge. Printer itself worked very well for what I needed. Email sent to company 10/2024

product_name: Nelko Label Maker Machine with Tape, P21 Bluetooth Label Printer, Wireless Mini Label Makers with Multiple Templates for Organizing Office Home, White
description: I am happy with the ease of use and the format options this little printer offers. but I am really disappointed with how quickly the printing rubs off of the labels, with use. If the label does not get touched at all, it is fine, but if it's on a container that gets frequently handled and the label gets touched at all, the printing is soon gone.

product_name: Nelko Label Maker Machine with Tape, P21 Bluetooth Label Printer, Wireless Mini Label Makers with Multiple Templates for Organizing Office Home, White
description: Works well, but don't get the label damp as the ink easily smudges.

product_name: Nelko Label Maker Machine with Tape, P21 Bluetooth Label Printer, Wireless Mini Label Makers with Multiple Templates for Organizing Office Home, White
description: The label maker was not easy to line up the labels so the print was centered.

product_name: Nelko Label Maker Machine with Tape, P21 Bluetooth Label Printer, Wireless Mini Label Makers with Multiple Templates for Organizing Office Home, White
description: I bought this label maker for everyday use but I noticed that the labels fade very quickly with heat and if the label is touched too much. I would purchase a professional label maker if you need to create labels for microphones, cables, or items that will get wet or around heat.

product_name: Nelko Label Maker Machine with Tape, P21 Bluetooth Label Printer, Wireless Mini Label Makers with Multiple Templates for Organizing Office Home, White
description: I use this to make labels for the things in my work van. It is good for that. The labels are kind of small but that makes them great for applying to smaller tool boxes. The labels tend to stay stuck to the things I apply them to. I live in Texas and the summer heat doesn't seem to affect the labels.The thing I dislike about this label printer is how hard it is to get the printer to reconnect to my phone the next time I need to make a label.Over all, I am glad I made the purchase.

product_name: Nelko Label Maker Machine with Tape, P21 Bluetooth Label Printer, Wireless Mini Label Makers with Multiple Templates for Organizing Office Home, White
description: I have been wanting a label maker and I knew nothing about them. So I had no idea what to buy. I almost spent a lot more because I felt like that is what I needed to do to get the best product. This NELKO brand is high quality and built well. This label maker is awesome. It is the easiest set up on my iPhone and connects through Bluetooth and everything workd perfectly. Zero issues and the labels are high quality and stick great.  The ones I stuck crooked, I was able to be peel and reused and stuck great again. Everything about this is user friendly. I know it sounds weird for me to say that I love this thing but it is cool because it works so well and it is easy to use. The app works great and has useful options and easy to use. I highly recommend especially if you have no idea what you want. This one offers tons of options.

product_name: Nelko Label Maker Machine with Tape, P21 Bluetooth Label Printer, Wireless Mini Label Makers with Multiple Templates for Organizing Office Home, White
description: I got this to label some file folder and have now labeled about half of my house. The app is super easy and it's fun to use, has a lot of options for fonts and borders, and the labels are waterproof and great quality. No smearing, quick printing, ready to go. Amazing little labeler, especially for the price!

product_name: Nelko Label Maker Machine with Tape, P21 Bluetooth Label Printer, Wireless Mini Label Makers with Multiple Templates for Organizing Office Home, White
description: I love the small size. It’s a little taller than my 15oz coffee mug, same height as small box of Kleenex. The app is super easy to use. Printing is fairly quick. Print quality is fairly decent. It prints text pretty easily, but if you upload a custom logo or image, it’s a little distorted. The description states the labels are water and oil proof, but the ones that I have in cupboard beneath my sink and the ones on my stainless steel table have started to fade after getting wet. This is with the labels that come already with the printer. I’d understand having this issue if I were to be using cheaper labels from some other place, but to be advertising their own labels as water and oil proof is a little misleading.I’ve enjoyed adding labels to things around the house since it’s so quick and easy to use. Its small size fits nicely in kitchen drawer or desk drawers. It has a built in wrist strap which you could use to hang it if you wanted to. I got the case for mine since it’ll reside in the kitchen and the case will help keep it clean. Having eight people living in our house is nice to add labels to things to lessen the frequent question of “where’s ______ item” after I’ve rearranged things.I’d give this printer 5 stars, but had to deduct one star for the labels that come with being not water proof as stated in the description. Also, it took me a bit to figure out how to turn it off. The instructions that came with it only say how to turn it on and pair it with the app. I thought maybe it would turn itself off after you close the app and disconnect from the printer.  It would be nice if the instruction book stated “To turn off, press and hold the indicator button,” or if it would auto power off after you close the app.  For the price, this is an excellent little label maker printer. Another thing I find slightly annoying is having to have the printer connected to your phone to create labels. It would be nice if you could create your labels in the app, save them in the app, then turn on the printer to print.Overall this is a very excellent, low cost thermal label printer.

product_name: Nelko Label Maker Machine with Tape, P21 Bluetooth Label Printer, Wireless Mini Label Makers with Multiple Templates for Organizing Office Home, White
description: It’s an excellent choice for my workplace layout due to its crisp white look that exudes an air of professionalism. However, the ability of this label maker to wirelessly connect to my devices via Bluetooth is what really sets it apart from other similar products on the market The entire labeling process is simplified as a result of this function of removing the prerequisite use of cables and cables. Simple instructions and simple user interfaces get me through the process without any problems. I just connected and looked at all the templates available, each designed for different labeling. The simple power of the label manufacturer was on full display when it was used to create barcodes and organize archives. A pleasant and welcome surprise was the availability of a mobile app that allowed for individual characters. I had the ability to customize the characters by choosing fonts, colors, and even logos. My planning efforts got a creative boost thanks to this tweak, making the characters not only useful but also aesthetically pleasing. The excellent typography was the thing that impressed me the most. The density and clarity of the text as well as the graphics are far better than I expected. My attempts to organize everything were successful as the adhesive didn't get on any of the materials used, be it paper files or plastic containers I love to see my office space now organized large, uncluttered, and aesthetically pleasing. Because the label maker is portable, I can take it with me wherever I go, be it work or home. This allows me to work

product_name: Nelko Label Maker Machine with Tape, P21 Bluetooth Label Printer, Wireless Mini Label Makers with Multiple Templates for Organizing Office Home, White
description: Bought this to make small price labels for greeting cards after trying and failing to do the same with a 8x11 page ink jet printer template.  (Could not get the printing to line up with the labels).  This works great.  You just press the button to get the label properly aligned for printing.  The templates in the app are easily editable, you can remove the images, choose your font, and text can be re-sized with a slider.  You can print multiples in one go. Only slight negative is there does not seem to be a square shape label option, only rectangular.

product_name: Nelko Label Maker Machine with Tape, P21 Bluetooth Label Printer, Wireless Mini Label Makers with Multiple Templates for Organizing Office Home, White
description: This is an awesome little gadget!  Works well, labels are good quality

product_name: Nelko Label Maker Machine with Tape, P21 Bluetooth Label Printer, Wireless Mini Label Makers with Multiple Templates for Organizing Office Home, White
description: It can do much more, but labeling my craft and  other items has been a game changer.  It's easy to set up the link to your phone and it haves so many different options I haven't even used yet. It fits in the palm of your hand and the price is right.

product_name: Nelko Label Maker Machine with Tape, P21 Bluetooth Label Printer, Wireless Mini Label Makers with Multiple Templates for Organizing Office Home, White
description: Neat and handy little label maker! The app is easy to navigate and fairly user friendly, I got the hang of it right away.Only reasons I dock .5 star;1) not sure how the ink works, or if there are replacement cartridges. I didn’t see any info on the pamphlet2) the size of the labels are pretty small. I think a larger size vertically would be better, so that you could do a bigger font without having to keep it within such a small perimeter.3) along with size, the label roll that came with it are individual little rectangles all the same size - which can be helpful but I’ve used other ones (back in the day) that were just 1 big roll of sticker and you could type something longer and it would just go as long as you’d want. I’m sure I could order a roll like that & just make sure the size will still fit in the machine.But not a big deal, can’t complain especially with the cool app features! They have tonsss of shapes and symbols, you can change the text size & font, and you can even add pictures! I tested that with a QR code I screenshotted and cropped, and even though it’s small it will still scan both on phone camera and through the Venmo app!Overall, I think it’s great! Affordable too, I believe I paid $15 for it which might be a sale.

product_name: Nelko Label Maker Machine with Tape, P21 Bluetooth Label Printer, Wireless Mini Label Makers with Multiple Templates for Organizing Office Home, White
description: If you organize or like to label things, this is an incredible little device!I bought it on sale at Amazon for $19.95 and wasn't really expecting much for that price.It's one of the coolest gadgets ever!- It arrived in beautiful, sturdy packaging in one day.- It comes with everything you need (except the smart phone you need to operate it.)- The app is a quick, easy, free download you can access with a QR code they provide.- It's compatible with both IOS and Android.- Setup was easy and only took a few minutes.- Label rolls are effortless to load.- It comes with white 1½" long labels, but they also make 2" labels (which I just ordered).- Labels also come in a variety of colors... or with colorful borders... even transparent.- Built-in cutter is a slide-button that works easily and cuts cleanly.- You don't have to cut each label.  You can print a string of the (see photo) and cut when you're done.- You can switch partially-used label rolls in and out.- It is well-made and thoughtfully designed to fit in the palm of your hand.- It has a carry strap so if you're clumsy like me, you won't drop it.- It has endless features and plenty of fonts to choose from.- It prints (and includes) all kinds of graphical items, including clipart, bar codes, QR codes and more.- You can even upload your own images. (I haven't tried that yet.)- It is so easy to operate. I made my first label about a minute after setup without reading instructions.- It's a thermal printer so there's no ink involved. (Prints only in black).- It prints immediately and quietly the moment you hit the PRINT button.- You can save labels you will use a lot... or as templates for similar labels.- Everyone in family can us it as along as they install the app on their phone.- Nelko makes a beautiful case that holds the P-21 labeler, charging cord and 4 label rolls.  (The case is sold separately.  I just bought mine on sale for $9.99 at Amazon.)- It is rechargeable via the included USB cable and the charge seems to last forever.- The labels are easy to peel from their backing, affix firmly and can be removed without hassle.I could go on and on covering the minutia with respect to this labeler but I am still exploring it's features.  It is truly one of the best "under $20" purchases I have ever made.When I first tried it, I played with it for about 10 minutes.. and then went back and ordered 2 more (with cases) for Christmas gifts.Don't think this over too much.  You can return it within 30 days if you don't like it, but I am certain you will.This printer far exceeded my expectations!  I couldn't be happier than I am, with it!

product_name: Nelko Label Maker Machine with Tape, P21 Bluetooth Label Printer, Wireless Mini Label Makers with Multiple Templates for Organizing Office Home, White
description: Update - After a few more attempts restarting and re-pairing it finally recognized the label. Hadn’t done anything different. No idea what the problem is. Minus one star overall for this inconvenience. Note that the customer support isn’t available at night (was looking at this around 11pm EST)I loaded the labels and paired the printer. Designed and printed a few labels. Turned offDevice and plugged it in to charge for use tomorrow. Randomly decided to label one more item. Went to unplug, turn on, re-pair the printer via Bluetooth  - and reopen the app and now getting an error that it can’t detect genuine labels… it’s the label roll that shipped with the printer and I used earlier… make it make sense. I can’t even bypass the error with “continue printing” to use them. The troubleshooting guide just says non genuine labels can be blurry, not “it won’t print at all”. Also, again, these labels came with the printer.

product_name: HP Color Laserjet Pro MFP 3301fdw Wireless All-in-One Color Laser Printer, Office Printer, Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF, Duplex, Best-for-Office (499Q5F)
description: 5th and final update 7/1/24:Two months ago I had to return this HP printer model MFP 3301fdw because of the print issues, and HP couldn't sent out replacement toner (which they beli would fix it) since they didn't have the new toner model in stock.Last week I got delivered from FedEx Ground the HP Toner in all 4 colors. The thing is, the printer is returned and refunded back to Amazon and using a different model. So now I have the toner for a printer I no longer have. Good job HP!----------------------4th Update 5/8/24:Since it has been a week since the last time HP Support called me, I decided to call them. After about 20 minutes, I was again told that my case was escalated (two weeks ago) and they still can't order replacement toner to replace the toner cartridges that aren't working right on this (new) printer MPF3301fdw. They said I should get a call back on Friday.If I don't hear from them or they can't send new toners, then I am sending this model back.I then may go with the 283fdw model, since it is identical to my 281 model that went bad after 4.5 years of use (belt went bad).All I can say is HP Support is pretty much useless.If you are looking for a color laser printer, you're better off going with the 283fdw model that is supported and has toner available for purchase.The newest 3301fdw has no support from HP since it is so new, and none of the toners are in-stock because it is a new model. Also, it prints color pictures MUCH darker than the 281 and 283 model. To me, the 281/283 prints more natural and realistic color pictures than the 3301.----------------------3rd Update 5/2/24:I have got 2 call-backs from HP Support this week Monday and Tuesday saying they are still not able to put in an order for the defect replacement toner (see full review below). They say the issue is that since this printer model MFP 3301fdw is so new that it isn't in their system for support, and that the 218A toners are not in stock to send out for replacement.As far as I'm concerned, this is a total failure on HP. You have a new printer with printing defects. Not sure if it's the actual printer or the toners that are bad. They can't send out replacement toner because none is available.At this point, I'm just going to return this back to Amazon. My HP M281fdw never had any issues until just last month, which is why I ordered this one. So I might get the M283 model, since it's basically identical to my M281 model and at least there is toner in stock for it.-----------------2nd Update 4/29/24:Since HP Support is basically useless and isn't able to replace the defective toners, which has streaks/banding and areas where no color is transfered to the HP Paper. I decided to buy another HP 3301fdw printer that comes with new toners and see how it prints. It was delivered yesterday and I printed about 25 pictures on it, and so far the quality has been better, no banding issue and all the colors are being transfered/fused to the paper. But after about 25 color picture and 15 black text pages, the "introductory toner cartridges" are down to 20% capacity! How is this possible? It Specs PDF says the introduction toners are good for a few hundred pages. I've only done 25 pictures + 15 text pages (under 50 pages total) and it's down to 20% capacity? Unless the Calibration On Start Up is using a lot of toner, so I turned that Off.I'm still not sure about this printer, as no one (including Amazon or HP) have the 218A standard capacity toner or the 218X high capacity toner in-stock. So how do you get toner for it???-------------------1st Update: 4/27/24:This is an update to my original review.I would also like to point out all the 5 star reviews for this MFP 3301fdw  printer are from Amazon Vine, which means the person got the printer for free at no cost and only had to agree to write an review. I actually paid full price for this printer, so I am reviewing it as a paying customer. Over the 8 days that I have had the HP MFP 3301fdw printer, the color prints have had issues with the toner not fusong to the HP Paper. I called HP Support on 4/24/24 and was on the phone with them (India) for almost an hour and they had to do a video call to show them the printer and the pictures with the color issue. The woman said he was going to replace the toner, since she believed that was the problem and was down to 20%. But she wasn't able to get the toner ordered, and said it would be taken care of through their back end department. Then several hours later I got an HP saying the case was closed. I called the following day on Thursday and spoke to someone else. They also said they couldn't get replacement toner ordered and said they would bring it to their internal support and asked if they could call me the next day Friday at 1pm. So then on Friday I'm waiting for them to call at 1pm and nothing. I end up calling at 1:45pm. The first person I talk to says they are not trained on this printer, and I have to talk to "industrial printer support". They transfer me, and the person there says this is not a industrial printer (big surprise) and has to transfer me back to home office printers. Finally after 30 min I was able to talk to someone. They also said they couldn't order the toner, and said they have to call back next week on Tuesday.This is absolutely the worst support (well no support) I've ever had from a company. If a large company like HP can't make the toners right, causing print issues, and then can't put in an order for replacement toner and takes multiple phone calls, there is basically no support for HP! I have no trust in this printer or in HP to stand by it for the 1 year manufacturers warranty.I did look to see if the toner was available for order (either the standard capacity or high capacity) and no one (including HP and Amazon) has the toners in stock, and shows it won't be available for 1-2 months. How can you sell a printer and not even have the toner in stock when the limited "introductory toner" runs out after about 150 prints?At this point, I would either need to replace my old old HP M281fdw printer with the 283 model, which is basically the same unit and features (just a different toner ) or go with a different brand.-------------------Original Review:First off, I have been using the HP 281 color laser since 2019 without any problems, until a month ago there was issues and the printer started to die and go out. I decided to replace it with with 3301 model, since it is the newest version. I got it last week and after setting up the printer it begins by initializing the pre installed toners and then a calibration. I went into the menu and did a Print Quality Test that shows the toner colors on a page, and there was major streaks in the colors (,mostly cyan blue and magenta). I ran it 10 times and did a few more Calibrations and it got a little better but was still there.I then tried printing some high quality pictures that I had and noticed that there was areas where the toner (,color) was not sticking on the paper (HP Premiums 24). Areas of the picture that was blue sky, you could see parts that was missing toner, showing the white paper behind it. Or if it was a picture that had some dark/black areas, again you could see areas where the black was not transferring and could see the white paper.I called HP Support yesterday about this, as my old 281 printer never had this problem. Support has to do a video call to see the printed issues on the papers. After I showed them, they said they wanted to replace the toner to see if new toner would fix the problem. But after 40 minutes, they could not get the system to have a replacement toner order put in. She said it would be sent to their back-end department and I would get an email about the toner being sent. A few hours later I got an email saying my case my closed. I called back today at 8am when they open and the guy that I talked to needed a ton of information again. But he also said he could not get the system to take an order for replacement toner, and would have to talk to their internal support and he would call me tomorrow with an update.This is totally unexceptionable.My 281 printer was $350 and worked fine for 4.5 years. This new 3301 printer has issues (possible the toner defect?) being brand new, and still can't get the toners replaced after 2 calls. At this point if they can't get the toner replaced.....or if I do get a replacement and it still has the same problem, then I'll have to either replace the 3301 with another 3301 to see if mine was defective, or go with a different brand like Canon.As far as the 3301 printer, I do like the larger LCD display, and it is faster and quieter than my 281 model. Black text looks the same on both. When doing color photos, the 3301 does looks to have more realistic color than the 281, but it is marred by the areas of the print where the toner is not transferring to the paper making white see-though areas.I will update this review based on what happens with HP support, getting the toner replaced or not.

product_name: HP Color Laserjet Pro MFP 3301fdw Wireless All-in-One Color Laser Printer, Office Printer, Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF, Duplex, Best-for-Office (499Q5F)
description: The problems with this device and its drivers are manifold. For one thing the toner life, if actually printing in color frequently, is dismal. And for another, the driver immediately and automatically defaults (I understand that "automatically" and "defaults" may look redundant) to 2-side printing. But when I use both terms I mean that there is absolutely no way to make it default to 1-sided pages. Not with the HP driver that is available from HP or from HP via Microsoft. So one has to be eternally vigilant about checking a different box with every print batch or you will waste paper and toner on anywhere from 1 to 250 pages (which is the size of the tray) if you're not watching the thing work as it prints. But that's where the pathetic toner life comes into play. It wasted about 50 pages of 2-sided printing for me before I noticed that I had to make sure to change it every time. That means that, apparently, the toner cartridges were almost halfway depleted after a mistaken 50 page print task which wasn't supposed to be 2-sided. And the HP cartridges are not cheap. Which brings me back to the headline that this is simply not a good small business printer, let alone a great value.As far as print quality, it's fine. About what's to be expected in 2024 for this type of machine. But with the volume limitations, the constant vigilance needed for every task, and the seemingly intentional low life expectancy of the toner cartridges, it's simply not a good value at all, unless you're getting it for scanning. But good scanners can be had for a fraction of this price.So that I don't lead any readers of this review astray, here are the parameters of the job(s) that completely frustrated me. You be the judge on whether this will meet your "business" needs.300-400 pages of 8.5x11" pages with about 75% needing some color and around 45% needing color on most of the page (NOT photos or graphics) in a day (knowing that would mean new cartridges after the job) and it still disappointed. I was getting warnings and then urgent warnings on toner life about 2/3 of the way in.Lack of a manual feed tray for printing envelopes or thick paper or labels. It does OK with putting that kind of media in the main tray, but it did jam a few times on typical Avery tab labels which are not much thicker, if at all, than standard 24lb laser printer paper.The built-in interface w/ touch screen is not good. There are not many options for improving or calibrating - to which I'll add a disclaimer that even those "workgroup" printers commonly available from Brother, HP or Canon don't seem to make much of a visible difference with adjustments even though they have more granular menus - to do much about the differences between how colors, hues, and darkness/brightness/saturation/contrast actually shows up on the printed page.I'm sure this printer would be fine for a mom-n-pop travel agency that still needs printed media strictly relegated to 8.5x11 or slightly smaller/larger media/paper with only a few "major" print jobs a week. But I really find myself scratching my head when I read PC Magazine, CNET, and the like praising these small printers as "business" ready (again, even though MOST of us RARELY need to print stuff) when in fact they fall WELL short of "workgroup" printers like....I dunno....the Brother 83XXX family from a few years ago that comes with a default main tray capable of holding at least 500 sheets of letter and with multiple options (including aftermarket) for toner cartridge capacity. The only thing those lack is a scanner, but as noted, good scanners are cheap now. And who needs dedicated copiers? Not someone buying one of the products in this class.NOT recommended. Especially not at the $500+ price point.

product_name: HP Color Laserjet Pro MFP 3301fdw Wireless All-in-One Color Laser Printer, Office Printer, Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF, Duplex, Best-for-Office (499Q5F)
description: This is longer than I meant it to be, but if you are serious about buying this printer, please read my whole review.I've never been a fan of HP products, but when my Epson inkjet printer died in the middle of a large printing job, I needed to get a new printer as quickly as possible so I turned to this HP. It's my work printer, and it lives in a fairly dirty environment, even though I do my best to keep it clean. I had already decided when the Epson died to give laser a try to see if it lasted any longer than the inkjets I've had in the past. With Prime shipping, I could get this HP here in one day, with the time crunch I was under it seemed like the best route to go, even though I was wary about the HP brand. I should have just explained to the people who were waiting on me that I was having technical difficulties and got something that shipped slower.My issues are: first and foremost, the software. I was prepared for it to be bad, but if I knew just how bad it was I wouldn't have bought the printer. Of course, HP wants you install their full software suite. I don't want that, I just want the drivers. After hunting around for awhile, I finally found the drivers without the software package. Got those all downloaded and installed, and while my PC would recognize the printer, it wouldn't pick up the scanner. After trying several things unsuccessfully, I decided it was only going to pick up the scanner if I downloaded the full software suite. So I did. This is where my biggest caution comes in. (All caps so you take me seriously here) IF YOU ARE PLANNING ON SCANNING AND DON'T WANT TO SPEND THE TIME TO FIND WORK AROUNDS, DON'T BUY THIS PRINTER. The HP software suite only allows you to scan into their cloud service, not directly to your PC. 100% deal breaker. I already have cloud services that I pay for. I don't need HP's on top of it. I want my scans to go onto my PC, not into any of the cloud services, even the ones I pay for. I sometimes scan sensitive business information, and it's bad enough just saving it on my PC, I sure as hell don't want it on HP's cloud service. At this point I was ready to send the printer back and start over. But, after some more digging, I found another work around by downloading HP's old scanner software called simply HP Scan (alternatively, you can use Window's native scan software, but you don't get as many options).So after about two days of trying to get it to work, I finally was able to resume my large printing job. The box the printer came in said I should get about 1350 pages out of the toner cartridges it came with. That was plenty for me to finish, so I didn't order any more. I printed 130 pages and started to get notifications that I was running low on toner. At first I thought it was a mistake. So I took all the cartridges out, shook them around, and plugged them back in. Nope, not a mistake. I understood that I was printing full color pages, satellite maps to be exact, and I expected that I wouldn't get the full 1350 pages the box promised. But 130? 1200 pages LESS than what the box said? Come on. So I start looking for toner. None to be found. Everywhere is out of stock of yellow, the first color to run low. Ok. I get it. It's COVID times, stock is weird, getting parts and supplies is hard. Trust me, you're preaching to the choir here. So I won't hold it against HP, but I did want to cry at this point. I just threw in the towel and finished the project in greyscale. Whatever. I ordered some toner from our normal ink supplier, which still hasn't shown up. Hopefully I get it soon.What happened today is what prompted me to write this review. I will be totally upfront here, this is probably part of my poor research before I bought this printer. But, it doesn't have auto duplex scanning/copying. Unless I'm missing it somewhere. But, you have to scan all of front pages first, walk over to the printer, flip the stack and scan all of the back pages second. If you're just trying to copy, there is no option for 2 sided to 2 sided. Like. Come on. It's 2021. My 5 year old Epson that I paid $100 for could do that. This is a $500 printer aimed towards small businesses, and yet it can't do something as simple as auto duplex scan/copy. It can auto duplex print, so why can't it when I'm scanning/copying?Print quality is fine, connecting to wifi was simple, it prints fairly quickly. It's loud and bulky, but in my business office, I can deal with those downsides. At home, it would be more of an issue I think. But, all things considered, I really wish I would have listened to my gut and stayed away from HP. If one more thing irritates me about this printer, it's going up for sale on Marketplace, and I'm getting something different. It may go up for sale on Marketplace anyway.

product_name: HP Color Laserjet Pro MFP 3301fdw Wireless All-in-One Color Laser Printer, Office Printer, Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF, Duplex, Best-for-Office (499Q5F)
description: First the important positive things - the print quality is in top. It prints fast - haven't really needed to scan much yet, and really FAX?  It's 2021 ... stop pretending that it's 1990!  So nope, will NEVER use that.  The unit can print on both sides (requirement for me) and holds quite a lot of paper in the tray.Now to the odd things - perhaps the not so "positive".  The printer wants/requires internet access. Even if you just need an office printer, if it cannot see the internet it gets mad at you and stops working.  Our network is restricted - access to the internet is monitored and limited. What seems to happen is after X number of failures to talk to some hp server, the printer claims the wifi is broken and stops working. It's happened several times now - it will claim it's working but "no connectivity" and somehow you cannot tell the printer to just retry the wifi again.  Turning it off and then on again seems to be the only option.Since we're not using "e-printing" or whatever HP calls it - nobody needs to print when they aren't in the office. That's what VPN is for.  This unit needs to simply serve the clients on the network it's attached to. It should simply wait for an incoming connection - but no, it wants an active role for some reason. Something it's being denied and it seems to fail every week or so.  And of course nobody notices until they need to print something and "it won't work".Technically the printer supports quite a few protocols and ways to connect. That's great - and one of the reason I choose the model. From wired, to wireless and USB - the choice is yours. It even support special apple wireless and direct wifi - stuff I turned off, so there aren't more SSIDs in the wild for people to hack in on.  If you do not use static IP addresses, the unit will use mDNS to allow clients to find it.  Without mDNS your clients will have to manually be told about the printer - which shouldn't be a problem. A simple print-server will do just fine, and you can turn off all the broadcast traffic and get better audit/control with what/who is printing.  Bottom line, you have a lot of options and that's important. Over time your need may change, and it's good to know that the unit supports a wide range of options.Our clients are Linux based or Chromebooks, phones etc.  HP claims you must use the app to configure the printer, but that's not my experience. As a matter of fact, the "HP Smart" app seems to do very little to help with the printer that any computer cannot tell me. It seems to be a platform to allow HP to present you with ads and "suggestions" of what to buy - their toner, their paper etc. - so far any Linux workstation is a simple "cups add printer" - in the "control panel" you simple add a printer, and it finds it on the network and the rest is ...well, that's it. It's done.  For scanning, you could manually add the IP to the sane setup, but so far I haven't needed to - it finds the printer/scanner automatically using mDNS.Configuring the printer can easily be done through it's web-interface.  If you name the printer, you can provide the printer a TLS certificate and get some validation that it's a trusted device on your network.The printer seems designed for small offices, it has all the network features I would expect - but it comes with a lot of 'add stuff" which is the only way I can explain why it wants to access the internet on a regular basis.

product_name: HP Color Laserjet Pro MFP 3301fdw Wireless All-in-One Color Laser Printer, Office Printer, Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF, Duplex, Best-for-Office (499Q5F)
description: Had a couple of older Brother all-in-one machines that did a pretty good job for me at home and at my shop. Wanted to upgrade to machines with a scanner feed, so went this direction based on reviews. Now, I'm not a network engineer, and not an IT pro, but I've had no problems setting up both work and home networks and maintained them for years. At the shop I typically have 15 devices on, and at home between 30-40 depending on day and time.  All devices happy, chatting with each other and the outside world, everything just works.Then comes the printer switch, and my whole world comes crashing down. This has been the most maddening, awful experience, with both printers, that I have had with a network device since WiFi was in its infancy.  I truly want to go full Office Space on both of them. Today's incident sealed it. Wife home doing school finals. I'm at my shop. After 2 solid weeks of no problems, no drop-offs, no changes in our infrastructure at all, can't print or scan. Scanning is a must because she has to show work.  I get home and despite seeing the printer on our local network using the Eero app, and seeing wife's PC on the same network, both connected to the same Eero, neither can see each other. I literally typed the IP address into the URL field, nope, doesn't exist. Fine, let me find one of those weird printer-only USB cables just to get her out of the woods. Connected printer to Carbon X1, scan app sees the printer, scan commences, then errors out at the end.Thousand bucks down the drain for 2 of these garbage paperweights.  Now dreading getting on the phone with tech support only to likely hear "did you plug it in until it clicks?"Update: updated my Eero setup to include WPA3 authentication, and it worked!  For 4 whole days.  Tried to print this morning, "printer offline".  Printer confirmed to be on. Checked all devices on the network. Both of our laptops, and this pile of garbage "printer" showing on the network, and both even connected to the same Eero. I type in the IP address into a browser, and the printer page comes up with all of the settings.  But, can I print?  Nope.  Full Eero network reboot, unplug printer, plug it back in, and we can print again...from only one of our laptops.  I normally have to reboot the network *maybe* 2x/year.  I'll keep adding to this as needed.Again, DO NOT BUY THIS PILE OF JUNK.6/4/21 - good news, we made it almost 7 days without having to reboot our whole world!  But today, customers lined up, ready to cash out, can't print. Can't scan.  Nothing changed in our infrastructure.  Ten minutes rebooting our world, and everything works again. Seriously, this is probably the worst piece of tech on the market right now.7/7/21 - just got the alert that my printer is low on all toner.  I bought this printer on 4/15 for $488.  It is now 7/7, and just added 4 genuine HP toner cartridges to my cart here.  Total will be $432.  This is the type of thing that inspires movies like Falling Down.  Oh, and if I click on the handy window that shows up every damn time I print that says "ORDER SUPPLIES!", it takes me to the HP store, where all but black toner is sold out.  So soon, I'll be writing again about a printer that I won't be able to use at all.  Awesome.11/13/21 - Yet another reminder of why HP might be the worst company on the face of the earth.  Remember when I had to spend $432 on toner 4 months ago?  So, like Kramer and the used car salesman trying to see how far they could get on the low fuel light, I kept dismissing the "Critically low" messages every time we'd print at my shop.  We print roughly 15-20 pages per day.  Yeah, I have yet to replace the toner, and the pages still look fine.1/12/22 - still printing just fine. Toner message screaming at me every time I print.3/30/22 - ditto the last update.8/15/24 - still falls off network (both at home and at my shop), still need to reinstall software, still the worst piles of crap in the printer universe.

product_name: HP Color Laserjet Pro MFP 3301fdw Wireless All-in-One Color Laser Printer, Office Printer, Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF, Duplex, Best-for-Office (499Q5F)
description: Originally I downloaded HP's "Easy" setup installer, which adds lots of ads for their toner carts and automatically logs on to HP's site for managing the printer. I deleted it and then downloaded the printer driver itself along with the scanner app, so no more nag ads and a big privacy boost.Print quality is good, but printing a bunch of envelopes from tray 2 is slow and requires you to set up the paper type and size to the envelope used. Originally I had set tray 1 (the slot feed) for envelopes but got tired of standing there feeding it envelopes one-by-one.The scanner app is OK, but not very straightforward compared to the one I used for my Officejet AIO.Still on the small HP starter toner carts that came pre-installed, so I don't know if the offbrand ones I bought, which use HP firmware, actually work. They are less than half HP's price for a similar toner capacity. Seems HP makes their profit on the supplies, which is why they monitor for genuine HP brand.EDIT: After using it for several months now, I agree with the other reviewers that the wifi connectivity is a problem. My Win 11 computer is not able to find the printer ("offline") even when the Eero mesh wifi app says the printer is online. I had to dig out the old USB cable and use it instead. Luckily I only print from the computer, but my son and others use the wifi connection.Also, after resetting the paper type and size between #10 envelopes and letter-sized paper, now the printer wants me to press the "OK to print" button on the screen. Doesn't it recognize the correct paper size in tray #2 anymore?Downgraded it to 3 stars.

product_name: HP Color Laserjet Pro MFP 3301fdw Wireless All-in-One Color Laser Printer, Office Printer, Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF, Duplex, Best-for-Office (499Q5F)
description: I bought this printer because I was tired of ink cartridges drying out.  I have a business and time is money.  Every time I go to use this printer or scanner, I spend about 20 minutes between resetting the printer, having the app do a diagnostic, even getting the scanner app to recognize the printer.  I am using the HP software to install the printer and scanner, and all I have running is normal Windows Defender (no third party firewall applications or anything).  The software says a firewall is blocking the printer, but, there are no firewalls.  Super frustrating when a company releases a product that has tons of software issues and just never chooses to correct them.  When it does print, it does a great job.  But, all of the aggrivation only lets me give this printer 2 stars.  Look elsewhere if you want something that will just work without having to spend a half an hour to print or scan one document.

product_name: HP Color Laserjet Pro MFP 3301fdw Wireless All-in-One Color Laser Printer, Office Printer, Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF, Duplex, Best-for-Office (499Q5F)
description: The best word to describe this printer is “aggravating.” The hardware is solid.  Print quality is excellent and scanning and copying features work fine.  I love the way it prints #10 envelopes.  But the geniuses who designed the embedded software should be fired.When the printer starts up, it whines and groans and bangs for the better part of a minute.  Others have pointed out how noisy it is and how horrible the instructions are.  They are correct.  But, the most weird thing is it starts when you turn on a warm light in the room.  My printer is connected to my home network via Wi-Fi.  Sending a print job from another room does not wake it up. AirPrint is not available when it is sleeping.  Only turning on a light, or manually starting the printer, wakes it up.  You cannot turn  off going to sleep.I can’t find this documented anywhere.  My home office has a ceiling light with LEDs and a desk lamp with a CFL.  When I turn on the desk lamp, the printer starts up, but not when I turn on the ceiling light!Who thought this up???  HP thinks every time I turn on the light, I want to print something?  They think no one wants to print when they are not in the room with the printer?  You can’t get much dumber than that, HP.  The 10-year-old Brother inkjet I replaced made AirPrint available 24-7 and woke up whenever I sent it a print job.  That’s 10-year-old technology!Incidentally, apparently only turning a motor keeps it awake, not sending it an empty print job nor downloading from its HTML server.  I tried both.I sure wish someone at HP would do the right thing and make competent embedded software available for this printer.

product_name: HP Color Laserjet Pro MFP 3301fdw Wireless All-in-One Color Laser Printer, Office Printer, Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF, Duplex, Best-for-Office (499Q5F)
description: The printer does have excellent quality printing--when you can actually get it to print. I have been struggling to get this printer to print reliably since I bought it at the end of last year. I have run every troubleshooting app that is provided by HP, but every time I finally get it to work, the second the printer goes into power save mode, it will no longer work. Most recently, my laptop can see the printer, but can't communicate, and always reports that the printer is offline. I have wasted hours this week trying to get it working again and I am done. I can't recommend this printer. I may not be an IT Specialist, but I'm also not dumb when it comes to setting up my devices. I am going to have to try to hard wire it to my lap top each time I want to print, and hope for the best. But that is NOT why I bought this printer. I bought it to use as a wireless printer so I don't have to be right next to it every time I print. Really disappointed at this point.

product_name: HP Color Laserjet Pro MFP 3301fdw Wireless All-in-One Color Laser Printer, Office Printer, Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF, Duplex, Best-for-Office (499Q5F)
description: The print quality is good. Functionally it is pretty basic.The biggest problem i had with it - after some time of inactivity (2/4/8 hours) it "shuts down". If it's on Wifi - it turns wifi connection off. No way to wake it up over network. No way to disable this behavior.Touching the screen supposed to wake it up, however it can't reconnect to wifi. Internal checks recommend to "turn my router on". Seems like it turns the Wifi card off and then can't turn it back on.The only way to re-connect is to hold the power button for some time until it's fully shut down, then turn it back on and wait for it to boot up and connect back to wifi (takes another 2 minutes).Another issue is the phone app. It doesn't let you do anything unless you create HP account and login with it. OS X application is whole another story. to start using this app you have to authenticate by logging into your HP account, it's done by opening a web brower and navigating it to HP login screen. if you're not using Safary as a default browser, it will give you a hard time. It will keep your Chrome as a focused window and will not let you switch to another app. If you try - it will instantly switch back to Chrom. The problem is that it won't open the login page either. So you have to kill Chrome, kill HP Smart app, make safary as your default browser and retry to authenticate.After 3 weeks of having all these issues i got tired - returning it back to Amazon and switching to another brand.

product_name: HP Color Laserjet Pro MFP 3301fdw Wireless All-in-One Color Laser Printer, Office Printer, Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF, Duplex, Best-for-Office (499Q5F)
description: So I did some research and this HP Color LaserJet Pro looked nice and compact, it had some good reviews, and the price was right.  I checked it out on some YouTube videos for setup and replacing toner cartridges and everything was so simple to do.  I only use Macs and the Color LaserJet Pro was supposedly compatible with macOS.  So, I took the printer out of the box, ran the initial setup, checked the toner cartridges, put in some paper, ran the print demo, connected to my 2.4 GHz WiFi Network, and printed a one-page PDF file from my 2015 MacBook Pro in another room.  I didn't need to install any HP drivers or anything else.  The printer was instantly recognized on my network and was ready to go after a minute or so of initialization.  Now the LaserJet Pro connects and prints instantly whenever I turn it on.I have to say this printer puts out some beautiful print and it will likely be the last printer I will ever need.  I was blown away by the color-print demo.  I don't know why I waited so long to buy a decent laser printer.  I don't think this printer is expensive at all and as long as the toner cartridges stay working, I don't mind paying the price of genuine HP toner cartridges.  It will probably take me years to use up the toner in those cartridges and I even bought a spare black toner cartridge just in case.  I am honestly pleased with this Color LaserJet Pro and I highly recommend it for basic print jobs.  Printing from my Mac running Mojave OS was a breeze.  I don't think printing gets any easier than this.  I'm going to play around with it a bit, such as printing from my smartphone or my other Macs.  I basically use my MacBook Pro laptop daily to do everything, so that's all I need to print from.  I really didn't need a color laser printer, but now I have one if I ever need to print something in color.  For me, it's totally worth it if I'm going to use it for years.  The printer came in handy right away, as I need to return a corrupted PNY SSD to Amazon, so I printed the return shipment code to give to the UPS store.  I had to give this printer a 5-star rating.  I don't see any cons for the short-term.  If it keeps on working as it is, then it's perfect.I bought this Color LaserJet Pro as a replacement printer for some older crappy, multi-function HP Color-Jet printer I had been using over the past few years.  I rarely print anything, so on occasion (every few months), whenever I needed to print or copy something important, the ink-jet cartridge was either partially clogged or dried out.  That's even after I removed the ink-jet cartridges, used the nozzle cover, and placed them in plastic ZipLoc bags.  It drove me bonkers and so I decided to trash that freaking ink-jet printer.  No more ink-jets for me.  I wasn't trying to save money.  It's just that I rarely printed documents and didn't realize there was a problem with those crappy ink-jet cartridges always getting clogged no matter how carefully I treated them.  My advice is... Stay away from ink-jet printers for document printing unless you're going to use them every day.

product_name: HP Color Laserjet Pro MFP 3301fdw Wireless All-in-One Color Laser Printer, Office Printer, Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF, Duplex, Best-for-Office (499Q5F)
HP Color Laserjet Pro MFP 3301fdw Wireless All-in-One Color Laser Printer, Office Printer, Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF, Duplex, Best-for-Office (499Q5F)
description: After long passed time. I finally decided to purchase a color laser printer. Thus far, I have been impressed with the printer itself. One of the huge improvements is the and it appears the laser and inkjet line. Is the ability to use several connectivity options. It seems HP has learned from their mistakes that just a wireless connection just does not cut it. This and also several inkjet printers give you the ability to choose wireless, ethernet and more importantly USB. Yes I know it is a little backwards but, if you have connectivity issues with your wireless connection you are out of luck in printing. Thus USB is a well appreciated addon! The printer performs very well and of course it be a color laser even better. Of course the toner as well as inkjet consumables have to be HP with their chip otherwise it will not work. Also it is my opinion not not waste your time with HP Instaink. I can't say that the toner have the same attributes as the injet cartages but they use a different chip to tell HP that you are running out of ink so it can be replenished by them. The problem with that is if you should decide to cancel and you happed to just got new cartridges you can not use them. You will require to purchase regular ones thus wasting your money with the ones you have. Again, I am not sure this is the case with laser toner but I am not going to subscribe.

product_name: HP Color Laserjet Pro MFP 3301fdw Wireless All-in-One Color Laser Printer, Office Printer, Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF, Duplex, Best-for-Office (499Q5F)
description: I had an Epson Workforce All-In-One (A-I-O) inkjet printer that finally gave up the ghost.  I decided to upscale, and invest in a laser printer; not that I have a lot to print, but when I do, I'd like to be able to, like, read what I print.  And it prints in duplex to save paper!Did a lot of research.  Looked at Cannon and Brother printers along with this HP model.  I do need the A-I-O capability (I am of a generation that still faxes stuff), and color.  This printer just hit all the check-boxes and it is a bit smaller than the old Epson!  Fits nicely in the cubby next to my desk!  And the price-point was good.PRO- It was easy to set up.  Win10 found it and installed both the drivers and control programs as soon as it came online.- Prints FAST!  Well, it is, after all, a laser printer- Has it's own Email address so I can send stuff to it for printing.  I also was able to lock down that Email address to only receive information from specific Email addresses.- The replacement toner is not much more expensive than the multi-pack of ink for the old printer.  I remember when toner was a FORTUNE!!!CON- Somewhat louder... okay a LOT louder than the Epson.  Sounded like a vacuum cleaner turning on the first time I fired it up.  But only for the duration of the print, then it quiets down to nothing.- The LCD display is nearly impossible to read and operate.  The screen is small and I had to be, like, right on top of it to read.  The screen lacks sensitivity - I found I had to pound on the representative information a couple of times for it to register.  But, okay, it's now set up and I am done, and it looks like I can now do the rest through the HP Smart App.I have not downloaded and installed the dedicated HP software for the printer - I am sure that a lot of the functions though the LCD would be duplicated there, but I don't like having a lot of extra apps on the PC if I don't need to use them frequently.  As I mentioned, Win10 found the drivers and control program for me.  The HP Smart Print app seems to work nicely, and I have that installed on my PC and i-Stuff devices. Being a retired IT professional, I like when the user interface is similar across multiple platforms, and the HP Smart Print app allows that - I know what to look for and where.It was nice, too, that when I was done setting up my printer, the HP user site already had the printer information (type, Email address and serial number) there, along with the warranty coverage information.  Thank you!  I HATE when, after setting up something, I then have to go and type all that into a corporate site for coverage!So I got almost 10 years out of the Epson - let's see if I can get the same out of this HP!All in all, pleased.Oh, and printing photos in documents... OUTSTANDING!!!!  Nice to see color on paper that looks like it does on the screen!So... all in all, a good printer for the price!  If that changes, I will revisit my review!

product_name: HP Color Laserjet Pro MFP 3301fdw Wireless All-in-One Color Laser Printer, Office Printer, Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF, Duplex, Best-for-Office (499Q5F)
description: I really like this color laser.  It was easy to install and configure.  I was up and running in approximately an hour.  My only real issue was that the scanner defaulted to WIA when TWAIN is what my File Center software uses.  Not a problem.  This color laser supports both and HP had the driver I needed.  Jut went out to their well organized support site and there it was.Printing from my iPhone and iPad was easy.  As this is replacing an old Brother that didn’t have that capability, this is a big step up for me.  I’m not getting rid of the Brother as it still works well, but it will mainly do black&white from here on.The print image is sharp.  I needed to print some landscape designs that were made for large format printing and I easily read all but the smallest detail.  For the super small detail, with the help of a magnifying glass, that print info was also very sharp.  Maybe if I had my eyes from 40 years ago I could have seen it.The printer is quiet.  In a room full of equipment that is important.Probably my only critique is removing printed pages.  The holding surface needs a little dip to make it easier for those of us with sausage fingers.  I got used to it quick enough but would have liked a little dip in the surface to make it easier.The printer comes with very old software and I tested both the wireless printing as well as the email to the printer option.  As always, HP has a bunch of available forms and crafts.  With land line phones almost obsolete, the mobile fax option is important.  For me, it is important only one time per year.Overall this a a very solid color laser for home office use.

product_name: HP Color Laserjet Pro MFP 3301fdw Wireless All-in-One Color Laser Printer, Office Printer, Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF, Duplex, Best-for-Office (499Q5F)
description: So easy and fast setup. Great size printer even for a smaller room/table. And the prints are so sharp, no matter which paper you use. HIGHLY recommend this one.

product_name: HP Color Laserjet Pro MFP 3301fdw Wireless All-in-One Color Laser Printer, Office Printer, Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF, Duplex, Best-for-Office (499Q5F)
description: At first, I was disappointed as the printer was much smaller than the one I replaced.  Once we set it up and started printing, it was doing the same as our old printer.  It was just a smaller version.  It faxes, scans, copies and prints just like the other.  And the color is the same as the larger.  The plus, plus side to this is that the toner package is hundreds of dollars LESS than the prior.  I could buy 2 toner packages for this printer for what I paid for one on the older printer.  It's a thumbs up for me.

product_name: HP Color Laserjet Pro MFP 3301fdw Wireless All-in-One Color Laser Printer, Office Printer, Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF, Duplex, Best-for-Office (499Q5F)
HP Color Laserjet Pro MFP 3301fdw Wireless All-in-One Color Laser Printer, Office Printer, Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF, Duplex, Best-for-Office (499Q5F)
description: So I just received this printer today and having gone through the setup process I can agree with some of the complaints. To get it to connect to my wifi I had to go through the little screen on the printer and then print off the stats page. From there I got the MAC address that I needed to add to my MAC address filtering. Then the IP address let me add the printer via manual IP. Then it would find the printer otherwise it would scan and never find it. That isn't acceptable. Second I still haven't figured out how to have it scan to a network folder. There is no example with their online video demo. I get a constant error. However opening the software I can at least click on the scan function to accomplish this.Over all the printer seems rather nice but the software is not intuitive nor too user friendly. HP really needs to clean it up. The user manual is basically worthless and for the price I paid for it they could have done a lot more. I feel that HP is more geared at giving network engineers a headache installing their products that they forget that regular folks like me just want a decent printer and are not techno wizards.The upside from what I've read you can roll back the firmware to a previous version that will let you use third party toner cartridges. I haven't tried it yet and as little as I print that would be a good two years down the road. So once I can do that, then I'm sure I'll be rather happy with it.I chose a laserjet as I' so sick of the mess of refilling ink cartridges but more so clogged dried out print heads. Even an eco tank models can get a bit expensive and add the cost of a new print head and I'm into the price of this printer. The way I print, I go through a print head about every year. The last print head I got didn't work as it was of poor quality and took 3 weeks for it to arrive. So going with a laserjet should bypass this problem. So for those who are interested in this printer the hardware seems fine. It's the software that is problematic. So expect a headache and watching a few youtube videos should get you up and running. Otherwise I'm rather excited to begin using it. One thing I do not know is if the scanner will continue to work even if the printer is out of toner. Usually in inkjets no ink bricks the entire unit and praying this doesn't happen with this printer. So my final initial opinion is the printer is decent but HP really fell down on the job in their software.01/13/2024Update. The printer is still working fine. Still using the original toner cartridges. Some things I did notice. Whenever you lose power you must turn off then on again. Then the printer will scan fir your network, find it and login. Else the printer won't find your network as it takes longer for the router and PC to boot than the printer.Now scanning to a network feature. I finally got it to work. First you have to create a sharable folder. Then to login. You have to use your Microsoft username. It's a pain and recommend that once successful to write it all down for future reference.Other than that I've had no problems with this printer and still very satisfied with its performance. Another feature that is overlooked is the ability to roll back the firmware. The previous version which you can download for free will let you use third party toners without bricking the printer. I haven't done it but there are numerous YouTube videos demonstrating this.Final thoughts, very nice printer but the software and instructions are a bit lacking and confusing.

product_name: HP Color Laserjet Pro MFP 3301fdw Wireless All-in-One Color Laser Printer, Office Printer, Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF, Duplex, Best-for-Office (499Q5F)
description: I've wrestled with ink jet printers for the last time....clean the print head, align the print head... adios print head!after I was up to my wrist in ink the old HP inkjet printer grew wings and took flight...the best part for me is that "new" laser printer smell... reminds me of the ol'office printer when I use to go into an office!

product_name: Marshall Emberton II Portable Bluetooth Speaker, Black & Brass
description: Me agrada el sonido,  pero no me agrada la carga de energía,  se descarga muy rápido

product_name: Marshall Emberton II Portable Bluetooth Speaker, Black & Brass
description: Sounds amazing when I can get it to connect. Hardly ever connects on my Android phone.

product_name: Marshall Emberton II Portable Bluetooth Speaker, Black & Brass
description: This speaker sounds great, quality for the speaker is 10/10.The problem with mine is as many reported... the battery worked for about 1 year and then it stopped working, audio sounds for 10 seconds even when connected and then drops the connection, sometimes with some "static" noise.I tried all the troubleshooting and was advised to open a case with Marshall, have not gotten a single mail there.As I really liked this amplifier I went to a 3rd party who advised me it was the battery what is damaged.

product_name: Marshall Emberton II Portable Bluetooth Speaker, Black & Brass
description: Looks cool and sounds good but no bass at volume and bad overall sound at volume
