product_name: Marshall Emberton II Portable Bluetooth Speaker, Black & Brass
description: only 6 hours playtime music from full battery, Maybe I got defect unit? it's very far from their claim 30 hours + playtime

product_name: Marshall Emberton II Portable Bluetooth Speaker, Black & Brass
description: Android users, just say no. The sound is very good and it feels like a heavy well built product. I bought this for my husband who will only ever buy an Android phone...but this device does not work with an Android.He is keeping it because he can use it with his computer, but he is disappointed. He has a Marshall amp for his guitar. He loves Marshall.I just checked the stats...worldwide there are 3 billion Android devices to 1 billion iPhone. Seems like plenty of reason to get the app fixed so Android users can use their beloved Marshall.

product_name: Marshall Emberton II Portable Bluetooth Speaker, Black & Brass
description: I have a few of these and really like them but the volume is limited. Wish they were a little louder.

product_name: Marshall Emberton II Portable Bluetooth Speaker, Black & Brass
description: This item is an exceptional piece of technology, the sound is crystal clear and powerful, the interface is simple and effective, and the build is rock solid. But alas! It's got no mic hence no speakerphone capabilities! This means that if someone calls you (or you want to interact with your phone at all through voice) you will have to get your rear end to your phone and do it through the phone which will sound like a motherboard speaker after listening to the Marshall. Remember you have an HD sound device connected to your phone literally in your hand.If this was a purposeful decision by the design team then they really messed up what could have been a perfect product. I wonder what was going through their minds. For me, this is a deal breaker.

product_name: Marshall Emberton II Portable Bluetooth Speaker, Black & Brass
description: The quality of the speaker is great, very elegant and it sounds beautiful. However, compared to other speakers I have bought, this does nothing but just Bluetooth play. I am very disappointed because I was under the impression that it would play from SD card, USB port, and auxiliary port. Other speakers cost less, have those features, and sound as good.

product_name: Marshall Emberton II Portable Bluetooth Speaker, Black & Brass
description: Overall soundstage is muted but I listen at low to mid volumes so it's not much of a concern.I purchased it primarily because of its aesthetics.Build-quality is beyond reproach.Love the compact design and solid feelNo regretsUPdate (07/24/'24)Recently, an annoying problem has surfaced: I have 2 Embertons and when in "Stack" mode, one would intermittently drop from "Stack" mode while the other would continue playing. I would then have to double-press the Bluetooth button on the non-playing speaker to reconnect to the "Stack" mode. I still love the sound and attractiveness of the Embertons but would have probably chosen different speakers had I been aware of this failing.

product_name: Marshall Emberton II Portable Bluetooth Speaker, Black & Brass
description: It has a beautiful design, great sound quality, and impressive battery life. The build feels durable, and it’s perfect for both indoor and outdoor use. I highly recommend this speaker for anyone looking for a high-quality portable Bluetooth option. It has exceeded my expectations in every way.

product_name: Marshall Emberton II Portable Bluetooth Speaker, Black & Brass
description: Priced right, great sound and it looks sooooo cooooool. Haven't had it long enough to know for sure but the charge is lasting a very long time. I'm extremely pleased with this purchase.

product_name: Marshall Emberton II Portable Bluetooth Speaker, Black & Brass
description: A few months ago I had an epiphany.  When I was a kid my father loved to have the best in sound equipment in the house, and I would play with graphic equalizers and lay in the floor looking for the best position between the giant speakers to experiment how to better enjoy the music.Today, I hear music in monophonic audio in an old JBL Charge 3 speaker (don't tell my dad, he would be ashame of me).So I started to get better equipment.  Now, I live in a small apartment with thin walls in a 3rd floor, so, big amplifiers and so are out of the question, but at least I could get better bluetooth speakers, so I tried the Marshall Emberton II.To say that I impressed with the sound would be an understatement.  With out-of-the-box settings, the sound is more than detailed.  80s and 90s music sound outstanding although, Peter Cetera's Glory of Love and Toto's Africa vocals sound as I never heard them before, they are sharp and strong, sometimes detracting just a little from the overall sound (keywords here, really, just a little).This brings me to my first recommendation: do not mess with your applications equalizers if you don't know what you are doing.  This speakers were clearly designed to use the manufacturer equalizer settings (more on this later).  I have youtube music and amazon prime music (yeah, I know, no spotify), and my sound with the latter was to heavy on bass, to the point of drowning the music and feeling almost distorting.  Tron: Legacy's soundtrack sounded specially dreadful, as Daftpunk uses heavy bass in their electronic music for that specific music.  I then set the equalization in Amazon Prime Music to flat.  It was a different performance altogether.  I could ever hear some slight effects they used, that I had not noticed before.Now, one down for the application.  Bluetooth pairing used Google Fast Pair, which was seamless and impressive (it shows appears to be a custom Marshall little window, so, it looks cool), but the application takes forever to actually "discover" the device, even when it is already paired.When it finally discover it (which was not too long, but took a couple of turning on and off the speaker), the application notified me of a firmware upgrade, which I proceeded to install.  The installation failed miserably, so, I temporarily stopped that effort, which I retook successfully a day later.  The update was surprisingly big in size, taking around 5 minutes to download, and the application simply marked the update successful while the speaker was still rebooting, which took a few seconds more than what I feel comfortable with, but it went through, and after that, the application again took surprisingly long to detect the speaker.To end that topic, the equalization settings are definitely underwhelming, with only three modes: Marshall, Voice and Push, of which I have only tried Marshall as everybody else says that Voice is just for podcast and such and Push increases bass at the expense of all the other sound bands quality.Lesson learned: unless too picky, when using this speaker, leave your apps equalizers on flat, their profile is that good.Now, to the hardware itself, people will notice this little wonder.  Using the nostalgia factor with the Marshall amplifier design was a touch of genius, and the brass button on top is the cherry on top.  Some reviews complain about a single button approach to multifunction (power, volume, forward-back, bluetooth pairing has another almost invisible button, which fits because you are not changing your pairing frequently).  If we can handle touch control on over-head and in-ear speakers, this button is a piece of cake.My only complain in this department is that, at least for me, an old guy, the signs indicating the functions around the button, being carved in the black speaker, which has texture, are for all intent and purposes invisible, but once you get accustomed, an use the logo as a positional reference that's not a problem anymore.And finally, the little caveat.  Single speaker, stereo sound.  Let that sink in.Done?  Ok, they achieve this trick by separating the sound left and right with drivers back and front respectively (or was it the other way around? well, you get my point).  Stereo suffers a little (not too much) because both sources are incredibly close, but it brings this caveat.  This speaker should not be set as others, against walls, like in shelf, and so, because you end up drowning one side.The best position for this speaker is in the center of the audio stage, and if you want to appreciate the sound, you should point one side (not the front or back) to you.  that way both sources are equally distanced from you so you get a better balance.If you are ok with the caveats this product is worth the price, I definitely recommend it.

product_name: Marshall Emberton II Portable Bluetooth Speaker, Black & Brass
description: This Bluetooth speaker has a nice, balanced sound. Some may find it is a little lacking in the bass range, but for my musical tastes it is a fine speaker. Long battery life. Its smaller size makes it very portable.

product_name: Marshall Emberton II Portable Bluetooth Speaker, Black & Brass
description: Audiophiles will love how much the music played in these speakers sounds the way it was meant to sound. Providing you have a great recording.The build quality is perfect. I bought the cream colored one. Elegant and classy looking. Will fit in any nice decor.Played it for my husband, a professional musician and he immediately ordered another, for himself. It was that good.Honestly, before this, there were no Marshall speakers I had liked enough to buy.Once my husband’s speaker arrived we tried out the stacking feature. Once we finally figured out how to get it to work. Wow! It sounded great. Like spatial audio if you center yourself between the two speakers. He immediately ordered two more Emberton II’s so we could both enjoy the stacking feature.The only disappointment is that it doesn’t stack in stereo. So you don’t get that speaker interplay from stereo recordings.To stack, only connect one of the two speakers via bluetooth to your device. Then follow the instructions for button pressing to stack the second one, without connecting it to the same device via bluetooth. The speakers connect to each other independently. While the main one is connected to your device.They are also surprisingly loud.The Marshall app EQ controls are kind of lame. But you can get a bit more base out of it.Very pleased! But not enough experience yet to know about battery life.

product_name: Marshall Emberton II Portable Bluetooth Speaker, Black & Brass
description: Feels churlish to give just three stars. 3.5 imo. So to the point. I bought this Em II to mainly listen to my true crime podcasts in my bedroom. Easy & seamless Bluetooth connection to my iPhone 14max. Easy straightforward use for controls on the unit. I really didn’t need to look at the instructions with that. Smooth use there.To test the sound quality I streamed some mesic. The sound quality for music is fine’ish considering the size of speaker. It’s fine for background music if you’re flexible on sound quality as long as you don’t play loudly, at that point the music will frazzle out. So limited, not surprising. Podcast quality is definitely an improvement from my phone’s speaker and in line with the price point, in general. I think it should be about $25 less.  The app is useless. I guess I expected something from the app. I’m at a loss for the point of it. I tried it out on my phone. It continued so say my phone Bluetooth was not on. Even as I was literally playing music through it. I did all the stuff. Restart, reconnect etc. Reviewed the booklet, Nothing. Everything re the speaker and phone working fine. But what is the point of the app? I interpreted from the manual that I should download the app to get extra features. Maybe bass and treble controls? The book claims you can stack more speakers through the app but I would not invest in that as it continually says my phones Bluetooth is off. lolFine retro look, sturdy, small footprint and working out for podcasts. Do not think the app is or will be helpful.If I were to try another I’d probably go with the Klipsch of similar design. It’s approximately $50 more but better sound and working app.Remove $25 dollars off price on the Em II and it’s a fair deal.

product_name: Marshall Emberton II Portable Bluetooth Speaker, Black & Brass
description: Not only does this little speaker look amazing, but the sound is great and totally worth the price. I have no complaints with this product.

product_name: Marshall Emberton II Portable Bluetooth Speaker, Black & Brass
description: I think this is a really great looking device, and it feels very high quality. It sounds really great, though it doesn't go too loud. At about half volume, it starts to crack. But I got this to use in my backyard, and I wouldn't have it very loud there, because I don't want to bother my neighbors. It sounds great at the volume I use it at.

product_name: Marshall Emberton II Portable Bluetooth Speaker, Black & Brass
description: Marvellous purchase I must say! Honestly for the price, you get a speaker that sounds REALLY good. I use it for playing something in the background in my room while i'm working and more than a couple of times i got somebody saying to me "wow, it sounds really good"Audio is best when playing classical music, but the bass lacks some power sometimes. Be aware that when you dial the volume to 100, the sounds start to distort and it doesn't sound so crisp.Still, for the price you get an excelent product. Wish it had more bass sometimes, but i can't deny that it sounds beautiful and it can be an excelent conversation starter in a living room. Definetely a purchase that has made me happier than I expected

product_name: Marshall Emberton II Portable Bluetooth Speaker, Black & Brass
description: Cumple con un buen sonido, hasta que llegas arriba del 85% del volumen. Buen diseño y los materiales se sienten de buena calidad. Si es resistente al agua y polvo. Lo único que no me gustó, es que la interfaz con la app nunca pudo establecer conexión y no puedo cambiar el ecualizador. Pero en general, buen producto

product_name: Apple Watch Series 10 [GPS 46mm case] Smartwatch with Jet Black Aluminium Case with Black Sport Band - M/L. Fitness Tracker, ECG App, Always-On Retina Display, Water Resistant
description: The watch is fine as far as I can tell--just received last night so not much to tell.  iPhone 13 pro max had to be updated to v18 software in order to pair but after that, no big deal.  It's just another Apple watch.  Only purchased because Series 4 support has ended.Not happy at all about the sport loop band though.  Gorgeous color but useless because it is way too short compared to previous versions which were great.  The band which is supposed to be one size for everyone appears to be child sized.

product_name: Apple Watch Series 10 [GPS 46mm case] Smartwatch with Jet Black Aluminium Case with Black Sport Band - M/L. Fitness Tracker, ECG App, Always-On Retina Display, Water Resistant
description: I'd like my watch a lot more if charging wasn't so frustrating.  USB-c for a charger?  Really?  There are so many versions of USB-c then I care to list.  So what Apple is telling me is I have to buy something in order to get my watch charged.  Kind of them to at least include a battery.

product_name: Apple Watch Series 10 [GPS 46mm case] Smartwatch with Jet Black Aluminium Case with Black Sport Band - M/L. Fitness Tracker, ECG App, Always-On Retina Display, Water Resistant
description: It took forever to pair and connect to my iPhone 16Pro. Issues connecting to Apple server.I really preferred the somewhat smaller size of my previous Apple Watch (40). The included watchband is cheap looking and not up to my expectations considering the price point. Again, my previous Apple Watch had a much nicer watchband.  I finally got my watch connected this morning so I can’t speak to its functionality.

product_name: Apple Watch Series 10 [GPS 46mm case] Smartwatch with Jet Black Aluminium Case with Black Sport Band - M/L. Fitness Tracker, ECG App, Always-On Retina Display, Water Resistant
description: It is OK. I really can’t tell the difference between my old one and this one.

product_name: Apple Watch Series 10 [GPS 46mm case] Smartwatch with Jet Black Aluminium Case with Black Sport Band - M/L. Fitness Tracker, ECG App, Always-On Retina Display, Water Resistant
description: Doesn’t do O2 or blood pressure.

product_name: Apple Watch Series 10 [GPS 46mm case] Smartwatch with Jet Black Aluminium Case with Black Sport Band - M/L. Fitness Tracker, ECG App, Always-On Retina Display, Water Resistant
description: I bought two of this thinking they'd be the perfect upgrade for me and my wife, but it wasn't they weren't what we expected nor wanted, don't get me wrong the display is amazing and impressive and the health tracking is useful (at least that's what my wife said), but we found the battery disappointing, even with few use the watch did struggle to last through the day without needing a charge, which really detracted from the utility and connectivity was another issue the watch had problems connecting to my phone many many times and to wi-fi is another story it never worked maybe once or twice in a week.

product_name: Apple Watch Series 10 [GPS 46mm case] Smartwatch with Jet Black Aluminium Case with Black Sport Band - M/L. Fitness Tracker, ECG App, Always-On Retina Display, Water Resistant
description: I bought this for sleep apnea but I don’t think this actually has it.  Even though it says notifications are on I don’t think it registers anything.  I have very low heart rate laying down and although I get low heart rate notifications nothing is ever recorded under the AFIB part.  The fall mechanism does not work, I fell hard outdoors and it did not even sense it.  Makes me wonder if the other health apps are accurate at all.

product_name: Apple Watch Series 10 [GPS 46mm case] Smartwatch with Jet Black Aluminium Case with Black Sport Band - M/L. Fitness Tracker, ECG App, Always-On Retina Display, Water Resistant
description: Box is super dirty. Did u not check before ship it out to the customers? Thankfully watch inside is fine.

product_name: Apple Watch Series 10 [GPS 46mm case] Smartwatch with Jet Black Aluminium Case with Black Sport Band - M/L. Fitness Tracker, ECG App, Always-On Retina Display, Water Resistant
Apple Watch Series 10 [GPS 46mm case] Smartwatch with Jet Black Aluminium Case with Black Sport Band - M/L. Fitness Tracker, ECG App, Always-On Retina Display, Water Resistant
description: I “upgraded” to the new Series 10 Apple Watch, and it’s been a frustrating experience.The battery drains way too fast, leaving me anxious about constantly needing to charge it. Worse, it won’t track my workouts properly, it keeps stopping while I’m still exercising, so I waste time resetting it, and the data ends up inaccurate.On top of that, the sleep apnea app doesn’t work at all.For the price, this is a major letdown. I expected much better from Apple ☹️

product_name: Apple Watch Series 10 [GPS 46mm case] Smartwatch with Jet Black Aluminium Case with Black Sport Band - M/L. Fitness Tracker, ECG App, Always-On Retina Display, Water Resistant
description: Love love my Apple Watch! I’ve only had it a few days but it’s easy to use, fast, smart and is so light. Love the larger screen (my former watch was an 8).

product_name: Apple Watch Series 10 [GPS 46mm case] Smartwatch with Jet Black Aluminium Case with Black Sport Band - M/L. Fitness Tracker, ECG App, Always-On Retina Display, Water Resistant
description: I upgraded my old Apple Watch after many years of wearing one of the original versions. I love the bigger screen and sleeker design. The new health features are useful. Battery lasts the majority of the day and through multiple workouts. Took a chance ordering this from Amazon and am very pleased.

product_name: Apple Watch Series 10 [GPS 46mm case] Smartwatch with Jet Black Aluminium Case with Black Sport Band - M/L. Fitness Tracker, ECG App, Always-On Retina Display, Water Resistant
description: I am fully entrenched in the Apple ecosystem and this watch is a great addition to my collection. The band (M/L) is a perfect fit. I love the slimmer profile of the Series 10 compared to the previous models. The watch works seamlessly with my iPhone 15 Pro and my MacBook. There is a little bit of a learning curve and it will take some trial and error to get the face layout and complications the way I want it, but it's so easy to customize the watch. I may even use different faces for different moods or events. Overall, I highly recommend the Apple Watch Series 10

product_name: Apple Watch Series 10 [GPS 46mm case] Smartwatch with Jet Black Aluminium Case with Black Sport Band - M/L. Fitness Tracker, ECG App, Always-On Retina Display, Water Resistant
description: Great charging speed, good vitals measurements, good battery, flawless sync with iphone

product_name: Apple Watch Series 10 [GPS 46mm case] Smartwatch with Jet Black Aluminium Case with Black Sport Band - M/L. Fitness Tracker, ECG App, Always-On Retina Display, Water Resistant
description: Trying out my first Apple Watch.  It is tastefully minimalist, with your choice of complications for the watch face.  Comfortable wristband.

product_name: Apple Watch Series 10 [GPS 46mm case] Smartwatch with Jet Black Aluminium Case with Black Sport Band - M/L. Fitness Tracker, ECG App, Always-On Retina Display, Water Resistant
description: Gotta say, my old Apple Watch SE 1 (2020) would take 2 hours minimum to charge to 100%Got the new series 10, and from 30% charge, Im back up to 100% charge in 30-40 minutes maximum.Aside from that, it’s an Apple Watch. It’s good. Though unless you are upgrading from  watch that’s 4 years old or older, then it’s not worth the upgrade. It’s really all the same watch. You won’t notice that much of an upgrade if you are considering upgrading from a series 8 or 9. I would have never upgraded my SE watch had apple not dropped software support for it.

product_name: Apple Watch Series 10 [GPS 46mm case] Smartwatch with Jet Black Aluminium Case with Black Sport Band - M/L. Fitness Tracker, ECG App, Always-On Retina Display, Water Resistant
description: The watch is very practical, everything worked perfectly from the start.

product_name: Apple Watch Series 10 [GPS 46mm case] Smartwatch with Jet Black Aluminium Case with Black Sport Band - M/L. Fitness Tracker, ECG App, Always-On Retina Display, Water Resistant
description: Never owned any of the previous iterations but I can say with certainty that this is a great device. The range of features is great and having it all on your wrist is even better. No longer do you have to pull your phone out for everything. The watch itself is of great build quality and everything from the haptic feedback to the smooth roll of the scroll wheel is incredible. I cannot complain about this watch. Sure if you have the series 9 maybe you won’t need the series 10 but if you’re like me and you’ve never owned one before or you have a very old model you’ll be in for a treat

product_name: Apple Watch Series 10 [GPS 46mm case] Smartwatch with Jet Black Aluminium Case with Black Sport Band - M/L. Fitness Tracker, ECG App, Always-On Retina Display, Water Resistant
description: I didn't want to spend the money on a Apple watch when my FitBit was working just fine.  I've had 3-4 Fitbits with no issue.  But with this latest version, If I didn't sync regularly the battery would die more quickly and it would lose time.  When I contacted FitBit they told me to sync 6 times a day.  LOL - I was lucky if I hit sync 6 times a month.  Ridiculous.Anyway, none of that is necessary with the magic of Apple.  Everything just happens as it should in the seamless Apple world and I've gotten a lot more features to boot.  This was a great exchange.The sport loop band is the most comfortable band I've had.  Highly recommended (even though the price point on the Apple brand is astronomical).  Battery life is great, getting easily more than 24-hours.  I do need to remember to charge daily which is something I'm not used to.Very happy with the purchase.

product_name: Apple Watch Series 10 [GPS 46mm case] Smartwatch with Jet Black Aluminium Case with Black Sport Band - M/L. Fitness Tracker, ECG App, Always-On Retina Display, Water Resistant
description: I am 77 with health issues, friends and family suggested I get the watch for “fall protection “ because I had just fallen and couldn’t get up on my own without help all caused by meds.Wife wanted the watch in case she wasn’t around, the watch would notify 911 and send help.  So now I have the watch, wow it does so muchAnd it’s fun, love it, no fall yet but still great.

product_name: HP 14 Laptop, Intel Celeron N4020, 4 GB RAM, 64 GB Storage, 14-inch Micro-edge HD Display, Windows 11 Home, Thin & Portable, 4K Graphics, One Year of Microsoft 365 (14-dq0040nr, Snowflake White)
description: This is a shockingly terrible computer.  The look and feel is extremely cheap.  The thing felt incredibly flimsy, and the entire keyboard could be pushed in without much effort.  Awkward feeling keyboard feel and layout too.  The screen quality was awful.  If you weren't looking at the exact perfect angle, the screen would appear faded out and the color would change.  It has an extremely narrow range of viewing angles.  I could never adjust my eyes to the color, and photos would look simply terrible.  My Chromebook has vastly superior color rendering, and the screen looks good at a wide range of viewing angles.  The resolution was purported to be 1080, but the pixels seemed very large and most things appeared "blocky".  But the worst part of this computer was the performance.  Unbelievably slow!  Web pages would take forever to load, text would come in, and a bunch of white boxes would appear on screen until each image would load.  It is not my connection either, as I ran this computer right next to my Chromebook, which had none of these loading problems.  This computer was so slow that it would literally hang up while I was typing!  I would start to type a sentence, and nothing would happen on screen, then a few seconds later, the words would start to show up.  I closed everything but one web browser to compose an email, and I could not write simple text without the computer lagging behind.  It was beyond terrible to the point I may have just gotten a lemon.  But if this was not a broken machine, it's the worst computer I have ever used.  Returned it less than a week after using, I was fed up!

product_name: HP 14 Laptop, Intel Celeron N4020, 4 GB RAM, 64 GB Storage, 14-inch Micro-edge HD Display, Windows 11 Home, Thin & Portable, 4K Graphics, One Year of Microsoft 365 (14-dq0040nr, Snowflake White)
description: It's in just slow. No two ways about it. I am not a gamer, all I do is surf the web and sometimes order from Amazon. I can run 3 open windows, a fourth will freeze up. Probably needs more RAM but why should I have to add RAM to a new computer that I have had less than 90 days? Also short battery life, don't plan to do any work from your lunch break!

product_name: HP 14 Laptop, Intel Celeron N4020, 4 GB RAM, 64 GB Storage, 14-inch Micro-edge HD Display, Windows 11 Home, Thin & Portable, 4K Graphics, One Year of Microsoft 365 (14-dq0040nr, Snowflake White)
description: Its kind of slow no matter the wifiIdk it gets the job done if you're looking for a college laptopI can watch movies sometimes and get my school work done

product_name: HP 14 Laptop, Intel Celeron N4020, 4 GB RAM, 64 GB Storage, 14-inch Micro-edge HD Display, Windows 11 Home, Thin & Portable, 4K Graphics, One Year of Microsoft 365 (14-dq0040nr, Snowflake White)
description: i’m not sure if it’s an error on my part, smth i did while setting it up or if it’s just how it comes but it’s really laggy and i can’t play majority of games on it bcs of how laggy and slow it is. otherwise works like normal.

product_name: HP 14 Laptop, Intel Celeron N4020, 4 GB RAM, 64 GB Storage, 14-inch Micro-edge HD Display, Windows 11 Home, Thin & Portable, 4K Graphics, One Year of Microsoft 365 (14-dq0040nr, Snowflake White)
description: For the price not bad but if you are looking to do more then just write papers on word I would recommend something with more Ram

product_name: HP 14 Laptop, Intel Celeron N4020, 4 GB RAM, 64 GB Storage, 14-inch Micro-edge HD Display, Windows 11 Home, Thin & Portable, 4K Graphics, One Year of Microsoft 365 (14-dq0040nr, Snowflake White)
description: Processor was too slow for what we needed it for.  Very light weight, which doesn't mean that it's bad, but it just felt "cheap".  I was afraid that if I set something too heavy on it, it would shatter.  Probably good for those who want a cheaper computer, it just wasn't for me.

product_name: HP 14 Laptop, Intel Celeron N4020, 4 GB RAM, 64 GB Storage, 14-inch Micro-edge HD Display, Windows 11 Home, Thin & Portable, 4K Graphics, One Year of Microsoft 365 (14-dq0040nr, Snowflake White)
description: It’s a decent system. Win11 plus a year of O365. 4GB of RAM does not provide enough if you intend to use this for 7-9 hours. Requires reboots but still for the value it’s good!

product_name: HP 14 Laptop, Intel Celeron N4020, 4 GB RAM, 64 GB Storage, 14-inch Micro-edge HD Display, Windows 11 Home, Thin & Portable, 4K Graphics, One Year of Microsoft 365 (14-dq0040nr, Snowflake White)
description: It show 2.8Ghz and it runs at 1.1Ghz , rest is ok.  It is basically laptop functional but processor speed is not correct

product_name: HP 14 Laptop, Intel Celeron N4020, 4 GB RAM, 64 GB Storage, 14-inch Micro-edge HD Display, Windows 11 Home, Thin & Portable, 4K Graphics, One Year of Microsoft 365 (14-dq0040nr, Snowflake White)
description: Gift for my mother

product_name: HP 14 Laptop, Intel Celeron N4020, 4 GB RAM, 64 GB Storage, 14-inch Micro-edge HD Display, Windows 11 Home, Thin & Portable, 4K Graphics, One Year of Microsoft 365 (14-dq0040nr, Snowflake White)
description: I haven’t had a laptop in awhile so I thought I would use it to test my knowledge of a newer Microsoft Windows product. Turns out it’s very easy to use and I may get a better quality product later

product_name: HP 14 Laptop, Intel Celeron N4020, 4 GB RAM, 64 GB Storage, 14-inch Micro-edge HD Display, Windows 11 Home, Thin & Portable, 4K Graphics, One Year of Microsoft 365 (14-dq0040nr, Snowflake White)
HP 14 Laptop, Intel Celeron N4020, 4 GB RAM, 64 GB Storage, 14-inch Micro-edge HD Display, Windows 11 Home, Thin & Portable, 4K Graphics, One Year of Microsoft 365 (14-dq0040nr, Snowflake White)
description: I really like my new laptop. Can't believe how light it is and how easy it is to use. I was using Chromebooks for a long time, so it took me a while to get used to this. But I am very much enjoying it.Its very fast, screen us bright and touch screen is very easy.

product_name: HP 14 Laptop, Intel Celeron N4020, 4 GB RAM, 64 GB Storage, 14-inch Micro-edge HD Display, Windows 11 Home, Thin & Portable, 4K Graphics, One Year of Microsoft 365 (14-dq0040nr, Snowflake White)
description: We bought these for school work. I've always loved HP and have bought several. However now you have to go through several steps to be able to get google on the HP laptops they are completely set up with Microsoft/edge only. A good bit of the school programs we have to use require google chrome and it was a bit of a task to get it downloaded during the setting up process. But other than this, these are very good durable laptops.

product_name: HP 14 Laptop, Intel Celeron N4020, 4 GB RAM, 64 GB Storage, 14-inch Micro-edge HD Display, Windows 11 Home, Thin & Portable, 4K Graphics, One Year of Microsoft 365 (14-dq0040nr, Snowflake White)
description: I love the way the laptop is so customizable. I can change almost anything on it. I deleted all Microsoft office apps because I use Google Which freed up some much needed space. The laptop came brand new and I enjoyed setup process. I am currently using this laptop with a cover on it to protect the color on it I’m looking to get a keyboard cover too. Great value, brand new, easy to set up

product_name: HP 14 Laptop, Intel Celeron N4020, 4 GB RAM, 64 GB Storage, 14-inch Micro-edge HD Display, Windows 11 Home, Thin & Portable, 4K Graphics, One Year of Microsoft 365 (14-dq0040nr, Snowflake White)
description: Arrived quickly,  2 days sooner than stated! Package well.  Was going to wait to three weekend,  but was feeling a little blue & bored so decided to set up.  It took about 30 minutes total,  which wasn't long since I wasn't doing anyting else.  Three screen size is perfect,  raised keys, and plenty of ports to connect my wireless mouse (My only issue is my issue - having long nails makes using the TouchPad difficult, hence needing a blue! Cord is long enough to plug up and reach a decent distance so you aren't sitting on the wall when charging!  I LOVE the white housing,  looks sleek and now I don't feel so blue!

product_name: HP 14 Laptop, Intel Celeron N4020, 4 GB RAM, 64 GB Storage, 14-inch Micro-edge HD Display, Windows 11 Home, Thin & Portable, 4K Graphics, One Year of Microsoft 365 (14-dq0040nr, Snowflake White)
description: Thin and well finished. Typical excellent HP quality. 64 gig solid drive. Drives have gotten so big that 64 seems puny. Actually 64 gig is actually quite large for the average user. You can add space quire easily these days.I started with a TRS80 with 4 K of memory and! used audio cassets for storage. We have come a long way.

product_name: HP 14 Laptop, Intel Celeron N4020, 4 GB RAM, 64 GB Storage, 14-inch Micro-edge HD Display, Windows 11 Home, Thin & Portable, 4K Graphics, One Year of Microsoft 365 (14-dq0040nr, Snowflake White)
description: The HP 14 is a great choice for those looking for a basic laptop under $200, but it’s not for gamers, designers, or anyone who does more than the basics on their computer. Most surprisingly, it’s even decent  for streaming video and for cord cutters who can take advantage of the HDMI port to connect to a larger display.The basics:  It comes with Windows 11 Home in S mode, but you can easily switch out of S mode if you need to install additional programs not found on the Microsoft store. I turned it off with 4 minutes of use, so that’s a breeze.  And of course, this laptop features a 14-inch 1920 x 1080 display, an Intel Celeron N4020 processor, and 4GB of RAM.**Here are some of the highlights of the HP 14:*** **Great for basic tasks:** The HP 14 can handle basic tasks such as browsing the web, checking email, and using productivity software, but with only 4GB of RAM, I  experienced some  slowdowns when I had many tabs open in my browser or was running multiple programs at once.* **Long battery life:** The laptop can last up to 6.5 hours on a single charge. I was definitely impressed!* **Comfortable keyboard:** The keyboard is bouncy with a generous click and plenty of room for typing.if you like firmer keyboards, this one may not be your jam.* **SD card slot:** The HP 14 includes an SD card slot, which is a rarity for laptops in this price range.perfect for me,because my trail cam’s card can be emptied daily with ease!* **HDMI port:** as mentioned, this is great  for cord cutters who want to connect to a larger display or projector. My last cheap laptop was twice the price of this one and didn’t have an hdmi or a card reader.**Here are some things to keep in mind:*** **Small touchpad:** The touchpad is small and can be difficult to use.* **Dim screen:** The screen is a bit dim and I found it impossible to use outside no matter how I adjusted the display settings.* **Low storage:** 64GB of storage may not be enough for some users.* **Limited RAM:** 4GB of RAM  limits multitasking capabilities.I don’t know yet if those last two items are upgradable, but I’ll check into it if things get bogged down over the next few weeks!**Overall, the HP 14 is a great laptop for students, casual users, and anyone looking for a basic laptop under $200, especially if you don't plan on running multiple programs at once.  However, if you need a laptop for more demanding tasks, you may want to consider a model with more RAM.**

product_name: HP 14 Laptop, Intel Celeron N4020, 4 GB RAM, 64 GB Storage, 14-inch Micro-edge HD Display, Windows 11 Home, Thin & Portable, 4K Graphics, One Year of Microsoft 365 (14-dq0040nr, Snowflake White)
description: It’s pretty dang slow. I’m having my tech buddy come by to see what hardware he can swap out to make it faster. Takes about 10 minutes to fully load main screen

product_name: HP 14 Laptop, Intel Celeron N4020, 4 GB RAM, 64 GB Storage, 14-inch Micro-edge HD Display, Windows 11 Home, Thin & Portable, 4K Graphics, One Year of Microsoft 365 (14-dq0040nr, Snowflake White)
description: The size is perfect for what the person used it for! Understand a Backlight would cost more money but they could have made the keyboard numbers & letters a different color to make them easier to see!

product_name: HP 14 Laptop, Intel Celeron N4020, 4 GB RAM, 64 GB Storage, 14-inch Micro-edge HD Display, Windows 11 Home, Thin & Portable, 4K Graphics, One Year of Microsoft 365 (14-dq0040nr, Snowflake White)
description: Great size, love the color,it was cost effective brightness level 👍, I've not experienced any freezing.

product_name: Introducing Ring Pan-Tilt Indoor Cam | See all around with 360° pan coverage, HD video, plus Two-Way Talk (2024 release) | White
description: Product as advertised. Flaws are mainly in packaging. Product comes with NO instructions, No Quick Start guide, No enclosed parts list, and worst... no customer support phone number or web address. Literally all you get is a QR code (and a six page warranty guide to protect them legally.) Camera came packaged with a number of parts, but I have no idea thier use. Camera had wrapper glued around body - is it just for shipping? No idea. It started to fall off after a couple days, so I left it off. QR code led to relatively simple set up instructions, but no parts list, no videos, no app help, or much else. But don't worry, they will be contacting you immediately/daily to suggest you upgrade your monthly service contract. I give 4 stars for product, 2 for packaging, 3 star rating overall.Addendum: They read my review above and immediately called me :-O not to offer help :-( but to schedule a time the next week to call back and offer help. To my posted concerns, they replied, "yes, I can see how including instructions could be helpful." WHAT??? I also learned there were several helpful features in the app that would improve functionality of the camera, but instead of a positive, that just made me sad and angry that again there were no instructions or information provided. While I'm impressed that they (a rep in the USA) called and followed up, I would have much rather they just provide the information up front, when I really needed it. I've edited my original review accordingly, but the ratings don't change.

product_name: Introducing Ring Pan-Tilt Indoor Cam | See all around with 360° pan coverage, HD video, plus Two-Way Talk (2024 release) | White
description: Even on highest sensitivity settings in place, the motion detection is poor. It missed ten minutes of an important event I really needed the footage of. Also note it will not automatically pan to follow motion as some would hope (I knew this buying it but others didn’t). And it is not capable of doing the beta 24/7 recording function I have my other cameras trialing. This may be a feature released for it in the future but currently it isn’t available for this camera only out of my five. Night vision and clarity is improved from my other cameras of previous generations though!

product_name: Introducing Ring Pan-Tilt Indoor Cam | See all around with 360° pan coverage, HD video, plus Two-Way Talk (2024 release) | White
description: It looks like a great camera, but I could not add this cam to my account, as my Samsung Galaxy S7 phones are not compatible with the RING app needed for this “new” camera.  I know I need to update phones, but not ready to do that quite yet. They keep changing/updating the apps for these “security” products to MAKE YOU HAVE TO BUY new technology. After all it’s your SECURITY, so you’ll probably do it.  Noticed the same thing with my Wisenet Pan and Tilt Smart Cams, that I have used for many YEARS and really like. Why can’t they just leave the old apps out there for people that like things the way they are?

product_name: Introducing Ring Pan-Tilt Indoor Cam | See all around with 360° pan coverage, HD video, plus Two-Way Talk (2024 release) | White
description: Nothing like my Ring flood lights. The quality is subpar and volume even on high on the App & my phone is muffled and hard to understand especially when the tv is on.The night vision is very grainy. I found turning on a light helpsEasy to hookup & tilt works well

product_name: Introducing Ring Pan-Tilt Indoor Cam | See all around with 360° pan coverage, HD video, plus Two-Way Talk (2024 release) | White
description: Product works great I think. Does it matter how well the product works if you cannot administrate the app?The app would not accept my credentials on my I phone, but did on my laptop.

product_name: Introducing Ring Pan-Tilt Indoor Cam | See all around with 360° pan coverage, HD video, plus Two-Way Talk (2024 release) | White
description: Good camera, good picture and easy to set up and view.Unfortunately the piece I need to attach mine to the wall was not included, so that sucks.Overall a good camera for indoors.

product_name: Introducing Ring Pan-Tilt Indoor Cam | See all around with 360° pan coverage, HD video, plus Two-Way Talk (2024 release) | White
description: It doesn’t say in the ad that you must have a subscription I wanted it just to keep a watch on my dogs when out. Not great can tip itself over

product_name: Introducing Ring Pan-Tilt Indoor Cam | See all around with 360° pan coverage, HD video, plus Two-Way Talk (2024 release) | White
description: Image is so small. Cord isn’t long enoughMy Arlo camera has better images.

product_name: Introducing Ring Pan-Tilt Indoor Cam | See all around with 360° pan coverage, HD video, plus Two-Way Talk (2024 release) | White
description: Simple things like setting home or away are behind a paywall for the service. It’s annoying but it’s only $50 a year so not terrible. Still some may not want to pay for it.

product_name: Introducing Ring Pan-Tilt Indoor Cam | See all around with 360° pan coverage, HD video, plus Two-Way Talk (2024 release) | White
description: I love all my Ring cameras, but this one disappoints.  It does not capture and record as well as my older, simpler versions.  I could be doing something wrong, but I currently do not recommend it

product_name: Introducing Ring Pan-Tilt Indoor Cam | See all around with 360° pan coverage, HD video, plus Two-Way Talk (2024 release) | White
description: Always used Ring - so nice to have a single app for all your cameras and doorbells!  This is the first P/T camera we have.  As usual, very easy to set up, worked right out of the box and was added to our Ring app without issue.  Control the pan and tilt using the same app - no additional efforts or downloads were required!  Worked great, just like it should!  Very pleased with this camera.

product_name: Introducing Ring Pan-Tilt Indoor Cam | See all around with 360° pan coverage, HD video, plus Two-Way Talk (2024 release) | White
description: This is a review of the Ring Pan-Tilt Indoor Camera. Overall, I give it 5.0 out of 5.0 stars. This is an initial review as the camera was set up not long ago.Likes:1. Quality camera resolution. Of course this can be dependent on your internet speed as it is connected via WiFi.2. Night vision works great.3. Motion detection works great and is highly adjustable for range and sensitivity.4. Alerts of any motion is great and can be adjusted to your preferences.5. App for remote viewing is good and easy to use basic stuff. Some adjustments when you have it integrated to the Ring Alarm can get more complicated.6. Audio receive and transmit is great.7. The Pan and Tilt features are such an advantage over the old models. Now you can swivel side-to-side, up-and-down from the app in your phone or tablet. Plus, after viewing is done, the camera will reset to the default position, which I really like. If you want a more permanent adjustment, just physically adjust the camera.8. A little more weight to the camera versus the older models that were too lightweight. If I bumped the cord of the old ones, it would jostle the position and angle of view. The bew model minimizes this with a little more heft, which will keep it stable when it Pan-Tilts.Dislike:- None so far for this camera. I do have some complaints for may aging Ring system. Sometimes I felt that when you get an alert and try to view the alert (never tried with this specific camera yet), it would be delayed before you can get a live feed. By the time you see anything, the person could be long gone. Then when you go to review the footage, it takes long to load.Overall, this Ring Pan-Tilt Indoor Camera has been great initially, 5.0 out of 5.0 stars. We shall see in the long-term. The old ones are still working great, but how will the pan-tilt motors hold up?

product_name: Introducing Ring Pan-Tilt Indoor Cam | See all around with 360° pan coverage, HD video, plus Two-Way Talk (2024 release) | White
description: Really like the good video resolution, dynamic control to pan the camera all around and was of installation.  Works very well!  Motion detection works well with zone control and linking to the other ring devices is really nice to ensure maximum capture of important video.  Easy to connect via wifi.  Plugs in so no battery limitations, and the streaming is smooth!

product_name: Introducing Ring Pan-Tilt Indoor Cam | See all around with 360° pan coverage, HD video, plus Two-Way Talk (2024 release) | White
description: I already have Ring doorbells so setup was simple.  Scan the barcode in the printed instructions.  Follow a few steps and your done.Since the camera can pan and tilt allow enough room around the camera for this.  Otherwise it can literally push itself off your shelf.Optically it’s outstanding.  Clear, wide angle images.Integration with existing Ron’s devices is great.  Everything sets up in a similar manner. Alerts, zones, and such are the same.I have Amazon video devices and the integration (skill) was already there.

product_name: Introducing Ring Pan-Tilt Indoor Cam | See all around with 360° pan coverage, HD video, plus Two-Way Talk (2024 release) | White
description: No hardcopy of a manual with instructions on how to set it up.  Instead, just download the ring app, scan the barcode that comes with the camera and boom.  You're done!  The Ring app gives you step by step instructions on how to set it up.  It only took me 2 minutes.  I placed my camera where I wanted it to be, paired it to my home network, calibrated it and it was up from there.  No issues!  I use all Ring products in my home and as always everything I purchase never disappoints.  This indoor camera gets the job done.  The daytime video and night time vision works perfectly.  Both has a clear video.  I got the pan-tilt version and I love it and it's function.  The only downside to me is the subscription.  I pay for the basic annual plan at $49.99.  It covers only 1 ring video door bell.  To get coverage for my indoor camera costs me an additional $50.00.  So, I had to upgrade my plan to cover the indoor camera as well (hence the (4 stars).  I feel like the basic plan should cover at least cover 1 Ring video doorbell and 1 indoor video camera.  It just doesn't make sense to me that their packages are set up that way.

product_name: Introducing Ring Pan-Tilt Indoor Cam | See all around with 360° pan coverage, HD video, plus Two-Way Talk (2024 release) | White
description: I got this camera so I could watch my animals at home when I was gone. It works great to pick up motion detected. The sound quality is good. Records very nice. It’s a great value for the money. The picture clarity is awesome with it. It moves up and down and side to side very smoothly. My cat already knows the sound of it when I start moving it and walks over to the camera and Looks at the camera.

product_name: Introducing Ring Pan-Tilt Indoor Cam | See all around with 360° pan coverage, HD video, plus Two-Way Talk (2024 release) | White
description: Very good quality and flexibility to view our whole garage.  No need to record.  Just easy to see what is happening.

product_name: Introducing Ring Pan-Tilt Indoor Cam | See all around with 360° pan coverage, HD video, plus Two-Way Talk (2024 release) | White
description: Our family has been using Ring Protect for sometime.  For the most part the ring app has always worked as designed. I have been waiting a while for them to come up with a pan-capable camera. It is functional, but aesthetically lacking.Pros:- pans smoothly and quietly- home position lock. After live viewing the cam and panning around to see the room; once you exit the live view the Ring Cam was adjust back to the default viewing position you choose during setup.- low light color (image1) and night vision (image2) are clear- built in privacy cover, that once slid to lock position, turns off video and audio- install was a breeze; go to your ring add, add new device, scan the QR code and follow instructions. Was probably the smoothest install of a Ring device for me as of yet.Cons:- the build of the device is kind of bulky. It is clear the decided to add to an existing design instead of creating an entirely new one. This cam looks like the engineers just stuck an indoor cam on an additional base that had the pan and tilt function.- would be nice if Ring started making more higher definition cameras, as this one is still 1080pOverall, I am pleased to add this to our home security collection. I will update with any further developments!Update:- I hope the developer's are listening and will add this via software update in the future. But, a huge selling point would be motion tracking after detected. If the subject walks out of view of the positioned cam, the only way to follow would be LIVE VIEW and manually. Not a deal breaker for our needs, but a more than worthy function that should be included.

product_name: Introducing Ring Pan-Tilt Indoor Cam | See all around with 360° pan coverage, HD video, plus Two-Way Talk (2024 release) | White
description: I have the regular non-tilting Ring cameras and the tilt cameras. I find these tilt cams to be the better of the two not just because they tilt and turn, but because the base is weighed. On the regular indoor cams I have to make weighed bases for them to make sure they are stable on flat surfaces. Without the weighted base the stiffness of the power cord or having the power cord touched can effect the placement and direction of the camera view. While making the bases isn't hard, it does take some time and efffort.The tilt cams have nicely weighed bases and they give you the ability to change the view of camera. They sit much more firmly on a flat surface than the non-tilt cameras. They operate silently too. The tilt cam is about an inch taller than the non-tilt cam, but when I add a weighted base to a non-tilt cam the difference is less than half an inch. The additional $20 for the tilt cam is money well spent.The tilt camera has a couple of features that need improvement. The first is that when the camera is started or reset it spins and tilts back and forth. This exercise means that the camera has to be set where it has plenty of room or the tilting back and forth will knock it over.  You're not going to be able to tuck this in a tight place on a shelf. The other feature, that is on all Ring indoor cams, is that there is no way to turn off the little blue light indiciating that the camera is recording. I understand why Ring does this, but if you don't want the feature you'll need to place a small piece of electrical tape over the blue indicator light.I like these tilt cameras and if I need a new Indoor Cam I will only buy the tilt version. Unless you are trying to tuck the camera in a tight space or maybe plan to wall mount it the $20 extra for the tilt cam is a worth it.

product_name: Introducing Ring Pan-Tilt Indoor Cam | See all around with 360° pan coverage, HD video, plus Two-Way Talk (2024 release) | White
description: I bought this new video camera to allow full coverage of my home’s entrances. I already had a Ring camera that covers the living room and front door. This one covers my dining and kitchen areas and the doors that exit from them. By using the pan and tilt features, it also allows me to see some of the “hidey holes” where my dog frequently goes when he’s home alone. For its fundamental purpose, to cover the doors from the dining room and kitchen, I’m not disappointed.But I have learned that using my phone to pan and tilt the camera is a little problematic. When both are on the same WiFi at home, the screen controls immediately move the camera. But when I’m away, so that my phone is either on a cell service or another’s WiFi, there’s a very definite lag before the camera starts to move, and another lag when I try to stop its movement. This isn’t horrible, but it’s a little disappointing, hence the 4 stars.On the positive side, it (like my other Ring devices) was extraordinarily easy to set up. It takes no skills at all—just follow the Ring app’s very brief instructions to add a device, and within moments, it’s up and working.

product_name: [Sound by JBL & Built-in Battery] Yaber T2 Outdoor Projector with WiFi 6 and Bluetooth, Native 1080P Smart Movie Portable Projector for Inside and Outside, Compatible with TV Dongle (Not included)
description: Do not recommend. Pay attention to the fine print. There’s no way to stream anything on this without a Roku or other tv toggle. Spend your money on something with the streaming apps built in.

product_name: [Sound by JBL & Built-in Battery] Yaber T2 Outdoor Projector with WiFi 6 and Bluetooth, Native 1080P Smart Movie Portable Projector for Inside and Outside, Compatible with TV Dongle (Not included)
description: We have movie nights on our back patio with friends in the summer. This was a replacement for a short throw projector that just did not live up to its promise. I had hoped this one would do a good job for a summer movie night. Overall sound was good and brightness after dark was good, not excellent but good. The big issue was not matter what we tried, the auto keystone and auto focus would not work. We kept getting error messages and finally had to resort to turning auto functions off and just using the manual off the remote. We had updated the firmware, including for the MCU but that did not help. Sadly, this one is missing the mark after demonstrating such promise in its online description. Also, good luck trying to get the Yaber hdmi dongle without ordering the T2+ model. I kept getting messages that the dongle was going to be available but have yet to see it for sale as an accessory to the T2.

product_name: [Sound by JBL & Built-in Battery] Yaber T2 Outdoor Projector with WiFi 6 and Bluetooth, Native 1080P Smart Movie Portable Projector for Inside and Outside, Compatible with TV Dongle (Not included)
description: Struggling to download movies for use when out of WiFi range. Bought for camping and now unable to play downloaded content.

product_name: [Sound by JBL & Built-in Battery] Yaber T2 Outdoor Projector with WiFi 6 and Bluetooth, Native 1080P Smart Movie Portable Projector for Inside and Outside, Compatible with TV Dongle (Not included)
description: Nonostante abbia testato parecchi proiettori, questo è risultato quello più bislacco in assoluto. Ha sicuramente un buon impatto visivo, un'estetica gradevole, colori e materiali moderni, un peso notevole a causa del pacco batterie all' interno, una buona stabilità nella base e una luce mediamente intensa.---Ha una proiezione sul piano orizzontale, di conseguenza va collocato ad una certa altezza da terra per sfruttare il telo o la parete a noi frontale. Ha il sistema di fuoco automatico,sebbene impieghi un bel po' di secondi: se notiamo qualche sfocatura,possiamo agire con il telecomando e migliorare l'asse ottico ancora di più. Copre distanze superiori ad 1 metro, altrimenti non focalizza bene.---Diciamo che ho perso un po' di tempo per trovare la lingua (è arrivato con caratteri cinesi). Mentre lo collegavo alla Rete Wifi, per ben 4 volte ho dovuto inserire la password, perchè ogni tot minuti la perdeva. Mi son reso conto che è privo di sistema operativo e non può navigare in Internet. Ho provato a connetterlo con lo Smartphone tramite Miracast Android, in quanto vi era specificato in una schermata che potesse farlo, ma niente, non ci si connette proprio. Ho dovuto scaricare quindi una APP che si chiama Yaber ,ma nonostante telefono e proiettore fossero collegati al medesimo modem non sono riuscito ad andare in condivisione schermo. Per cui non ho potuto testarlo con immagini, musica, video in definizione 4K e via dicendo, nemmeno sul web ho potuto navigare,niente. In pratica funziona solo con una prolunga HDMI fornita in dotazione, operando da semplice monitor a parete, e nemmeno a soffitto, in quanto se è coricato non può smaltire il forte calore che proviene dalla ventola sottostante.---Il telecomando poi non ne parliamo: su 5 cliccate una la perde. Come se il sistema si bloccasse di tanto in tanto, per poi riprendere vita.---La cosa più stramba è anche la maniglia, che collocata sotto per rialzarlo leggermente dal piano orizzontale fa si che lo schermo sia obliquo verso destra, per cui è necessario inserire anche dei cartoncini per ispessire la maniglia sotto e raddrizzare l'immagine. Un'assurdità.---Se viene spostato due millimetri, il sistema mi richiede di correggere immediatamente il trapezio, il fuoco, etc., etc., e questi 'warning' diventano una palla al piede.---In linea di massima, nonostante abbiano sfruttato la sezione audio JBL , non è che vi sia chissà quale effetto impattante, non è che con due altoparlantini da pochi cm. ci si possa realizzare un concerto all'aperto. E' comodo in quanto portatile, attualmente è in offerta a 330euro, ma sinceramente non saprei bene se consigliarlo in quanto ha pregi & difetti che si mescolano tra loro.

product_name: [Sound by JBL & Built-in Battery] Yaber T2 Outdoor Projector with WiFi 6 and Bluetooth, Native 1080P Smart Movie Portable Projector for Inside and Outside, Compatible with TV Dongle (Not included)
description: This is a review for the Yaber T2 Outdoor Projector.  This is the first such projector I have ever owned so I have nothing to compare it to.  I felt the instructions could have used some improvement.  There is a full manual online but again I think it fell short.  In the end, I just had to plug it in and play with it.  Initially I had a problem setting it up because I couldn’t get it to connect to wifi.  It said "connecting" and then just stayed on that screen.  I wasn’t sure if it was doing something like updating in the background but  eventually I gave up and cancelled it.  When I went back later to try again, it said my wifi signal was “not good”.  I was in the room the furthest away from my router but other devices have no issue connecting there and were connected when I was trying to get the projector to connect.  You need to connect to wifi to update the firmware which is recommended when you first get it.  When I moved to the same room as my router, it said my signal was “good” and I was able to do the updates.  Note the projector did not prompt me to update it, I had to go into settings and find it.  When it finished updating, it just shut off.  Initially I wasn’t sure if that was part of the process but when it didn’t come back on after waiting, I realized it wasn’t.When I tried to use NFC to connect to my phone, my phone kept prompting me to go to the Play Store and download the Yaber app which I didn’t want to do.  Eventually I downloaded and installed the app but I still couldn’t get NFC to work as it was still prompting me to download the app.  I was able to screen mirror with the app and I was able to connect a Chromecast with Google TV via HDMI and play video.  The picture looked very clear.  The project auto focuses and that generally worked really well though one time when I turned it on, it was slow to focus and I couldn't read the screen.  Sound was good but watching a movie it seemed odd that it was coming from the projector and not from speakers near the screen.  Of course that would be the case with any projector and something to get used to.  The sound was better when I changed it to movie setting. There are three sound modes.The projector felt a little heavy to me for a portable projector but I guess that has to do with having a battery.  It has a carry handle which is nice.  The handle also doubles as a stand which is convenient.  It says it runs for 2.5 hrs on battery but I haven’t had a chance to try that out yet.  The power cord that comes with isn’t that long so that could be useful and not just outdoors.  I do like that you can connect to it multiple ways including HDMI, USB, NFC and wifi though NFC didn’t work properly for me.  It comes with an HDMI cable.  It has a remote control to operate it but it isn’t always responsive and I found at times have to hit a button multiple times.Overall,  I liked the projector once I got it working but it was a little frustrating getting there and I still haven't figured out the NFC issue.

product_name: [Sound by JBL & Built-in Battery] Yaber T2 Outdoor Projector with WiFi 6 and Bluetooth, Native 1080P Smart Movie Portable Projector for Inside and Outside, Compatible with TV Dongle (Not included)
description: El proyector Yaber T2 ha sido muy bien recibido por sus características portátiles, sonido JBL de alta calidad y una resolución máxima de 1080p. Sin embargo, cuando analizamos el contraste y el rendimiento en exteriores, especialmente en condiciones diurnas, se presentan algunos desafíos.Contraste y calidad de imagen: El proyector cuenta con 450 lúmenes ANSI, lo que proporciona imágenes nítidas y vibrantes en ambientes oscuros o con poca luz pero por lo que en interiores o durante la noche, el proyector rinde notablemente bien, proyectando una imagen clara y con colores vivos. Sin embargo, su desempeño disminuye cuando se usa en exteriores durante el día. Uno de los puntos que destacan es que, al funcionar con batería, el brillo se reduce para ahorrar energía, lo que afecta aún más la calidad de la proyección en ambientes con luz natural.Para aprovechar al máximo este proyector en exteriores, es mejor usarlo al atardecer o en la noche, cuando la falta de luz ambiental no interfiere con la proyección. Durante el día, incluso con sombras o bajo techados, la luminosidad podría no ser suficiente para garantizar una experiencia óptima.Rendimiento en exteriores: Un aspecto que se destaca en varias reseñas es su portabilidad y la duración de su batería, que lo hace ideal para llevar al exterior y disfrutar de películas o videojuegos en una pantalla grande. Sin embargo, al usarlo fuera, la visibilidad dependerá en gran medida de las condiciones lumínicas. Por lo tanto, aunque es un excelente compañero para actividades al aire libre como campings o reuniones en el jardín, su uso está más limitado a horas sin luz solar directa.Si bien este proyector es excepcional en términos de sonido, portabilidad y facilidad de uso, su capacidad de proyección durante el día es su principal limitación. Con un rendimiento óptimo en situaciones de baja luz, es ideal para proyecciones nocturnas, donde el contraste y los colores realmente destacan. Durante el día o con luz ambiental, su desempeño se ve comprometido, por lo que no es la mejor opción si lo que se busca es una proyección clara en exteriores en plena luz del día.Sobre la conectividad, puedo decir que va bien provisto:Conexiones físicas:HDMI: Incluye un puerto HDMI compatible con ARC (Audio Return Channel) y CEC, lo que permite una conexión fácil con otros dispositivos como consolas de videojuegos, reproductores Blu-ray, ordenadores y decodificadores de TV, etcUSB: Puedes conectar pendrives y otros dispositivos USB para reproducir contenido multimedia directamente desde el proyector. Soporta sistemas de archivos FAT32 y NTFS, aunque no reconoce exFAT.Puerto LAN (RJ45): Para conexiones de red por cable, ideal si prefieres una conexión más estable que el WiFi.Salida de audio: Te permite conectar sistemas de sonido externos si necesitas más potencia de audio o deseas usar altavoces externos en lugar de los incorporados, aún que no veo que haga falta, porque suena muy bienConectividad inalámbrica:WiFi 6: El proyector admite WiFi 6, lo que le da una ventaja en cuanto a velocidad y estabilidad de conexión para transmitir contenido desde tu red doméstica o desde plataformas de streaming (siempre que esté conectado a un dispositivo externo con esta capacidad).Bluetooth: Permite utilizar el proyector como un altavoz Bluetooth independiente, conectando tu smartphone o cualquier dispositivo de audio. También puedes conectar auriculares o altavoces Bluetooth para mejorar la experiencia auditiva.NFC: Esta tecnología simplifica la conexión con dispositivos compatibles. Solo tienes que tocar tu teléfono en la parte superior del proyector para emparejarlo rápidamente y comenzar a proyectar o transmitir contenido desde el móvil.Vamos, que por conectividad va genial, lástima que no tenga más potencia, porque de lumens va un poco justo.

product_name: [Sound by JBL & Built-in Battery] Yaber T2 Outdoor Projector with WiFi 6 and Bluetooth, Native 1080P Smart Movie Portable Projector for Inside and Outside, Compatible with TV Dongle (Not included)
[Sound by JBL & Built-in Battery] Yaber T2 Outdoor Projector with WiFi 6 and Bluetooth, Native 1080P Smart Movie Portable Projector for Inside and Outside, Compatible with TV Dongle (Not included)
description: It will not turn on or charge.

product_name: [Sound by JBL & Built-in Battery] Yaber T2 Outdoor Projector with WiFi 6 and Bluetooth, Native 1080P Smart Movie Portable Projector for Inside and Outside, Compatible with TV Dongle (Not included)
description: [Audio de J y Batería Integrada] Proyector Exterior Y T2 con WiFi 6 y Bluetooth, Proyector Portátil Inteligente 1080P para Cine en Casa, Compatible con Dongle TV (no Incluido) (Smile Face).Tras 1 mes entero de uso tengo varias cosas que decir sobre este proyector.La calidad del audio es excelente. Se nota que entra en juego la marca líder JBL.La calidad de video también es buena, pero solo con total oscuridad. Con luz en el ambiente noto que le falta fuerza a la lámpara. A un precio de 399.99€ a la hora de solicitarlo esperaba más en cuanto a la potencia de la lámpara. Además cuando la película es oscura la imagen empeora bastante.Los puntos positivos son (aparte de los altavoces):-el diseño con asa, que puedes bajar para usarlo de soporte y elevar la imagen.-El enfoque automático y la corrección trapezoidal, que en mi caso he notado que solo funciona bien cuando la pantalla donde quieres proyectar la imagen contrasta mucho con el fondo, sino le cuesta cuadrar la imagen.-No tener que preocuparme por que entre polvo al interior de la lente, porque va sellado. (A los anteriores les ponía una funda cuando  no los usaba).Los puntos negativos.-Me costó mucho conectarlo al wifi la 1a vez. Indican que hay que actualizar el software nada más estrenarlo y para ello hay que conectarlo a internet. Tuve que reiniciarlo de fábrica estando conectado por ethernet y ahí sí salió una pantalla de "system is updating", y después ya me dejó conectar el wifi.-Necesidad de mucha oscuridad para disfrutar de la imagen al 100% (a menos que la película sea oscura).-La batería, aunque en principio es un plus, al reducir la intensidad de la luz no anima nada a usarla. Es preferible tirar de cable. Además solo da para ver una peli de hora y media aprox, si se alarga te puedes quedar sin ver el final.-En la descripción se promociona un stick-dongle que no va incluido, cuando por el precio que tiene considero que debería venir integrado.En resumen. Es un buen proyector para usar en oscuridad. Disfrutarás de la peli, sobre todo por el audio, pero lo encuentro muy caro en comparación con otros con la misma calidad de imagen.

product_name: [Sound by JBL & Built-in Battery] Yaber T2 Outdoor Projector with WiFi 6 and Bluetooth, Native 1080P Smart Movie Portable Projector for Inside and Outside, Compatible with TV Dongle (Not included)
description: I tested this device hard because I want to like it more than I do.The image quality of the projector is really good. I love the autofocus and auto keystone correction.The battery is good too.However, it's heavier than I expected and not really all that portable.The WiFi won't connect to a WPA3 encrypted WiFi signal and I'm not lowering my home network defences for a projector, so I couldn't connect via WiFi.Then, the sound quality really lets this device down. The bass response is poor for such a large speaker. Sure, it has volume, but even that distorts at high levels, and the bass is underwhelming.I'm afraid I have to rate this a 2-star, and conclude that it's not great value for money.

product_name: [Sound by JBL & Built-in Battery] Yaber T2 Outdoor Projector with WiFi 6 and Bluetooth, Native 1080P Smart Movie Portable Projector for Inside and Outside, Compatible with TV Dongle (Not included)
description: We’ve now tried 4 projectors for our outdoor patio to include a “nicer” Yaber. This is very easy to setup and a big bonus the sound is good and it’s portable. It seems to be of better quality than the 2 off branded ones we got, and because it’s smaller than the V12 it also feels more sturdy. We connected a fire stick for ease of use and it’s working for us flawlessly. Haven’t tried the NFC connection yet but we’re hopeful. The value of quality to cost we think this takes the cake.

product_name: [Sound by JBL & Built-in Battery] Yaber T2 Outdoor Projector with WiFi 6 and Bluetooth, Native 1080P Smart Movie Portable Projector for Inside and Outside, Compatible with TV Dongle (Not included)
description: We bought this for a vegas trip. Works great inside the hotel room. Loud speaker with clear picture. You will need to purchase the dongle to access Netflix for a additional $50. For the price you can't beat it

product_name: [Sound by JBL & Built-in Battery] Yaber T2 Outdoor Projector with WiFi 6 and Bluetooth, Native 1080P Smart Movie Portable Projector for Inside and Outside, Compatible with TV Dongle (Not included)
description: (Indoor) Rating: ★★★★☆ (4.5/5)Pros: • Very user-friendly and quick to set up • Excellent lighting and sound quality • Reliable auto-focus - quick & easy • Highly portable & versatile • Quiet fan operation, making it unobtrusive • Simple screen-sharing featureCons: • Focus is limited to within 10 feet; a manual focus option would be a great addition • The projector size adjustment only works when using USB • Color grading options don’t seem to have any noticeable effect • Only one HDMI port availableOverall, this projector is a solid choice with great features for indoor use. With just a few improvements, it could be even better.

product_name: [Sound by JBL & Built-in Battery] Yaber T2 Outdoor Projector with WiFi 6 and Bluetooth, Native 1080P Smart Movie Portable Projector for Inside and Outside, Compatible with TV Dongle (Not included)
description: Good picture. Sound is pretty good but I usually hook up my Bluetooth speaker.

product_name: [Sound by JBL & Built-in Battery] Yaber T2 Outdoor Projector with WiFi 6 and Bluetooth, Native 1080P Smart Movie Portable Projector for Inside and Outside, Compatible with TV Dongle (Not included)
description: I went with this projector for the portability so I can use it for camping and in the backyard for NY Giants games. Tested it out in the house, seems great

product_name: [Sound by JBL & Built-in Battery] Yaber T2 Outdoor Projector with WiFi 6 and Bluetooth, Native 1080P Smart Movie Portable Projector for Inside and Outside, Compatible with TV Dongle (Not included)
description: Says Fan abnormal, shutting down and then shuts down every time and does not work.UPDATE: Yaber reached out and made things right, there customer service is fantastic.

product_name: [Sound by JBL & Built-in Battery] Yaber T2 Outdoor Projector with WiFi 6 and Bluetooth, Native 1080P Smart Movie Portable Projector for Inside and Outside, Compatible with TV Dongle (Not included)
description: I've reviewed quite a few projectors lately, and have owned many. I absolutely love watching movies or tv shows on a huge screen and my TV's seldom get used these days. When I had the chance to order and review the Yaber T2 Outdoor Projector I jumped at the chance.There are three main things you look for in a projector, the projected image (size, resolution, sharpness, color, brightness), Connectivity (Wifi, Bluetooth, manual ports) and the build quality. Obviously price is an important variable too and that can affect the priorities of the aforementioned attributes!The Yaber (who came up with that brand name, seriously...) ticks a lot of boxes. The native resolution, whilst not being 4k is full HD at 1080p. I find the image to be pretty good when viewing 1080p content. Absolutely no issues there for me. Brightness nets out at just 450 lumens which is on the low side. You 100% will not be using this during the day or even at sunset. This is a night time projector! The model I have features WiFi 6 and Bluetooth, but has no operating system so to speak. I have added a Fire stick to cover all apps and it's been perfect, just need to consider how you power the stick and have a stable wifi connection outside. There is a matching Google dongle from Yaber sold separately but I haven't looked into that. Another alternative is to stream directly from your phone or tablet wirelessly or via USB cable. I have not tried that yet.Audio wise, this thing has JBL speakers and they are great! Dolby audio is onboard to help pick up and define the sounds. Power wise this is 16 watts in total for the inbuilt speaker. I really enjoy the sound given how small the unit is. It's not the loudest but if you are outside with not a lot of noise in the background you will need no external speaker (unless you really want to amp it up).The big selling point for this is the battery inside! I wanted this for a 4th July BBQ with friends. We have a patio with a large white wall and I thought it would be cool for everyone to watch sports and a movie outside at night, which we did and everyone was super impressed with this projector. The battery is advertised to last 2 and a half hours. In reality we got to the end of a 90 minute movie and we had to plug it in. There was a little juice left so i'd like to say you could probably get a 2 hour movie on the battery or 2 tv shows.The build quality is very good and it feels reliably well made. There is apparently a 3 year repair warranty and 6 month returns. That seems a little too good to believe but could also be an indicator of how reliable these machines are.Given the sub $400 price tag, this is a great option for outdoor viewing and I can highly recommend this.

product_name: [Sound by JBL & Built-in Battery] Yaber T2 Outdoor Projector with WiFi 6 and Bluetooth, Native 1080P Smart Movie Portable Projector for Inside and Outside, Compatible with TV Dongle (Not included)
description: I was impressed with the picture quality and the volume of sound.  Portable, slick design.  A must buy.

product_name: [Sound by JBL & Built-in Battery] Yaber T2 Outdoor Projector with WiFi 6 and Bluetooth, Native 1080P Smart Movie Portable Projector for Inside and Outside, Compatible with TV Dongle (Not included)
description: I have reviewed several projectors, and every time there is something wrong or missing that I notice in the projector. However, this projector has nearly everything I like about a projector: it has a great compact build, is very attractive and highly functional, has full HD resolution, great brightness, good image quality, WiFi and Bluetooth connectivity, great compatibility with different OS, and great JBL speakers. What more could I need? It also has a good battery that lasts around 2 hours, which is perfect. The build quality seems sturdy and reliable, and it has great software that updates when needed. I appreciate the handle and stand feature, as it is very helpful. The only thing missing here is the buttons on the projector's body, so if there is no remote, this means you can't fully control it easily. However, it's still a great option for outdoor activities. Highly recommended!

product_name: [Sound by JBL & Built-in Battery] Yaber T2 Outdoor Projector with WiFi 6 and Bluetooth, Native 1080P Smart Movie Portable Projector for Inside and Outside, Compatible with TV Dongle (Not included)
description: Awesome projector. This is a great outdoor projector and it works really well. The built in speakers are unbelievable loud. Excellent sound quality. Wifi feature works well. I was easily able to set this projector up. I was able to get on my streaming app and stream movies to the projector. Excellent video quality. Picture is clear and bright. I really like the design. It's made well, nice and durable with a carry handle on top.

product_name: 15FT Flat Extension Cord, Flat Plug Power Strip with USB C, Ultra Thin Flat Plug Extension Cord - 6 Outlets with 4 USB Ports(2 USB C Outlet), No Surge Protector for Dorm Room Travel Essentials
