It was a secret undocumented thing, or the old update re-installed (why??). Perhaps it was not a Fire OS update but an update of some other built-in component (like the Apstore, or some such thing). The Appstore still seems hung on the page where I update apps. The other parts of it work. It is an issue with the app, because F-Droid can install and update just fine. And my new Fire 10 also works fine, so it is not the server for the Appstore. I'm now thinking it got a corrupted (interrupted?) update and won't work until Amazon has a newer update that I can install on top of it.Amazon, if you are listening: please please be normal about updates. Let your users know there is an update and let them pick when to do the update. If control-freak Apple can do this, you can, too. I do not want to be using my device while it is trying to update (or shutting it down to remove a corrupted card...). That's just asking for trouble. I want to have it plugged in and keep my hands off it for a while. This is a problem with other Amazon devices as well. Okay, you're gonna force an update whether I like it or not, but please, if you don't want to cause a lot of grief, just let people have some control (and awareness!!!!!) when the device needs to be updated. My guess is that even when there is only a minor update (as seems to have been the case for me), the Kindle is not fully functional but pretends to be, and since it is not fully functional (it quits some processes), some unexpected quits will cause corruptions/crashes/SD card issues.....But otherwise it is a good device. Truly. I'm still happy to have it. I love the whale background :-)Initial Review:I got the productivity bundle and I am super pleased. I needed something to take notes with in classes, that also had a touch screen for drawing, and this is great for that. (Amazon Appstore has OneNote and Squid and both are great for notes with this.) In my experience it DOES matter which app you use with the pen because a paint app I tried worked but was slow (so I blame the app, since OneNote and Squid are fine). There is also a fairly new open source app called Saber that seems great (I still need to experiment with that one -- available on F-Droid). I'm thinking that some of the professional reviews (on other web sites) got an early or different version of the pen because the harsh criticisms of it do not match my experience. It works great.This is my 2nd Fire tablet, and I like it so much better than my first one, Fire 8 HD from 2017. I wasn't unhappy with the old tablet when I got it (because I got it on sale for a great price) but I just almost never used it because the screen was so unpleasant and stressful to look at, plus the device was annoyingly slow. Not so with this new tablet -- I am very pleased with the screen quality, and the speed is good for how I'm using it.The pen and keyboard are truly awesome. I wasn't sure at first whether I liked the aspect ratio/shape of the tablet but actually it makes sense. The longer shape allows for nearly full-sized key spacing on the keyboard while not causing the tablet to be unnecessarily large and heavy, as it would be with the iPad's aspect ratio. Someone said they prefer the snap-in clamshell keyboard that is available for the 10, but I much prefer this thin-and-light keyboard (didn't have the 10 but considered it and looked at pics of its keyboard). It is super easy and fast to pull off and snap on the keyboard and it does not need batteries. At home (where I have "real" laptops) I use the tablet mostly without the keyboard, and half of the keyboard case stays on it, protecting the back and the camera, and giving the tablet a nice non-slip feel, plus I can use the fold-out stand. I don't use it on my lap at school, and at home I use a lap desk so I don't mind that I can't put it directly in my lap while typing. Really, I have no complaints at all about this setup. Perfect.Well, maybe I can complain a little about Fire OS but it is mostly okay. I would hate it for a phone but it is fine for a tablet. And it is much improved over what I had on my old Fire, especially the settings (I like to have control and info). I put Google Play on my previous Fire but I'm not sure I will do so on this one. I mean I have an Android phone that has things I'd like from the Play store, like my calculator collection and bank apps and whatnot. I don't need to replicate that on this tablet. I've installed F-Droid so I can still easily put a bunch of nice apps on it. I have a Linux terminal app (Termux) and will probably install a small Linux distro with desktop which will further expand the usability. Plus I have a Microsoft 360 subscription from work and it is nice to have an app for that on this tablet too. It has the most critical work apps like Zoom and Teams and Office and Outlook. So it already has what I really need on a tablet. Oh, and Kindle, of course. I think in the past it was almost necessary to side-load Google Play but the Amazon Appstore now has my most critical apps, at least for a tablet. (Yea, it generally is not great and not well maintained, with tons of outdated apps.) Don't be mad at Amazon about Google Play Store, YouTube, etc. It is a Google policy. Google does not want others to take the open source piece of Android and build their own thing on top of it, with no control from Google. There are penalties for doing that. And Amazon couldn't sell its media to you directly on regular Android, so it kind of has to make a separate OS. This is your tradeoff for getting a subsidized tablet. I'm poor so I will accept the tradeoff, especially for a tablet as nice as this one.I paid to get rid of the ads, and I do that on every Kindle or Fire (I value discounts a lot, but aesthetics even more) and now this tablet is a pleasure to use. And soooo much less expensive than a similar setup would have been from Apple.

product_name: Amazon Fire Max 11 tablet (newest model) vivid 11” display, all-in-one for streaming, reading, and gaming, 14-hour battery life, optional stylus and keyboard, 64 GB, Gray
description: I'm somewhere between 3.5-4 stars.....I am (and fortunately my 12 yo kiddo is) an avid reader. Always have been. I write too, so my main hobby my entire life is reading. Sure, I do love other things, but you will most likely find me if I am awake and not doing anything else? Reading. My reading appetite is voracious as you can imagine and that leads me here. I'm also big into a lot of tech. I was an early adopter of e-readers and ebooks which I scoured irc, libraries, and other places to find ebooks back in ye olden pirate days. Argh. BUT today, things are so much easier. No sailing is required. I even read ahead on series I love and buy the original language ebooks and then translate them into English because today it is so simple to do! And while I read from a great many sources and websites, my kiddo and I read a ton of manga, manhua, and light novels so we hit up Amazon often. Besides getting to directly support the original author (& better publishers), we have a ton of fun swapping novels and reviewing them together. I do own the latest Kindles because one of the Kindle downsides is that you cannot buy content from an iPad or iPhone. Which bites to be honest. I often when traveling if I forgot or didn't want to lug a Kindle have to buy from Google Books or other sites because this is such a pain. I do try to keep up with new releases, but often, the next big book in one of our current 257th favorite series drops and we NEED IT NOW.I own a new huge honking iPad as my main device, and up until now, it has been my favorite to read on. (I have a bit of TED so my eyesight can vary from day to day. Some days I needed extreme readers and the next day just 1.25 is perfect. There's no rhyme or reason but I'm almost through with this the doctors say.) I do love that I can access all my favorite reading sites and spaces via iPad (except for buying Kindle books but I can read Kindle content fine). I can also keep up on my iPad with my favorite Korean and Japanese sites as they update and instantly translate our favorites. (Tech makes reading life good!) If I'm writing, I also use the iPad with a Bluetooth keyboard. My kiddo mainly reads on her iPad mini, but she has her own Kindle too.So what I'm saying is I was not going to buy this. I was like meh, looks nice but, I don't really NEED it. And then my bday came around Black Friday and this made it into my hot little hands. Oh, hello. I thought it was a nice gift but I would probably not keep it because it's really strangely long compared to the iPad. And skinny.BUT let me tell you where it does super well. It is a pleasure to read on. The battery life on this is incredible. I've been sick with walking pneumonia (yay), and have been reading for hours and hours and I'm still at 79% after reading the better part of 12 hours (in between coughing and catnaps here and there)! The battery life is insane. And it just looks lovely, my eyes feel super relaxed without too much adjustment. Manga is very nice on it and nothing looks warped or stretched out. I was worried where I didn't need to be.Now for some books, and I emphasize some, the text/font they chose can be too small for me. If you need big letters some days (or all days) this is not for you. You'll strain. The iPad is much more customizable and utilitarian. No question there. BUT occasionally if I am doing something else and reading on this? If I ask, Alexa will instantly pick up where I left off and read to me. I can get my iPad to do this I suppose, but this level of integration is super nice.I mean you could (or years ago I would have) jailbroke this puppy and made it exactly what it should have been. A real ereader that happened to be capable of other things. The dream of 2005! But now really? Way too much effort and money to get it to basically be like an off-brand iPad-like device from 2005. For most people, this either works because they enjoy reading what they have on it, or they will stick with their iPads.Kiddo and I do a bit of gaming and for that? OML! No. Do not do this. Save yourself! It is super slow. The lag is insane. And it randomly zooms in when it shouldn't and refuses to zoom out. We played Animal Jam just to try it out and it's soooo slow! Same for ebook sites and pages. So slow and too sensitive for taps. This is a one-trick pony and it is Kindle/Amazon. As far as connecting to the internet? No problems. It is just a very slow device. The iPad screams in speed while this slug is barely able to move. I would never trust this for writing (unless I was reading my own writing). It would never keep up with my typing and I don't think my favorite writing apps are even able to run on it.My other real-world problem is there's not a great case for this yet. I'm big into tech protecc. I throw an Otterbox on everything. Once I have everything set up on a device, I don't want to break it and start again. This Max is huge and the glass screen is not going to survive a tumble on my bathroom tile or down the stairs. The one screen saver glass available is too small and did not stay on without massive bubbles. The first silicone case I bought was rubbery junk. The next one I tried was ready and fitted for a keyboard, but I don't want to carry around a keyboard I will rarely use when I have a better Bluetooth one if I need it. The keyboard cases I tried either didn't close well or made this too heavy or too thick to stick into my reader spaces as I read around the house (there are at least two in every room lol). The case I'm using now has a handstrap which is uncomfortable for long hours. The huge honking iPad in an Otterbox case even fits my hand better but battery life? Forget it. The iPad has to be charged off and on all day. This does not only not have to be charged but recharges very fast.Kiddo and I read the same book series yesterday and within an hour she had to plug her mini in. She switched to my new iPad while hers charged and soon that had to be charged too. The Kindle Max was at 83%! So I guess I'm keeping it. I do really enjoy reading on it. So does my kiddo apparently because she keeps borrowing it for manga! She's very nervous about dropping it though so she only reads on it in her bed. I hope there is eventually a good screen protector and case. I have a ton of cases that I tried but all are just terrible that I'm going to now return.SO all in all it's like a C+ to a B- grade. I don't think after all I will gift one to my Mom who is also a big reader because she reads mostly her library ebooks. I think the setup for her outside of directly connecting to her Amazon account will be too much. There are way too many limits between the software and hardware. And she has worse hand arthritis than I do, so I think it will be too uncomfortable for her to hold. She mostly reads on an old iPad. Maybe I'll buy her a new case for that. I would in no way give this to a young kiddo without a very good case. It's bulky and breakable at best.I am also not sure if I would bring this traveling unless there was a good case. Guess I will keep traveling on longer trips with my Kindle Fire 10 since the case is great, it's smaller, and I love that it charges magnetically.It is what it is.

product_name: Amazon Fire Max 11 tablet (newest model) vivid 11” display, all-in-one for streaming, reading, and gaming, 14-hour battery life, optional stylus and keyboard, 64 GB, Gray
description: First off I have two of these, one I set up for my sister and another I have for personal media consumption.I'll start with the cons: no fast charge and I believe this only supports up to 15w charging at max. Lowering the charge time down to about 3.5hrs instead of 4.2, and it ships with a 9w power brick so I recommend using something other than the included brick if you want to knock 30 minutes off charge times.They have a screen protector but they don't provide something like and anti-blue light tempered glass screen protector. The screen is low blue light which is a good thing, but I'm sure consumers would want to generally have the option to additionally add an anti-blue light screen protector anyway ..even better if it's tempered glass for the added protection while retaining visual clarity.There's not too many great cases and the first party one is really pricey. I wish they had also made their own tri-fold smart folio style case as one I got felt like it was designed well but the quality wasn't good. (If they do make a tri-fold case eventually, I hope they make it in more than just three colors and with a tpu backing) or sell the kickstand backing separately from the keyboard.Limited first party apps due to lack of the full android implementation, this also limits the whole productivity portion they're trying to sell to consumers, it does do a handful but don't go expecting this to compare to an ipad or Microsoft surface tablet ..or even a fully Integrated android tablet.For the processor this is pushing, it would've been nice to see this have at least 8gb of RAM, but generally this is competing with the likes of my old Google Pixel 3 XL rather than any full fledged tablets out there. Even then it's only slightly better.And last Amazon either needs to ditch FireOS or update it to a current version of Android, this is still an android tablet running an Amazon skin over it that's about 3 generations behind running android 11. Either Amazon should update it or make a hybrid Operating system that can do both desktop android and tablet, this way programs can be installed to utilize the productivity side of this machine.pros: great screen that runs 2k resolution, colors are nice and vivid with a natural color tone and decent blacks The pixel density at this size means the images are nice and sharp too being squeezed in a smaller form factor. it's not the highest rated HDR but it's far from the worst.The touch screen is pretty responsive with no lag, unless you're playing an extremely graphic heavy game the unit can't handle and you hit deep frame dips where it becomes slow.Speakers aren't too bad, they retain fullness at louder volumes and it does get a decent amount of volume, don't expect it to be loud enough to fill a room though, but the sound chip does it's job well and the Dolby surround is pretty good imo, sounds better through headphones either wireless or wired with a USB-C adapter.Expandable storage! such an ancient yet god tier part of the specs that every piece of tech these days has unfortunately phased out. This tablet supports up to 1TB with a microSD memory card, I hope any future versions keep this feature. I also hope other companies would also go back to using this method of expandable storage.Now as for things I'd like to see in the future if they either plan on updating this version or make future versions.If a revision was made, I'd like to see fast charging, at least 8Gb of RAM with a snapdragon 8 gen 3 mobile chip. I'd also like to see Amazon ditch FireOS and just use the proprietary Android OS or use a hybrid desktop/tablet format, they can just fill it with their bloatware. FireOS just looks really outdated and takes me back to when I had my old 2nd gen fire HD 7" (not a good look). Maybe it'd be nice if the keyboard had backlit keys. For the love of God add google play store (that alone would make any fire tablet sell like crazy, Amazon is really hurting themselves here and it's embarrassing, listen to the userbase and the money will flow).As for accessories, it'd be nice if Amazon made a tempered glass anti-blue light screen protector, the screen already has low blue light, but it'd be nice to also have that option on top of it.As for covers, why doesn't Amazon make a magnetic cover that rotates from portrait/landscape mode? make a trifold rotation case or a smart folio (preferably with a tpu backing)As for the current version, either do an OS overhaul through a firmware update, Get us past android 11 ..or just completely update the system to fully run android. You have no idea how much people would love to have a customizable home screen and widget with the android experience plus Google would regularly cover security updates for the device.Overall: This is a decent tablet, it's not slow but I wouldn't say it's immediately snappy either in some areas, it's best use case is media consumption and some light mobile gaming. The L1 wifi encoding is great for consistent video playback and I almost never get stream buffering which is nice. The app store is abysmal and the OS is outdated and lacking, I hope people who get this are tech savvy enough to find a way to get the full potential out of this. I opted out of an ipad mini 6, although it is more powerful it doesn't have upgradable storage and is about $250 more expensive, hopefully I don't end up with buyers remorse. I went with a 64GB ad free version and added a 512GB microSD (seems overkill but I play some pretty big mobile games that sometimes hit above 25GB with internal updates in total)Edit: my additional complain is read/write speeds with the microSD card. Naturally, native storage will run faster, so those that got the 128gb don't really have this problem until they run out of storage and have to pop in a card, but even with a A2 Level read/write speed apps saved to the microSD feel a little sluggish at times to open. Hopefully one day there's an update to properly support faster read/write speeds for microSD.For those that got the 64gb version like I did. Save your most used apps on the native storage and your less important ones to a microSD, that way your more used apps will load in faster.Thank you for your review.I'd also like to add that this tablet is pretty hefty, it's not really a pro or a con. The heft adds to a premium feel, holding it while reading will cause some fatigue after about 6 minutes. It's about as heavy as an 11 inch lenovo yoga laptop I own ..and that has a keyboard on it.

product_name: Mini Projector, VISSPL Full HD 1080P Video Projector, Portable Outdoor Projector with Tripod, Kids Gift, Home Theater Movie Phone Projector Compatible with Android/iOS/Windows/TV Stick/HDMI/USB
description: TL;DR:(Update:) After some time, this projector’s sound is okay, brightness gets better in the dark and after warming up, tripod is hard to use though. The customer support is excellent and will help you with your issues. Highly recommend investing in the non-mini version as its improvements are BIG.(Original:) Okay for the price point, came with a lot of accessories like cables and stand. Brightness is what you expect, big issue is significant blurring at the edges especially when keystoning.UPDATE:I wanted to add some comments without removing my original review (below) but I’ve had some extra time with this (mini version only, don’t mix with the higher end one) projector and have warmed up to it a little bit, and feel that the sound is good for what the mini costs. The brightness gets better if you let the light source warm up and works especially well in darkness so turn off your lights! The focus on this get better if you’re willing to adjust it so that it’s closer to perpendicular to the wall, but there’s still some fuzziness.Since my original review, the company has reached out and has communicated with me about my shortcomings with the mini version. Their communication was excellent, and will be happy to assist with your concerns. They sent over their higher end version NON-MINI version for me to consider, and I would say it is definitely the better investment in the budget projector space so go for that one if you can! The higher end one addresses pretty much all the issues I’ve had with the MINI. (more that usually goes in a separate review, but the gist is that the higher-end one is brighter, better focus (less fuzzy edges, more features (mirroring without dongles, much easier to use), comes with a cloth screen, all the usual accessories, and seems to have Android as it’s OS which is a plus in my book). For all the reasons in the parentheses, I would say that the worthwhile version is the non-MINI version.ORIGINAL:The product at the price point I got it was okay, and functioned, came packaged well with a good collection of basic accessories, runs at an okay sound level, however that’s all it really has.I’m not expecting much but the few things I found bothersome were with focus on the edges. If you use the projector from slight angles and try to adjust it with the built in adjusters to get the picture back to a rectangular form it makes one or the other edges fuzzy.Just a quick rundown of the other features that I’m neutral about since this is quite a budget projector: sound is just there, colors… not the best but it’s what you can get, connectivity is good, and brightness needs a fully dark room to appreciate.

product_name: Mini Projector, VISSPL Full HD 1080P Video Projector, Portable Outdoor Projector with Tripod, Kids Gift, Home Theater Movie Phone Projector Compatible with Android/iOS/Windows/TV Stick/HDMI/USB
description: I am sorry that I did not take pictures. Here is my best description of the reason I returned it:I don't know what it looks like on the inside, but I assume there are multiple lenses and I think one of these components is warped. When you try to focus the projector (best-case scenario, straight-on, no keystone/tilt) on the midpoint of an image, you notice the left and right edges are blurry, and the corners are worse. The viewport/screen appears to be properly square on all edges, but it looks like the middle of the image has a different optical index from the outer edges & corners. You try to optimize for average overall focus rather than a point, but then either the top-left or bottom-right corner can be in focus, but not both. Almost like there is a curve on a diagonal on some component inside.As for other issues, which were not the reason for my return (because you get what you pay for):Color is terrible. But, who cares (again, $50).The remote is wiggly. You can deform the thin plastic shell with no effort whatsoever. The buttons are clicky and feel nice to press. I like this remote.The buttons on the top of the unit are... nearly adequate. Best use the funny remote.I like the wall wart power supply, but that is subjective.Included HDMI cable is short, and super cheap.The threaded mount on the underside of the unit protrudes slightly, making it incompatible with some tripod mounts.Also, I really like how smol it is. Very smol. It fits in a backpack nicely.If it weren't for the impossibility of focusing the thing, I would have kept it.Why do I need to peel the serial number off the bottom to clean inside lol

product_name: Mini Projector, VISSPL Full HD 1080P Video Projector, Portable Outdoor Projector with Tripod, Kids Gift, Home Theater Movie Phone Projector Compatible with Android/iOS/Windows/TV Stick/HDMI/USB
description: I have now tested two versions of this projector that are tied to this page, so this is a compound review.4K Projector:  4-5 starsThis is a very good projector for its price point competing with many mid-range projectors that cost 4-5x as much.  It has a nice clear picture across the field of view when level.  Moving to the maximum tilt for its keystone correction there is minor blurring at the top / bottom of the image when focused on the center, but text is still legible across the field, suitable for giving a presentation or sharing a computer screen.Mini Projector:  2-3 starsThe mini is a very small projector that would be easy to take with you or fit in a small desk space.  The down side is it has poor depth of focus across the image.  I could not get the top and bottom in focus at the same time.  It would likely be good for a movie on the go if you don't care about picture quality too much, but it is not suitable for displaying legible text.

product_name: Mini Projector, VISSPL Full HD 1080P Video Projector, Portable Outdoor Projector with Tripod, Kids Gift, Home Theater Movie Phone Projector Compatible with Android/iOS/Windows/TV Stick/HDMI/USB
description: The VISSPL 6D/4P/4K Projector is a true marvel of modern technology, delivering an unparalleled home cinema experience that will leave you mesmerized. With its impressive array of features, including WiFi and Bluetooth connectivity, electric keystone correction, and support for 4K resolution, this projector redefines what's possible in home entertainment. Here's why it deserves a spot at the center of your entertainment setup:Crystal Clear Picture Quality:Prepare to be captivated by the stunning visuals produced by the VISSPL projector. With support for 4K resolution and a brightness of 15000 lumens, this projector delivers breathtaking image clarity and vibrant colors that bring your favorite movies, TV shows, and games to life like never before. Whether you're watching a blockbuster film or immersing yourself in the latest video game release, every detail is rendered with unparalleled precision and brilliance.Immersive Sound Experience:Complementing its stunning visuals, the VISSPL projector offers an immersive sound experience that rivals that of a traditional theater. With built-in Bluetooth connectivity, you can easily pair your favorite wireless speakers or soundbar to enjoy rich, dynamic audio that fills the room with cinematic surround sound. Whether you're watching an action-packed movie or listening to your favorite music, the VISSPL projector ensures that every sound is crystal clear and immersive.Wireless Connectivity and Smart Features:Say goodbye to tangled cables and cumbersome setup processes with the VISSPL projector's built-in WiFi connectivity. Stream your favorite movies, TV shows, and online content directly from popular streaming services like Netflix, Hulu, and YouTube without the need for additional devices. Plus, with support for Bluetooth connectivity, you can easily mirror your smartphone or tablet screen to share photos, videos, and presentations with friends and family.Electric Keystone Correction:Achieving the perfect image alignment has never been easier thanks to the VISSPL projector's electric keystone correction feature. With the touch of a button, you can adjust the vertical and horizontal keystone settings to eliminate distortion and ensure a perfectly rectangular image, even when the projector is placed at an angle. Say goodbye to crooked images and distorted proportions—every frame is displayed with precision and accuracy.Versatile Screen Size:Whether you're hosting a movie night with friends or giving a presentation at work, the VISSPL projector's impressive screen size capabilities have you covered. With support for screen sizes of up to 400 inches diagonally, you can enjoy larger-than-life visuals that make you feel like you're right in the middle of the action. From intimate home theater experiences to immersive gaming sessions, the possibilities are endless with the VISSPL projector.In conclusion, the VISSPL 6D/4P/4K Projector is a true powerhouse of home entertainment, offering unparalleled picture quality, immersive sound, wireless connectivity, electric keystone correction, and versatile screen size capabilities. Whether you're a cinephile, gamer, or presenter, this projector delivers an unmatched viewing experience that will leave you speechless. Elevate your home entertainment setup and experience the magic of cinema in the comfort of your own home with the VISSPL projector.

product_name: Mini Projector, VISSPL Full HD 1080P Video Projector, Portable Outdoor Projector with Tripod, Kids Gift, Home Theater Movie Phone Projector Compatible with Android/iOS/Windows/TV Stick/HDMI/USB
description: The VISSPL Full HD 1080P Mini Projector is an excellent addition to classroom settings, offering a versatile and affordable solution for enhancing learning. Its compact size and portability make it easy to transport between classrooms, while the included tripod provides a stable setup for projection in different spaces.With its native 1080P resolution, this projector delivers sharp and vibrant visuals, which significantly enhances the clarity of educational videos, presentations, and multimedia content. The brightness is adequate for dimly lit classrooms, ensuring that students can clearly see the material being displayed. Its compatibility with Android, iOS, Windows, TV Sticks, HDMI, and USB means that teachers can easily connect various devices, making it convenient for displaying different types of content.The projector is especially useful for collaborative learning as it supports screen sharing from smartphones and tablets, making it an interactive tool for engaging students. However, in brightly lit classrooms, the projector’s visibility may be somewhat reduced, so it is ideal for use in darker environments.Overall, the VISSPL mini projector is a practical and budget-friendly tool for classrooms, enhancing visual learning and engagement with its easy setup, versatile compatibility, and high-quality display.

product_name: Mini Projector, VISSPL Full HD 1080P Video Projector, Portable Outdoor Projector with Tripod, Kids Gift, Home Theater Movie Phone Projector Compatible with Android/iOS/Windows/TV Stick/HDMI/USB
description: I have a bigger, nicer projector at our lake cottage, but this one was *so* much cheaper, I had to give it a go before I dropped the significant bucks on one for our master bedroom at home. I figured if it wasn't any good, I could put it in a guest room.Well, turns out it's *almost* as good as the projector I spent five times as much money on. Mounted on a little shelf above the headboard, this unit projects a clear, relatively hi-res picture on my off white wall across the room at about 7xWhatever feet. Even when there's some ambient light in the room, it is a usable image. With all the lights out at night, it is more than acceptable for most viewing situations.Downside: The audio is a bit on the weak side and it *does not* have Bluetooth connectivity. If you want to add a remote speaker (and you will) you'll need a physical cord to make that happen. Also, this thing is not exactly built like a tank and certain options you may be used to with a more expensive projector may not be found here. Even so, I like it a lot and it more that fills my modest viewing needs. For the money, hard to beat.

product_name: SAMSUNG T7 Shield 4TB Portable SSD - 1050MB/s, Rugged, Water & Dust Resistant, for Content Creators - Black
description: The Samsung T7 Shield Portable SSD is an excellent product. The SSD performance is fast, its housing is quite rugged and may likely withstand reasonable bumps and drops, and it's small enough to fit in your pocket. For size comparison, it is noticeably smaller than most smartphones, and is very slightly larger than a credit card, albeit thicker.The one major disappointment I have with this product is the uncommon limitation on the number of characters you may use for the password when you choose to enable encryption. The maximum number of characters is only 16! This may be good enough for an average user, but those among us (and there are many of us) who take privacy and computer security very seriously will want to be able to implement a password that is longer than 16 characters. As a matter of fact, a strong password should be at least 16 characters, not the maximum!All of my passwords (and I use literally a couple hundred unique passwords) are at least 20 characters in length and most are even much longer. I use Bitwarden as my password manager which makes password management a breeze. With a password manager, all I have to memorize is the master password and it's long and randomly generated (just like all of my passwords).I hope Samsung reads this review and doubles or even triples in a future firmware update the maximum password length allowed for products like this. Because of the lower password maximum length, I had to take off two stars and give this product an overall rating of 3 out of 5 stars, even though everything else regarding this product is excellent. Encryption is a big deal to a lot of people and longer randomly generated passwords make encryption virtually impossible to crack.For those wondering, the Samsung T7 Shield Portable SSD uses AES 256-bit hardware-based encryption, so that by itself is very secure, but only if the password is long and very hard to guess. So I recommend anyone buying this product who wishes to enable encryption (which is optional) to use a very hard to guess password that is the maximum length for this device, which is 16 characters. If one day Samsung raises this limitation, I'll definitely be making my password longer than 16.

product_name: SAMSUNG T7 Shield 4TB Portable SSD - 1050MB/s, Rugged, Water & Dust Resistant, for Content Creators - Black
description: After some months of use, the writing speed is very slow at the beginning of the file transferring. After some time in the file transfer process, it starts going faster.

product_name: SAMSUNG T7 Shield 4TB Portable SSD - 1050MB/s, Rugged, Water & Dust Resistant, for Content Creators - Black
description: I bought the 4 TB version of this drive to replace a USB enclosure + 2 TB 860 evo, as I was running out of space with that. Its primary purpose is to host Kontakt libraries and other things like that, fast temporary space and lots of streaming files from all over the drive. Copying files to and from it achieves the advertised speeds, sequential is good, but random reads are horrid. Crystal Disk mark says that with a queue depth of 1 the read speeds can degrade to an absurd 13 MB/s. I appreciate that random reads are not as fast as sequential ones, but they should not be over 20 times slower on an SSD! Worth noting is that when the queue depth goes up to the unreasonable 32, the random reads perform just as well as you'd expect them to, close to the sequential speeds. So the NAND itself can certainly respond fast enough.  Ever since I set this up I noticed that whenever I would go browsing the folder tree and land in some folder I hadn't viewed yet, my file manager, which is an alternative that is much faster than Windows Explorer, would downright hang for a second while it read the directory. My 8 TB mechanical doesn't do that. The EVO didn't do that. This is NTFS, not EXFAT, so the file system shouldn't be the problem here. And I'm not displaying thumbnails or anything of the sort, so it's not like reading that folder is resulting in an absolute spike of reads to display it. And attempting to use it as a Kontakt sample drive results in Kontakt being completely unable to stream things fast enough, which causes constant drop-outs in the middle of sounds. I'm kind of in a bind as I gave away the prior 2 TB drive, so even if I want to return this I don't currently have a place to put all the data that's already on it. Firmware is updated. Hopefully this is something that can be fixed, I certainly would prefer to continue recommending Samsung as the King of SSD!

product_name: SAMSUNG T7 Shield 4TB Portable SSD - 1050MB/s, Rugged, Water & Dust Resistant, for Content Creators - Black
description: Using this is a blessing and a curse. It was nice and quick when I first used it but around the second or third time using it it would disconnect on its own regardless of whether it's moved or not. The ports that im using are fine so it's not disconnecting because of that. The device itself just seems to disconnect randomly whenever you are using it. Sometimes it can be hours and no disconnect while other times it can be a few minutes and it'll randomly disconnect. It's not necessarily worth the price tag when I bought it to be better and faster than a standard HDD.

product_name: SAMSUNG T7 Shield 4TB Portable SSD - 1050MB/s, Rugged, Water & Dust Resistant, for Content Creators - Black
description: This is a quality rugged SSD like stated in the title. The date speed is very much below the the advertised speed on the listing. I assure you that the speed should be sufficient for most use cases. The speed was actually above my expectations of a USB SSD, even more so when using the USB-C Lightning port(Over 500 MB/s sustained).On that same note the storage is far below whats advertised on the listing, I ordered the 1TB model however my unit only came with 930 GB, that's 70 GB less storage than stated on the product listing! This is 70 GB less than what is stated on the listing! .but unfortunately these deceptive marketing tactics are normal in the digital storage industry.  For anyone buying a Samsung T7 SHIELD I highly suggest they pony up the extra few dollars and buy the 2TB or even the 4TB model instead due to the actual storage being 10s of gigabytes less than advertised on the listing, I suggest buying the higher capacity models to off set the reduction in storage compared to the advertised amount. I sure wish I did get a higher capacity unit, but alas I didn't know I was going to get a drive with 70 GB less than what I paid for!  At the time of writing this review I've only had this SSD for a little over a month, so I am not sure about its longevity or durability due to lack of experience using it however it is well built and sturdy. I have a lot of faith in the durability of this product, its built like a tank! the exterior is wrapped in a hard rubber shell to adsorb shock and enhance durability. the rubber wrapping even extends to protects the edges, even if it lands on an edge its still covered by the rubber exterior shell. I am satisfied with the durability, my unit hasn't suffered any abuse so take my word about this with a grain of salt.One last thing before I wrap this up. I highly advise against the use of the encryption software pre-installed by Samsung. There is far superior and more importantly free and open-source encryption software out there.In conclusion this is a quality rugged portable USB SSD. I have faith that this will survive falling off of my desk plenty of times. The date speed is satisfactory even if it never hit the coveted 1 GB/s. I am very disappointed in the lack of storage, 70 GB less than the stated amount of storage is huge, That's over 5% of the advertised storage, very deceptive of Samsung to pull. I do not recommend buying the 1 TB***(930GB actual storage) model and instead go for higher capacity models.

product_name: SAMSUNG T7 Shield 4TB Portable SSD - 1050MB/s, Rugged, Water & Dust Resistant, for Content Creators - Black
description: I bought this 4TB drive because my Mac needed to be backed up and was also short on storage. I transferred all the files and lightening fast it was complete. Transfer is quick. Removed all the copied files from my mac. Went to bed. Woke up to begin doing some programming. Couldn't mount the drive. All of my most important files are gone.Tried Samsung Magician. It wouldnt load unless I disconnected the drive. After other attempts to read it such as using other cables (both that came with it) and ones I have for other drives... nothing worked.I tried disk utility to mount the drive. wouldnt load unless the drive was disconnected. One time it did load but the drive was grayed out and showed not mounted. I used the terminal to mount the disk. No luck. I finally accepted that 6 years worth of work was gone forever.I left the computer plugged in and walked away in an attempt to deal with the stress. I came back the following day to look and viola the drive was mounted. Then it worked for a bit. Tried a few more times and it was up and working. I wrote it off as being from improperly ejecting the drive which never happened on purpose but happened none the less. Here I am few more months down the road. On an international trip. Cant access my files. Dead in the water. Nothing. I plugged in an old SSD from 2012 WD Passport for Mac and it loads within seconds with the same amount of data and it has its own connection type and a usb on the other end. No type C. That drive has been through hell. Years of abuse.,.. still works. I got out two other T5 drives I have both loaded on type c on SSD with usb into the dock mounted to macbook pro. The doc has standard usb connections. Both loaded in 1-2 seconds. T7 still cant be found. Rugged? The thing is babied and only a few months old. Its in a pelican case. The case is kept in a padded computer backpack. First trip out of the house.... nothing. This drive is worthless. It was highly recommended and I am ok with spending premium dollars on premium drives but at this rate a cheap chinese knockoff would perform better. I wish I could get my money back. It is worthless. Bought directly from Samsung. Just as I did the two T5 1TB SSD drives. I see on reddit others are having the same issues. Garbage. Dont buy. Buy the T5 instead or consider WD as I am. I paid premium bucks for trash along with the anxiety of whether I just lost my entire livelihood. I deserve it since I trusted Samsung from years and years of great products. Come to think about it, I had failed USB drives I bought from them recently also. Someone should contact me to fix this or I will be parting ways with Samsung. Unacceptable. I bought all of their premium models when it came to building several PC computers for my dad's business and for my flash storage needs.... This is so disheartening.

product_name: SAMSUNG T7 Shield 4TB Portable SSD - 1050MB/s, Rugged, Water & Dust Resistant, for Content Creators - Black
description: The SSD itself works great! If you have a high-quality USB C-to-C cable, it will remain firmly attached to your PC, even if its a laptop you're shifting around - the worst thing is an external HD that disconnects on you easily.  Also, this thing is insanely small - as someone who remembers having to cycle through multiple floppy disks to play a game that was a few megabytes, having 2 terabytes of storage space in a package the weight of a smartphone and half the size is wild.The included USB-C cable is NOT good enough to get you USB 3.0 seeds, which is a cheap move by Samsung, honestly, but with a good 3rd party USB-C cable, I can get write speeds of over 500 megabytes/second on this bad boy, which is amazing. It's more than good enough to play games off of, and in fact, the first thing I did with this was migrate my entire Steam library.That said, I'm knocking off a star not just for the cheap cable, but the fact that the TWO MONTH ADOBE CLOUD SUBSCRIPTION IS A LIE. That wasn't my reason for buying an external SSD at all, but it was a reason I chose this particular SSD over its competitors.I bought the drive, dutifully registered on Samsung's website, and... nothing happened. I called Samsung, waited on hold for 30 minutes, got cycled through various departments and then hung up on, called Samsung back angrily, got hung up on AGAIN, and then on my THIRD CALL, I finally got to someone who admitted - they were out of keys, and had been for a while. Yes, the promo technically does say "while supplies last," which I didn't notice originally, but it's tacky of Samsung and I feel like borderline false advertising not to remove this non-existent "promo" now that they know they're out of keys. I think my state's attorney general might be interested in this "promo", in fact.But, other than that, the drive IS actually good. Samsung, however, is not.

product_name: SAMSUNG T7 Shield 4TB Portable SSD - 1050MB/s, Rugged, Water & Dust Resistant, for Content Creators - Black
description: All I did was a simple format upon receiving. Even with the silicone cover, this drive seems to run very hot. I am contemplating returning it as I have fire concerns if I leave it plugged in overnight or go out for a bit with it plugged in.  Anyone else have these issues?

product_name: SAMSUNG T7 Shield 4TB Portable SSD - 1050MB/s, Rugged, Water & Dust Resistant, for Content Creators - Black
description: At first I plugged it into the USB-A slot on my 6 year old Windows desktop (Skybridge.)  I was underwhelmed.  The read/write speed was exactly the same as my 8 year old external rotating drives.But then I read my old ASUS Z170-A MOBO manual (from 2015) It turns out I've got a well hidden  USB-C slot on the back panel. (Who knew?) I plugged the T7 into that and the read/ write speed must be 10X as fast as before. Screaming fast!Here are some more tips. 1) Don't password protect your drive unless you never forget your passwords.  If you forget it you're screwed. (See tip 2 =>) 2)  If you put confidential data on an SSD and then you decide you don't want it and send it back, you should reformat (overwrite) the drive to erase your data (or just mail it directly to Kim Jong Un in N. Korea.)*****************************************Here's a Day 3 update.  On Day 2 (after writing the above) things deteriorated.  The drive really really does not like being disconnected when  data is being written or deleted.  I was in debug hell for hours trying to recover from corrupted data. But now on Day 3 all seemed ok again (after I reformated the drive!)Bottom line: before unplugging the drive,  make sure you eject the drive and (in Windows Explorer) check that the device icon is gone and/or that the drive is no longer showing up under Device Manager.  Ejecting the drive can be finicky (but is essential.)Ejecting the drive also seems easier, if the device is password protected (but don't forget your password or it's going back to Samsung for a factory reset (you can't do it.) and bye bye data.************************Day 7:  I need to tell  you that I returned the T7 Shield, and - having tested a 2nd one (hope springs eternal) - I've returned that also.  Obviously I really wanted this to work.Why a 3 star review?  I have to wonder whether the finicky performance, data corruption, and difficulty ejecting the drive (principally when plugged into my lone usb-C port) might be due to my 6 year old Skylake system (under Win 10).  The drive was more consistent when plugged into the usb-A port, but was 8 times slower (so, why keep it?)  It did work more consistently with my Intel Gen 11 (Rocket Lake) laptop where I saw 250 MB/sec read/write speeds; but even there ejecting the drive from a usb-C port was difficult (and hence rendered it prone to data corruption.)I really wanted to make this work, but - alas - it was not to be.  (BTW I've probably purchased a dozen Samsung internal SATA SSD's over the years and love them;  totally reliable and great software (Data Migration and Magician.)

product_name: SAMSUNG T7 Shield 4TB Portable SSD - 1050MB/s, Rugged, Water & Dust Resistant, for Content Creators - Black
description: This drive essentially died after 1.5 years. It used to be blazing fast but then only accepted writes at 1 MB/s. I reformatted the drive with NTFS and ran trim. The drive seemed to come back to life but had to transfer-off data to reformat.

product_name: SAMSUNG T7 Shield 4TB Portable SSD - 1050MB/s, Rugged, Water & Dust Resistant, for Content Creators - Black
description: I recently purchased the Samsung T7 Portable SSD, and I couldn’t be more impressed! This little powerhouse has transformed the way I store and transfer data.First off, the speed is phenomenal. With read speeds up to 1,050 MB/s and write speeds of 1,000 MB/s, transferring large files is a breeze. I’ve moved several gigabytes of data in just a few seconds—it's a massive time-saver!The design is sleek and modern, making it not just functional but also a stylish accessory. It’s lightweight and compact, fitting easily in my pocket or bag, which is perfect for on-the-go use. Plus, the durable casing adds an extra layer of protection, giving me peace of mind when I'm traveling.Another standout feature is the built-in security. The T7 includes password protection and AES 256-bit hardware encryption, ensuring my data is safe from prying eyes. It’s reassuring to know my sensitive files are well-protected.Compatibility is also excellent. I’ve used it with my laptop, desktop, and even my gaming console without any hiccups. The T7 is truly versatile, making it an essential tool for anyone who needs reliable external storage.In summary, the Samsung T7 Portable SSD delivers on every front—speed, design, security, and compatibility. I highly recommend it to anyone in need of a dependable, high-performance storage solution. It’s worth every penny!

product_name: SAMSUNG T7 Shield 4TB Portable SSD - 1050MB/s, Rugged, Water & Dust Resistant, for Content Creators - Black
description: I recently purchased the Samsung T7 Shield SSD for use with my Blackmagic Pro 6K camera, and my experience has been nothing short of remarkable. Initially, I encountered a hiccup as the first SSD unit arrived dead on arrival. This was undoubtedly disappointing, but the replacement process was smooth and hassle-free, which speaks volumes about the customer service.The second SSD, however, worked like a charm right out of the box. The compatibility with my Blackmagic Pro 6K camera was seamless, offering a significant upgrade to my workflow. The read and write speeds are incredibly fast, ensuring that I don't miss a beat while shooting high-resolution footage. The SSD's robustness and durability are also noteworthy, as the T7 Shield is designed to withstand the rigors of outdoor shooting and challenging environments.I was particularly impressed with its compact size and lightweight design, making it extremely portable and a perfect fit for on-the-go shooting scenarios. Additionally, the heat management of the device is excellent, maintaining optimal performance even during extended use.While the initial DOA issue was a setback, the overall performance and reliability of the Samsung T7 Shield SSD have been outstanding. It has proven to be a reliable companion for my professional camera setup, enhancing both the efficiency and quality of my work.In conclusion, I highly recommend the Samsung T7 Shield SSD to any professional videographer or photographer looking for a high-performance, durable, and reliable storage solution. The exceptional performance it delivers, especially in tandem with high-end equipment like the Blackmagic Pro 6K camera, makes it a worthy investment. Five stars for a product that ultimately lives up to its promises, despite the initial hiccup.

product_name: SAMSUNG T7 Shield 4TB Portable SSD - 1050MB/s, Rugged, Water & Dust Resistant, for Content Creators - Black
description: As a fervent tech enthusiast, I can confidently assert that the Samsung T7 Shield 4TB Portable SSD is an absolute game-changer. This sleek and robust piece of hardware embodies the epitome of innovation and reliability.Firstly, let's talk speed. With read and write speeds hitting a staggering 1050MB/s, this SSD catapults my workflow into hyperdrive. Editing large video files, transferring hefty datasets, or even running demanding applications—all are executed with lightning-fast efficiency, saving me precious time and ensuring seamless productivity.Durability is another key highlight. The rugged design coupled with water and dust resistance instill a sense of security, allowing me to venture into various environments without fretting over potential damage. Whether I'm working in the field, on a bustling set, or simply on the move, the T7 Shield remains steadfast, safeguarding my valuable data against the elements.Furthermore, the ample storage capacity of 4TB ensures that I never have to compromise on my creative endeavors. Gone are the days of juggling between multiple storage devices or fretting over insufficient space. With this SSD by my side, I have the freedom to explore limitless possibilities without constraints.In essence, the Samsung T7 Shield 4TB Portable SSD is not just a peripheral—it's an indispensable companion for any content creator or tech aficionado. Its unrivaled performance, durability, and generous storage capacity elevate my workflow to unprecedented heights, making it a quintessential addition to my arsenal of tools. Five stars? Without a shadow of a doubt.

product_name: SAMSUNG T7 Shield 4TB Portable SSD - 1050MB/s, Rugged, Water & Dust Resistant, for Content Creators - Black
description: In the era of data-driven lifestyles, having a reliable and portable storage solution is essential. The SAMSUNG T7 Shield 2TB Portable SSD steps up to the plate, offering a powerhouse of storage capacity and enhanced security features. Join me as we explore the performance, security, durability, and convenience of the SAMSUNG T7 Shield 2TB Portable SSD.The SAMSUNG T7 Shield 2TB Portable SSD delivers impressive performance, providing lightning-fast data transfer speeds. Utilizing the cutting-edge NVMe technology and USB 3.2 Gen 2 interface, it offers blazingly fast read and write speeds, allowing you to transfer large files in a matter of seconds. Whether you're working with high-resolution media, large datasets, or demanding applications, the T7 Shield SSD handles it all with exceptional efficiency. It's a true workhorse that keeps up with your data-intensive tasks.The SAMSUNG T7 Shield 2TB Portable SSD is built to withstand the rigors of daily use and travel. Encased in a sturdy metal body, it can withstand drops from up to 6 feet, providing added protection against accidental bumps and shocks. The SSD is also resistant to extreme temperatures, allowing it to operate reliably in a wide range of environments. It's a rugged and durable companion that can keep up with your active lifestyle.The SAMSUNG T7 Shield 2TB Portable SSD is designed with convenience in mind. Its compact and lightweight form factor makes it highly portable, allowing you to carry your data wherever you go. The USB-C connectivity ensures compatibility with a wide range of devices, including laptops, tablets, and smartphones. The included USB Type-C to Type-C and USB Type-C to Type-A cables provide flexibility and convenience for various connection options. The T7 Shield SSD is also backward compatible with older USB versions, ensuring seamless connectivity across different devices.A powerful combination of performance, security, durability, and convenience. With lightning-fast data transfer speeds, advanced security features, rugged build quality, and effortless portability, it's a top-tier storage solution for professionals, content creators, and anyone in need of reliable and secure portable storage. Whether you're working on the go or simply need a backup for your important files, the SAMSUNG T7 Shield 2TB Portable SSD is a worthy investment that delivers on its promises.

product_name: SAMSUNG T7 Shield 4TB Portable SSD - 1050MB/s, Rugged, Water & Dust Resistant, for Content Creators - Black
description: Not much more to say.  It's very fast and so far very reliable.  The manufacturer has a good reputation.  I don't anticipate any problems.

product_name: SAMSUNG T7 Shield 4TB Portable SSD - 1050MB/s, Rugged, Water & Dust Resistant, for Content Creators - Black
description: This is my second purchase of this same Samsung T7 Shield 4TB portable SSD They offer great performance, just plug in and go.I knocked off a star because the included cables fit loosely in the USB-C port on both SSDs, and they fall out easily. I went ahead and bought high speed USB-C data cables to replace them, those fit very snugly into the SSD port and performance is great with my laptop.(I bought LEIRUI brand 240W USB4 Cable for Thunderbolt 4 Cable 90 Degree USB Type C Fast Charging Cable 40Gbps Data Transfer 8K@60Hz Video Display Cable for iPhone 15 Pro,Samsung,Steam Deck,Switch,eGPU,MacBook - https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0CG5CP4PP - if interested.)

product_name: SAMSUNG T7 Shield 4TB Portable SSD - 1050MB/s, Rugged, Water & Dust Resistant, for Content Creators - Black
description: I bought two of these last fall, and a couple more this month. I'm happy with the drive. It's fast, works well, and seems very durable. I haven't dropped it, but I expect the case would protect it if I did.I do wish though that the connecting cable was a bit longer and was more durable. One drive kept giving error messages of being "disconnected improperly"; I finally realized the problem was the cable connecting it to my laptop, which must have had an internal short. When I replaced the cable, the drive worked fine again.

product_name: SAMSUNG T7 Shield 4TB Portable SSD - 1050MB/s, Rugged, Water & Dust Resistant, for Content Creators - Black
description: **Product Review: Samsung External Hard Drive**As an officer of the law, I'm always on the lookout for reliable tools, whether it's to uphold justice or back up critical data. The Samsung External Hard Drive is more than just a storage device—it's the ideal partner in my quest to "serve the public trust, protect the innocent, and uphold the law."First off, the design is sleek, compact, and durable. It’s built like a tank (or a well-armored cyborg), but with the elegance of a device that could fit right into my leg holster. The hard drive’s speed is nothing short of impressive, transferring files faster than I can say, "Dead or alive, you’re coming with me."Its security features are robust, just the way I like it. With encryption capabilities, I can keep all my sensitive data safe from cybercriminals. They won’t stand a chance against this digital fortress—consider it the "Directive 4" of data protection.But let’s not forget the storage capacity! With room for everything from case files to crime scene photos, I’ve got space to spare for all my justice-related needs and a few cat memes too (hey, even a cybernetic cop needs a laugh).In conclusion, the Samsung External Hard Drive is efficient, reliable, and a solid companion for anyone looking to secure their data. Whether you’re backing up important files or just need some extra storage space, this device will have your back—just like me, RoboCop. I’d buy that for a dollar!(Note: It's actually worth a lot more than a dollar, but you get the point.)

product_name: SAMSUNG T7 Shield 4TB Portable SSD - 1050MB/s, Rugged, Water & Dust Resistant, for Content Creators - Black
description: Been trying to find something to store all my music and play them in the car without Amazon Cloud. Got this little guy in the mail on 09/29/2024 and it is small. Don't let small fool you on the storage capacity, it will store and very user-friendly.  Of course, I have always been fond of Samsung products for a while, they are on the pricier side. You get what you pay for, if you want quality that is. All I had to do was grab the newer USB cords and plug right in and it will do the rest and I didn't even read the instruction manual. That easy and then use it for what your heart desires, for me well I wanted someplace to play and store all my music.  Plays in a 2019 Volkswagen Tiguan USB plug all my music, don't even have to install anything. Comes up and plays everything right there, they were not kidding it can be used everywhere and how. very durable and fits right in the palm of your hand, unless you have big hands then it will be swallowed up. First day review I know and so thus the date in this review, if it doesn't come down. For the price, if you want durable and user friendly then this product for the price isn't bad. Thank you, Samsung you once again succeeded with a happy customer

product_name: SAMSUNG T7 Shield 4TB Portable SSD - 1050MB/s, Rugged, Water & Dust Resistant, for Content Creators - Black
description: I purchased this because of its durability and storage size.  It exceeded my expectations.  I did have some trouble networking it but with a little technical support from Samsung they help me format it to work in Windows 11 and 10.  The USB cables that come with it allow for the different connection types that come on new/old computer ports which is a nice option if you're using this on different computers with different USB connections.  I would highly recommend this external drive if you are an on-th-go person who needs to have access to large amounts of files.  I use it as a redundant drive if I'm traveling which contains archives of my files that I have access to if I don't have internet connections... works great!

product_name: Canon EOS R6 Mark II Mirrorless Camera (Body Only), Full-Frame Hybrid Camera, 24.2 Megapixel CMOS Sensor, Photo and Video Capabilities, Black
description: I wanted to like this. Reviews were generally favorable. Performance specs are great. Looking for camera with many capabilities and this looked the best compromise.It is light - but unfortunately it feels like it is plastic - not what I have had in prior DSLR bodies. (1D3, 7D2, 5D3 etc). It rattles - out of the box it rattles - not when shaken violently - just turn it upside down and it rattles. Read it is the stabilizer - it stops when camera is powered on - but not what I expected.It has decent performance in real world - but I had way way too many anomalies in images. No rhyme or reason - they happen in bursts, they happen in single shots, they happen in auto and manual modes, and with different lenses (70-200mm, 24-70mm etc). I was using the Genuine CANON CONTROL RING MOUNT ADAPTER EF-EOS R but no mention that is should introduce issues. Either way I have EF lenses so it is part of the program.I have to return this. For the price - I am not willing to gamble that it does not get worse. And I need my pictures 100% for the best chance for the best shot - getting 77 defects from 350 photos is not workable.

product_name: Canon EOS R6 Mark II Mirrorless Camera (Body Only), Full-Frame Hybrid Camera, 24.2 Megapixel CMOS Sensor, Photo and Video Capabilities, Black
description: I have to buy a 200$ adapter just to use my ef lenses

product_name: Canon EOS R6 Mark II Mirrorless Camera (Body Only), Full-Frame Hybrid Camera, 24.2 Megapixel CMOS Sensor, Photo and Video Capabilities, Black
description: Excited about this camera. Concerns….The view finder flickered and would focus for a second or two and then go dark first attempt at using it.  Debating on returning for a replacement before return time frame expires.  Update  10/ 13/23 the view finder has gone black in manual mode and I don’t see a solution to this thru canon support threads.  I so regret purchasing this camera.

product_name: Canon EOS R6 Mark II Mirrorless Camera (Body Only), Full-Frame Hybrid Camera, 24.2 Megapixel CMOS Sensor, Photo and Video Capabilities, Black
description: I’ve been shooting for over 7 years and have never had an issue with a camera before. This camera will freeze if you use dual slot, and you are on high continuous shooting fast moving pictures.It also froze when a second photographer was using an external flash, it caused my camera to freak out and the lcd went in an out. I called canon, YOU CANT EVEN TALK TO A TECH, you talk to customer support and they don’t know anything.WOULD NOT RECOMMEND.

product_name: Canon EOS R6 Mark II Mirrorless Camera (Body Only), Full-Frame Hybrid Camera, 24.2 Megapixel CMOS Sensor, Photo and Video Capabilities, Black
description: I was sold a canon r6 mark 2, brand new and the item went corrupt less than two months of having this item. I was in the middle of a ceremony when it went faulty and stopped working. Contacted the seller and while I understand the product has a warranty, you’d think they’d offer an exchange since I hadn’t had the camera for more than 60 days when it started to have issues….nope, they just threw it on canon like I didn’t just spend $2500 through them for a camera.

product_name: Canon EOS R6 Mark II Mirrorless Camera (Body Only), Full-Frame Hybrid Camera, 24.2 Megapixel CMOS Sensor, Photo and Video Capabilities, Black
description: I am done with Canon.  After losing an hour of footage because a camera decided to shut down with no audible warning, I have had it.  Their software is absolute trash.  Both Canon cameras I own have the same issues where I have to unplug and replug the usb cable to get it to even detect.  Even then, the file transfer is slow.  I spent hours trying to copy files only to find out that the files it copied were hidden and I will filling up my drive with over a TB of duplicate files.

product_name: Canon EOS R6 Mark II Mirrorless Camera (Body Only), Full-Frame Hybrid Camera, 24.2 Megapixel CMOS Sensor, Photo and Video Capabilities, Black
description: Maybe I just got a bad camera but this one was returned.  Would not focus consistently near and far…had to rotate the zoom slightly for it to gain focus.  And, for some reason some of the images came out very soft, much worse than the old R6 that I sold to get this. (Big mistake!). I used Canon lenses…the rf 100-500, the Canon ef with adapter 500mm f/4 and the Canon ef 400 f/4 DO…all razor sharp with my Canon R5.Very disappointed…wanted this as a backup.

product_name: Canon EOS R6 Mark II Mirrorless Camera (Body Only), Full-Frame Hybrid Camera, 24.2 Megapixel CMOS Sensor, Photo and Video Capabilities, Black
description: Did not come with usb cable.  I spent 10 agonizing hours trying to get the camera to download a photo to my computer...with no success.  Had to sign up to Canon Utilities site, which costs 50 dollars per year.  Boxed up camera and sent back in under 24 hours.

product_name: Canon EOS R6 Mark II Mirrorless Camera (Body Only), Full-Frame Hybrid Camera, 24.2 Megapixel CMOS Sensor, Photo and Video Capabilities, Black
description: I currently cannot control the aperture on my third party lens whereas with my R5 I can.I should have jumped ship and gone with a manufacturer that plays nice with other companies.So it would seem it's actually happening, shame on you canon.

product_name: Canon EOS R6 Mark II Mirrorless Camera (Body Only), Full-Frame Hybrid Camera, 24.2 Megapixel CMOS Sensor, Photo and Video Capabilities, Black
Canon EOS R6 Mark II Mirrorless Camera (Body Only), Full-Frame Hybrid Camera, 24.2 Megapixel CMOS Sensor, Photo and Video Capabilities, Black
description: The Canon R6 Mark II is my second purchase of this incredible camera model, and I absolutely love it. As a professional photographer, I’ve used a wide range of cameras over the years, and the R6 Mark II stands out as one of the best for capturing stunning photos with ease and precision.One of the most impressive features of this camera is its focus tracking. It’s nothing short of amazing how accurately and quickly it locks onto subjects, even those in motion. Whether I’m photographing wildlife, sports, or portraits, the focus tracking never fails to deliver sharp and clear images. This capability has elevated my photography to a whole new level, allowing me to capture moments with incredible detail and clarity.The R6 Mark II also offers excellent low-light performance, thanks to its high ISO sensitivity and advanced image stabilization. I’ve been able to shoot in challenging lighting conditions without compromising image quality, which is a huge plus for anyone who loves shooting at night or indoors.Additionally, the camera’s ergonomic design makes it comfortable to hold and easy to operate, even during long shooting sessions. The menu system is intuitive, and the touchscreen display is a pleasure to use.Overall, the Canon R6 Mark II has exceeded my expectations in every way. It’s a reliable, high-performance camera that’s perfect for both amateur and professional photographers alike. Whether you’re upgrading from another model or looking for a powerful camera to start your photography journey, the R6 Mark II is a fantastic choice that won’t disappoint.

product_name: Canon EOS R6 Mark II Mirrorless Camera (Body Only), Full-Frame Hybrid Camera, 24.2 Megapixel CMOS Sensor, Photo and Video Capabilities, Black
description: This camera excellent for any kind of photography, focusing system is top notch, as now is 2 years old and is hard to beat by any camera in its class. shooting photos at a blazing 40fps with little rolling shutter, I like the 24mp full frame sensor size that give amazing picture quality with very well controlled noise even at high iso, video quality also is excellent, 4k at 24, 30 and 60fps, there are many nice features packed in this camera, for then price you won't be wrong, there are minor limitations that so far don't bother me much, like memory cards are not CFexpress, buffer for fast photo burst capture is on the small size for 40fps but for 12fps I never hit the buffer limit shooting in raw. Again, many features to put them all here!

product_name: Canon EOS R6 Mark II Mirrorless Camera (Body Only), Full-Frame Hybrid Camera, 24.2 Megapixel CMOS Sensor, Photo and Video Capabilities, Black
description: The Canon R6 Mark ii was my upgrade from a Canon 5D Mark iii (circa 2012).  I've had it for a few days and need to familiarize myself with more of its features.  It is much smaller and lighter than my old camera.  This camera makes it easy to navigate the menus via the dials and buttons.  The autofocus is fast and flexible.  The exposures for the shooting modes I've used (Av, Tv, and Manual) are very good.  The mirrorless rate of image capture is jaw-dropping.  No doubt there are faster cameras, but this is something compared with my old one.  The photos were all hand-held, illustrating the image stabilization and exposure capability of the camera.I'm happy with the purchase and am eager to spend more time using this camera.

product_name: Canon EOS R6 Mark II Mirrorless Camera (Body Only), Full-Frame Hybrid Camera, 24.2 Megapixel CMOS Sensor, Photo and Video Capabilities, Black
description: I invested in this camera, and I’m so happy I did. I immediately fell in love. I upgraded from a Nikon d3400 which was a big upgrade. I love the screen and how light weight the camera body is. The good lenses are super expensive, BUT the quality is WORTH IT!!!!!!! It works AMAZING! I am still learning the camera and the new settings and buttons and such but I’m already so in love with it.  The battery life of the canon batteries are also excellent, as they should be for the price. I do suggest those over the off brands for battery life.  LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS CAMERA!!! Best decision I ever made for my photography.

product_name: Canon EOS R6 Mark II Mirrorless Camera (Body Only), Full-Frame Hybrid Camera, 24.2 Megapixel CMOS Sensor, Photo and Video Capabilities, Black
description: I bought this as my R8 had started to have glitching screen issues. I kind of wish I had bought this model 1st before the R8 as it really is a bit of a step up, over the R8.There are a ton of actual product reviews online but if you like me, are wondering about whether the R6 mkii is worth the extra over the R8, then yes, I would definitely say yes.It does feel a little more robust in the hand, not that the R8 feels cheap although a bit smaller, the R6 just feels and performs in a more professional way.Both cameras are absolutely AWESOME to be perfectly honest. Sensors are identical and give properly professional results. The R6 just has more options like IBIS and a bigger battery for starters if that is of any concern to you.

product_name: Canon EOS R6 Mark II Mirrorless Camera (Body Only), Full-Frame Hybrid Camera, 24.2 Megapixel CMOS Sensor, Photo and Video Capabilities, Black
description: Why didn’t I go mirrorless years ago!? The silence when photographing a wedding is sooooo nice (especially during the ceremony in the church!)! I was used to Canon from my 5d mark 3 so the learning transitions to this was nice and simple. The touch screen is helpful for menu options, the screen tilting is helpful to take photos from all different angles. The focus options, such as on the right eye is helpful for portraits.  I’m in love with this camera!!! I got the 25-70 lens to go with it, and it works beautifully for almost every paid shoot I go on.

product_name: Canon EOS R6 Mark II Mirrorless Camera (Body Only), Full-Frame Hybrid Camera, 24.2 Megapixel CMOS Sensor, Photo and Video Capabilities, Black
description: I’m sure people write verbose reviews talking about Canon color, features, mirrorless technology, etc. you can go on line and watch a weeks worth of reviews. Bottom line, every part of this camera is stunning. The autofocus in articular is a huge step forward. I enjoy the ease of control and immediate access to what I want to adjust before taking the photo. Two card slots is great if using this in an Lu professional job or even capturing special moments. Having redundancy in camera is nice. This is an advanced camera and shooting in raw will give you the most flexibility. If you don’t plan to spend time editing images on the computer, then a less expensive body would suffice. This camera has amazing video capabilities. I don’t use video at all so would be nice to have a less expensive option without video but Canon doesn’t provide that. It’s amazing. It’s a lot of camera that gives the user unlimited control. It’s rather expensive, and it’s worth it!

product_name: Canon EOS R6 Mark II Mirrorless Camera (Body Only), Full-Frame Hybrid Camera, 24.2 Megapixel CMOS Sensor, Photo and Video Capabilities, Black
description: I've been using prosumer cameras for 30 years. I decided it was time to replace my 13-year old Canon 7D, and I chose the Canon R6 Mark II. I'm very happy with it. I was considering buying the R8, but when I held it, I realized it was too small to fit comfortably in my hand. (I'm just an average size guy, with average male hands.) The R6 Mark II is 1/4" taller so it fits my hand better than the R8, plus it has a better viewfinder (especially important for glasses wearers like me), plus it has in-camera image stabilization. To me, those were the features that justified the extra price.Compared to my old Canon 7D, the new R6 Mark II has *much* better focusing, better resolution (more than the extra 6 megapixels would suggest), and shoots in much lower light. With the 7D, ISO 1600 was the highest I could go if I wanted good image quality, but the R6 Mark II can easily go up to ISO 12800. Heck, even ISO 56000 works for casual use.The camera has TONS of customizations. So if you like to tinker and read user manuals, you will be in heaven.One of the cool new features is focus stacking. This lets you take a close-up picture of something and get the whole thing in perfect focus, front to back. The camera takes many individual shots, each at a slightly different focus point, and stitches them together in-camera. It works best with a completely still subject and a tripod, so I won't be using it a lot, but it is cool.I was wondering how much I would like the electronic viewfinder, and it turns out I prefer it over a "real" viewfinder that older DSLR cameras like my 7D have. The biggest benefit is at night because the viewfinder is brighter; this makes the camera easier and more fun to use.

product_name: Canon EOS R6 Mark II Mirrorless Camera (Body Only), Full-Frame Hybrid Camera, 24.2 Megapixel CMOS Sensor, Photo and Video Capabilities, Black
description: Great color, good autofocus but lacks features that keep it from being great. I use this for video so I have no review on this if you're wanting to use this for photography. For video, I love the colors that come out of this and the autofocus is pretty good. It can be a little jumpy at times but usually locks on pretty well.Some flaws. The biggest flaw is that you can't use the camera's lcd while using a monitor and be able to record internally in camera. This means that if you want to use a monitor, you will either lose the ability to use the camera's lcd screen (so not touch to focus or any touchscreen features), or you'll be able to use both but won't be able to record internally so you'll need a monitor that has a recording option such as the Atomos Ninja V. If I had known about this before buying, I probably wouldn't have bought it.Another flaw is you also lose display screen info once you start recording so your histogram disappears once you hit that record button.One flaw I've never experienced in another camera before until using the R6ii is when you pair this camera with a lens that has Image Stabilization and mount it on a gimbal. It has these weird 1-2 frame micro jitters every few seconds that will ruin your footage. So make sure you turn off the lens IS if using on a gimbal.

product_name: Canon EOS R6 Mark II Mirrorless Camera (Body Only), Full-Frame Hybrid Camera, 24.2 Megapixel CMOS Sensor, Photo and Video Capabilities, Black
description: I upgraded to the R6mk2 from a 5Dmk2 mainly for video capability. My 5D2 left nothing to be desired in the image quality dept. and honestly I’m still more comfortable with it for stills while continuing to familiarize myself with the R6mk2. I still use all of my EF lenses with the Canon branded adapter.Things I like:4K/60 FPS C-Log Video.Amazing autofocus.In Body Image Stabilization (hello again 70-200L non-IS, my old friend)Articulating touch screen (which isn’t that new of a feature, but for me it is).Lightweight/Size.ErgonomicsAwesome low light/high ISO performance.Things I don’t like:Battery life. I can easily kill 1 battery shooting stills for a couple of hours. The exact same battery lasts days in my 5D2.The electronic viewfinder looks and feels unnatural, or unreal, but not in a good way. I’ve learned that I really prefer optical viewfinders.I miss using the top LCD menu on older bodies to set AF type and more importantly ISO! The m.fn menu works but feels too clunky especially while looking through the viewfinder.The Auto ISO feels a bit disjointed more often than not.I’m very happy with the R6mk2 and I’m sure the more familiar I become with it, my dislikes will decrease. It was a nice upgrade and very versatile. I can’t say that it being mirrorless makes any difference in my use case. But for video it blows my 5D out of the water and is a game changer for me.
