I would’ve probably been just as happy with the R8 with the exception of its battery life, or even an APSC crop body, just because of how old the DSLR technology I use is (5Dmk2 primarily and 50D/T3i as a backup bodies).I hated how expensive the EF to RF adapter was but I didn’t want to get a cheap 3rd party one and have it give me problems while shooting.If you’re in the fence coming from an older generation of DSLRs you’ll probably be impressed by the R6mk2.

product_name: SAMSUNG 65-Inch Class Crystal UHD 4K DU7200 Series HDR Smart TV w/Object Tracking Sound Lite, PurColor, Motion Xcelerator, Mega Contrast, Q-Symphony (UN65DU7200, 2024 Model)
description: Bottom line up front: great picture, everything else sucks.When we purchased this TV, I was excited. Picture quality was great. But things started going south pretty quickly. The remote is wonky. You click a button and nothing happens, you try again, and nothing. You contort yourself to get different angles and finally it scrolls forward or raises the volume or whatever you wanted. But then it keeps going, like it stored all those button presses and ran them all at once. It is marginally better using my phone app to do these things.  It has the same problem only less often. The problem with the app is that sometimes it randomly severs the connection and you can’t turn it on. It then wants you to go through a whole diagnostic process which took about 15 minutes. Unplug it, plug it back in, check the WiFi, check some other crap. I am starting to get nostalgic for the days when I got up pushed the button on the tv to turn it on, turn the channel with a knob, even old tube tvs which took a few seconds to warm up are faster than this crap sometimes.The external speaker feature is also crap. I have a home theater than is a few years old, that works perfectly on my old tv or when I listen to music via Bluetooth, but only randomly works with this tv. We will be watching, and it works great. Turn off the tv and turn it on later and no sound. Play with the settings for a while and eventually you just use the tv speakers. But the next time you turn it on, it decided to use the home theater and maybe sound comes through the home theater but mostly it doesn’t. Their tech support is useless here. They have a list of algorithms for you to walk through, and when those don’t work, they give up and tell you it’s not the TV but the home theater. Finally the “Smart” features are anything but Smart. Trying to add apps, put them on the screen in some semblance of order is not intuitive with this machine. This is such an ugly process that I guess enough people complained, that tech support actually has an effective algorithm that they can help you set it up. I recommend that you write it down, because next month when you want to add Hulu, and put it on your screen in a convenient place, you’ll need to call again to wind your way through the process.

product_name: SAMSUNG 65-Inch Class Crystal UHD 4K DU7200 Series HDR Smart TV w/Object Tracking Sound Lite, PurColor, Motion Xcelerator, Mega Contrast, Q-Symphony (UN65DU7200, 2024 Model)
description: Samsungs great, the tv is amazing and the features are insane buuuttt, the shipping service used is a joke. NSD held it in the warehouseSitting still forever and delivered it by rented a moving truck from the uhaul company.. could have made it weeks earlier but no. Use your local search engine.. the ironery of the company name, "none stop shipping"Buy from walliworld instead, 3 days u got it, not 3weeks over due

product_name: SAMSUNG 65-Inch Class Crystal UHD 4K DU7200 Series HDR Smart TV w/Object Tracking Sound Lite, PurColor, Motion Xcelerator, Mega Contrast, Q-Symphony (UN65DU7200, 2024 Model)
description: The female delivery person literally exuded hatred. The man was all smiles and handshakes. I hooked the TV up and it works great except that I can in no way get it to hook up to my JBL 2.1 soundbar. I tried Arc, HDMI and Bluetooth since the TV has no Optical output I could not try that. The remote is intuitive and easy to use. It literally holds your hand through the entire setup process. The picture is amazing. I was a little gun shy on this purchase since my last 59" Samsung lasted 18 months and now just goes through a power on loop.

product_name: SAMSUNG 65-Inch Class Crystal UHD 4K DU7200 Series HDR Smart TV w/Object Tracking Sound Lite, PurColor, Motion Xcelerator, Mega Contrast, Q-Symphony (UN65DU7200, 2024 Model)
description: The remote control is horrible I’m a senior citizen and can barely see the remote laying on the table and to try to read the buttons on it,is rediculous. There isn’t a decent owner manual to help me understand how to use the remote. If it wasn’t such a hassle to get someone back here to package it back up, I would send it back.

product_name: SAMSUNG 65-Inch Class Crystal UHD 4K DU7200 Series HDR Smart TV w/Object Tracking Sound Lite, PurColor, Motion Xcelerator, Mega Contrast, Q-Symphony (UN65DU7200, 2024 Model)
description: I like that the TV was delivered on time and the delivery guys were very friendly upon arrival however what I don't like about is the fact that no matter much you adjust the brightness it's like the TV still shows goo dark for my liking, I aslo love how it shows in HD, maybe it will take some time to get use too.

product_name: SAMSUNG 65-Inch Class Crystal UHD 4K DU7200 Series HDR Smart TV w/Object Tracking Sound Lite, PurColor, Motion Xcelerator, Mega Contrast, Q-Symphony (UN65DU7200, 2024 Model)
description: I bought this TV after my last samsung flat screen died after 10 years. The image looks nice, but every app (youtube, rumble, prime, hulu) is littered with bugs and problems. Everything from crashes, hangs, freezing for 10 seconds, videos don't display at the correct size, etc... Also, the remote doesn't respond half the time you press a button. I don't think samsung or the developers of apps for their smart tv platform have any quality control whatsoever.

product_name: SAMSUNG 65-Inch Class Crystal UHD 4K DU7200 Series HDR Smart TV w/Object Tracking Sound Lite, PurColor, Motion Xcelerator, Mega Contrast, Q-Symphony (UN65DU7200, 2024 Model)
description: First one didn't work. Plugged in and title screen came up then everything went black. New one came no problem. Biggest issue was with amazon pick up. Finally had to do myself thru Amazon using a third party. Took 3 tries to get them to come to right address even after explaining during the return request that the delivery was made to a temp address due to buying a house and need the pick up to happen at my current address

product_name: SAMSUNG 65-Inch Class Crystal UHD 4K DU7200 Series HDR Smart TV w/Object Tracking Sound Lite, PurColor, Motion Xcelerator, Mega Contrast, Q-Symphony (UN65DU7200, 2024 Model)
description: Disappointed that I have a really good sound system I can't hitch it up to the TV and in the ad it does not tell you that you can't have a sound system added to the speaker that's on TV itself. The picture is pretty good I have to say that it's good. The other thing is when you switch from Montana TV to any other ones it doesn't have a TV guide either so that's pretty disappointing.

product_name: SAMSUNG 65-Inch Class Crystal UHD 4K DU7200 Series HDR Smart TV w/Object Tracking Sound Lite, PurColor, Motion Xcelerator, Mega Contrast, Q-Symphony (UN65DU7200, 2024 Model)
description: I wanted a standard tv, not a smart tv, maybe I read the listing wrong but to me it didn’t reference this being a smart tv.

product_name: SAMSUNG 65-Inch Class Crystal UHD 4K DU7200 Series HDR Smart TV w/Object Tracking Sound Lite, PurColor, Motion Xcelerator, Mega Contrast, Q-Symphony (UN65DU7200, 2024 Model)
description: Great picture, easy setup. The audio went out about a month after buying it.

product_name: SAMSUNG 65-Inch Class Crystal UHD 4K DU7200 Series HDR Smart TV w/Object Tracking Sound Lite, PurColor, Motion Xcelerator, Mega Contrast, Q-Symphony (UN65DU7200, 2024 Model)
description: After researching tvs for a few months, I decided to purchase this Samsung Crystal 4K because I wanted something larger for the distance of my viewing (8-9 feet) and I had a Toshiba 49” 1080hp that’s 5 years old. I made the leap and purchased this. Was delivered fast and up my 16 steps to my porch. TV is great! Easy to unbox by myself and carry inside. Packaging is excellent. Lightweight. I hooked it up immediately and noticed a HUGE difference in quality. The characters from The Hobbit I was watching looked so incredibly almost AI generated. The colors are so vibrant and vivid. I’m a huge gamer and hooked my Xbox up and it made everything so dynamic and better. The quality in picture is there. Some reviews said sound quality is terrible. I think the sound is good. I have a soundbar with an optic cable I haven’t figured out how to connect to this. But I love that I can say goodbye to my ROKU as this has WIFI Connectivity and all my apps are already pre-loaded. My favorite feature is turning the Xbox on with a single button instead of having to go to HDMI port settings and change it that way. Highly recommend.

product_name: SAMSUNG 65-Inch Class Crystal UHD 4K DU7200 Series HDR Smart TV w/Object Tracking Sound Lite, PurColor, Motion Xcelerator, Mega Contrast, Q-Symphony (UN65DU7200, 2024 Model)
description: The Samsung Crystal UHD 55-inch TV is so good, I think I’ve accidentally become a professional binge-watcher. I turned it on once, and I’m pretty sure I haven’t left my couch since. This thing sucks you into content like it’s a portal to another dimension—where Netflix asks, “Are you still watching?” and the answer is always yes.Picture Quality:The 4K resolution is so sharp, I swear I saw every individual pore on an actor’s face during a close-up—though I’m not sure I needed that level of intimacy with my favorite sitcom stars. Colors are so vibrant it feels like a Pixar movie exploded on my wall, and now I can’t go back to reality. Seriously, the grass on this TV looks greener than my lawn, and now I think my grass is just being lazy.Sound:The built-in speakers are surprisingly good! But do they make me feel guilty about not upgrading to a soundbar? Of course. It's like the TV is whispering, “I’m good, but imagine how much better I could be...” Sneaky.Smart Features:It’s got all the apps you can dream of—Netflix, Disney+, HBO, and about 12 others I didn't even know existed. My Roku looked at this TV, packed its bags, and left because it knew it wasn’t needed anymore. Also, the remote is so sleek that I lost it within 20 minutes, but it felt like a good excuse to try Samsung’s phone app remote control—turns out, that works like a charm too.Verdict:This TV has become the MVP of my living room—whether I'm watching a blockbuster or just admiring the menu screen because I can't decide what to watch. It's elegant, ridiculously clear, and smarter than me (but that's not saying much).5/5 stars! Just be warned: once you turn it on, you may find yourself saying, “Just one more episode” until 3 AM rolls around... at which point the Crystal UHD is still looking perfect, and you’re looking like a raccoon with no regrets. 🦝

product_name: SAMSUNG 65-Inch Class Crystal UHD 4K DU7200 Series HDR Smart TV w/Object Tracking Sound Lite, PurColor, Motion Xcelerator, Mega Contrast, Q-Symphony (UN65DU7200, 2024 Model)
description: The first TV I received had a cracked screen similar to other reviewers. The crack was significant and located at the bottom of the TV. The shipping box was fine and the delivery driver was very careful (they handed the box to me). I immediately contacted Amazon and they shipped me a new one the next day. The new one is connected and its working fine with an excellent picture. Setup was very easy. I'm worried, though, whether the TV is extremely fragile or if the damaged one was the result of poor quality control. Time will tell. For now, I'm pleased with my purchase and very impressed with Amazon's excellent service. Four stars instead of five due to the hassle of dealing with the damaged TV.

product_name: SAMSUNG 65-Inch Class Crystal UHD 4K DU7200 Series HDR Smart TV w/Object Tracking Sound Lite, PurColor, Motion Xcelerator, Mega Contrast, Q-Symphony (UN65DU7200, 2024 Model)
description: So easy to set up, did it just by myself.  Able to lift out of box, attached my Roku Device, plug in and turn on.  Everything transferred over from my old Samsung.  Very happy with picture and sound quality.  Customer service was great....the first one delivered had a cracked crystal....no problem, they exchanged and sent labels for the return and UPS picked up.....received my replacement quickly and there was no charge to my credit card....when they received the return they just consider original transaction complete.  I was very happy to get a slightly larger Samsung smart tv from my previous Samsung which worked very well though the screen was going dark at top and bottom....it was in service from January 2013!  This current model is very nicely priced too.....compared to the 2013 model.  Love Samsung TV quality.

product_name: SAMSUNG 65-Inch Class Crystal UHD 4K DU7200 Series HDR Smart TV w/Object Tracking Sound Lite, PurColor, Motion Xcelerator, Mega Contrast, Q-Symphony (UN65DU7200, 2024 Model)
description: Bought this TV for our home movie theater room to replace an 11 year old LED projector.  Amazing TV.  I can't believe how far TV tech has advanced in my lifetime (45 years old).  I went with Samsung because our other smart TVs in the house are also Samsung, which means my family members all know how to use and navigate the same user interface software.  I watched Thursday Night Football on it on Amazon Prime the other night and it was so immersive and beautiful.  So much more vibrant and sharp than a projector.I also recommend the Echogear tilting wall mount for TVs up to 90" if you will be hanging it on a wall.  It was easy to install myself.  The TV weight is about 72 pounds, so I was able to lift it from the middle, my 13 year old daughter on the left, my wife on the right to balance it steady, and it hangs right on the wall mount and snaps into place very easy.  Just take your time, follow the instructions, have at least 1 person to help you lift/mount, and you'll be good to go.  I loved the price, too.  Hope this review helps you out!

product_name: SAMSUNG 65-Inch Class Crystal UHD 4K DU7200 Series HDR Smart TV w/Object Tracking Sound Lite, PurColor, Motion Xcelerator, Mega Contrast, Q-Symphony (UN65DU7200, 2024 Model)
description: This tv arrived intact .  After setup, the TV is working as it should,  no problems with the remote and the screen wasn't broken or cracked.  Clear, beautiful picture.  Great value for the price.  Everything works as it should and I love this tv!

product_name: SAMSUNG 65-Inch Class Crystal UHD 4K DU7200 Series HDR Smart TV w/Object Tracking Sound Lite, PurColor, Motion Xcelerator, Mega Contrast, Q-Symphony (UN65DU7200, 2024 Model)
description: I'm loving my new Samsung tv. Great picture, Great price. Everything connects seamlessly. Plugged it in and it started setting itself up. I might invest in the smart things, they seem very cool how they can turn on and off lights etc.

product_name: SAMSUNG 65-Inch Class Crystal UHD 4K DU7200 Series HDR Smart TV w/Object Tracking Sound Lite, PurColor, Motion Xcelerator, Mega Contrast, Q-Symphony (UN65DU7200, 2024 Model)
description: Purchased the 65" for under $500. I like that Samsung TV makes it easy to watch free TV like national news. Setup was easy with wifi or ethernet cable. The remote isnt great. Coming from a Roku premier with radio, having to point the IR remote is annoying. I was also surpised it didnt have a voice search button. It works with Samsung Smart Things and has a smartphone remote option. It paired nicely with my Denon AVR to get 5.1 surround sound using HDMI Arc after an audio setting change. The first one came smashed which was dissapointing, but easily replaced. They picked up the return insted of having to drop it off.

product_name: SAMSUNG 65-Inch Class Crystal UHD 4K DU7200 Series HDR Smart TV w/Object Tracking Sound Lite, PurColor, Motion Xcelerator, Mega Contrast, Q-Symphony (UN65DU7200, 2024 Model)
description: My intention was to mount it on a stand but unfortunately, this television  is not mountable.Again, Samsung could do better adding a better remote control to the item instead of that flimsy one that came with it.

product_name: SAMSUNG 65-Inch Class Crystal UHD 4K DU7200 Series HDR Smart TV w/Object Tracking Sound Lite, PurColor, Motion Xcelerator, Mega Contrast, Q-Symphony (UN65DU7200, 2024 Model)
description: Always wanted to purchase a Samsung product...but it has mostly been too beyond my budget. Could shoot myself in the foot this time...up-graded from a Vizio 36" Smart TV to a Samsung 50"...and it still under sized the item I should have at my age of 76 and resulting eyesight and hearing! Next time!Anyway, the unit is awesome with its narrow border (perimeter) and picture and send are spot on. We opted for ROKU, Netflix and local service...cut the cord and order a la carte when needed! For us as readers from the local library mostly, this arrangement made sense.Thanks, Amazing AMAZON!

product_name: Epson EcoTank ET-4800 Wireless All-in-One Cartridge-Free Supertank Printer with Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF and Ethernet – Ideal-for Your Home Office, White
description: I bought this printer via amazon and had high hopes to free myself of the expensive ink with other brands of printers.  but there was something wrong with it when trying to set it up.  Called Epson customer service and after several minutes they said it had a defective hardware issue and could not be fixed by phone support.  they connected me to warranty dept.  Incredibly, the warranty department put every conceivable obstacle in the way to honoring warranty.  they wanted the Amazon reciept, which they made me take a scree shot of and send them.  then once i did that, they said that wasn't acceptable as it didn't show if it came from 3rd party seller. I said. "what difference does that make".  the reciept showed me as the purchaser, the exact product description and date of purchase and delivery and amount paid.  what else more did they need.  So after 20 minutes of back and forth with Epson on this, they said they'd accept the Amazon reciept.  so then they were going to send me another if i sent the defective one  back first.  I didn't trust that as if i sent it back without the replacement first, and then they just neve sent the replacement, i'd be SOL.  so they said they would charge my credit card the amount of the defective printer and mail me the replacement first and issue me a credit when the defective one got to them.  but then they said i was giving them invalid credit card info and they could not process warranty claim.  I knew the credit card info was accurate and called Discover customer service on another line and put them and Epson customer service on speaker phone to basically create a 3 way call.  Discover said that the Epson person was inputing address incorrectly and thats why it was getting rejected. Epson had my full printed address from Amazon reciept and the Discover representative and myself repeated the address to the Epson rep again to him verbally.  but he still said he could not process warranty claim and that we were giving him wrong address.  In summation after two hours, it became plain Epson refused to honor their warranty by all these fake receipt and address issues that did not exist.  I ended up calling Amazon and explained all this to them and how Epson kept me on the phone for two hours and would not honor warranty.  so Amazon took it back.  So i am returning it to them.  So for me, I will never buy an epson product ever again. they refuse to honor their warranty.  defective right out of the box and all the above occurs.  Since it never worked from day one, i can't clearly rate product features, etc.  but  buy this brand at your own risk.  If you do buy it, make sure you get it from a retailer who will stand behind you as Epson surely will not.

product_name: Epson EcoTank ET-4800 Wireless All-in-One Cartridge-Free Supertank Printer with Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF and Ethernet – Ideal-for Your Home Office, White
description: I have used Epson products for years, and have never been disappointed.  This time I am sorry for the poor choice I made.  I went for this one because I thought it would suit all my needs, and it was a good price.  I LOVE the ink tank feature, and I think I will save a lot of money with refills.  I like the ease of refilling the paper and printing via WiFi.  What I am disappointed with:1- the document feed for the scanner is very fussy. If the source document is even a 1/32" too wide, it jams. I have to unjam it, and trim to continue.  And if I am scanning a lengthy doc, it is frustrating.2-  It will not save my scans to a thumb drive. Even better, it would be great if I could figure out how to save to a folder via WiFi.3- The print quality is not great.  If this was a critical issue for me, I would be totally frustrated.4-  Navigations and settings are not intuitive for me. It takes forever for me to figure out how to enlarge or reduce my copy.My next purchase will be made in person at the brick and morter, so I can see and feel the functions.

product_name: Epson EcoTank ET-4800 Wireless All-in-One Cartridge-Free Supertank Printer with Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF and Ethernet – Ideal-for Your Home Office, White
description: This is my second Epson Eco Tank printer I’ve owned. We bought this one to replace the last one. I own a small business and print a lot (correspondence, invoices etc). I might even do a photo or two with pretty good results. They have a 6 color version which I’m sure would do an excellent job on photos. The problem I have with the Epson printers is they have a counter on there Eco Tank printers that shuts down the printer when it hits a number claiming it needs to have a head wiper changed and counter reset. The last print we made on the old printer was perfect. The printer said to contact Epson for service which I did and was told that the printer was out of warranty and they would not service it. But I could try a third party authorized service company. I did and they quoted a higher price than the printer cost. There were several page chip reset claiming to be able to reset the counter to zero. I tried one and it did not work. I called there customer service and they tried by walking through the process but it didn’t work. They reluctantly gave me a refund. I couldn’t wait to research other printers so I bought another Epson Eco Tank. It was a good think this issue happened when it did because we were considering to buy the 11 x 17 version that cost around a thousand dollars. I’ll need to do some research before we need another printer. Unfortunately we just had to throw the perfectly fine Epson Eco Tank printer, except for the print count chip in the trash.

product_name: Epson EcoTank ET-4800 Wireless All-in-One Cartridge-Free Supertank Printer with Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF and Ethernet – Ideal-for Your Home Office, White
description: I purchased this after reading the reviews that people were having problems connecting the wireless internet and it was true unfortunately. I watch countless videos and called Canon company for assistance but they were unable to assist. So I ended up having to return it but it would have been a great printer had that not been the problem.

product_name: Epson EcoTank ET-4800 Wireless All-in-One Cartridge-Free Supertank Printer with Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF and Ethernet – Ideal-for Your Home Office, White
description: Replaced older model assuming it would be better and plug and play! WRONG!  It was a frustrating nightmare to set up adding multiple drivers adding apps took me 6 hours.  It came with a CD that the instructions said would add all I needed! Nobody uses CDs today.  I finally got it to wifi print and scan. But I still haven’t gotten it to do a pdf scan which was simple on the old one I scrapped!  Tried to get help from Epson with zero results.  They never responded.  I’m very unhappy with Epson and this 4800!

product_name: Epson EcoTank ET-4800 Wireless All-in-One Cartridge-Free Supertank Printer with Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF and Ethernet – Ideal-for Your Home Office, White
description: Just know when you buy this printer and you have set up problems, which I did, customer service people are paid by the phone call.  Their goal is to get you off the phone as soon as possible so they can answer another call and it's very obvious.  It doesn't matter if your problem is resolved or not.  Very bad on the part of Epson.  You can hear Shaquille O'neil recordings while you're on hold.  After 3 times calling customer service for help, I was able to get someone who stayed on the line to actually help.  She admitted to me they are paid by the number of phone calls they handle and not the problems they resolve.  If I knew this I wouldn't have bought an Epson.  The only reason I did buy an Epson was due to the ink tanks.  Hopefully the ink tanks pay off because their customer service certainly did not.

product_name: Epson EcoTank ET-4800 Wireless All-in-One Cartridge-Free Supertank Printer with Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF and Ethernet – Ideal-for Your Home Office, White
description: I have to say, this product prints nicely and sips ink. I appreciate that. I also appreciate the affordability of the ink when looking to refill. Now, it worked flawlessly on a specific network for a month and a half, and then suddenly the network disappeared. I thought this was a fluke since my laptop, cell phone, and all of my other devices detected the network and functioned fine on it. I reset the printer back to factory settings and the network still would not show up. Using the app on my phone to set the printer up the app said that the printer did not detect the network my phone was on. I did not change any settings on my router. Nor did I change any settings on my printer. My printer is less than 6 feet away from my router. This was very upsetting because I wasted two hours of my time when I was supposed to be working to fix this problem. I finally settled on a network one of my other printers is on, which is inconvenient. I was trying to keep the two separate because there are people who live in my house who do not know how to switch between printers... The inconvenience, stress, frustration, etc knocked two stars off of this printer. It's really a shame. It has so many other positive things about it.

product_name: Epson EcoTank ET-4800 Wireless All-in-One Cartridge-Free Supertank Printer with Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF and Ethernet – Ideal-for Your Home Office, White
description: Everything about this printer is cheap and flimsy and it is difficult to work with.I got it to replace an Epson XP-830 only because that printer's overflow ink reservoir was full.  There is no comparison in the build quality of the two printers.  The ET-4800 looks and feels like a cheap toy.  And then there are problems setting up and using the machine.First, the instructions say that the printer will automatically find your wireless network and connect once you put in the password, and the instructions also say you don't need the app for this.  My unit did not locate the wireless network.  It led me through the fax set up and then stopped setting up.  I had to go into the control panel to find the wifi instructions and then connect manually.  Furthermore, there was no guidance on how to switch among upper case letters, lower case letters and numbers and symbols in the set up when entering the password.  It was trial and error before I figured out how to do this.  All very frustrating.And entering my password was hampered by the fact that the control panel is far too small, as other reviewers have noted.  The control panel is difficult to see with for anyone with poor reading vision.  I had to use glasses with a strong magnification.The printer does not come with a usb cable, rather cheap of Epson I thought.  So if you like a wired connection to your computer, as I do to avoid the vagaries of a wifi connection, you have to provide one yourself.Unlike my Epson 830, the 4800 loads paper from the rear only.  This limits where you can locate the printer.  I have my 830 under my desk but that is an awkward location for a rear loading machine and I will now have to do some rearranging to be able to place the 4800 printer on my desk.There is no automatic access to the printer's output tray.  You have to pull it out and close it manually.  The paper load and the output tray both seem very flimsy and I wonder how long it will be before they break.There is no automatic two-sided printing.  After setting the two-side option through your computer you have to manually turn over the paper for printing on the second side.  Epson should do better than this at such price for a printer.In designing this printer I have the impression that Epson looked for ways to cut costs to make up for the fact that, at least as they claim, you will use less ink than on cartridge models.  Ink is where manufacturers have traditionally made money, which allowed them to keep the costs of printers down.  Now, with more efficient ink usage it seems that Epson are cost-cutting on the printers themselves.I cannot recommend this printer.  But then again, I'm sure I'd say the same thing about most other eco models.PS. I would now add that the printer is extremely slow.  I timed the last page that I printed and it didn't have much text.  It took one minute and forty-four seconds to print!!

product_name: Epson EcoTank ET-4800 Wireless All-in-One Cartridge-Free Supertank Printer with Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF and Ethernet – Ideal-for Your Home Office, White
description: I am disappointed that the scanner is so bad.  The ink filling process is easy if you follow directions.  The printouts are nice quality.  Software is easy to use.  However, if you want to scan, do not buy this product, it will drive you nuts.  The quality of scan is poor, and that is only if you can get the ADF to work, because it jams half the time.  Since most things are digital now, I think scanning is almost as important as printing.  Single side scans only, no double sided scans.

product_name: Epson EcoTank ET-4800 Wireless All-in-One Cartridge-Free Supertank Printer with Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF and Ethernet – Ideal-for Your Home Office, White
description: I really like the level of ink that the ECO tank offers. However, the print quality is awful! The left picture is the Epson printer and right picture is my former HP printer, as you can see the HP printer has better print quality. The first pic is a copy print of the original page and the second print is downloaded from my iPhone.

product_name: Epson EcoTank ET-4800 Wireless All-in-One Cartridge-Free Supertank Printer with Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF and Ethernet – Ideal-for Your Home Office, White
description: Printer Review from an Artist.Printer cost with a 3-year extended warranty - $199.00.  Came with four full bottles of Ink.  Each bottle was huge, and enough to completely fill up the tanks.  In my old Epson printer that used Epson 127 Ink Cartridges a cartridge held 8ml of ink.  The cost per cartridge for the XL Black was $31.00 on Amazon.  In comparison, a bottle of ink for the tank printer costs $15.00 and holds 65ml.  The Epson 127 Ink Cartridge is rated at 175 pages for the XL cartridge and the Tank Printer is rated at 4500 pages per bottle of ink.  So, the difference in cost is striking.Unboxing the printer was simple enough.  The printer weighs about half the weight of my old Epson printer.  The new printer does not have printer drawers but, back feed only.  This actually worked out well for me since I was constantly taking the paper in out and out of the drawers when changing paper size.  Also, with this direct paper feed, I figure it will handle my heavier weight card stock paper that I use for my art and greeting cards.  To my great surprise, the printer offers two-sided printing.  This is really handy when printing my Zines.  The printer setup was extremely easy as they recommend a phone app, that walks you through each step with pictures.  And it communicated perfectly with the phone for the setup.  It takes about 15 minutes to completely set up the printer. I have learned to not rush setup.  Take your time, and follow the instructions step by step, Which include filling the tanks.Features,* The printer dues Dual-Sided Print - Great for zines.* It has fax capability, but we do not have a landline, so that will not be used.* It does copying, with a document feeder or you can lift the feeder and place the document on the glass.* I mostly use my Epson Precision San copier but it is nice if you wish to make a quick copy of a document.* Some reviews complained about the very small LED display but I find that by using the app or computer I can control all that I need to do.Print Alignment.  I did this test but the printer heads did not require any alignment.During the setup process, the program installs the printer driver on my computer.  However I found it to be the very basic driver, and I went to the Epson Website and downloaded and installed the latest driver which is very robust and has all the settings that I needed.The printer's footprint is smaller than my old printer. And my old printer had two paper drawers, though I never used the second drawer.Negatives.The output tray is flimsy and seems like it would easily break if bumped when I walked past the printer, so I have to be careful about this.So far I do not see a way of checking the ink levels from the computer.  And they said in the instructions to be sure to check your ink levels.  You can see on the front of the printer, where you can see the ink levels.  When you purchase more ink, you can attach the bottle and it will not overfill the tanks, and you can then use more ink from the bottle later.  So I will purchase a complete set of ink and keep it and as it runs low with about 1/4 left in the tank, I will just fill it up.So far I am very happy with the investment and now printing and ink cost is not a major factor.  And I figure I will do a lot of printing with this printer when the holiday season rolls around for my greeting cards.As for print quality, I will need to report on this later, though there were no negative reviews of print quality.  A test print on regular paper and the colors seemed to be spot on.One note, I still will continue to use my Canon Pro-300 Wide Printer for my Fine Art Prints, but the new Tank Printer will be my studio workhorse.

product_name: Epson EcoTank ET-4800 Wireless All-in-One Cartridge-Free Supertank Printer with Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF and Ethernet – Ideal-for Your Home Office, White
description: I was replacing an HP that made me crazy, though I did like the scanner. It was easy to install and adding the ink to each tank was easy, just match the ink color to the tank color. It works well. There is a learning curve to the software as it wanted everything on the "cloud", NO I said. Also the rollers on the scanner are cheap, it will take a couple of sheets, I've done up to 4 sheets. The rollers tend to jam the paper pushing originals thru. I was displeased with this and the scanning software was the cloud again, at the bottom you can chose a folder to save to, also I used the ADF feed instead of default (or glasstop is ok), and the box (click) where you can choose to add a page or save will bring up a second screen for choices. I like that it is a space saver, half the size of the other one. Yes I am pleased with its operation. Wished the scanner was more sturdy, I scan a lot. Its about $50 to replace the ink for all carts. Its a good product.

product_name: Epson EcoTank ET-4800 Wireless All-in-One Cartridge-Free Supertank Printer with Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF and Ethernet – Ideal-for Your Home Office, White
description: This multi-function machine is just what I have needed for years! It is compact, user friendly and well made.I love the idea of the Eco-tank and expect that it will save big bucks in the future. They should all be this way!When I think of all of the ink cartridges that I have bought through the years, I'll be so happy to never waste my money on another one ever again.It does a good job on all functions. I can't say how long it will last, so I am buying another one now just in case I won't be able to get another in the future.

product_name: Epson EcoTank ET-4800 Wireless All-in-One Cartridge-Free Supertank Printer with Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF and Ethernet – Ideal-for Your Home Office, White
description: The GOOD --I bought this printer because I wanted to produce t-shirts with artwork by the dye sublimation process.  As compared to the method using applique sheets adhered to fabric, dye-sub infiltrates the dyes into fabric fibers, producing a comfortable, durable, washable shirt.  Once functional, this printer does this very nicely. You can also decorate ceramic mugs and other hard surface objects with this process.Be aware that the ink that comes in the package is NOT dye-sub ink - you need to order it separately. Both types of ink are quite inexpensive compared to typical photo-printer ink tanks. Filling the printers ink tanks is a neat, mess-free process.  The ink bottles seal onto the tank inlets, and fill them by gravity.The NOT SO GOODInstalling the print driver was not a smooth process.  Wi-fi connection is recommended, but USB or wired ethernet are also possible.  Entering my router password on the tiny viewing screen on the printer was difficult. It took me a while to realize that there is a three-way shift button for upper case, lower case, and number/symbol.  After managing to enter the password the first time, I touched the physical 'OK' button on the printer front -- WRONG -- that made me start over again.  Instead there is secondary 'OK' button on the tiny screen.  On the third try, the printer screen indicated successful Wi-fi connection.Then I tried to proceed with the driver installation on my Windows 11 computer. After "searching for printers" for a minute or so, the software reported "NO PRINTER FOUND".  I then connected a wired ethernet cable, and tried again -- "NO PRINTER FOUND".  I found the tech support phone number (a good thing), but it was Sunday, so that was not an option.  I rebooted everything, and ran the driver installation again, with same result.Then I looked in Windows settings, saw the ET-4800 printer listed, and printed a test page -- successfully!  The printer has functioned fine so far since then. A few more details in the installation instructions would have saved me a lot of frustration.The print-head alignment process is also done on the tiny screen.  Why not have this on the computer screen instead?In summary -- excellent printer, software installation process needs improvement.

product_name: Epson EcoTank ET-4800 Wireless All-in-One Cartridge-Free Supertank Printer with Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF and Ethernet – Ideal-for Your Home Office, White
description: I've had probably a dozen printers, mostly laser printers, in our home the last 20 or more years. All the printers we've owned have been fine; nothing special but they all did a decent job.  I tried an ink cartridge color printer but found the color poor and the cartridges short lived.But the Epson ET-4800 printer is a pleasant surprise.PROS:It's reasonably priced.The ink tank technology is great. After 2 months and approximately 400 pages, (about 80% pages with color) the black ink tank is still over 50% full and the color tanks are over 80% full.I had no setup problem at all. It took less than 30 minutes.The standard color is fine for handouts and presentation. The high resolution color is fair to good photo quality.The black and white printing is fast enough for me, and the same for standard color printing.CONS:The display screen is small, but I have not found this to be a problem.Printing on both sides is not automatic, but I've worked around this.There is no paper tray; you have to load the paper from the rear and it holds about 50 24lb sheets. For someone doing higher volume work this could be a problem.The printer makes a real racket while printing, even with my very poor hearing. No printing late at night. This is the only real issue with me.Again, I'm very pleased with this printer. It fits my needs.

product_name: Epson EcoTank ET-4800 Wireless All-in-One Cartridge-Free Supertank Printer with Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF and Ethernet – Ideal-for Your Home Office, White
description: This printer is both a workhorse and great on ink consumption. I have printed stickers, pictures, flyers, and vinyl with no issues and no jamming. Plus the ink refills are some of the cheapest I've seen. I got this on the Amazon Prime Days July sale so it was less expensive than the more basic Epson Eco Tanks, otherwise I wouldn't have sprung for the 4800, but I'm glad I did.

product_name: Epson EcoTank ET-4800 Wireless All-in-One Cartridge-Free Supertank Printer with Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF and Ethernet – Ideal-for Your Home Office, White
description: I had used an Epson printer for years with the eco tank feature. Got lots of good use from it. The new eco tank fill is even better than the original. It was always an economical option… it is less messy now. Here is the reason for this post. If you are planning this for a home office you need to note two “shortcomings”. First, there is no paper tray. You load from the back of the printer and it only holds a minimum amount of sheets if paper. While it does print wirelessly, you may run out of paper quickly. The second issue may not bother you, but while you can do two sided printing, you cannot do it remotely as the paper has to be re-inserted manually. My previous printer had a paper tray and auto two sided printing features and was a dream to use. If you are looking for these features, Epson does make a model that has them… just not this one.

product_name: Epson EcoTank ET-4800 Wireless All-in-One Cartridge-Free Supertank Printer with Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF and Ethernet – Ideal-for Your Home Office, White
description: Bottom line - I'm happy with the printer.  HOWEVER, it took me 2 hours to set it up.  I read every word in the instructions, and followed them carefully.  I would have called for help, but there is NO support on Saturday or Sunday.  I submitted a return request to Amazon and had the QR code ready for returning the printer.  Then I tried once more to turn off and turn on the router.  That did it! Finally both the laptop and the cell phone found the printer.  Scanner works.  Printing works.  I can change settings.  All good.  During setup, as requested, I had run an update to the firmware, and that required a reset of the router, though it never told me that.  It worked out but it REALLY should have been easier.

product_name: Epson EcoTank ET-4800 Wireless All-in-One Cartridge-Free Supertank Printer with Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF and Ethernet – Ideal-for Your Home Office, White
description: Anxious to try this printer which I purchased for $200 for several reasons. For one, the tanks, when filled are supposed to last for a year or more. Refills for all colors are around $50. The refill package for cartridges on my HP were $90, and they don’t last near as long (so far), even though the color cartridges were rarely used.Two gripes keep this a four star rating. Printing on both sides requires manually turning the sheets of paper over, you select the feature before printing on HP. The other gripe is the info screen on the printer. It is literally the size of a postage stamp and is very difficult to see and even harder to make selections on. I knew this before purchasing but thought the Epson phone app was designed to duplicate the screen, therefore making the physical screen size irrelevant. Wrong.HP now makes a refillable tank model and I would have to consider it. , knowing what I know now. The Epson has a smaller footprint, prints well, but doesn’t seem to be as sturdily made. Also, the paper feed precludes automatic printing on both sides.

product_name: Epson EcoTank ET-4800 Wireless All-in-One Cartridge-Free Supertank Printer with Scanner, Copier, Fax, ADF and Ethernet – Ideal-for Your Home Office, White
description: The Epson ET4800 model:  I have only one complaint. This printer does not truly do two-sided printing, and I don't consider a manual two-sided printing true two-sided printing. This will cost you in some paper. You don't find out till you have setup your printer's software just how it works.On the plus side; This printer produces a sharp clean print, wonderful color photos. It seems to print at a comfortable speed. I was able to set it up on three P/C's in under 35 minutes nice!The paper table is a little flimsy; so you don't want to get it in your way moving about. I keep a light towel over the printer when not in use, for it is kind of open to dust.I would recommend this printer too anyone looking for an inexpensive printer that really is environmentally friendly. It is also very easy to use in home.

product_name: Meeting Owl 4+ 360-Degree, 4K Smart Video Conference Camera, Microphone, and Speaker (Automatic Speaker Focus, Smart Zooming, and Noise Equalizing)
description: It costs more than the 3 which surprised me but If you are buying either one just spend the extra money for the 4+. I use this for all hands and the most complaints came from the 3s camera quality. I'm a happy IT guy after upgrading to the 4+!

product_name: HP DeskJet 4255e Wireless All-in-One Color Inkjet Printer, Scanner, Copier, Best-for-Home, 3 Months of Ink Included (588S6A)
description: UPDATE 4/28/2024:Although this printer was beyond the return period from Amazon, after I got the replacement printer which still was not working, I told HP that I did not want anything to do with that printer model and that I was requesting either a full refund or a different model printer.They offered me a credit towards a different model but wanted me to pay the difference. At that point, I did not want to invest any extra money in a HP printer so asked for the refund.The HP Escalation Team was very reasonable and communicated with me throughout the whole process of sending me a check for the exact amount I originally paid to Amazon and then asking me to send back the original printer and just discarding the defective replacement.This took a lot of phone calls from me to get to the Escalation Team  but I was so done at that point once the replacement was not even working. So, I stand by the original review to AVOID this printer but HP does have excellent customer service and, in this case, they did everything I requested to make this situation right and give me some closure.I wouldn't write off HP as a company but maybe get a less flimsy and completely inept model. If you do get really stuck, contact HP because they did do their best to find a resolution and genuinely seemed to care after I kept insisting for a refund or different model printer.If you do contact HP with any issues, I recommend asking for a supervisor or referral for your case to the escalation team if it's something really serious or frustrating. Typically, you have to deal with customer service via a chat platform but you can request a supervisor there.The empathy I received from HP helped to defuse the situation and restored my respect for the company. Technically, I was beyond the return window and HP didn't have to do anything at all, but they listened t my concerns with sincerity. They first tried resolving it by sending a replacement printer and then supported my subsequent decision to get the heck out of Dodge and abandon ship.Thank you, HP! You truly do stand by your core values: "We are a technology company born of the belief that companies should do more than just make a profit. They should make the world a better place."=================================================ORIGINAL REVIEW FROM EASTER 2024:This is the worst printer I have ever bought in my entire life! The first model had the top snap off from the tiny plastic hinge which held it, then I contacted tech support for HP and was told by the representative that they couldn't help me since it was a "customer induced" problem!I attached pictures; you can see the one cheap plastic that is supposed to bear all of the weight of the heavy cover -- feels like at least 2 pounds as it's lifted up and down.Then I explained that was inappropriate, accusing me of basically breaking the printer on purpose and calling me a liar! Finally after another hour of insistence, the representative agreed to send me a replacement printer which I JUST GOT delivered on Friday!!!Now it is EASTER SUNDAY and was just trying to photocopy a simple document to bring with me to the family gathering and am spending it with HP support again -- they want to troubleshoot why there are BLINKING RED ERROR LIGHTS and the printer keeps making humming sounds, moving around, not printing or photocopy, and now none of the buttons do anything when I press them! I contacted support, requesting a REFUND or a DIFFERENT MODEL and the representative just keeps saying they want to "troubleshoot" and do technical support!!!I never wrote a bad review on Amazon like this after almost 20 years of ordering on here. But this is RIDICULOUS, I never had so many ISSUE because of a PRINTER! No wonder why Amazon is offering it right now for 40% off, down to $60 from the $99 I paid for it!!!  DO NOT GET THIS PRINTER, you will REGRET IT.. It is Easter and I am just so frustrated by this device!Why can I not click the PHOTOCOPY button like I have with every other printer I ever owned in my life and watch the printer spit out a simple black and white page?Even the PIXMA which I had for over 5 years never did this, and that seemed pretty cheaply made too! But the cover never broke off, and it never let me down! I've had DELL, BROTHER, CANON, EPSON.. none of them had the cover bust off just from trying to scan a document! Now I just get a replacement and then I can't even make a basic one-page photocopy? And then I have to spend HOURS trying to get support, entering my phone number 5 times to finally get to a live agent?YOU WILL RUE THE DAY YOU BUY THIS PRINTER!!  DO NOT MAKE THE MISTAKE I DID! I am on the verge of just throwing this printer into the DUMPSTER for the satisfaction of being FINISHED with it this complete waste of $100 if HP does not give me a refund or send a different model!!I WISH I BELIEVED THE POOR REVIEWS ON HERE.. they are TRUE! I wish I had listened... please save yourself this complete mental stress and feeling of BETRAYAL that what I thought was a reputable brand, would let me down in SO MANY WAYS!!If you do choose to ignore my warning -- and again I have never left a review like this and do not think I even have left any negative reviews -- then when it BREAKS on you and you realize what a total piece of JUNK this is with its CHEAP lightweight PLASTIC and apparent electronic issues... then just remember this review.. and then you'll be in my position, leaving a negative review.. saying to yourself, "Darn, I really should have listened to that guy... he was RIGHT!"I've had a BROTHER laser printer for five years... it never let me down.. HP has let me down twice now in the space of FIVE MONTHS!Good luck.

product_name: HP DeskJet 4255e Wireless All-in-One Color Inkjet Printer, Scanner, Copier, Best-for-Home, 3 Months of Ink Included (588S6A)
description: Surprised at how many amazing reviews there are yet in my opinion this is one of the cheapest quality printers I've ever used and I wouldnt recommend it if you plan on using it for multiple printing projects or anything more than a one sided page to be printed. Not office friendly or organizational friendly either. It's very light weight, which can be a positive but it's too lightweight that it's clear to see how cheaply it was made. One bump of a baby finger can send the printer flying off the desk. Also it does not have a place to hold the unused paper and the paper you place in the feeder only holds a few or else it gets jammed. There is no easy way to copy front & back of something without waiting until all front sides are printed then you turn the paper over yourself & feed it through again to print. It's not automatic. To make a photocopy is an annoyance too. If copying/scanning from a physical book or paper, you need to make sure you hold the top down the whole time you're copying or else it doesn't work correctly. To install the program onto a laptop or computer with a wifi signal, I was asked numerous times for very sensitive info which had really nothing to do with just installing a printer program. I didn't like that. Also it says you can use it over wifi and without wifi but everytime I try to do it without wifi it has an error/prompt message saying I need wifi to print/scan/copy. Plus no matter what there's always a delay when printing. Instead of immediate printing it takes a few seconds to a few minutes for printing to begin.  I do like though you can click the info button & wifi button on the printer and it tells you if something isn't working correctly and every last detail about the printer and signals and addresses available. Overall it's ok for one single person like a young kid who doesn't need tons of sheets being printed at once or if you don't need front and back often or to be organized like an office setting . If your going to use it like me for homeschooling stuff, office work, and printing photos, I'd say buy a way better one . This is good as a 1st time all in one printer for someone who is on a budget and doesn't care or has the time to do lots of extra steps to print/scan/copy something, as a college kid would. I'm keeping it for now but I don't expect it to last more than a couple months,  if that. .. update after using it for a month.. the ink runs out sooooooo fast its annoying. I replaced the black ink twice and colored ink once already. Definitely wouldn't recommend this

product_name: HP DeskJet 4255e Wireless All-in-One Color Inkjet Printer, Scanner, Copier, Best-for-Home, 3 Months of Ink Included (588S6A)
description: I have mixed feelings about the printer and of HP.After reading many review (in and out of Amazon) and not wanting to spend a lot of money for a printer I thought I found the correct one for personal photography work.After buying the HP 4155e, my first search for that of a manual that I could download and read as I my career taught me to be an information geek.  In other words, I want to know everything about the printer before I touch anything.  The only manual that HP could/would offer is to search for it in 123hp.com each and every time.  One cannot download it and cannot do a any kind of word search!I blame management’s limitations for this and all on a scale of 1 to 5 stars1 starFor sales information, I did not see anywhere of the printer not being able to print borderless.  I may have missed this but I am disappointed of its inability.2 starsOf customer service, they wanted to schedule a time for callback.  I personally am not a big fan of phone calls as I have limited hearing.  During a live chat with an online agent and wanting to answer one simple question, they wanted to hookup to my computer and allow them to take control.  I agreed to this.  What could have been a simple one, two step answer, I spent most of an hour looking for then chatting with the agent to get a simple two line of how to.  Otherwise, they were very good at reassuring that everything was okay.  The rating goes to the supervisors that always require scheduling call or insisting to hook up to one’s computer.The management’s standards 2 starsThe chat agent 5 starsOf the printer.  After some trial and error and reading the quick start booklet and trying several prints it finally started working well.  We shall see how it does on a long term basis.4 starsOf the quality of the printer.  I know I purchased a lower end price printer for some custom color photography work (all for my own gratification) I give the quality an above average grade4 starsAll in all, at this time I’m keeping the printer.  But who knows.

product_name: HP DeskJet 4255e Wireless All-in-One Color Inkjet Printer, Scanner, Copier, Best-for-Home, 3 Months of Ink Included (588S6A)
description: I purchased this to replace an old HP printer that was starting to have problems after a decade or so of use . Setup was a nightmare , my PC was a Lenovo mini PC running Win10 and it has built in WiFi as well as LAN . It absolutely wouldn't connect to the printer and it turns out that you can't connect to the printer if you have the LAN connected , and this is every time you want to print something you have to disconnect the LAN . I get it all set up and it seems to work okay , I used it once to print an all black return label for something and it goes fine . Then I get a new HP mini PC running Win11 and have to set it up again on that  . It had the same issue that you have to disconnect the LAN to connect and when I do , the printer is telling me that the color printer ink is empty after never using it . So I shut everything all down and try it again and recalibrate the printer , and the color printer ink isn't communicating . They are so worried about selling you more inks and so worried that you'll use another brand of ink that everything is over monitored and an issue . Not recommended .

product_name: HP DeskJet 4255e Wireless All-in-One Color Inkjet Printer, Scanner, Copier, Best-for-Home, 3 Months of Ink Included (588S6A)
description: Classic late 20th century printer with paper feeder in the back and single sided printing only with 21st century wifi and cloud printing.We replaced our HP OfficeJet that was 7 years old and our instaink account had been telling us for two years needed updated as it was no longer supported and went backwards in time. We thought we were just losing fax capability and auto print double sided, but that simply was not the case.The only positive I have to say about this printer is that it works. It prints black and white and color, and will make a single copy at a time.Set up was no harder than previous HP wireless printer, and with 6 mo free instaink the printer, the printer was free as HP credited our account based on our plan not the basic 5.99 a month plan.20th century technologyThe rear paper tray is almost impossible to load if you want to put more than about 10-15 sheets of paper in it. There's no way could ever get close to 50 or 60 sheets of that claims can hold. About 20 sheets is the maxWhat we received does not have an auto document feeder simply standard very basic flatbed scanner that scans most things fairly well.Bonus is that scanner works great wirelessly. Granted if you're scanning more than one page chances are you're close enough that connecting a cable isn't a major hassle, but nice convince not to need it.Will say when scanning music it does a better than average job of scanning for software recognition and not much correction of notes is needed which is generally not the case.The LCD screen is pretty useless.  It shows if you have a wireless signal or not and shows an i when needs attention such as a paper jam or out of paper. Then has 4 manual buttons 1- turns wireless on/off 2- has a sheet of paper with an arrow to start printing again if paper ran out, 3- black copy, 4 - color copy.Previous printer the LCD screen let you manage copy settings by increasing or decreasing darkness, enlarging or shrinking image, and designating multiple copies. None of those features are available despite supposedly comparable printer.Major blunders1-No auto document feeder2-Printer is offline more often then not3-Printer is always offline when initially attempt to print from mobile device, but then will respond to signal. Unfortunately some applications refuse to print after initial offline/unavailable message4- rear paper tray needs an overhaul5- manual double sided printing doesn't work well6- rear paper tray combined with catch tray take up extreme amount of spaceSave yourself the grief and stick with a printer with an input tray under the printer that also does auto double sided printing. This is junk. Had we realized how much grief it was to be a temporary solution would have been done until  something reasonable could be done. HP unfortunately had a window where the only office quality/feature functioning printers available were not home office friendly. 7 months and though printer works fine it's likely going to be replaced.Getting ink seems difficult as well. HP instaink keeps indicating shipments of 1 black and 1 color has shipped and then 2 black or 2 color arrive. Not in habit of actually opening boxes when they arrive, then don't have ink when need to install new cartridge.

product_name: HP DeskJet 4255e Wireless All-in-One Color Inkjet Printer, Scanner, Copier, Best-for-Home, 3 Months of Ink Included (588S6A)
description: When my old office printer finally kicked the bucket, I was determined to find a replacement that wouldn't break the bank. As my workplace has transitioned to mainly electronic records, I didn't need a heavy-duty workhorse – just a reliable printer at a reasonable price point. Enter the HP DeskJet 4155e.For my needs, this printer delivers a solid performance. While it may not be perfect, it gets the job done efficiently. One of its strengths is the printing speed, which is relatively fast for basic document printing. The printer is also user-friendly and straightforward to operate, making it a convenient choice for a small office setup.However, I did notice that the ink cartridges seem to deplete faster than some other models I've used in the past. This could be a concern for those with higher printing volumes, but for my current low-to-moderate usage, it's a manageable trade-off.The setup process, which some reviews had flagged as difficult, went surprisingly smoothly for me. I was able to get the printer up and running without any major hiccups, which was a relief.In terms of print quality, the DeskJet 4155e delivers crisp and clear results, whether for text documents or graphics. It's not the quietest printer out there, but the noise level is tolerable and shouldn't cause significant disruptions in a typical office environment.One notable limitation, however, is the lack of duplex (double-sided) printing capability. This feature would have been a welcome addition, especially for those looking to save paper and reduce waste.Overall, the HP DeskJet 4155e Wireless Color Inkjet Printer is a solid choice for those seeking a reliable, affordable option for light office printing needs. While it may not be loaded with advanced features, it strikes a good balance between performance and value. If your printing requirements are modest and you're working with a tight budget, this printer is definitely worth considering.

product_name: HP DeskJet 4255e Wireless All-in-One Color Inkjet Printer, Scanner, Copier, Best-for-Home, 3 Months of Ink Included (588S6A)
description: As someone who frequently prints for personal projects and small business needs, I was on the hunt for an all-in-one printer that wouldn't break the bank. I’d give this printer a solid B+ for ease of setup on my iPhone 15 and MacBook Air. Sure, I ran into a few bumps along the way, but after a couple of tries and about 30 minutes, I finally got it up and running.However, as someone with multiple health challenges, I found swapping out the ink cartridges to be a bit of a struggle. I’ve owned several HP printers over the years, and with most of them, you could easily lift the scanner bed to install the cartridges. But with the HP4255e, there’s a tight front flap near the paper exit that makes it tricky. If you don’t get the cartridge in just the right spot, it can take a bit of wrestling to get it seated correctly. I really wish it had a top-loading option instead.Another hiccup was the printing delay. There were times when I’d hit “print” on both my phone and laptop, only to wait around three minutes before hearing the printer start to pull the paper in, followed by another 90 seconds of silence. A few times, it actually finished printing about 15 minutes after I first hit “print,” but more often than not, it just stalled out. I tried everything I could think of—uninstalling and reinstalling the HP Smart app on all my devices, unplugging the printer, and even going through tech support for over an hour. Unfortunately, even with their guidance, the inconsistencies persisted. It wasn’t until after my call with them that I realized I should try printing directly through the Smart App on my phone, and that finally worked for me. So, I’m left unable to print from my laptop, which is a bit frustrating.Oh, and I must admit, I was a bit disappointed to discover there’s no automatic duplex printing. That’s more of a personal preference, but it did catch me off guard. Honestly, I’d only recommend this printer to someone who prints infrequently and is okay with using the app.On a positive note, when it does print, the quality is beautiful! However, I’m puzzled as to how I went through almost half of my color ink cartridge in less than 24 hours after getting the machine. I only printed about 10 pages, mostly black and white with just a few colored elements. Overall, it’s a mixed bag for me!

product_name: HP DeskJet 4255e Wireless All-in-One Color Inkjet Printer, Scanner, Copier, Best-for-Home, 3 Months of Ink Included (588S6A)
description: I have long been aware that low priced printers generally come with high priced ink but that's the case for even high priced printers most of the reviews were for difficulty in setting up I did experience a little of this and I'm going to try to put it in small detail as the way to really go on setting it up when you go online they want you to download a mobile app and give you that as your best option that is not the best option the best option is to set it up from your laptop or desktop I did download the app and it originally would not work but after it was set up via the Internet and my laptop it miraculously started working through my phone so my advice is do not use the vendors advice to set up through your mobile app do that after you have it set up that was the easiest way for me and originally trying to use it through the app or set it up through the app my phone would never recognize it and for some reason after I set it up via my laptop my phone suddenly recognize the device other than that it's a great printer the Bluetooth works good it sets up on your Wi-Fi easily I am now able to Mobile Print through my phone and the best option it has is 3 months worth of ink and if you sign up with an account with them it's $4.99 a month for your free ink so that's a pretty good deal I would recommend this printer for anybody's home or small small business

product_name: HP DeskJet 4255e Wireless All-in-One Color Inkjet Printer, Scanner, Copier, Best-for-Home, 3 Months of Ink Included (588S6A)
description: Ran out of ink quickly while only using it for coloring sheets. We made maybe 30 coloring sheets and it's already saying its low on ink. Mind you these coloring sheets aren't very elaborate. They are for 5 year olds. The app works well just keep it updated. The paper is frustrating to deal with. Scanning works perfectly though so that's a plus. In all its not bad but not good.

product_name: HP DeskJet 4255e Wireless All-in-One Color Inkjet Printer, Scanner, Copier, Best-for-Home, 3 Months of Ink Included (588S6A)
description: Pretty basic printer scanner not long on setup instructions.  For those that are concerned with security, this thing has a open direct line to the mother ship at will.  From what I saw, it cannot be setup without this connection, a HP account, and the Smart HP app.  Presumably a continued connection is for ink replacement  and there was mention of  'Print from anywhere' function.  Initially the Smart HP app Printer Scan responded with Feature not available for the printer, but it has since started working after first using the MAC scanner utility in printer setup. Mac M2 Sonoma 14.6.1

product_name: HP DeskJet 4255e Wireless All-in-One Color Inkjet Printer, Scanner, Copier, Best-for-Home, 3 Months of Ink Included (588S6A)
description: This is WiFi only. No HMDI connection. You need to use the HP+ app on any device to use the printer. I found that it won’t print correctly when on a VPN for work, so I work around that.It’s not super fast but not super slow either. Set up with the app was easy and scanning worked well with an editor before saving the scan, which is helpful if you load it wrong on the glass.

product_name: HP DeskJet 4255e Wireless All-in-One Color Inkjet Printer, Scanner, Copier, Best-for-Home, 3 Months of Ink Included (588S6A)
description: This seems like a good printer so far. I like that it is wireless. At first it had an issue printing when I set it up. It only wanted to print the first page repeatedly. I cancelled all the print jobs and tried to reset things. Works great now and haven’t had the problem since. It was a good price and the print quality seems good for a basic printer.

product_name: HP DeskJet 4255e Wireless All-in-One Color Inkjet Printer, Scanner, Copier, Best-for-Home, 3 Months of Ink Included (588S6A)
description: The printer itself seems to do a good job. I have had HP printers for years. But this one has a flaw that drives me crazy. My printer sits up on the second tear of my computer desk. When I print, the papers come out and fly all over the room because there is no piece of plastic there, like the others printers have, to catch the papers. This is a terrible flaw with this printer and I wish that HP had thought about it before they put it on the market. May not sound like much, but no matter what your printing you better be there to catch it because it will definitely fall and flutter all over the room.

product_name: HP DeskJet 4255e Wireless All-in-One Color Inkjet Printer, Scanner, Copier, Best-for-Home, 3 Months of Ink Included (588S6A)
description: I’m very happy with the printer so far. It was very easy to set up. It was easy to connect and get everything turned on and running. It seems like it’s terrible and the quality is nice. I like that I can use the app to do scanning and other things on my phone. It comes with so many different features is pretty cool. It seems to print really fast which I’m happy about and the color and just printer quality is great. I would definitely recommend plus you can sign up to have ink sent to you on a Mail subscription when you start to get low, which is very useful Plus it’s like half the price of a regular ink  if you print a lot

product_name: HP DeskJet 4255e Wireless All-in-One Color Inkjet Printer, Scanner, Copier, Best-for-Home, 3 Months of Ink Included (588S6A)
description: This was a replacement for my HP 3 in 1 that finally died after 16 years of faithful service. I was a bit hesitant over the mixed reviews, but after 3 days deliberation I finally decided to take a chance. So far, so good! I do not have it hooked to wifi, I bought a $10 printer cable and it was hooked up and working in minutes. I also did not bother with the free ink. It does seem to run out of ink pretty quickly, but I have also done alot of printing the last few weeks.  All in all, I am very pleased!

product_name: HP DeskJet 4255e Wireless All-in-One Color Inkjet Printer, Scanner, Copier, Best-for-Home, 3 Months of Ink Included (588S6A)
description: I had to replace my very old Canon Pixma and I couldn't pass up this deal especially with the 3 month Free Ink replacement.I have a 2017 MacAir and once I went to 123.hp.com to connect the printer to my Mac I received a "pop-up" stating I needed Big Sur Upgrade in order to proceed & connect this printer but my Mac is not compatible with that program. After 3 hours of wasted time condensing, deleting files, etc. I decided to just connect my mobile device since everything I would possibly use the printer for was also on my cell as well.  It took MAYBE 10 minutes at the most to connect via 123.hp.com and I was also able to receive the trial ink cartridges for 3 months. After finally testing the printer and loving it I took a break from my phone, etc to give my eyes a break.  Once I had a clear head I remembered System Preferences has a "Printer/Scanner" icon.  I went back to my Mac, clicked on that (if this is your first printer remember to turn off any Firewalls FIRST otherwise you will not be able to connect the printer. You can turn it back on once the Printer is in your system) and after adding the HP Deskjet 4255e with location (my home address), etc I had the printer connected and working with my Mac within a few minutes.That is everything in a nutshell and I hope this review helps anybody else in the future with their setup.You will definitely LOVE this Printer and the ease of operating it.

product_name: HP DeskJet 4255e Wireless All-in-One Color Inkjet Printer, Scanner, Copier, Best-for-Home, 3 Months of Ink Included (588S6A)
description: I don't know if I can fully blame the hardware of the printer 100%, the software for HP is just horrendous.there's a scene in the film AIR FORCE ONE (1997) with Harrison Ford where he is trying to send a Fax out after the terrorists take over the plane. That's how I feel printing out one document with this printer.The app says it's connected, but it'll then say, can't connect.... and I'm not printing a complex doc. It's a statement so I can send to a company for proof of residence (Just use ID me or SheerID or something)Sometimes, the power button will blink. I don't even know what that means. Like why, what does that even mean? It's a70 dollar printer. Just print.On the software, it wont give me an option to print only a selective page. It's just button, and size of the paper..... I dont want to print out all 15 pages. I just want one. Why isn't that option available?The app never fails to ask me for a refill subscription. NEVER, everytime I open it.Do better HP.It's worth the price if you print here and there. But then again, perhaps if I have it on, it wouldn' thave this connection problem.

product_name: HP DeskJet 4255e Wireless All-in-One Color Inkjet Printer, Scanner, Copier, Best-for-Home, 3 Months of Ink Included (588S6A)
description: This printer works great, but it is slower printing than it said it would be and I don’t like how the paper loads but that part is my fault because where I have my printer sitting but overall a good printer just not fast

product_name: HP DeskJet 4255e Wireless All-in-One Color Inkjet Printer, Scanner, Copier, Best-for-Home, 3 Months of Ink Included (588S6A)
description: It's a good purchase for the price. Good choice for occasional printing. Ink runs out too fast. It looks flimsy and paper get stock sometimes. Good printing quality. Even in photographic paper. Fast set up. If you don't have wifi forget about it thought. For me works just fine. Again, great for the price

product_name: HP DeskJet 4255e Wireless All-in-One Color Inkjet Printer, Scanner, Copier, Best-for-Home, 3 Months of Ink Included (588S6A)
description: So far the Printer has functioned done.  It was relatively easy to setup but tends to lose connection very often.  Thresh print quality is good.

product_name: NEW Bose SoundLink Max Portable Speaker, Large Waterproof Bluetooth Speaker, Up to 20 Hours of Battery Life, USB-C, Built-in 3.5mm AUX Input, Black
description: I highly doubt you'll find a better sound in a similar package. What drew me in was the promise of improved stereo effect using Bose's effective Articulated Array. It does that wonderfully. It's incredible how effective it can be when the drivers are literally inches apart. While not perfect (the soundstage is large, but imprecise--a physical limitation of a narrow device), it creates a large sound atmosphere that is VERY well suited for live music. Listening to live albums through this is a genuine delight.Bass is great for the size. It won't give you full extension, but it's compact, so it's unreasonable to expect it to. Just judging by my ear, I think this is effective down to about 65Hz and smoothly rolls off below that. At low to moderate volumes, you can easily imagine you're listening to a large home stereo.Mids are.. unique, in a mostly-good way. There is a lot of processing going on in this frequency range that aids the stereo effect. In typical fashion, this means imprecision and a slightly-off tone, but the tradeoff is well worth it for this device class and form factor. Your ears will adjust quickly and it'll sound pleasant and realistic enough. You will likely find it subtly emphasizing details in songs that you've never paid attention to. It's kind of fun, honestly. Novel, but not offensive.Highs are a mixed bag. They're fairly smooth and detailed, but being a single tweeter in the center, all the detail is right there in the middle. In ordinary listening, you won't really notice.. especially if you're moving around or off axis. But it's something possibly worth mentioning.It all combines to a unique, pleasant experience. It's well-processed, but processed nonetheless. It's an impressive sounding speaker making the very best of its modest, portable size.But the price is just too high. I've long felt that Bose's Flex is the best combination of outstanding sound, overall quality, and price. I don't think this is enough of an upgrade over that to cost nearly 4x as much. And if you don't mind fussing with Bluetooth stereo pairing, two Flexes will give you an awesome, authentic stereo sound for about half the price of this. You'll only miss out on just a little bit of bass extension/emphasis, but everything else about the Flex sounds as good or better. It's a no-brainer to me.Battery life is outstanding at low to moderate volumes, btw. When camping, I had it playing lightly most of the night (~8hrs) and it only dropped around 20%. Crazy.A welcome addition is the 3-band tone control (bass, mids, treble). They're fairly well-spaced and nicely adjustable. That said, I barely touched it (bass 0, mids +1, treble +2). It sounds great right out of the box.Feature-wise, it's fairly basic, but I kind of like it that way. It's just a good, simple speaker. Happily, they included an aux input! If your TV has level-adjusted RCA analog output (Vizio does, many don't), you could practically use this as a nice little soundbar in a small to medium sized room, which was compelling to me as I was considering soundbars for my bedroom. I don't know if I'll bother doing that, but it is an option if it makes the price more palatable.But yes, the price is too high for my tastes. I think many people will find it worth it, but $299 would be a far more reasonable price (preferably even less, but this IS a luxury product).Ultimately, I don't know if I can recommend it. It's impressive, but not quite enough to justify the cost.Also possibly of note, my Bluetooth has disconnected periodically. I'm confident that it'll be improved with a firmware update eventually, but I still want to mention it. Sadly, that's just how things are--as things get more and more tech-heavy, everyone releases imperfect products once in a while, and Bose is no exception. Fortunately, most kinks can be worked out with simple updates.
