Uber trips, shopping, walking in public spaces, waiting at the train station etc they perform quite well. However, I work specialty service and in my shop I basically have to both work with heavy steel grinders and be able to field phone calls with clients/speak to customers in shop. When I'm standing and working on my machine, the ANC will be humming along smoothly when suddenly some frequencies stop being blocked, if that makes sense? All will be quiet, then suddenly through one earbud I will pick up certain sounds as louder than the other ear as they evade the ANC's processing. It's quite disconcerting to be honest, I'd almost liken it to feeling a pressure change in your ear but without the physical sensations. Some times it's better/worse than other times, but I'd say by and large the ANC holds its own. If every other point in my review is a 5/5, battery life is a 4/5 and ANC is (currently) a 3.5/5.I would hope to, and assume to, see the problems with ANC addressed with future software updates. For now, as an early purchaser that understands products almost never release in a perfect state, I am very pleased with my purchase and do feel that I got my money's worth.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds 3 Pro AI True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds, Noise Cancelling, Sound Optimization, Real-Time Interpreter, Redesigned Comfort Fit, Silver [US Version, Amazon Exclusive 2Yr Warranty]
description: These fit well and stay in. They are comfortable and come with other tips if you need them. The functionality is great and the apps shows you how to use it. It connects through the app and it’s super simple. I haven’t used them much yet so I’m not sure about the battery life. It has wireless charging which is awesome. I got it on sale so it was a no brainer to buy it.The sound quality to me is better than my AirPod pros. I think it’s worth the value if you are running Samsung.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds 3 Pro AI True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds, Noise Cancelling, Sound Optimization, Real-Time Interpreter, Redesigned Comfort Fit, Silver [US Version, Amazon Exclusive 2Yr Warranty]
description: These are terrific earbuds.  I'm coming from a pair of Airpods Pro (2nd gen), which I really like.  Main reason for replacing is that I've gotten tired of not being able to change certain settings since I'm not an Apple user.  These sound great, just as good as Apple if not better.  I'd say the ANC is about the same, which both do a great job in that department.The fit, like all earbuds, can be hit or miss depending on a person's ears.  They come with 3 sizes.  I found the largest ones to fit snugly in my ears.  Most of the negative reviews that I've read are from people who weren't able to find tips that fit their ears.  If they don't fit snugly, sound quality and ANC won't be very good so fit is critical.I wear these mostly for sleeping.  I tried several top brands and none were comfortable when sleeping, which is why I landed on the airpods about a year ago.  These are very similar.  They might extend out just slightly more, but work very good for sleeping like my airpods.  The big advantage to these is that I can turn off ANC and Ambient modes to save battery life.  The airpods I could not turn modes off because I don't own an iphone.  This results in longer battery life and gets me through the night.In summary, I would definitely recommend these.  My son bought a pair of silver buds and I have the ones in white.  We are both very pleased with sound quality, ANC, and the different settings that you can select.  One thing I would recommend if you get these is to adjust the EQ.  Once I did, the sound is pretty amazing.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds 3 Pro AI True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds, Noise Cancelling, Sound Optimization, Real-Time Interpreter, Redesigned Comfort Fit, Silver [US Version, Amazon Exclusive 2Yr Warranty]
description: I received my earbuds on Sept 1 after the unfortunate delay on pre-order. Am writing this review on sept 21 since first using these earbuds. Am glad I still waited on these because for the price am pretty satisfied with the sound clarity and comfort. Real quick to setup and connect to my s23 plus.Personally I don't like using the noise canceling feature on headphones or earbuds, mainly because I find it to cause fatigue on my ears within about 30mins of use. However the noise canceling is pretty good. Not as good as the sony wf1000 mx4 I used to have, but pretty good to say the least. I find myself using more the ambient sound to hear others around me while listening to music. But if am just want to tune out I just have it set to off all together. In fact when I go out for walks I just have it off without noise canceling/ ambient. Just having the sound up can block outside great as is.In comparison, I had my sony wf1000 mx4. Personally, I though those earbuds were great on sound quality but not so much on comfort. Those that know, the sony mx4 earbuds used memory foam ear tips that expand on your ears and can cause fatigue as soon as you start using them. Had to use the small earbuds size to feel better on my ears. But it was unpleasant. The sound quality and good bass was my favorite thing about the sony mx4 earbuds but they stop charging some time last year. And been using my back up razer chroma earbuds  waiting to see what samsung will put out on the buds 3. Am pretty glad I did.My first impression on the galaxy 3 pros is the sound clarity, comfort fit, and the light weight they rest on my ears. The audio quality is great but I did prefer the sony better and bass. Battery life is great but of course is better if you leave the light bar on the sides off, but a pretty cool feature.I will say I do recommend playing with the eq settings. I personally did find the default eq a bit dull. I'm happy to share my eq settings but I don't think you need to make any big changes to make the earbuds sound a bit more vivid it needs to be. Everyone has their own taste when it comes to eq adjustments. But like I said before i don't think is something to make big changes to. I like to listen a bit of everything, classical, rock, metal, classic rock, rap, kpop/ jpop, country, phonk, jazz, Latin.Nevertheless, I hope this review helpsPs. If you plan to get these earbuds for a apple device, I don't recommend it because of codec support. I recommend researching more on your own if you don't know the difference with apple use of aac codec and android device LDAC/aptx codec. Basically apple devices don't support the same high res audio on Android devices. However, to some is not that noticeable difference.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds 3 Pro AI True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds, Noise Cancelling, Sound Optimization, Real-Time Interpreter, Redesigned Comfort Fit, Silver [US Version, Amazon Exclusive 2Yr Warranty]
description: I recently purchased the new Galaxy Earbuds, and they have completely exceeded my expectations! The sound quality is phenomenal, with deep bass, clear mids, and crisp highs. Whether I’m listening to music, podcasts, or making calls, everything sounds rich and immersive. The noise-canceling feature works surprisingly well too, blocking out background noise without feeling too isolated.One of the best things about these earbuds is the comfort. They fit perfectly in my ears and stay in place, even during workouts or long walks. The lightweight design means I can wear them for hours without any discomfort. I also love the customizable fit with different ear tips, so they’re great for anyone.The battery life is impressive, lasting me through an entire day of use without needing a recharge. The fast charging is a game-changer—just a few minutes in the case and I’m good to go for hours. Pairing with my Galaxy phone was seamless, and the touch controls are intuitive and responsive.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds 3 Pro AI True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds, Noise Cancelling, Sound Optimization, Real-Time Interpreter, Redesigned Comfort Fit, Silver [US Version, Amazon Exclusive 2Yr Warranty]
description: First off, the sound quality is much better than the Buds 2 Pro, which I was using before.I think the new control system of pinch and slide is better than Buds 2 in the sense that you won't accidentally hit pause by touching them like with Buds 2, but you'll also find it tougher to get the touch controls to register your inputs.My main issue though is the ear tips; they only give 3 sizes and in my case, none of them fit. I really like having that seal on my ears, and cannot achieve this at all. This was still an issue with Buds 2, but less so, and in that case, aftermarket foam tips fixed the issue. As of my writing this, there are no manufactured aftermarket foam tips available, though there are some vendors on Etsy who make them, and so I'll try those.For reference, I have the biggest non-custom US hat size (8), but the biggest tips are too big, and the medium tips are way too small. Additionally, the AirPod-style shape prevents me from being able to push the earbuds deeper into my ear.Overall, they're great if they fit you, but will require modification if they do not. I don't understand why Samsung is copying Apple with this.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds 3 Pro AI True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds, Noise Cancelling, Sound Optimization, Real-Time Interpreter, Redesigned Comfort Fit, Silver [US Version, Amazon Exclusive 2Yr Warranty]
description: I bought these at a discount during the Prime Deal Days. I have moderate hearing loss with tinnitus, so I hear crickets and locusts 24/7. I think that most of it was due to my work and not using any hearing protection.The first time I wore them, I was using my hammer drill to put in some tapcons. I had them set in the adaptive mode while listening to the radio, and as soon as I pulled the trigger, they blocked out the sound of the hammer drill while the radio played on.I also discovered that there is a hearing test in the Galaxy Wearable app that will help to compensate for my hearing loss. I hear better with these than with the hearing aids. The noise canceling is excellent.The sound quality is excellent, but the battery life is less than I was hoping for.There is another feature that I have not tried yet. It requires another app to enable it which is "Real-time Voice Translate". I'm going to give that a try the next time I'm working with my Latino friends. I don't know if I can also use it on a phone call, but I will have to try it.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds 3 Pro AI True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds, Noise Cancelling, Sound Optimization, Real-Time Interpreter, Redesigned Comfort Fit, Silver [US Version, Amazon Exclusive 2Yr Warranty]
description: I'm not a huge review guy but I do have experience using exclusively Samsung buds over the course of the last few years.In a vacuum the Buds3 are the best in its class which should be somewhat expected from a latest model,  they cosmetically look way more stylish/sleek, they have a cool light up featured I've used a few times really just to show off at night.In terms of quality of life improvement, these are terrific in comparison to the Buds Live, which is not a bad ear piece by any means, but I must say the side by side comparison between the Buds2 and Buds3 isn't a significant difference.  I was a little disappointed when testing these downtown that that the battery life is extremely close to the Buds2. The battery life is pretty close, the sound quality is pretty close,  both fit snug in your ears for the most part and I haven't gotten frustrated with any gesture commands up to this point.  I utilize both Buds 2&3 to get through the course of an entire day without any recharging. Just think if you're already a Buds2 owner, wait till these hit some sort of discount to get them, worth having, just difficult to justify the price point between the 2 currently unless cosmetics is a really important feature for you.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds 3 Pro AI True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds, Noise Cancelling, Sound Optimization, Real-Time Interpreter, Redesigned Comfort Fit, Silver [US Version, Amazon Exclusive 2Yr Warranty]
description: Overall, these are the BEST earbuds I've ever owned. The sound quality is excellent for my purposes, mostly listening to music while working out at the gym. They are very comfortable. Others I've tried caused my ears to hurt after a fairly short time. The only downside, IMO, they won't pair with any TV except certain Samsung TVs. Very disappointing. If not for this, I would have given 5 stars.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds 3 Pro AI True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds, Noise Cancelling, Sound Optimization, Real-Time Interpreter, Redesigned Comfort Fit, Silver [US Version, Amazon Exclusive 2Yr Warranty]
description: This is my first pair of noise canceling earbuds....and my god it's like a new world of listening. Anyways onto the review. The sound quality is better than my old jbl earbuds. Touch controls are finicky but I'm not used to them yet. They fit pretty well in my ears, which is NOT normal for me. I always have to switch out the default tips for bigger ones. Haven't had them long enough the test the battery life. Will come back if things change. Worth the price? Not so much, am I happy yes. I recommend these to any musicphile.

product_name: INIU Portable Charger, 22.5W 20000mAh USB C in & Out Power Bank Fast Charging, PD 3.0+QC 4.0 LED Display Phone Battery Pack Compatible with iPhone 16 15 14 13 Pro Samsung S23 Google iPad Tablet, etc
description: I bought this just before Hurricane Milton hit my area of Tampa Bay. I was without power for two days and thankfully it came back, because depending on this thing was sketchy.To put it in perspective, on Thursday, while I was without power all day, I was able to charge my phone, tablet, and laptop to bring the Portable Charger down to 50% in 3 hours.  Which was awesome. Truly, great.But the next day, when I hunted down a place to recharge the Portable Charger to try and get it back up to 100%, I had it plugged in for four hours, and it only went from 50% to 65%...in four hours.Even when I first bought the Portable Charger, it came ready at 55%. It took two days to get it up to 100%.So keep that in mind. It'll charge your devices. But if you were hoping for a quick turnaround time...it's not going to happen. Still...better than the "solar powered" ones I've been seeing.

product_name: INIU Portable Charger, 22.5W 20000mAh USB C in & Out Power Bank Fast Charging, PD 3.0+QC 4.0 LED Display Phone Battery Pack Compatible with iPhone 16 15 14 13 Pro Samsung S23 Google iPad Tablet, etc
description: I love my 25000mah 100w version, so I wanted a backup for emergencies and my other family members.  The price on this one seemed great, and it works as it should.  However, I didn’t realize how slow it is to recharge.  At the fastest it takes 6 hours to charge from zero, and closer to 10 hours if you don’t have a fast charging USB.  I’m spoiled by the 25000mah 100w version that can recharge in 2 hours!  If you can afford it, get the 25000mah 100w version instead.

product_name: INIU Portable Charger, 22.5W 20000mAh USB C in & Out Power Bank Fast Charging, PD 3.0+QC 4.0 LED Display Phone Battery Pack Compatible with iPhone 16 15 14 13 Pro Samsung S23 Google iPad Tablet, etc
description: I thought it would be super fast to charge the phone and also to charge the portable battery. Not the case. It takes forever to charge the battery, literally several more than 5 hrs to charge and not even from 0 to 100. Just like from 50-60%. The phone it takes a few hours to charge with it. Not 25-30 mins. I used the adapter of my iPhone and after a few times of using it, it doesn’t work anymore. :(

product_name: INIU Portable Charger, 22.5W 20000mAh USB C in & Out Power Bank Fast Charging, PD 3.0+QC 4.0 LED Display Phone Battery Pack Compatible with iPhone 16 15 14 13 Pro Samsung S23 Google iPad Tablet, etc
description: I got this to charge my iPad and it can only charge it almost twice on one charge. That’s disappointing but at least it charges it fast.

product_name: INIU Portable Charger, 22.5W 20000mAh USB C in & Out Power Bank Fast Charging, PD 3.0+QC 4.0 LED Display Phone Battery Pack Compatible with iPhone 16 15 14 13 Pro Samsung S23 Google iPad Tablet, etc
description: This is good, simple and works. I needed something slim and maybe a bit smaller.Too large for my taste. The digital output is nice, and it works with USB, USB-C, etc.Just not for me.

product_name: INIU Portable Charger, 22.5W 20000mAh USB C in & Out Power Bank Fast Charging, PD 3.0+QC 4.0 LED Display Phone Battery Pack Compatible with iPhone 16 15 14 13 Pro Samsung S23 Google iPad Tablet, etc
description: When I purchased this item it was indicated that it had an industry leading three-year warranty. I received a letter that it only had a two year warranty. I won’t return but extremely disappointed!

product_name: INIU Portable Charger, 22.5W 20000mAh USB C in & Out Power Bank Fast Charging, PD 3.0+QC 4.0 LED Display Phone Battery Pack Compatible with iPhone 16 15 14 13 Pro Samsung S23 Google iPad Tablet, etc
description: I bought this so I could have something a little less bulky and I could see the charging percentage balance. What I found right out of the box is that the charging cable that goes from the device to the plug end is very short. I would have preferred a longer cable. And the plug end that plugs in to the device is not anything that I have access to- seems to be specialized to the device. Pretty disappointed about that.

product_name: INIU Portable Charger, 22.5W 20000mAh USB C in & Out Power Bank Fast Charging, PD 3.0+QC 4.0 LED Display Phone Battery Pack Compatible with iPhone 16 15 14 13 Pro Samsung S23 Google iPad Tablet, etc
description: Works great i just wish it charged faster!

product_name: INIU Portable Charger, 22.5W 20000mAh USB C in & Out Power Bank Fast Charging, PD 3.0+QC 4.0 LED Display Phone Battery Pack Compatible with iPhone 16 15 14 13 Pro Samsung S23 Google iPad Tablet, etc
description: i jst recieve  this product this morning and i was so exciting to test to it and let it drain the battery then charge to fully when i open the mail the boxes got some dent of the box to it so i was worried about it hoping the power bank not broken or something the seal its look like some one open already .what I like this product it's small can fit in hand also in my bag  will made nice finishing  touch. the only I dislike it's take forever to fully charge from 5 pm to 10pm  for that long period of time. I notice when I charge the power bank its only one digital  number is blinking the one was steady im not sure if this is part of his features. I try to charge thru the phone  galaxy S22 Ultra and Iphone 14 from 100 down to fast.

product_name: INIU Portable Charger, 22.5W 20000mAh USB C in & Out Power Bank Fast Charging, PD 3.0+QC 4.0 LED Display Phone Battery Pack Compatible with iPhone 16 15 14 13 Pro Samsung S23 Google iPad Tablet, etc
description: I purchased three of these based on reviews so I’m ready for the next hurricane.  The problem is it takes forever to charge.  Like 24 hours to get from 56% to 100%.  I thought the first one might have been a fluke but the second is going even more slowly.

product_name: INIU Portable Charger, 22.5W 20000mAh USB C in & Out Power Bank Fast Charging, PD 3.0+QC 4.0 LED Display Phone Battery Pack Compatible with iPhone 16 15 14 13 Pro Samsung S23 Google iPad Tablet, etc
description: Great portable charger. It has 2 USB-A out ports and one USB-C in/out. It charges heavy devices like a s24 ultra or a mbp m3 pro nicely.I would give it a half star off due to how slowly the brick itself charges. It can bring a s24 ultra from 80 to 100% in under an hour but it will take hours for it to charge from 60 to 100% even on a high capacity outlet brick and cable.If you forget to charge it before a trip, you may be stuck with a partially charged charger...Always good to plan ahead but we've all been in a rush and forgotten to charge everything we should have.The flashlight is a nice touch.I like the little usb a to usb c cord length as I keep this and my phone in a fanny pack to charge my phone on the go.The heat level is minimal but can get a little warm as it charges or is charging.It's a solid little unit that works well

product_name: INIU Portable Charger, 22.5W 20000mAh USB C in & Out Power Bank Fast Charging, PD 3.0+QC 4.0 LED Display Phone Battery Pack Compatible with iPhone 16 15 14 13 Pro Samsung S23 Google iPad Tablet, etc
description: tl;dr - At about twice the thickness (and weight) of a smartphone, this portable charger is a game changer for travel.Pros:- Digital display- Multiple outputs (USB-A x2 and USB-C)... and you can charge 3 items at once- Slim/Easy to Transport- Holds Charge for Very Long Time- No Issue with Airport SecurityCons:- Weight- Only has USB-C input- Doesn't have a phone holder (the 10000 mAh version of this does)Review:I own the 10000 mAh version of this charger which can recharge an iPhone just under twice. With an upcoming extended trip planned, decided to pick up this little guy to have more juice on the go. It's the same dimensions except for being thicker and heavier.It charges a recent/current gen iPhone or Android phone 3 times fully from 5% (on the phone) plus a little more on the 4th try (good for Airpods?). While you can share in an emergency, if you are traveling I would just get each person their own. That way you don't have to recharge the powerbank every night.This item tends to go on sale regularly. At full price (currently $45 USD) it's a little steep in my opinion but still worth it if you need it now. If you can catch this on sale, don't hesitate.During the trip, it went through airport security without any issue and functioned flawlessly. I love that it can charge more than one item at once and can do USB-C to USB-C (or USB-C to Lightning).After the trip, I charged it back fully and let it sit for 3 months in a drawer. It still read 100% and worked flawlessly when used, so good for storage.As mentioned, I have the 10000 mAh version of this charger and the only thing I'm missing from the 10000 mAh is the slide out phone stand (which is a really nice touch). The bigger powerbank is also twice as thick and twice as heavy.Lastly, the travel case is a really nice touch. It's a padded mesh bag with a drawstring. It looks really nice and makes carrying the charger easy.Overall: I was impressed with the 10000 mAh, but I love the 20000 mAh. Being able to fully charge 3 times is a game-changer and the digital readout takes all the guesswork out.If you want a smaller powerbank, check out the INUI 10000 mAh version. It's cheaper, but also more portable. Better suited for taking to school/college in my opinion. I'm donating my 10000 mAh one to a college student we know.Hope you found this review helpful!

product_name: INIU Portable Charger, 22.5W 20000mAh USB C in & Out Power Bank Fast Charging, PD 3.0+QC 4.0 LED Display Phone Battery Pack Compatible with iPhone 16 15 14 13 Pro Samsung S23 Google iPad Tablet, etc
description: My phone doesn't keep a charge all day.  I needed a charger for a trip to Europe as I knew I would be using my phone heavily and needed to be able to charge.  I picked up this portable charger and was not disappointed.  When my Samsung phone was down to 20-30% I would connect to the charger and was fully charged to 100% within the hour.  Super speedy.  It is a bit heavy, but I was able to charge my phone and others at least 3 or 4 times with this charger in a day.  It does take some time to charge the unit, but I did this at night and never had an issue.  A great buy!

product_name: INIU Portable Charger, 22.5W 20000mAh USB C in & Out Power Bank Fast Charging, PD 3.0+QC 4.0 LED Display Phone Battery Pack Compatible with iPhone 16 15 14 13 Pro Samsung S23 Google iPad Tablet, etc
description: This is a great charger, easy to use and is quite substantial.  This is by far the best charger l’ve had so far. It doesn’t take long to charge a lasts a long time and charges my iPad in a timely manner. It works great

product_name: INIU Portable Charger, 22.5W 20000mAh USB C in & Out Power Bank Fast Charging, PD 3.0+QC 4.0 LED Display Phone Battery Pack Compatible with iPhone 16 15 14 13 Pro Samsung S23 Google iPad Tablet, etc
description: The INIU Portable Charger is a solid choice for anyone needing a dependable power bank. With its 20,000mAh capacity, it provides ample charge for my devices, allowing me to stay powered throughout the day. The 22.5W fast charging feature is impressive, quickly revitalizing my phone and tablet. I also appreciate the USB-C in-and-out capability, which makes it convenient to charge both the power bank and my devices. The design is sleek and portable, fitting easily in my bag. My only minor critique is that it could come with a carrying case for better protection. Overall, a great investment for on-the-go charging!

product_name: INIU Portable Charger, 22.5W 20000mAh USB C in & Out Power Bank Fast Charging, PD 3.0+QC 4.0 LED Display Phone Battery Pack Compatible with iPhone 16 15 14 13 Pro Samsung S23 Google iPad Tablet, etc
description: Pro #1:  This works well - it charged my phone quickly and multiple times on a single charge of the battery pack.  The LED display with the exact % of remaining charge is a nice upgrade from my previous power banks (with just zero to four blinking LED's).Con:  This is BIG - it's about an inch thick and weighs almost a pound.  It's too big and heavy to conveniently carry around on a daily basis in my backpack, let alone in a pocket.  For my purposes, I'm going to switch to a 5,000 mAh battery pack that's half an inch thick and weighs only 1/4 pound.Pro #2:  Customer support was VERY helpful.  By the time I realized this battery pack was too big, I'd missed the Amazon 30-day return window.  INIU customer support responded in less than 24 hours to my email, and they found a way to help me out - even though it was my fault for 1) buying a too-big battery pack, and 2) not returning it promptly.

product_name: INIU Portable Charger, 22.5W 20000mAh USB C in & Out Power Bank Fast Charging, PD 3.0+QC 4.0 LED Display Phone Battery Pack Compatible with iPhone 16 15 14 13 Pro Samsung S23 Google iPad Tablet, etc
description: I never ever write reviews. I felt compelled to write a review for this product because it truly is that good. There was no incentive for this review, and I am in no way affiliated with this company. I do happen to take think this is the best 20,000mAh power bank on the market by far, and I was surprised because I thought I was stepping down in quality since the price was lower than usual. I had been buying Anker in the past, but their prices were higher than ever, so I was looking for a cheaper bank that still did what I wanted, and oh boy did it. I love this little device. I keep it in my backpack always, and it never seems to discharge without me actually using it. It’ll stay at 100%, I think that’s because of the modern type of battery they used which at the time I bought this was pretty new and only in a handful of power banks, so I thought they were lying when I saw it in this one for such a low price.Best power bank I’ve ever had, hands down, and I got it because it was far cheaper than the others at the time I bought it. It charges devices faster than any power bank in similar price range. It says it is 20,000mAh capacity, but it lasts far longer than any other battery pack claiming the same capacity. It has a convenience flashlight that I’ve actually used a handful of times in a pinch. It can charge 3 devices at once, has two extremely fast USB type A ports, and even has a USB type C port that is still a fast charger compared to other battery packs, but is slower than the type A which are lightning fast. It doesn’t get that hot when charging compared to other high end battery packs. One unique feature is the USB-C that serves as input doubles as an output. This is super cool because every other charger that I could find at the time of purchase had an input which couldn’t output. It was purely an input. This power bank is also incredibly light for 20,000mAh, and fits in my pocket with my phone without being incredibly burdensome. I think it’s probably half the size and maybe a quarter to a third the weight of my first charger (from Anker many many years ago) which was supposed to be 26,800mAh, but didn’t last as long as this one.Not sure if this company replaces broken chargers but I would bet they do because it says they have a 3 year warranty. Anker will replace broken power banks basically with no questions asked within 18 months of purchase, and I had to use that one time, so if they replace them without making you prove you didn’t break it or whatever then this company has twice the warranty (at less than half the price at the time I purchased). I think that is why the battery bank is such high quality. They don’t want it breaking within 3 years, so they use the highest quality materials. It really is nice in the hand and you can tell it is high quality. Mine is barely scratched after being used and abused almost daily for so long now.I’ve had this product for at least a year now, I think longer, and I recently went to Hawaii and didn’t need to charge my Bose portable speaker or iPhone 12 Pro Max until the end of day 5 of the trip, and I used both frequently each day. The portable charger charged my phone like 4 times over as well as my speaker.Overall this is the best portable charger in this capacity range hands down, and I am a portable charger fanatic and have owned many mostly Anker power banks over the years.  Definitely get this charger as long as the price is still low and it’s available!

product_name: INIU Portable Charger, 22.5W 20000mAh USB C in & Out Power Bank Fast Charging, PD 3.0+QC 4.0 LED Display Phone Battery Pack Compatible with iPhone 16 15 14 13 Pro Samsung S23 Google iPad Tablet, etc
description: This charger is essential for my child that plays travel sports and rides a bus to and from away games.Now she’s charged to play games and even help a friend to share the charger with a friend.  Holds a charge forever.Incredible for the price.

product_name: INIU Portable Charger, 22.5W 20000mAh USB C in & Out Power Bank Fast Charging, PD 3.0+QC 4.0 LED Display Phone Battery Pack Compatible with iPhone 16 15 14 13 Pro Samsung S23 Google iPad Tablet, etc
description: I was going on a lengthy hike in about 3 days & needed a portable charger to ensure my phone didn’t die on the hike. My phone’s battery health is currently at 81% capacity & continues to drop.I came across the INIU portable charger & read the reviews & they were mostly positive. I knew it was going to a bulky portable charger, but it seemed manageable.It’s an amazing portable, but after I used it a few times, I’ve come to notice that it would basically charge my phone 2% while using 1% of its own battery. This means I can recharge my phone from 0-100 twice, which isn’t bad at all. However, it takes up to 10 hours to charge the portable battery from 0-100.In my own personal opinion, I just don’t feel like you’re getting the maximum return, so to speak. The absurd amount of time it takes the portable battery to only give 2 cycles of charges is slightly disappointing. Not the end of the world, but it’s the reason for the 4 stars.Every other aspect of this portable battery is great.

product_name: INIU Portable Charger, 22.5W 20000mAh USB C in & Out Power Bank Fast Charging, PD 3.0+QC 4.0 LED Display Phone Battery Pack Compatible with iPhone 16 15 14 13 Pro Samsung S23 Google iPad Tablet, etc
description: I was astounded into writing this review when I found "the one I got last time" to replace my seemingly dying power bank and saw that "last time" was February of 2020. I'm skittish with battery stuff, so I'm careful to at least read customer reviews of what I buy; consequently I was too nervous to purchase some of the other products currently on offer. This bank was familiar, but looking back, it's also reliable.I've dropped it as few times as possible, but that's a nonzero amount. In four years I've probably dropped it fewer than ten times, but it survived my clumsiness, possibly through its own merits. Mainly, I was surprised to find it was sufficient to charge my phone and headset multiple days each week, the exclusive source of charge during the days I used it for those two devices. I charged the bank only once a week in order to get this benefit, all the way up until this week in August of 2024 when it finally couldn't take any more of what I'd consider moderate use - and even then, "couldn't take" only means "not the same way." Still charges up to 30% overnight.I only paid so much for it last time and I'll only pay what they're charging for it this time. And I find it to be good value for money, under $10/year. I'm definitely going with the same one again, and frankly, I hope the next one serves me as well as the one I technically still have.

product_name: Amazon Fire 7 tablet (newest model) 7” display, read and watch, under $80 with 10-hour battery life, 32 GB, Black
description: First, I want to give a shout out to Dyle, the Amazon customer service representative, who patiently and valiantly tried to help me with the issues I'm having with my new Kindle Fire 7.  He is phenomenal, and I'd give him 100 stars if I could.  Unfortunately, the overall rating is 1 (and I wish I could give it something lower) due to Amazon's product, and the very weak warranty period surrounding it.  I bought my first Kindle Fire 7 in 2013, and have absolutely loved it.  I used it everyday, primarily borrowing books from my local library.  The interface between the library and Amazon worked perfectly, and I downloaded over 1000 books during that time, all downloaded to my Kindle Fire successfully.  I decided this past August that I should get a new Kindle Fire 7, as the charging of my old one was getting slower and slower.  Big mistake on my part - I should have on to the old one.  Everything started out fine with the new Kindle Fire 7.  I continued my usual routine of getting books from my library, and they successfully downloaded to the new Kindle.  After about 6 weeks (halfway through the meager 90-day warranty period), the downloading function stopped working.  I got an error message saying that Amazon was working on the issue, and to try again later.  After about a week of continuing error messages, I thought I should contact customer support.  Well over an hour later with the representative, all I was told was that it must be an error at my library.  The error message indicating that Amazon was working on the problem certainly seemed bogus.  With the customer service rep, I was able to successfully download library books from my PC and my iPhone to the new Kindle.  So the rep also added that I should just use my PC or iPhone to download books.  Not a good answer, Amazon.  I bought the Kindle Fire 7 specifically for the functionality which allows me to, with only the Kindle, take out books from the library and download them.  And, obviously, the Kindle had proven that this technology should work, until 6 weeks into my ownership of the new Kindle.  I wound up speaking with an Amazon supervisor, who acknowledged that the issue was on the Amazon side.  She indicated she would open a case with Amazon's Software Engineering Department in order to resolve the issue.  She also indicated that I would be contacted by Amazon in about a week with a resolution.  I asked if I could call in, concerned that I may not get a call back.  I was told that I could not call Software Engineering.  This was not unexpected, I just wanted to talk with someone in Customer Service who would be able to tell me the status of my issue.  The supervisor said she would document this situation in detail in my account record, so if I did call in, I should be able to get a quick response.  Fast forward 10 days, I still haven't heard from Amazon, and my warranty period is quickly ticking away.  I called in, and got the wonderful Dyle to help me.  (I did not put him on the spot, but it seemed apparent to me that the supervisor I had spoken to previously did not document the issue, or at least not sufficiently for someone else to be able to follow). Dyle tried a number of troubleshooting ideas that neither of the first two representatives tried.  Unfortunately, none were successful, and through consultation with someone else at Amazon (I assume his supervisor), they said I needed to send my Kindle back and they would attempt to repair, or else send me a new one.  I asked if the warranty period starts fresh with the repaired/new Kindle, and was told that it did not.  So, in the time I waited, seeing if Amazon's error message was accurate (indicating they were working to resolve the issue), calling into Customer Service and waiting 10 days with no response from them, then sending my Kindle in for repair/replacement, I estimate I have lost about 30% of the already skimpy 90 day warranty period.  This is just not right.  The issue with the Kindle did not occur until owning it for 6 weeks.  If the same pattern repeats itself, I will be well beyond the warranty period when the issue occurs, and then I will just have thrown my money away on this Kindle.  Dyle (and his supervisor?), understanding my concern, offered a partial refund if I just wanted to return the Kindle.  Why partial though, Amazon?  It's been acknowledged that the issue is with the Kindle.  Why should I have to pay anything if you send me a defective Kindle?  Very bad business model.  Not a good way at all to treat your customers.  I cannot recommend this product.

product_name: Amazon Fire 7 tablet (newest model) 7” display, read and watch, under $80 with 10-hour battery life, 32 GB, Black
description: I can't say whether this product is worth buying or not I kind of on one hand regret buying it but on the other hand it was very affordable This does not have any Google base anything in this tablet It does not tell you that right off the bat I found that out once I bought it and I was very disappointed So you can't sync your cell phone if you are Android person you have Google on everything you can't sync this with this tablet but if you're can do everything Amazon everything then you might be fine with that The apps on here for games and stuff sucks is very limited This is not a tablet that you can download games or anything like that it doesn't have all those apps that I'm used to seeing on like my cell phone or something like that So for Kindle it's perfect it does exactly what I want for my Kindle books and that's usually what I use it for You do have Amazon music on here You do have Spotify on here and I just use it for reading my Kindle books cuz it has a automatic voice activating reader thing that reads the book to you and you just push play in the book reads to you I like that feature the cell phones don't have that feature I don't know what's up with that So that's a plus for me Amazon music and Spotify when I get ready go to bed I use my tablet to listen to my music instead of my cell phone save my phone battery life So that's pretty much what I use it for The only game app I have on here will be surfer I think it's what it's called and that's about it there's some free TV show stuff you can watch on here It searches the web very nice but it's not your Google web search is Amazon's web search but I haven't run into any problems it's searching the web or it can't access something so the web is perfect I don't see this as a work tablet though It don't have any apps that supports that I don't think I get word on here but I haven't looked it up to actually see if it works like I said the App store  put more decent apps into this tablet.Oh in the lock screen The lock screen won't show a picture that you put it would show advertisement for the device or whatever that they put on it that's annoying can't get it off I think you you really think about it before doing it and if you can look up some review videos I recommend you do that too

product_name: Amazon Fire 7 tablet (newest model) 7” display, read and watch, under $80 with 10-hour battery life, 32 GB, Black
description: So In 2020, I got the 8in version of this tablet for $50.  I accidentally bought this one thinking the 7in version was the size I had.  When I saw it was $60 I was disappointed, but for what it's used for, it beats paying $100s more, so I got it.  When I got it in and it was smaller, I didn't mind the size, but was even more disappointed at the price.  Shame on you Amazon for charging $10 more for a smaller tablet only 2 model years later.  The price doesn't reflect inflation.That being said, if you want a cheap smaller tablet (I actually like the size myself) that does basic streaming and some games, maybe some kindle reading, this works fine.  However, do yourself a favor and mod it so that you can dump the unnecessary apps Amazon won't let you remove and install apps like google play since Amazon doesn't support their own app store.  Once you do THAT, it's worth the $60.

product_name: Amazon Fire 7 tablet (newest model) 7” display, read and watch, under $80 with 10-hour battery life, 32 GB, Black
description: I've been a loyal Kindle buyer, having bought six over the past decade, but this Fire 7 may be my last. It comes with  a Trending news section at the bottom of the For You page that is impossible to get rid of. I expected to get an e-reader, not a tablet with forced options. I don't want news, I don't want dancing graphics (I did turn that off). I paid to get rid of ads on the Lock screen. JUST BE AN E-BOOK READER!EDIT: After trying to get rid of the news feature without success, I gave up. About a half an hour later I went back and notice the news feature was also on my Kindle Fire 7 (2019 version) but way below a bunch of recommendations. I went back to my Fire 7 (2022) and made some changes and the news went away. I'm not sure what I did, but I dare not fiddle with it again or it might come back. I am changing my rating from 1 to 3 stars due to the frustration of so many options to deal with on what should be a simple tablet.

product_name: Amazon Fire 7 tablet (newest model) 7” display, read and watch, under $80 with 10-hour battery life, 32 GB, Black
description: I love the size of the tablet.  Most are at the 8 in size.  This works better as an E reader at 7 in.  I like the price of the tablet.  The screen and picture are nice.  The app store had most of the apps I need.The processor in the tablet is frustrating and nearly makes a decent tablet UNBEARABLE!If Amazon would upgrade the processors in their devices ( tablet, tv, fire phone etc)These would be very nice devices ...

product_name: Amazon Fire 7 tablet (newest model) 7” display, read and watch, under $80 with 10-hour battery life, 32 GB, Black
description: I bought the 16Gb and 32 Gb versions of this tablet. 1) The least bothersome aspect is that the speaker is of very low quality. Maybe I'm spoiled with my Samsung Zflip 3 which has amazing audio but this tablet has a really bad speaker. 2) The memory. The 16Gb and 32Gb are adequate. However the RAM for these tablets is sub-par. The 2Gb RAM is woefully inadequate for todays uses between streaming services, music, videos and books; all it takes is a bit of any of those used together and the tablet will shut down and kick you back to the main menu. 3) Using a tablet cleaner which is constantly running will also take up the RAM. I other words, use a cleaner/maintenance app that does not run in the background. The 16Gb unit has a 250Gb card while the 32Gb unit has a 1Tb card. Books from the Kindle app do not get sent to those cards. Instead, the books are dumped into the internal memory of the tablet. I have a few thousand books (over 12 years of collecting Kindle books) and this presents a serious problem in particular when the thumbnails for each book are taking up RAM. 4) Tablets these days should come with a minimum 4Gb RAM. This one only as 2Gb RAM which puts it in a very bad position for using memory intensive apps. Consider getting something else 5) Taking into consideration the Kindle app and it not downloading books to the external SD card, I made the attempt to remove the Kindle app and then re-installing it in the hopes that this action would correct the problem of the books not being downloaded into the SD cards. For some reason, Amazon has made it impossible to remove the Kindle app and re-installing it. I was able to do that with all of my Kindles but this is the first time I was blocked (on both machines). MY RECOMMENDATION: DO NOT PURCHASE this tablet until 1) The RAM has been upgraded to a minimum of 4Gb and the issue with downloading books to the SD card is resolved. This tablet is good only if you will be using it lightly like in only playing music (I'm afraid to put music on this machine) or streaming videos. Streaming takes negligible amounts of RAM. But having anything in this machine which will have to load into the RAM itself will present problems. Please note that I have owned approximately eight Kindle Fire tablets and many of them were really bad. So, for lite use, yes, it is fine especially if you use it with headphones or outside speakers. Everything will work fine. Just be aware of the issues mentioned above and if you are fine with those then get this unit. If not, wait for Amazon to upgrade it to 4Gb and resolve the Kindle books issue.

product_name: Amazon Fire 7 tablet (newest model) 7” display, read and watch, under $80 with 10-hour battery life, 32 GB, Black
description: I was disappointed. I didn't read the fine print and was unaware that the tablet was not Google supported. I ended up giving it to my granddaughters. Soon after the warranty expired, the tablet stopped charging claiming there was moisture in the charging port (even though it is stored in a dry place and was not around moisture when not in use). I tried all of the remedys that Amazon suggested, but to no avail. Last night I did a factory reset on the tablet which seemed to remedy the situation (fingers crossed). All in all, I guess I got what I paid for, but if you can afford it, you might want to spend the money for a more elite brand.

product_name: Amazon Fire 7 tablet (newest model) 7” display, read and watch, under $80 with 10-hour battery life, 32 GB, Black
description: The only app I added was Spotify, and I don’t download songs, but I still keep getting “low storage” notifications. I’ve tried clearing caches, clearing temporary storage, and uninstalling all the apps I don’t use. Unfortunately several of the apps that ot came with, it won’t let me uninstall, even though I don’t use them. Nothing I do seems to help, and I continually have to deal with the low storage notice (which of course comes with an offer for me to purchase additional storage).The ONLY thing I wanted this device for is to play Spotify at work. It works great for that, aside from these annoying notifications.

product_name: Amazon Fire 7 tablet (newest model) 7” display, read and watch, under $80 with 10-hour battery life, 32 GB, Black
description: This tablet boasts phenomenal battery life, allowing for extended usage without needing a charge. However, that's where the positives end. The readability is just passable, the picture quality is lackluster, and the overall speed and performance are disappointingly dismal. To top it off, the tablet lacks any real applications, making it hard to recommend even with its impressive battery life.Overall, it's a decent tablet for its price if you're mainly looking for a device for kids. Just don't expect it to replace your laptop.

product_name: Amazon Fire 7 tablet (newest model) 7” display, read and watch, under $80 with 10-hour battery life, 32 GB, Black
description: This is a small tablet that runs Amazon Apps. In this price range you are not going to get eye popping graphics or symphony hall sound (it has mono output and speaker). But it does the basic job nicely and is simple to use. Initial setup was easy, if a bit slow. My big gripe about the setup was tapping through a number of nag screens that want you to install various Amazon Apps that I didn't need or want. But each one was easy to say "No" to and then proceed to the next nag.After getting it up and running, the Apps are a bit slow to load. I bought this primarily for listening to songs on my Amazon Music subscription. Here is where the glitches start. I occasionally get "unable to play this song" messages when I tap on a song. Going back to the Home Screen and restarting "Music" usually clears this up. I never have this issue on my iPhone or iPad, so it must be related to this tablet.  A much larger problem is that I sometimes will get a "you need an internet connection to play this music" when I tap on the song. WiFi is shown as connected and other Apps work, but Music will not play anything. Doing a shut down and restart will clear this problem up.The Bluetooth connected right up with my Bluetooth speakers and it seems to work fine and I've had no issues with the Bluetooth.The Ads that come with the cheaper model aren't too bad. They appear on the lock screen and a quick swipe up will banish them. There are also ads across the top of the Home screen, but they are not too intrusive and are easy to ignore. Thankfully, no jiggling or flashing ads that are difficult to close like you see on other devices.Overall, a pretty nice tablet. But I am keeping an eye on the Return date to see if I continue to have issues with with the "You need an internet connection" message. And, no, Amazon Support; I am not going to reboot my Gateway to attempt to solve this problem. Everything else I have in the house works just fine and glitch free on my WiFi - so it is some issue with this Tablet. (Support suggested I change my WiFi password to solve the problem; yeah, right).

product_name: Amazon Fire 7 tablet (newest model) 7” display, read and watch, under $80 with 10-hour battery life, 32 GB, Black
description: OK.  we know it's not a high end, super expensive, gadget.It's cheap.It is NOT stereo soundIt works.Setup was a breeze.The "denim" color, made this old hippie smile, but am getting a composition book style case to hide it...Test ran videos...at 70% charge and it lasted 8ish hours.  4 hours to recharge.It will keep you amused in the doctor's' office, or in the garage waiting for your tires to be rotated.I bought this solely because I wanted to see how the Fire 7 compares to my BELOVED HDX7 of years gone by.  No comparison.  The HDX 7 was the VERY BEST of the whole shebang, and I still own and use (blush) several of them.  Stereo sound still is excellent, picture, etc....please bring it back.  sigh....This little baby will, however, be thrown in my purse for the little annoyances of life stated above.  Much prefer to lose this, than the iPhone or iPad.  My books, access to my music, news, videos and the time will fly.  I sprung for the 32 gig..and can't see a reason to expand.  And when I leave it laying ...no huge loss.Best thing about it...size.  It fits my small hands, it fits in purse, or jeans/cargo pants/jacket pocket. The library...worth its weight in gold.  I have a lot of cookbooks, gardening books.  They just don't look as good in the grey format of the Paperwhite , and this is another reason I'm keeping this little rhinestone.I recommend for a handy, cost effective diversion..and plan on using it a lot.  I think a child...especially one who likes to read...not so much gaming...could use this.11/20/22sooo...a little update.I use this almost daily, because of weight and size.  I LOVE the ease with reading, much better as far as I am concerned than the Paperwhite (yeah...I own SEVERAL gadgets) color screen, play a little soft music or rain in background, etc)  I've read almost every day!!!  I LOVE ITThe lack of 2 speaker stereo bugged me a lot.  Sooo...i grabbed a set of earphones..and BOB's YOUR UNCLE.  I can listen to CCR, and play some solitaire, read the Post or Times...watch my tv shows, etc and the stereo sound comes in very well.Flying out for the holiday on Tuesday.  This will be in my hand or purse during the grueling 7 hr flight, stop overs.  And if something happens....its a damned cheap, but VERY serviceable source of entertainment.your gift to yourself.  I think you will be more pleased than you think.  Happy Holiday's Folks!!

product_name: Amazon Fire 7 tablet (newest model) 7” display, read and watch, under $80 with 10-hour battery life, 32 GB, Black
description: So I only just got this and thought I'd share my initial review and hopefully answer questions that others might have that has been difficult to find answers for.Size differencesAs most have already seen, this version is different from the previous in shape and size, yes it is slightly smaller. For most users who had the previous version, the kicker is that your covers and cases etc. are no longer compatible.Also the Charger uses USB-C plug also which is different from the previous versions.In terms of performanceThis is night and day in comparison to the older versions.  The older version was slick when it first came out but like most people know, the FireOS is basically Android and as more and more updates have been applied, the older version is now running really slow. So basically this new version hardware was tailored for the today's version of android thus it runs very fast and very slick, this is a very crucial issue.NO YOUTUBE KIDS APPThe biggest issue anyone will encounter and is well known about is that this does not have the Google Play Store or accompanying services. That means that IT DOES NOT HAVE THE NATIVE YOUTUBE KIDS APP.There are many people on here that simply either don't understand what a native app is or simply confuse it with the main Youtube. I myself had multiple answers that failed to answer this basic question with multiple contradictory answers or reviews that failed to  understand the question.Amazon FIRE tablets DO NOT HAVE YOUTUBE KIDS Apps. Amazon has their own Youtube.com app which it seems they created as the developer email address for that app is an amazon.com email address. When you click YOUTUBE KIDS link in that app it jumps to the browser and opens in the browser which is a terrible experience. It is strange given that on the fire TV, the YouTube app allows you to switch to kids profiles, if only Amazon would do that for their tablet youtube app. But until then What you have are 3rd party apps built by you know who on the AppStore that plays youtube. They are not native apps, nor do they support most of the functionality as is. They are not written by Youtube, Google or Amazon either, so if you want to give those apps your google login which is used for Youtube Kids then you do so at your own risk.YES YOU CAN INSTALL YOUTUBE KIDS NATIVE APP, BUT YOU HAVE TO DO IT YOURSELF.I don't know why nor will I try to even get into this very very old topic of not having youtube kids, but the GOOD news is that it is very simple and easy to get Youtube kids native apps on this 12th gen version. You don't need to be a modder or anything intense. But a simple web search will tell you how to do this. Just know that you will have to install 4 different google apps/services first to get the Play Store. This is even easier as you simply open the browser, download each of them from the website and Click to install. DONE AND DUSTED.  Once you have the Play Store you can easily install any of the native youtube Kids apps or even the original Youtube app from google and even login to your tablet with your gmail account. I was able to do this in 30 minutes.With YouTube Kids installed. I am now able to give this 10 Stars.This is basically very decent hardware and latest OS for $60.You cannot go wrong with this as a kids tablet especially with the ability from Amazon to quickly lock this down.Touch Screen is extremely responsiveI have struggled to find a decent priced kids tablet that is responsive enough to use the ANTON app without lag. This is the fastest tablet I have seen at this price point. For those that haven't used ANTON, it is by far the best app for teaching your kids. It has school derived lessons, I would recommend every parent should download ANTON. But it's writing lessons, needs a screen that is responsive and a fairly decent tablet. This tablet passes the ANTON test with a gold star.Sound is clear with some bass. It doesn't sound like a tin can.Sound quality is very loud and clear. Trust me, if you've been through the dozen kids tablets I have, you will be surprised how much of a let down it would be when you have poor sound. Kids need to hear clearly and this does it without issues.The Amazon AppStore itself is actually pretty good. All the apps we had on our old android tablet were available except for Youtube Kids. I'd imagine there are many more that are not available but most of the decent kids ones are on there including ANTON, ABC Kids etcI would think that since the FireTV Youtube app allows kids profiles, that Amazon would at some point do the same with their own tablet Youtube app.As it is right now this table is almost perfect especially once I was able to manually install play store and youtube kids easily. I'm ordering a second one.

product_name: Amazon Fire 7 tablet (newest model) 7” display, read and watch, under $80 with 10-hour battery life, 32 GB, Black
description: My old kindle that I bought years ago finally died and I got this one to replace it.  Better battery and more storage and it came preregistered with my account information.  All of my books were in the cloud although I couldn’t tell which had been downloaded to my old Kindle so I had to download them and open them to determine which had been read.  The only issue was that it was totally dead when it arrived and I had to plug it in and charge it before I could use it (nothing about that in the instructions) and there was no light to indicate that it was charging like the old one did.  It has a lot of apps that I’ll probably never use, but still all in all a good product at a good price.

product_name: Amazon Fire 7 tablet (newest model) 7” display, read and watch, under $80 with 10-hour battery life, 32 GB, Black
description: I was an early Kindle Fire adapter, but I think the last one I bought was in 2017.  So this one is definitely a step up from that.  I just got tired of the Fire OS - it was too locked up and not as robust as regular Android.  Plus, there is one mindless Android game that I love that isn't available in the Amazon App Store, so that's a thing.I like to talk a lot before getting to the actual review.  Sorry.  Context is important for me.***Actual review***I decided to buy a new Fire because I wanted something a little larger than my phone screen (I have a Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 3, which actually has a pretty large screen) to watch movies on when on vacation.  Fires tend to be cheaper than most tablets, so I looked there first.  This came up with decent specs for an amazing price, so I bought one.  Then realized that it wouldn't be out until 6/29.I got it yesterday and set it up.  Here are my impressions:Kindle Fire 7 with 32gb storage & no ads.Pros - Perfect size to watch movies on an airplane tray table - Decent screen resolution (my eyesight isn't what it used to be, and this is still better than everything I had growing up) - Made for Amazon environment, so Prime Video, Audible, and Kindle books work great.  Mostly. - Most of the apps I use are in the Amazon Appstore - I paid $94 to get this without ads and to get the 32gb size - that's way cheaper than a comparable name brand tablet anywhere else (I'm looking at you Samsung & Apple!) - There's an expandable memory slot - I have a 128gb micro SD card in there (It makes you format the card before you can use it) - USB-C cord!!!!!!  I don't know when Fires switched to this, but I'm glad they finally did - Amazing battery life.  I downloaded a whole bunch of shows and also reset a couple of times.  Then downloaded again.  After several hours of aggressive usage, it's still at 66%.Cons - Wow, this is slow.  I'm comparing it to my phone, which is technically top of the line as of last November, and this is slow.  It's also $1400 less than I paid for my phone, so while it's annoying, it's not enough to knock off a whole star. - Can't fast charge.  Not a huge issue because the battery is pretty big & I have to sleep sometime, but still. - Can't download the one game I want from the Play store.  Yes, I know that there's a way to do it, but it's annoying that it's not easy out of the box. - Not all the customer service people know enough about this to help when you have issues.  (Yeah, technically not the unit's fault, but as someone who was DM'ing with them for 2 hours yesterday and talked with 4 different people, I'm putting this con somewhere!) - Can't save Prime Video content to the SD card.  At least you can't download there.  That's why I got the card.  I'm not sure I can transfer Prime Videos between internal & SD yet.  I think this is the same for all Amazon content. - I kept getting "service_error" when I downloaded tv episodes that I had purchased, even when the episodes weren't on another device.  According to Customer Service, you can only have them on 2 devices.  I only had them on one, and I deleted them off that one, and I still kept getting the error.TL;DR: This is a really, really good tablet, bordering on great FOR. THE. PRICE!  The form factor is awesome for travel, and as long as you play in Amazon's sandbox, the experience is mostly good.  I did have a lot of problems downloading episodes, which is actually why I bought this in the first place, and I don't like that you can't download Amazon content to the SD card.  I'm not sure if there are legal reasons for that, but I don't like it.

product_name: Amazon Fire 7 tablet (newest model) 7” display, read and watch, under $80 with 10-hour battery life, 32 GB, Black
description: I've owned several Fire tablets but this was my first time buying this smaller size.  It does all the same stuff that the other Kindles do but fits in one hand, which I like.  I just use this one for reading books, nothing more.  The screen is bright, and there are atleast 3 different settings for font size (for those of us, like myself, who need a bit larger-sized text). ;)  Also, it's a very good value for the price. Highly recommended.

product_name: Amazon Fire 7 tablet (newest model) 7” display, read and watch, under $80 with 10-hour battery life, 32 GB, Black
description: This is my 5th kindle so I'm a little bit of an expert on this item.  I can watch pretty much any movie that can be streamed, shop for ad buy anything on amazon (or any seller for that matter), play any game that doesn't need a controller, and read any book that Amazon has with this kindle fire.  Copying my files over from an old kindle to my new one is almost automatic with WiFi.  Having said that, I have no experience doing this via USB cable from a computer so can't rate that process.  I don't play google-based games here, so don't know about those issues.My only negative is that this kindle came with a REALLY empty battery.  The battery was so low that when I initially placed it on a charger, I couldn't even get it to tell me it was charging.  Thankfully, when I returned to it several minutes later it gave me the low battery logo which indicates charging.  Also, the initial software freshen takes several minutes, so don't get in a hurry to use the thing.Pros:  It does everything I need it to do.  It's super user friendly to set up and transfer previous kindle files.Cons:  The low battery indicator won't show during early initial charging.  The software refresh is slow.

product_name: Amazon Fire 7 tablet (newest model) 7” display, read and watch, under $80 with 10-hour battery life, 32 GB, Black
description: I needed an e-reader which could handle my needs, and that's why I rated my Fire 7 highly. I'm not using it to play games or stream movies or take pictures and videos. Though I got the no ads/32 gig model, because reading is serious business.Because it was my six year old Kindle Paperwhite that got me into this. I love reading on it, even library books. This is important, because I'm a writer (The Way of Cats book) and a devoted reader. To keep up with this favorite hobby, I have a Kindle Unlimited subscription. Still, there are many books, and I also subscribe to Scribd. I have books I own, and books I rent, essentially.Which makes my Paperwhite less of a general reader than I would like. I'm also researching a new book. I can send all these PDFs to my Kindle account, but it's not the same reading or highlighting experience as an optimized PDF reader. In my mind, I'd like to keep these documents, but not on my Bookshelf, mixed with the thrillers and the sciences.Recent thoughts of how long my Paperwhite would last led me to consider e-readers in general. Reading outdoors is combining two of my favorite things, where a dedicated e-ink device really shines, so some kind of Kindle reader is important to me. But I could really use a general purpose reader. This was my first attempt at combining these needs. I am very pleased.The Silk browser, included, let me navigate to the address of the Scribd app (information on the Scribd site.) This let me download a third party app, permission for which I first adjusted in settings. Currently testing PDF readers in the Amazon App Store, for some free books I got in that format.Now I have three readers in one. My Kindle and Scribd books update on my other apps, and I them as I've always done. This screen is as easy to read on as my iPad mini, so no complaints. My iPad is bigger and heavier, with the case and the Pencil, and not something I put in my purse if I don't need to. The Fire 7 works better for what I usually need a purse device for, which is reading and web browsing. My phone is really old and won't keep downloaded books for very long. The idea being that if I'm stuck somewhere with no wifi, I have books in the device. And they will be there.The Kindle app is almost fully operational, but I can't put books into Collections with it, and the layout is subtly different, but it works fine. If it gets confused, I restart it. It's not a high tech device, but it's great for the price.

product_name: Amazon Fire 7 tablet (newest model) 7” display, read and watch, under $80 with 10-hour battery life, 32 GB, Black
description: Full disclosure, I bought this 2022 release 7 inch Fire tablet from Best Buy  (I had rewards that we fixing to expire and I didn't need anything else, so I bought this there, rather than from Amazon).This little tablet is perfect for my uses, as I bought it specifically to use as an eReader, and for that, it's perfect (for me).I also have the 2019 release of the 7 inch Fire tablet, which is about half an inch longer, so if you're planning to use the same case or screen protector, you're out of luck.This 2022 version (12th gen), in length and width, is about the size of a standard mass market paperback. It's right around 3/8ths of an inch thick, and feels pretty light weight to me. Certainly light enough that it won't become heavy even after several hours of dedicated reading.It charges pretty quickly. Right out of the box, it had a 6% charge. Using the included cord and plug, it powered up to 100% battery in an hour or so, and each charge seems to last a good while. (This Fire tablet will also tell you how many hours and minutes of charge are left, presumably based on your current activity. I like this feature a lot.)Setup was easy, as it wasn't linked to my account since I bought from a 3rd party vendor (Best Buy). It took maybe 5 minutes, because there was an update that needed to install.Other than the size difference between this one and the 2019 version, some things are changed. Most important for me are the control buttons.The power button has been relocated from the right side to the left, which is going to take me some time to get used to but I will, eventually.  Whereas before, the buttons, from L to R, were ordered as Volume, Headphone Jack, Charging Port, Power, the 2022 Fire 7 is ordered (also L to R) as Power, Volume, Charging Port, Headphone Jack. I can't say it's better or worse. Just different.So far, this tablet operates well and opens/navigates quickly. That may (or may not) be because I only use it for reading and checking other books on Amazon's website.I hate the Silk browser, but it is what it is.I don't like that I can't uninstall any of the pre-loaded apps that I will never use, or even just remove the icons from my home screen (as far as I know), but that's a relatively minor thing.I've given this 7 inch 12th generation 2022 Fire tablet 4 stars due to the inconvenient things I mentioned above, but on the whole, I like it for what I use it for. I can't speak to heavy/very varied use. I would not try to use this for hardcore gaming.If you're looking for an affordably-priced eReader with light internet use, this tablet might just be for you.

product_name: Amazon Fire 7 tablet (newest model) 7” display, read and watch, under $80 with 10-hour battery life, 32 GB, Black
description: I bought this to replace older Fire 7 tablet that has problems with WiFi connectivity and very short battery life. This ismuchit's better! My only suggestion: be aware that it is slight smaller and lighter than than the 2019 Fire 7. Thus, you will need a new case. (I found a case similar to my original Fire case, much less expensive, a bit stiffer, but works similarly. It does not have the 'open to wake' front, but neither does my cell phone case!) I do feel the sound is not quite as loud on this Fire tablet but that is minor. All in all, a great deal!Edit: 10/6/2024Although this tablet remains faster than my former Fire 7 tablet, I must add that I have discovered some Cons:1. The phasing in of the new Gallery photo app is awkward. I greatly prefer the original Photos app. I simply dropped Gallery into an Unused folder.2. The Amazon storefront app is not as convenient for as it is no longer so intuitive. (I now find myself purchasing more items locally.)3. The 'bloatware' continues to be a nuisance, taking up valuable space. I wish it were Google compatible so that I could choose my apps.4. A basic inexpensive tablet, largely a marketing tool, it remains serviceable. IMO, my android tablet and phone better suit my needs. The SD card does not integrate well to extend memory.5. The Appstore security app offering have greatly diminished. I was actually told by Amazon IT that I should remove one as the store only sells them, does not guarantee their safety. I am aware that this is a problem recently with other play stores, etc. I was assured that Fire tablets are hard to hack. But many data systems have vulnerabilities.In summary, a well priced tablet for basic entertainment,  it has limits. I own 2 older models and this newer one. They interface well with Alexa. The clock app works even if WiFi drops and is a great alarm backup. However, I will not purchase another.

product_name: Amazon Fire 7 tablet (newest model) 7” display, read and watch, under $80 with 10-hour battery life, 32 GB, Black
description: I was looking for something to dip my toe into the water of E-readers. This is small and lightweight, easy to drop in your bag to have on the go. I did buy a case to protect it during transport but it seems pretty durable without it. Screen quality is good, easy to read on. I do wish I had sprung for the paper white as reading in high light areas can be difficult sometimes. It is not the fastest at processing but if you take the time to download your intended reads it works just fine. The battery life is excellent, only needing to be charged every couple days with light to moderate reading. I do not use this for anything other than reading so I couldn’t tell you about any of the other features.

product_name: SAMSUNG T9 Portable SSD 4TB, USB 3.2 Gen 2x2 External Solid State Drive, Seq. Read Speeds Up to 2,000MB/s for Gaming, Students and Professionals,MU-PG4T0B/AM, Black (Pack of 1)
description: Sometimes it shows up in Windows 10 & 11.  Sometimes it doesn't.  I went to a lot of effort to test different scenarios to fix it and nothing got them to behave.  (Unfortunately I bought 2 of them over a time) Wasted my money.

product_name: SAMSUNG T9 Portable SSD 4TB, USB 3.2 Gen 2x2 External Solid State Drive, Seq. Read Speeds Up to 2,000MB/s for Gaming, Students and Professionals,MU-PG4T0B/AM, Black (Pack of 1)
description: I want to start off by saying I have a 1TB Samsung X5 from 2018 that transfers at 2,500MB/s. I've outgrown the 1TB capacity, and the T9 was recommended as a newer alternative to the X5 with a larger capacity.On the box, it claims up to 2,000MB/s. Unfortunately, the higheset write speed I've achieved is under 1,000MB/s.

product_name: SAMSUNG T9 Portable SSD 4TB, USB 3.2 Gen 2x2 External Solid State Drive, Seq. Read Speeds Up to 2,000MB/s for Gaming, Students and Professionals,MU-PG4T0B/AM, Black (Pack of 1)
description: I can not recommend this T9 SSD drive for Windows users.  I had difficulty getting my Windows 11 system to see and recognize the T9 drive.  For me this drive was not automatically recognized.  I tried on my computer.  I had my brother try on his Windows, and Chrome computers.  The drive was not recognized.  I was getting ready to return the drive, after trying several trouble shooting steps.  Then something worked (perhaps in Device Manager, in the Disk area).  I do not know what cleared my problem up, but my Computer started seeing the drive.  The drive Now works fine on my system, but I am concerned if I attempt to use this drive on other Window computers – I might have the same problems, of the drive not being recognized.  I have used other similar type of drives, and never had these issues.--------Update.  I purchased a new android tablet and attempted to move video files from my PC onto the tablet.  The transfer speed was slow at roughly 1 megabyte per second using this T9 drive. I next tried an older drive that I had and the transfer speed was roughly 20 to 40 times faster.

product_name: SAMSUNG T9 Portable SSD 4TB, USB 3.2 Gen 2x2 External Solid State Drive, Seq. Read Speeds Up to 2,000MB/s for Gaming, Students and Professionals,MU-PG4T0B/AM, Black (Pack of 1)
description: I finally used it tonight, and boy does this SSD get hot! the T7 does not have this issue, I own 4 of them.I cannot trust an SSD that gets that hot after a few minutes, going to exchange for a T7

product_name: SAMSUNG T9 Portable SSD 4TB, USB 3.2 Gen 2x2 External Solid State Drive, Seq. Read Speeds Up to 2,000MB/s for Gaming, Students and Professionals,MU-PG4T0B/AM, Black (Pack of 1)
description: The rubber shroud is dumb and makes it too big. Other than that it is great

product_name: SAMSUNG T9 Portable SSD 4TB, USB 3.2 Gen 2x2 External Solid State Drive, Seq. Read Speeds Up to 2,000MB/s for Gaming, Students and Professionals,MU-PG4T0B/AM, Black (Pack of 1)
description: Macs do not have the ability to take full advantage of this drive - Macs don't support USB 3.2 Gen 2 2x2. And, it only copies faster for extremely large files. The largest file on my and likely your computer is ~8 GB or smaller. At these sizes even if your computer does support USB 3.2 Gen 2 2x2, you won't see a speed improvement. Also, with older Macs like the 2015 Retina, the EVO line is just as fast. All external Samsung SSDs run at around 350 MB/s read/write or slower if they're getting full. The smaller size and durability of the Samsung T7 drives make them a great choice. Skip the T9 if you have a Mac - even an M2, because you won't see faster speeds than T7, you just pay more for T9.I just did a write test for 4TB T9, T7, and Evo drives on an 8.58 GB file (my largest file). Time to copy for the drives were 20 sec., 20 sec., and 25 seconds. T9 and T7 wrote at the same speed, Evo was a little slower. Black Magic Disk Speed Test indicates that the T9 is a little slower than the T7 - why pay more for less speed?

product_name: SAMSUNG T9 Portable SSD 4TB, USB 3.2 Gen 2x2 External Solid State Drive, Seq. Read Speeds Up to 2,000MB/s for Gaming, Students and Professionals,MU-PG4T0B/AM, Black (Pack of 1)
description: Likely just a manufacture issue. Cable is brand new but won’t communicate with computer. Disk seems ok. Had to borrow cable to test / communicate with hard drive

product_name: SAMSUNG T9 Portable SSD 4TB, USB 3.2 Gen 2x2 External Solid State Drive, Seq. Read Speeds Up to 2,000MB/s for Gaming, Students and Professionals,MU-PG4T0B/AM, Black (Pack of 1)
description: Performed as advertised for five months and then just went dead.  Not recognized by my laptop or desktop.  Blue light indicating "on" displayed briefly and then stopped.  Contacted Samsung and spent 75 minutes text messaging and getting passed from department to department indicating they weren't the correct department and I needed to contact someone else.  Finally, I got cut off.  Went back to the phone and chose a live rep.  Waited for 75 minutes before finally hanging up.  Went back online and finally text messaged someone who indicated what information was required and where it should be sent.  In my note to Samsung with the information, I indicated that after the hassle and delay and losing information on the disk, what I wanted was simply a refund of the purchase rather than to send the unit back again.  Their response: they could only make a refund for something purchased at their own web site and "Your support ticket has been resolved."  They did indicate that I could call a number for their "case management team" which I did.  When I finally reached someone there, they indicated that I should contact technical support at seagate.com\contacts.  I thought "that's strange but Samsung must have bought Seagate!"  And I asked the rep to spell the name which he did.  Again, back to text message with a very confused Seagate rep who ultimately figured out that I was in the wrong place.  But that any rep of Samsung would tell me something like that speaks incredibly poorly of Samsung.  In sum, the HD worked for a couple of months and then without warning died.  The replacement was DOA.  And customer service is without question the worst that I have ever encountered in any context.  I will never purchase another Samsung product of any type.

product_name: SAMSUNG T9 Portable SSD 4TB, USB 3.2 Gen 2x2 External Solid State Drive, Seq. Read Speeds Up to 2,000MB/s for Gaming, Students and Professionals,MU-PG4T0B/AM, Black (Pack of 1)
description: Do not include your FCPX project on the same T9 4TB Samsung drive as your stored video files!!! Keep them on two different drives or risk not being able to open the drive on your Mac because the drive has filled up too full with data. This might be an issue related with the software that’s included on the drive but I’ve never had this issue with a T5 or T7.  It’s happened to me twice where the computer no longer could read the drive because it got too full.  The last time this happened was on another brand new T9 SSD drive (I own 7 of them by now).  However, this time the video project I had on it filled up and ended up corrupting my stored video files on that SSD as a result.  That’s footage that I cannot recover!  Samsung needs to find a way to solve this issue real fast because a lot of wedding videographers are going to suffer with this issue
