product_name: Amazon Fire HD 10 Kids Pro tablet (newest model) ages 6-12 | Bright 10.1" HD screen | Slim case for older kids, ad-free content, parental controls, 13-hr battery, 32 GB, Nebula
description: Update: Amazon emailed me asking me to contact tech support.  I did and have updated this review after speaking with them.The basic idea behind the Fire 10 Kids tablet is to let Amazon do all the parenting for you!  Amazon will decide what is age-appropriate, suggest books to your kids, and select what websites they can visit.If you actually want to curate what your children access, here are some things you should know:First, the tablet is tied to Kids+.  When your kids go into Books, they are offered a huge selection of titles that Amazon has deemed age-appropriate.  You cannot curate, filter, or eliminate any of these.  You can only set an age range for your child.  Once you have, Amazon – not you – decides what is appropriate for a child of that age.  The same thing is true with Apps and web browsing.Amazon claims that you can set up web browsing so that your children can visit only white-listed sites you have hand-picked.  This is misleading.  The Amazon help forum is filled with complaints from parents who have turned on this ‘hand picked’ feature and then can’t find the web browser at all.  When you turn on the hand picked website feature, the browser icon disappears.  Instead, your child must now go to an icon labeled ‘On this Device,’ which yields a mostly blank screen telling your child to “Talk to an adult about adding content to this device.” If they then click on the search icon (at the top of this blank screen), they get a set of Amazon icons for ‘Adventure’ and ‘Animals,’ etc.  If you click on one of these, you get redirected back to a whole library of Kids+ content, but now – 4 lines down, so low that you can’t see it unless you scroll – you get a line labeled ‘Added For You’ that includes the websites you have picked for your child.Thinking of adding books that you have selected from your Kindle Library or downloaded from the public library via an app like Libby?  They don’t even appear in the Kids Books app.  That is strictly for Kids+ content.  Where do you find them?  In the same ‘Added For You’ section that is buried 3 layers deep under the On This Device icon.Second, if you unsubscribe for Kids+, you lose much of the tablet’s functionality as a child-friendly device.  You can’t actually cancel Kids+ immediately.  (It comes with the tablet and even if you unsubscribe the day you get it, the initial 1-year subscription continues for another 364 days.) However, you can unlink the tablet from the subscription or create a new child profile that is not linked to Kids+.Unlinking from Kids+ does eliminate all of the Amazon content.  No more Amazon-curated games, books, or videos.  But the related icons and apps disappear too.  No more Books app, no Apps and Games icon.  In fact, without Kids+, the child profile is incredibly clunky.  There are a few basic icons: Music, Camera, Call, Announce, Sound Box, and Screen Time – plus On This Device.  You can add apps and books from your Amazon account, but they all appear via On This Device.  To get to them, you have to go through the same process described above: click on On This Device, get a mostly blank screen, click on the search icon, and then get a series of thumbnails like ‘Adventure’ and ‘Horses and Ponies.’  Only now, if you click on one of those, you get just your downloaded content, without any Amazon offerings.There is no clear reason for this, since if you go to your adult profile, the downloaded apps are right there on the home screen, as independent icons.  It seems like Amazon has deliberately crippled the child profile to push you back into the Kids+ ecosystem.Unlinking from Kids+ also effectively kills many of the parent controls on the dashboard.  Since the new profile is no longer divided into Apps, Books, etc., you cannot manage your child’s time based on activity.  If you want to allow your child 10 minutes of video game time a day, but unlimited reading time, there is no longer a way to implement that effectively.What about reading books in a child profile without Kids+?  There is no Books icon anymore when you eliminate Kids+.  Where do you find the books you have added from your Amazon library?  You guessed it: 3 layers deep under On This Device.  There is no way to sort the On This Device content either, so all your books, apps, and websites are listed in one jumble.  I thought maybe I could partially fix this by adding the Kindle app to the device, so that my child could get to books by clicking on one app.  No luck.  Amazon tech support will tell you that you can get Kindle sharing it to your child’s account via the ‘Add content’ feature in the settings.  But the Amazon-installed apps don’t appear there, only new apps that you have installed.  You can’t actually download the Kindle app to the Fire tablet from the Amazon store (it’s listed as ‘Currently Unavailable’), so there is no way easy way add it.  I pointed this out to tech support and they responded “Ohh not to worry Please download from an unknown source.”  Really.There’s basically just one redeeming feature in a child profile without Kids+.  If you use the 'For You' screen instead of the 'Home Screen,' the downloaded apps to appear on a separate line and your added content 'Added for You' also appears on its own line.  So it's usable - but it's also messy.  The same apps appear on both lines, and your books are still mixed with the apps in Added for You.Third, you can’t turn an adult profile into a kid-safe experience.  The adult profile is the most functional and easily curatable: you can add the apps of your choosing (which appear with icons right on the home screen, just like on a normal mobile device) and you can use Kindle to create a curated library of books.  You could set Prime Video for the Kids profile.  If you are willing to use a workaround to install Google Play (Wired magazine has some good instructions) you could install a parent-friendly browser.  But alas, you can’t remove or disable any of Amazon’s apps.  You still have the Silk browser, which is mostly unrestricted.  You still have Freevee, with its adult-oriented content.  You child could even make purchases via the Shop Amazon app.Bottom line: unless you think Amazon is an awesome parent, this really isn’t a kid-friendly device.  It certainly isn’t a parent-friendly one.

product_name: Amazon Fire HD 10 Kids Pro tablet (newest model) ages 6-12 | Bright 10.1" HD screen | Slim case for older kids, ad-free content, parental controls, 13-hr battery, 32 GB, Nebula
description: We buy a lot of things on Amazon and are generally pleased and don't review much, but with the holiday season close by I wanted to share my experience with this new tablet and hopefully help some others in our position looking to purchase their little ones a new tablet before Christmas. I really wanted to like this tablet, and on first look it appears well built and comes with a nice case for our 4-year-old. I even think it'd be fair to give this tablet 2 or 3 stars on account of that, until Amazon's "Fire HD Tablet Customer Service" got involved trying to help. Though very polite, with the language barrier, extremely poor audio quality (very NON-HD), and them simply reading from a monitor to fix any troubles, there was no support to be found and I figure that technical support should factor into a purchase like this.Aside from the initial set-up issues, my biggest two complaints are these:After setting up your child's profile, there is NO WAY TO CUSTOMIZE your child's home screen. Well, of course there is and after a bunch of searching found that it can be done in the parent's profile. But it's an all or nothing approach. You can either let Amazon populate the tablet with whatever they think your X year old would like, or nothing at all. I actually liked some of the curated content but couldn't individually remove the hundreds of other icons to shows or channels that I didn't feel were educational, age appropriate, in another language, etc... Again, it's an all or nothing, on or off toggle. Speaking of which, in the adult's profile there's a slider to adjust the blue light shading. In our kid's profile it's again an on/off - blue light/brown light toggle.Second, and the biggest no-go for us was the video playback quality. Right away we downloaded a couple of our Amazon prime video purchases for offline playback in the car or for an upcoming trip in airplane mode. In our adult profiles the video will play perfectly, clear as a bell. But after sharing and downloading that same content to my son's profile, it plays like garbage. I've spent close to 10 hours with customer service, screen sharing and letting them rummage through the download/playback settings to figure out why it's that way and after being told "they'll look into it and get back to me", I haven't heard a thing. On other calls they've simply said to try a factory reboot and a download updates, again. C'mon it's a brand-new tablet. If you have one of these tablets, try this Pepsi challenge. Download a Prime video into your adult profile in the highest quality available, watch it (we like the screen in zoom/full screen mode as most likely would, but it doesn't matter). Then share that video content with your child's profile, download it, and try watching the same video with your child's profile (zoom or no zoom). For us we noticed it on our 1st try with Disney's Planes Fire and Rescue, 25m:25sec mark and watch for about a minute. With all the fast-moving action, you can clearly see how great the video is on the adult's profile and how grainy and burry it is on the child's profile. For our son and his young developing eyes, I do not feel comfortable letting him watch videos in that sort of poor quality. If it gives me a headache, that's enough for me. I guess we could just let him play with the tablet under one of our profiles, but that defeats the purpose of a "kid's tablet", and I don't want to be out a thousand bucks for monster truck paint schemes from in app purchases for a tablet that cost $128.99.HD is general term, but blurry and not in 1080p doesn't meet my 2023 definition of it. My first guess is that Amazon may have dumbed down the download, storage, or playback quality for our kid's profiles, thinking that our kids won't know the difference, parents won't notice the difference, and Amazon could save some $ on hard drive space for the price of the tablet. Unless there's a performance setting that I, or customer service while screen sharing couldn't find, this tablet is not for me, and not for our son.I don't want to improperly review this new tablet, so if there's anyone with a keen eye on your kid's videos and solution to either of these problems, please post or let me know.Edit Update 12/12/23: After more attempted fixes with our Fire HD 10 Kids Pro tablet, I've found the visual comparison above isn't really needed. Simply press on a playing video and on the bottom of the screen where the pause buttons/playing time comes up, below that there will be the words "1080p HD" letting you know the playback quality. This is the case for the parent's profile while streaming OR playing downloaded content, and the video looks fine. Switching to the child's profile, shared videos will stream fine via Wi-Fi in 1080p (and it will display that), BUT ONCE a video is downloaded for offline playback, there is no "1080p HD" displayed below the playing time (whether on Wi-Fi or not) and the video quality is clearly not HD. At least that's how it works on the tablet we got.The morning after posting this review I missed a call from a Seattle area code. Amazon customer service left a nice message wanting to help. They also emailed suggesting that I try downloading the video to an SD card instead of the hard drive. Guess we're doing Beta testing now. Bought a high-quality SD card from Amazon, and as I expected, it did not fix the problem. And just today I finally spoke with a seemingly knowledgeable, very helpful and professional US based technical support agent and learned right away that there's no need to dive into the settings as there wasn't a fix to this and it (at least to me) appears like it could be a known issue. That helps us out and put me at ease that I wasn't missing something. Another new (and possibly updated?) tablet is on its way, but it's been a few days now without any change from ordered to shipped. This was a black Friday purchase for holiday travels, but I'll be sure to change my review if a new working tablet gets here in time.12/20/23 - A replacement tablet arrived (with some finger prints on the screen) today. Surely updated as there's a new and even more confusing look to the kids menus and UI, but same issue. It still can't play videos in the kid's profile in HD quality once they've been downloaded for offline playback.

product_name: Amazon Fire HD 10 Kids Pro tablet (newest model) ages 6-12 | Bright 10.1" HD screen | Slim case for older kids, ad-free content, parental controls, 13-hr battery, 32 GB, Nebula
description: Tablet WORKED great especially for contacting your children on their kid's pro tablet via the Alexa app from your phone and vice versa.  This was a fantastic feature that allowed parents and relatives to keep in touch while away.We loved it, UNTIL the Dec. 6th, 2023 Alexa app update... then everything communication wise came to a screeching halt.Child's contacts were renamed, mine was replaced and renamed, and a "dead" link Home button appeared on the childs contacts with no information, and no way to edit it.the app now only allows you to "Call All Devices" when attempting to make a call,?!?Why would I want to do that? Why can't I call just the one I want anymore?  Oh, and btw, it only calls my echo device when it is intermediately working, if you wanna call that working I guess.Additionally, the Alexa app now shows half of my devices are located in several different houses on an unfamiliar street in my community, yet they are all in one house... my house!I've been the phone with Amazon for several hours a day for 3 weeks, and still they have got absolutely no where close to resolving my issue. NOR do I believe they are anywhere close to understanding the full complexity of the issues the update caused thus far.This is because I am stuck in an endless cycle of their internal ticketing system which wreaks of inefficiency and miscommunication.I've been escalated to Amazon's Tech Support Executive Customer Relations, what a joke. After waiting 7 days to get a promised call back that never came, I waited another three days to get a call from the relations team. First off he was clueless, then put me on mute and pretended the call went dead, then never called me back after we were disconnected. It's been 3 more days since, and still no call back! Email responses stating my rep was out "yesterday" from two new people in the same department, yet not one took the time to call me.No possible way to get transferred to this department, no phone number given, so wait in limbo again. When I call in and ask for a status update on my ticket, which takes at least 35 minutes to an hour each time, but its the only way to get an update, I am repeatedly having to answer the same questions or try the same "setup" settings we know don't work. Worst yet, you wait only for a technician to respond that "this specific feature" was not supported. However, talking to an Echo Kid's speaker now is!Wait, what? But it was working tablet to phone and phone to table before the update, so why is it not working now? Why is tablet to tablet communication now not working properly anymore either.Why is it not available anymore? There was no announcement, or choice before the update.Furthermore, if that's the case, why can't any other device in my Alexa app communicate with each other.I now have to purchase a tablet and carry it around all day so I don't miss a call from my nephew's Echo Dot?Why do they keep replying with irrelevancy and misinformation, Has anyone there tried any of this?I've be repeatedly asking to speak directly to an app developer specialist to explain all of things that have gone wrong since the update and have them confirm whether it's the update or simply my account settings.I've been kept from being put in touch with them at every turn, Nope, not possible they say.Finally got a great technician named Diego to take my "sandbox" advice and try to replicate and isolate the issue by installing the Alexa app on his phone and try making a calls between his tablet and phone.  To our surprise, he also had issues as described above.He helped escalate my call the app specialists, and even included screenshots. Unfortunately it seems his hands are tied as he has no part in how that information is perceived by the developers and account specialists.I guess those people aren't allowed to use the phones because all of I my notes reportedly say call me with questions so I can explain in detail instead of telling 60 low level reps my issues over and over but only parts of the conversation get entered into the notes, but nobody ever does.You'll never fix an issue you don't fully understand, Amazon.I'm so feed up, as far as I'm concerned, they can keep this junk... and the cruddy service that comes with it.Read Amazon's lame reply...Hello,I'm Hugo of Amazon's Tech Support Executive Customer Relations Team.We could verify that the option to complete calls to Amazon Alexa devices on a phone using the alexa app has been removed.Fire Tablet for kids only supports Alexa to Alexa calling after it is enabled from parents dashboard.Alexa to Alexa and Alexa to phone calling both are supported only on Kids Echo Dot device after enabling from parents dashboard.Thanks for sharing your thoughts about the Alexa app. We're always looking for ways to offer a better shopping experience, and I've made sure our Alexa team sees your feedback so they can consider it in their future plans.If you need any additional support, you can reach out by replying directly to this email.Have a nice day.Best regards,Hugo Quesada NavasAmazon.com

product_name: Amazon Fire HD 10 Kids Pro tablet (newest model) ages 6-12 | Bright 10.1" HD screen | Slim case for older kids, ad-free content, parental controls, 13-hr battery, 32 GB, Nebula
description: I have owned the 7 and now have the 10. I have 2 of them. And, so far, the 10 is awful. I like the content I get from Amazon Kids + for my boys, but the whole point of a tablet is for it to be mobile and keep content. This tablet has (on multiple occasions) lost access to all content and corrupted my SD cards.Now, I do like the 2years warranty that it comes with. I like the kids case for shock proof and a stand.But, I still find it hard to look at my child and say "all that work you did on your games is gone again".  I've even had to tell my kid on 2 separate vacations that ALL the movies we downloaded from Prime Video were gone. So, the plane flight and the long drives were extra long because all the content was gone and the tablet became a giant brick.These tablets have the ability to accept an SD card and use it for internal storage (its written on the page) but, that card is only good for 1 tablet and can not be moved to a new one without reformating. And when these devices corrupt the card, it is unusable anywhere (including computers and I'm a computer nerd). I've had Amazon support replace it once, but the last person wouldn't. Saying it wasn't an issue with the tablet. Coincidently, I've had to replace the tablet and its corrupted my SD card on 2 separate tablets. For the additional $50 you might get an older iPad that has the same memory or more than whats built in AND it wont slow down with games. Yes, thats right, this Tablet is known to slow down with games. It even says it will. Yay. The additional cost to replace SD cards each time, can easily add up to not using this tablet.How is tech support? Eh, its like calling a Comcast agent. Is the tablet on? Did you reboot? Can you factory reset the thing and start all over? That worked, great, bye.

product_name: Amazon Fire HD 10 Kids Pro tablet (newest model) ages 6-12 | Bright 10.1" HD screen | Slim case for older kids, ad-free content, parental controls, 13-hr battery, 32 GB, Nebula
description: Got this for my 5 year old. Her iPad is so old we needed to get something new. You have very limited access to apps. You can download YouTube but not kids YouTube on it, which makes no sense. If we cant access the apps we need we are going to be returning it soon.

product_name: Amazon Fire HD 10 Kids Pro tablet (newest model) ages 6-12 | Bright 10.1" HD screen | Slim case for older kids, ad-free content, parental controls, 13-hr battery, 32 GB, Nebula
description: It works okay, but some apps in the store glitch out the tablet and make it struggle to continue. Good deal for the price since it was on sale. Lightweight and my son enjoys it when it does work smoothly.

product_name: Amazon Fire HD 10 Kids Pro tablet (newest model) ages 6-12 | Bright 10.1" HD screen | Slim case for older kids, ad-free content, parental controls, 13-hr battery, 32 GB, Nebula
description: I recently purchased the Amazon Fire HD 10 Kids Pro Tablet (2023) for my daughter, and overall, it’s been a fantastic addition to her learning and entertainment. The 10.1" HD screen is bright and vibrant, making her educational games and videos really pop. The parental controls are easy to use, and the content is well-curated for her age group. It's durable and designed with kids in mind, which I appreciate.However, I do have a serious concern about the charger. Even though I’m careful not to let my daughter overcharge the tablet, the charger gets extremely hot during use. It's concerning to the point where I’ve burned my fingers while unplugging it. This is something that I can't overlook, as it poses a potential safety hazard.I hope Amazon looks into this issue, as it’s a great tablet otherwise, but the overheating charger is a major drawback that needs to be addressed.

product_name: Amazon Fire HD 10 Kids Pro tablet (newest model) ages 6-12 | Bright 10.1" HD screen | Slim case for older kids, ad-free content, parental controls, 13-hr battery, 32 GB, Nebula
description: I had to redo this review after being able to compare this Fire 10 HD Kids Pro (Gen 13 - 2023) with the previous model Fire 10 HD Kids Pro (Gen 11 - 2021). Unfortunately, I have to say that the previous model Fire tablet was much better at media consumption. The speakers of this latest model (Gen 13) are noticeably more quiet than those of the previous model (Gen 11). Additionally, colors seem to be slightly more vibrant on the older model as well. The older model tablet is slightly more heavy, but not enough to impede its use by anyone.That being said,  people in the reviews still seem to be expecting this product to be an iPad for a third of the price. While the Fire 10 HD Kids Pro isn’t an iPad, it’s an acceptable amount of tablet to be had as cheap as $100. I just wish the Fire 10 HD Kids Pro (Gen 13) could do as good of a job of playing audio and video as the previous Gen 11 model.The Amazon parental controls for this tablet do take some getting used to, but they do a decent job in delivering age-appropriate entertainment once set up. It’s not foolproof, as one can find ways to bypass filters if they really try. Android apps can also be sideloaded onto the tablet if desired, but I haven’t found a great way to get them to run outside the parent/unrestricted profiles.I still would recommend the Fire 10 HD Kids Pro (Gen 13) tablets to parents of older children, however its use as a portable media player for adults has suffered in the model update. For owners of the previous Fire 10 HD Kids Pro (Gen 11) model, I cannot recommend this new model as an upgrade. While this newest model has faster response times due to the updated hardware, the ability to enjoy streaming audio/video content has suffered with the less powerful speakers and display changes.

product_name: Amazon Fire HD 10 Kids Pro tablet (newest model) ages 6-12 | Bright 10.1" HD screen | Slim case for older kids, ad-free content, parental controls, 13-hr battery, 32 GB, Nebula
description: I bought this for my kids to do homework, but it won't let them record their assignments.

product_name: Amazon Fire HD 10 Kids Pro tablet (newest model) ages 6-12 | Bright 10.1" HD screen | Slim case for older kids, ad-free content, parental controls, 13-hr battery, 32 GB, Nebula
description: I'm not happy, this cost me 3 times more than the one I got my son 6 years ago, the only reason for this new one is the old one's battery makes his old Kindle HD shut down after about 5 or 10 minutes, but the issue with the new one is it doesn't connect well to my smart phone hot spot so it buffers every minute or so, I was not able to download any games or apps, they're taking a while, my son was trying to watch a movie on his device waiting for games to download and the movie kept buffering, he was getting really frustrated. He's special needs so he didn't understand why he couldn't watch his movie correctly or play games that couldn't download, so I gave him back his old device, because a least that one doesn't buffer, no did it have issues downloading games and apps. It will probably shut down due to the messed up battery but I'd rather hear 10 minutes of peace than every minute of him getting upset over the new device buffering. It makes me sad that the new products seems to have more issues than the older ones. I'll have to pay off my 200 hundred plus wifi bill and see if I can't get the Internet to work better with the wifi set up. 😕

product_name: Amazon Fire HD 10 Kids Pro tablet (newest model) ages 6-12 | Bright 10.1" HD screen | Slim case for older kids, ad-free content, parental controls, 13-hr battery, 32 GB, Nebula
description: We bought this tablet for my daughter after her last one broke. The package was delivered quickly and on time. Inside was the tablet, case, charging cord, and wall adapter. We upgraded to the newer version that is designed for older kids. This tablet has a much sleeker case but it is still sturdy and protective. Plus she loves the cute colorful design. The battery life is decent but of course will deplete faster when using certain apps. We charge it 3-4 days a week and it charges easily and fast. The table is very lightweight with a screen the perfect size for my daughter to watch movies, read books, or play games. And the headphone jack is ideal when we are on the go. Being able to download apps is also great when we are away and can't always connect to WIFI. Whether connected to the internet or not, all the apps seem to perform faster than her last tablet too. My favorite feature is all the parental controls. Some are set by default but can easily be changed. I love that I can set screen time limits and require a set time amount of something educational be done before the other apps are available. This product is definitely worth getting for your children.

product_name: Amazon Fire HD 10 Kids Pro tablet (newest model) ages 6-12 | Bright 10.1" HD screen | Slim case for older kids, ad-free content, parental controls, 13-hr battery, 32 GB, Nebula
description: ***it does take a memory card for extra space. If you're looking for the micro SD slot for more space you have to take the tablet cover off, and it's on one of the longer sides of the tablet. Flip it and insert memory card. Put back on your tablet cover. It's great so kids can't take it out as easy.**** Another update ****If your child's apps/games disappear try these two things:1. Check your Amazon kids subscription (you get 1 year free, then you have to renew.)2. Go into parental controls. Make sure you have not limited screen time (or set time limits), or turned on learning first. Just check all those boxes off, and fix the limits/restrictions after they get their apps/games back.They should reappear checking those 2 things.--------- Review ---------My child has had a fire tablet since he was 4. I have upgraded to the newest kids tablet every year for his birthday. This is the newest one for him. He's loved playing Minecraft, Roblox, some apps that come pre installed on the tablet, and he also likes browsing the store.- The kids fire tablet is easy for kids to use and pick up on.- I can set restrictions like he has to read or learn first, and what times he can use it to limit screen time.- The coolest thing is I can do it all from my phone. From approving games, education, and screen time.The memory on the device is decent for a kid but you can always upgrade it with a micro SD card. He has Minecraft, Roblox, messenger for kids, YouTube/YouTube kids, and some other games/apps. I had to approve.Sound: whew this thing is loud for what it is.  I'd recommend some headphones so you don't have to hear it loll.Overall the appearance nice, it's a good value for your money (I know it's a high price tag compared to other brands) but the amount of peace it brings to a parent is worth it. Such as they can't purchase items from the store that cost money. You have to approve it.

product_name: Amazon Fire HD 10 Kids Pro tablet (newest model) ages 6-12 | Bright 10.1" HD screen | Slim case for older kids, ad-free content, parental controls, 13-hr battery, 32 GB, Nebula
description: This tablet is amazing... it's so clear and durable! Definitely upgrade from the 8! My daughter loves it and we've had no issues. I wish I had one for myself! Lol

product_name: Amazon Fire HD 10 Kids Pro tablet (newest model) ages 6-12 | Bright 10.1" HD screen | Slim case for older kids, ad-free content, parental controls, 13-hr battery, 32 GB, Nebula
description: This is an excellent tablet for kids. Lightweight and durable and performs as well as you’d hope. It’s also very easy to navigate so the kids will really enjoy it.

product_name: Amazon Fire HD 10 Kids Pro tablet (newest model) ages 6-12 | Bright 10.1" HD screen | Slim case for older kids, ad-free content, parental controls, 13-hr battery, 32 GB, Nebula
description: We had some long flights for a two-week family vacation and thought having tablets for our boys would be necessary.  We aren't the type of parents that allow our kids to use phones or tablets so we didn't want to buy iPads. I was pleasantly surprised of the parental controls, the quality of the screen, durability, battery life and speed.  Our boys 4 & 7 were able to use two of these on vacation, they watched movies played games and took pictures and video and had a great time.  Now that we're no longer on vacation they use them on long road trips, or only on the weekends, and only for an hour a day.  The parental controls enforce these rules quite nicely.Overall we're very happy with this purchase, and I'm very happy it didn't cost an arm and a leg!

product_name: Amazon Fire HD 10 Kids Pro tablet (newest model) ages 6-12 | Bright 10.1" HD screen | Slim case for older kids, ad-free content, parental controls, 13-hr battery, 32 GB, Nebula
description: Bought 2 of these last Christmas for the grandkids. They love them. I love that they can be set up to allow age-appropriate content. With the Amazon Kids subscription, the grandkids can "shop" the app store and download content that aligns with their account settings. They can request content that either costs dollars or is a little outside of the guardrail settings. They are pretty sturdy. One of the two tablets is acting a little weird 9 months out; we have to turn it off and turn it back on, and then all is well. I know there was a 2-year warranty included - so I am hopeful that if I have to use it, that will go well. That is the reason for the 4 stars due to one of the tablets acting up.

product_name: Amazon Fire HD 10 Kids Pro tablet (newest model) ages 6-12 | Bright 10.1" HD screen | Slim case for older kids, ad-free content, parental controls, 13-hr battery, 32 GB, Nebula
description: Best tablet for kids. Size is big. Connects to many WiFi networks with ease. Got in prime day sale so exceptional value for money. Get free Amon kids plus for a year too! Very durable!

The memory is a lot better than the older versions and the sound goes really loud. Very clear and I can use the parent app to monitor and control content. That is a major safety concern so please be aware fellow parents!

product_name: Amazon Fire HD 10 Kids Pro tablet (newest model) ages 6-12 | Bright 10.1" HD screen | Slim case for older kids, ad-free content, parental controls, 13-hr battery, 32 GB, Nebula
description: The Amazon Fire HD 10 Kids Pro tablet (2023) is an excellent choice for children aged 6-12, offering a vibrant 10.1" HD screen and a range of features designed to provide both entertainment and educational value. Overall, I rate this tablet four stars due to its impressive performance and kid-friendly design, with a few minor drawbacks.Bright and Clear Display:The 10.1" HD screen is bright and clear, making it perfect for watching videos, playing games, and reading books. The vivid colors and sharp resolution enhance the viewing experience, ensuring that kids stay engaged and entertained.Kid-Friendly Content:The tablet comes preloaded with a vast selection of age-appropriate content, including educational apps, games, videos, and books. The Amazon Kids+ subscription offers a wealth of material that is both fun and educational, catering to a wide range of interests and learning levels.Robust Parental Controls:One of the standout features is the robust parental controls, which allow parents to set screen time limits, filter content, and monitor usage. This ensures a safe and controlled environment for kids to explore and learn.Durable Design:The tablet's durable design includes a sturdy case that helps protect it from drops and bumps, which is ideal for young users. The case also features a built-in stand, making it easy for kids to watch videos hands-free.Performance:The Fire HD 10 Kids Pro performs well, with a responsive interface and smooth operation. It handles various apps and games with ease, providing a seamless user experience for kids.Battery Life:The battery life is decent, lasting long enough for extended use throughout the day. It charges relatively quickly, minimizing downtime between uses.Minor Drawbacks:Despite its many strengths, there are a few minor drawbacks. The tablet's storage capacity can fill up quickly, especially with the addition of apps, videos, and books. An external SD card can help alleviate this issue, but it is an additional expense. Additionally, while the tablet is generally responsive, there are occasional slowdowns when running multiple applications simultaneously.Conclusion:The Amazon Fire HD 10 Kids Pro tablet (2023) is a fantastic device for children aged 6-12, offering a bright and engaging HD screen, a wealth of kid-friendly content, and strong parental controls. Its durable design and solid performance make it a great choice for young users, despite a few minor drawbacks related to storage and occasional slowdowns. Overall, it's a solid investment in both entertainment and education for kids. Four stars!

product_name: Amazon Fire HD 10 Kids Pro tablet (newest model) ages 6-12 | Bright 10.1" HD screen | Slim case for older kids, ad-free content, parental controls, 13-hr battery, 32 GB, Nebula

product_name: AI Voice Recorder, PLAUD Note Voice Recorder w/Case, App Control, Transcribe & Summarize Empowered by ChatGPT, Support 59 Languages, 64GB Memory, Audio Recorder for Lectures, Meetings, Calls, Black
description: I posted a long review about how bad this product was. It went over how the transcripts keep putting random links in them, how the audio is beyond terrible, like really really impressively bad. I included 2 pictures showing the lack of great customer service and examples of really bad ai generation. The review was denied because I include the link that this product keeps inserting into my transcripts. Now the review is gone and I cant be bothered to write it again.Trust me, this product is bad.Update: Have reached out to their customer service again and again, after TEN (yes 10) emails back and forth, they finally addressed my concern. Its very clear that the responses I was getting were AI generated and the explanation they finally gave me was so terrible its impressive. Their AI generated email responses are as followed>I email advising that their transcript is inserting "Subs by xyz website" over and over.Their response "We are unable to pinpoint the precise query at this time based on the description of the problem you provided. Would you please elaborate on your question regarding the  Recorder?">I reply, asking what they misunderstood. I repeat that their app is inserting random links into my transcription.Their 2nd response "Thank you for taking the time to contact us. We appreciate your initial submission request inquiry, but we are currently encountering some difficulty in fully understanding your query.Could you please provide us with more details or clarify your request further? Any additional information you can provide would be greatly appreciated and will help us assist you more effectively.">I reply again, saying, yes your app is inserting links to random websites saying "subs by xyz website" into the transcirption. I ask if they are using these websites as transcription services.Their reply "We apologize for the inconvenience you're experiencing. To resolve the issue, could you please try uninstalling and then reinstalling the PLAUD App? This often resolves technical issues and ensures that you have the latest version installed.>At this point I start asking them if they are even reading my complaint/concern emails, none of these are addressing or even speaking about my concern, almost as if these responses are pre-generated.Their reply "We are dedicated to assisting you with your concern. To better understand and address your issue, could you please provide us with more details?"After 10 emails, someone human finally replied, said that someone in the background of my meeting must have said that over and over, and gave me 360 minutes of free transcriptions. WHAT?!They literally pre-generate responses and send them to customers concerns in the hopes that people will just give up.

product_name: AI Voice Recorder, PLAUD Note Voice Recorder w/Case, App Control, Transcribe & Summarize Empowered by ChatGPT, Support 59 Languages, 64GB Memory, Audio Recorder for Lectures, Meetings, Calls, Black
description: I recently purchased a voice recorder that offers transcription and translation services, hoping it would be a great tool for my job, particularly for recording meetings and creating transcriptions. When I first bought the product, I found the price tag of $150 quite high, but I expected it to deliver premium features, especially transcription functionality.The device itself is impressive in terms of quality and performance. However, I was disappointed to discover that transcription services are limited and require a paid subscription. For someone like me, who is in constant meetings throughout the day, the limited number of transcriptions included wouldn't even get me through a full day, let alone two. Given the high price of the device, I feel the basic transcription service should be included for free, especially since this is a core function of the product.I understand the need for a subscription to access advanced AI features, such as highlighting key points, organizing notes, and improving the overall quality of the transcription. However, basic transcription—without the advanced AI—should be a free feature, especially at this price point.In summary, while the device itself is excellent, the limitations on transcription and the additional cost for a subscription significantly reduce its value. If the company can make basic transcription free and keep the advanced AI features affordable, this product would be much more worthwhile. As it stands, it feels overpriced for the value delivered. At the end of it decided to return it.

product_name: AI Voice Recorder, PLAUD Note Voice Recorder w/Case, App Control, Transcribe & Summarize Empowered by ChatGPT, Support 59 Languages, 64GB Memory, Audio Recorder for Lectures, Meetings, Calls, Black
description: I had high hopes for this product and I only scratched the surface of what it can do. I had this product for 1 week before it fell off my phone in transit. I am so disappointed. I was hoping it had some type of tracking built in, or if I could ping it somehow but I am so annoyed that I am out $160 after 1 week of use. I looked up some other reviews which showed that this happens to a lot of people so I would highly recommend securing it some other way and be careful not to lose it. Maybe attach a tracker to it.As far as the product, I love the potential however it was not able to distinguish between voices during one of my meetings so I had to go into the Plaud app and edit for about 30 minutes to separate the conversations. It was not easy to do. The app does not allow you to cut and paste to different speakers because of the way it is time stamped so I had to go in each paragraph and type the name of who made what comment and it got really annoying after 15 minutes. I might have been able to play around with it some more but the thing is lost now.

product_name: AI Voice Recorder, PLAUD Note Voice Recorder w/Case, App Control, Transcribe & Summarize Empowered by ChatGPT, Support 59 Languages, 64GB Memory, Audio Recorder for Lectures, Meetings, Calls, Black
description: I was really excited to try this, but I found my transcription needs exceeded the 1200 minutes allowed per month without having to pay extra costs. What can I say, I have to take an excessive amount of meeting minutes per month. This device is sexy, thin, and records OK however I chose to return this item and order a different voice recorder for the fraction of the price and use an online transcription service from a different company (Rev). I like that one better because it allows me to assign actual names to voices and makes taking minutes a lot easier that trying to remember who (person 1) and (person 2) is. I did not really use this device for recording phone calls, but I could see where that may be beneficial.

product_name: AI Voice Recorder, PLAUD Note Voice Recorder w/Case, App Control, Transcribe & Summarize Empowered by ChatGPT, Support 59 Languages, 64GB Memory, Audio Recorder for Lectures, Meetings, Calls, Black
description: 1. El producto graba muy bien pero solo cuando estas directo en el equipo móvil. (No se puede estar utilizando ningún otro dispositivo bluetooth para la comunicación durante el uso del Plaud Note, durante la grabación de la llamada o reunión debes estar con el móvil al oído).2. El soporte es muy lento y en general malo, se tardan en responder y las respuestas son impersonales y no tratan el tema solo disculpas y te remiten a que leas el manual.3. La aplicación no es igual a la que enseñan en los videos de la página de Plaud Nota o de los influenciadores que hacen propaganda.4. No inicia la grabación de manera automática, cuando inicias una llamada, todo debe ser manual, cuando vas a grabar una llamada antes tiene que estar en la aplicación Plaud Note el equipo conectado y desde la app o desde el dispositivo iniciar la grabación y cuando termine la llamada o reunión, debe ir a detener la grabación desde la app o desde el dispositivo.5. Cuando inicias una grabación como nota de voz el micrófono no tiene buen alcance, algunos que están en la mesa de reuniones más alejados quedan fuera del audio.6. En la aplicación hay una forma de recortar los audios, esto es muy importante pues te cobran por minuto y debes ir a realizar esto para optimizar el tiempo que tiene disponible.En general el producto es medianamente bueno, todas estas diferencias con lo que ofrecen nadie lo dice y tampoco en el soporte te indican eso, solo dicen la app es diferente y que ya no tiene las funciones.

product_name: AI Voice Recorder, PLAUD Note Voice Recorder w/Case, App Control, Transcribe & Summarize Empowered by ChatGPT, Support 59 Languages, 64GB Memory, Audio Recorder for Lectures, Meetings, Calls, Black
description: Plaid is good for English mostly. I was trying in other language and it was full of wrong texts . In meetings , all conversations typing after each other and there is no space to show the change of talking person in the meeting. It really needs better features.

product_name: AI Voice Recorder, PLAUD Note Voice Recorder w/Case, App Control, Transcribe & Summarize Empowered by ChatGPT, Support 59 Languages, 64GB Memory, Audio Recorder for Lectures, Meetings, Calls, Black
description: So here is the problem that no one seems to be talking about. The way this device "records" a phone calls by being attached to your phone and feeling the vibrations. No digital audio is connected through this as a passthrough. If you want to record someone you should just put them on speaker if you want to use this audio as a standalone recording to send to a friend or lawyer.Note-taking is good and audio quality is good on that as well. But I feel the reason that I couldn't find any video going over the phone call recording is because it is bad and they want to create sales from those videos. The summary is ok on the phone calls but if you can't hear the person on the audio how do you expect the AI to hear it? So if it misses a sentence or two how good will the summary be?

product_name: AI Voice Recorder, PLAUD Note Voice Recorder w/Case, App Control, Transcribe & Summarize Empowered by ChatGPT, Support 59 Languages, 64GB Memory, Audio Recorder for Lectures, Meetings, Calls, Black
description: It’s not quite as cool as all the tik tok and insta reviews portray.  It’s accurate for the most part, but I would recommend that you review the transcription and make notes.

product_name: AI Voice Recorder, PLAUD Note Voice Recorder w/Case, App Control, Transcribe & Summarize Empowered by ChatGPT, Support 59 Languages, 64GB Memory, Audio Recorder for Lectures, Meetings, Calls, Black
description: The ai tech (transcription, summary etc) is priceless. Amazing tech really. The failure of the weak magnet however resulted in the device getting lost within a week of usage. Strongly recommend you try adding velcro (but not too thick otherwise it might not record the other person on your call) or keeping it separate until ready to use because once lost no ai can help you. I tried using the Bluetooth connection to find it to no avail as this first iteration doesn't have GPS locator or tracker or any way to remotely locate it. Total bummer. No idea what happens to data if device found by someone else. Good news is, the charger is hard to get so hopefully that will give me time to chat with support to make sure data can't be compromised. Total bummer

product_name: AI Voice Recorder, PLAUD Note Voice Recorder w/Case, App Control, Transcribe & Summarize Empowered by ChatGPT, Support 59 Languages, 64GB Memory, Audio Recorder for Lectures, Meetings, Calls, Black
description: I recently purchased the CLAUD Note Voice Recorder and Transcription tool, and I was so impressed with its potential that I immediately upgraded to the Pro Version for $79. As a professional copywriter focusing on small businesses and real estate professionals, I bought this tool with a clear plan to enhance my workflow and deliver more personalized, effective copy for my clients.Client Interviews and Consultations:I’m planning to use the CLAUD recorder during client consultations to capture every detail of our conversations. This will allow me to focus entirely on listening to my clients without worrying about taking notes. I’m confident that the transcriptions will help me review all the details later, ensuring that I don’t miss any crucial information when crafting marketing materials or property descriptions.Brainstorming and Ideation:I often find that my best ideas come when I’m talking them through, so I’m excited to start using the CLAUD recorder to capture these moments. My plan is to review the transcriptions afterward, organizing my thoughts into actionable strategies. I believe this will help me maintain a creative flow and ensure that no idea gets lost along the way.Content Creation and Editing:I’m looking forward to dictating more of my copy using the CLAUD recorder. Whether it’s outlining a blog post or drafting a property listing, I anticipate that speaking my thoughts will speed up the process. The transcriptions will serve as a rough draft, making it easier to refine and polish my work. I also plan to use this tool during the editing process, recording my thoughts to get a fresh perspective on revisions.Property Tours and Descriptions:When I visit properties, I plan to take my CLAUD recorder along to capture my immediate impressions in real-time. I’m eager to see how the transcriptions will help me create more vivid and accurate property listings, and I’m sure this will be a valuable resource for brochures, social media, and virtual tours.Client Follow-Ups and Proposals:After client meetings, my intention is to record my thoughts on next steps and use the transcriptions to draft detailed follow-up emails or proposals. I’m looking forward to how this will streamline my follow-up process, making it more efficient and thorough.Training and Development:I’m committed to ongoing professional development, and I plan to use the CLAUD recorder to capture training sessions and webinars. I’m confident that the transcriptions will serve as a valuable reference, helping me to continuously improve my skills. I also plan to record myself practicing sales pitches, with the goal of refining my delivery through careful review of the transcriptions.Content Repurposing:I see a lot of potential in using this tool for content repurposing. I plan to record brainstorming sessions and use the transcriptions to generate consistent content across blogs, social media, and newsletters. I’m also excited about how easy it will be to capture and repurpose client testimonials for marketing materials and case studies.Conclusion:Although I’m just getting started with the CLAUD Note Voice Recorder and Transcription tool, I’m already thrilled about the potential it holds for improving my workflow and the quality of my work. If you’re a copywriter looking to boost your productivity and deliver more personalized content, I highly recommend considering this tool—it’s already proving to be a wise investment.

description: I bought this on a whim. I'm an attorney and this paid for itself in 5 minutes. Why do you need this? I don't need to turn my phone on and enter a password to then open recorder app. Just push button for 2 sec and it starts taking down a voice note (case notes, reminders, time entries, etc.). which then gets transcribed into text. Great for quickly recording thoughts during day (or when you wake up at night) when I can't take them down otherwise. Sits on back of phone with a magnet or it's easy to carry separately. I haven't even hit the other great features availalbe through software. For me, it's worth it just a digital notepad.

product_name: AI Voice Recorder, PLAUD Note Voice Recorder w/Case, App Control, Transcribe & Summarize Empowered by ChatGPT, Support 59 Languages, 64GB Memory, Audio Recorder for Lectures, Meetings, Calls, Black
description: The short version is I love the convenience and easy transcription / meeting summaries, but I loathe the archaically slow transfer speed (it can take 5+ minutes to transfer a 1 hour recording to the iphone app).More detailed pros and cons below. Note that I pay for the Pro Plan for more transcription minutes ($79/yr, or $7/mo if you subscribe for the annual rate - otherwise $13 if you opt to pay monthly).Pros- Discreet and thin- Useful all-in-one for meeting transcript +  summary meeting recaps - love it, super easy and reasonably good audio (not as clear as an iphone Voice app recording, but works perfectly for my purposes)- Responsive customer support- Transcription accuracy is reasonably good (enough for my purposes)- As you review the transcription in the app, you can tap on a specific section to play audio - I use this to manually correct the transcrip, or check who was speaking- Easy to export audio, transcripts,  summaries, and mind mapsDrawbacks- Audio quality isn’t super crisp but perfect for my purposes (NOTE that I haven’t tried the RAW audio file option which could make all the difference from a quality perspective, I just haven’t tried it)- The transfer speed is super slow, even on WiFi (~ 26-30kb/second, whereas I read that a normal transfer speed should be at least 100+ kb/sec). Very annoying when I want to quickly open or title a file I just recorded.- Because it takes so long to transfer recordings and you can’t create a file name until it’s fully transferred, I end up with a lot of unlabeled recordings that download all at once (have to listen to each one to remember what it was). It would be great if the device at least immediately synced the existence of a recording so it could be labeled in the moment even if not fully transferred.Tips:- I don’t know what the white light means, but it’s only recording if the light is red.- Check out YouTube videos for super easy set up and demo- Remember to check the app to see what the battery level is.- If you lose the bespoke charging cord, you can buy another on Amazon.

product_name: AI Voice Recorder, PLAUD Note Voice Recorder w/Case, App Control, Transcribe & Summarize Empowered by ChatGPT, Support 59 Languages, 64GB Memory, Audio Recorder for Lectures, Meetings, Calls, Black
description: This feel sturdy and well built. The storage capacity is  more than enough. I can record four hours of audio and still have plenty of room left for more. The battery is long lasting. The recording quality is high. Put the phone on a table and record the room with clarity.Caution:- the ChatGPT interface works amazing for transcription, when recording long meetings, I run out of minutes quickly. I just upload the recording to Word, and have Copilot transcribe it from there.- When in call recording mode, the phone must be on speaker.- copying long recordings to your phone via Bluetooth can take 10 to 15 minutes. I use the cable to attach to my Mac and I upload them from there.Despite the negatives, this has become a staple for my everyday life and I would purchase again

product_name: AI Voice Recorder, PLAUD Note Voice Recorder w/Case, App Control, Transcribe & Summarize Empowered by ChatGPT, Support 59 Languages, 64GB Memory, Audio Recorder for Lectures, Meetings, Calls, Black
description: UPDATE**(original belllow)Nothing bad to say, but now that it has been used more you should know how great the dictation and summaries are. I had a 2-hour video conference meeting with people in China. They were speaking English and then talking to each other and Chinese and the meeting lasted almost two full hours with the large gaps of silence. I recorded the whole thing and to my surprise everything that was recorded in Chinese was translated to english. And when I saw how it broke the notes down into the different sections of the meeting the questions that were asked marked who was who and put it all together. I see use this for this thing for anybody in any field that they need to remember anything, want to look professional with meeting notes, need to go to a doctor and have a bad memory, want to just keep a record of things, the list is endless. If you need a better reason just buy it try it out for a couple weeks, I have a hard time believing that you'll return it.You used to be able to use an app to record your conversations on your phone. It's getting harder and harder to find an app that will allow you to do that. But what's even nicer than an app is something that attaches to the back of your phone that doesn't stick out and just requires the top of a button to start. You don't have to open an app that doesn't have to be anything running on your screen and it doesn't have to be obvious. You can be in the middle of a phone call or before the phone call starts you can begin recording or if you're in a meeting you can begin recording anytime you like as well. The best part about this product is that it dictates everything and also summarizes it and breaks it down for you. So if you go to the doctor let's be honest it's hard for everybody to remember what the doctor tells you it's easy just to record your conversation it'll break down what did you talk about what are the answers what are your medications and that way you can go back and look at it. The same applies to a phone call if you're talking to somebody and they start giving you detailed information and you don't have a pen and paper handy you just tell them to hold on or even easier just tap the record button real quick and let him keep talking it'll record it all dictated and then you'll have detailed notes. I can't say enough good things about this product. I'm happy with my free trial, I'm not really looking forward to spending $10 a month to keep the dictation, but I am using it enough to make it worth the money. I do wish that for$150 that you got a Year's worth of dictation for free. Also the Aftercare support with the home company is good. I accidentally placed the metal ring on my case slightly off and I contacted them and they allowed me to get three new metal rings as well as two additional chargers for five cents plus shipping. The shipping was obviously the most expensive part. But it's nice to be able to get replacement parts and not be hassled about it.

product_name: kurdene Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 in Ear Buds Light-Weight Headphones,Deep Bass Sound,Built-in Mics Headset,Clear Calls Earphones for Sports Workout
description: Kurdene S8I was looking for a new pair of wireless earbuds and couldn't look at any on Amazon without being shown an ad for these. They seemed affordable and had a lot of great reviews. Either I received a dud, or these are deceptive.CASEI don't like the case. It's bulky and doesn't really fit in my pockets. It's an odd shape to hold. Rather than a notch to open, this case has a lip. The magnets holding it closed are quite strong - I've had other wireless headphones and what sets this case apart is that between the awkward shape, the odd lip, and the strength of the magnets, I have to grip a bit harder and push a bit harder than I expect to in order to open the case. I'm sure I'd get used to it if I used them more often, but, on the first use, I thought the case was accidently glued shut. if you have any sort of hand mobility/grip strength issues, I would not recommend these.Note: The headphones claim to be IPX8 rated, but the case does not. They also don't recommend submerging in water, whereas Tozo (on their website, not on Amazon) claim their IPX8 rated products can not only be submerged in water, they can also be cleaned with soap! That includes the case. If you're intending to buy headphones to use near a pool, lake, or ocean I do not recommend these.FITAfter I found the tips that fit best, I had the sensation that they were falling out of my ears, though with a nice seal they seemed secure - I tried shaking my head and they were still in my ears - they felt like they were constantly sliding out. With the really thin tips, it felt like it wasn't secure. Even when I rotated them, they were a bit large for my ear and stuck out a bit - I would not recommend for smaller ears.SOUNDThey sound ok. If you want better sound, I'd recommend wired headphones as better sound can be had for about the same amount. As-is they're fine for listening to music, podcasts, etc on the go. I have some wired earbuds that I use for passive noise-cancelling on planes. I otherwise prefer to be aware of my surroundings. Even with a seal, these have no sound isolation whatsoever. Even quiet noises could be heard. Additionally, if I had a seal and walked around in them, they sounded a bit weird, though I think that's just a noise caused by physically blocking my ear canals and not necessarily the headphones themselves.BUG?A single tap on the outer part (button) is supposed to play/pause the music. I tapped once to pause, then once to play. Instead of playing, the earbud I tapped beeped (as seems to happen when tapping/touching the button - I believe it is a noise to let you know your tap/touch registered), then the earbud I didn't tap beeped twice. The music did not resume. I tried again and it worked. That's the sort of bug I experienced 10 or so years ago. There have been so many improvements in technology, I'm surprised this happened within hours of receiving them after they had been charged.THOUGHTSUnless I received duds, I can't see these being good for too many people. Even if you're on a budget, Kurdene's own S9 (which is currently (02/24/2023) available for about $9 if you check the box for 50% off) resolves most of my issues. The case is a more standard size, thin enough to fit in a pocket, opens much easier, buds are smaller and don't need to go far into the ear canal. Sound is a bit better in my opinion. It even has LED indicators to show you how charged the case is. A huge improvement across the board, available for less, from the same company. Yet, when I started looking at new earbuds, the S8s were advertised on every single listing and search. They were pushed hard. With over 60k reviews, the overwhelming majority of people impressed by them, I thought I'd give them a try. Even at under $15, I don't think they're worth keeping as spares and I intend to return.

product_name: kurdene Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 in Ear Buds Light-Weight Headphones,Deep Bass Sound,Built-in Mics Headset,Clear Calls Earphones for Sports Workout
description: The sound quality and connectivity of these earbuds were good.I did notice that I got a throbbing headache after using this for about 20 minutes. I took them out and used my usual wired earphones and about half an hour later, my headache left and I felt relieved at feeling normal.I used it after 2 days and noticed the same thing again.Also developed pus secretion in the right ear that could be an indication of eardrum rupture.I used my wired earphones and these - both at the same volume - not too loud; so the only explanation I could come to was that there might have been some kind of radiation from these wireless earphones - as outlandish as that may sound, it was the only reason I could find to fit the pattern.Sticking to wired earbuds till I can find a better replacement.The convenience is not enough of a tradeoff for the splitting ache caused.

product_name: kurdene Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 in Ear Buds Light-Weight Headphones,Deep Bass Sound,Built-in Mics Headset,Clear Calls Earphones for Sports Workout
description: I had a video posted but Amazon declined my review because I mentioned cost. The seller is not getting my full review since I don't have time to write it again. These earbuds sound okay but not fabulous. It comes with extra earpieces and a charger obviously. If you ask me they would be fine for a preteen but not for someone that's really looking for Superior quality. You get what you pay for. These are adequate and don't sound bad. Very basic generic instructions. You should know that when you touch the earbud you will pause skip and all that. The directions say there is a button but there is no visible button. They are touch sensitive. I'll save you 20 minutes of time wondering what's going on when your music keeps changing and stopping. I'll update after I've used them a while maybe.

product_name: kurdene Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 in Ear Buds Light-Weight Headphones,Deep Bass Sound,Built-in Mics Headset,Clear Calls Earphones for Sports Workout
description: These are good quality for 8$ of buying these. Very loud and good bass however the earbuds keep FALLING out of my ear. I don’t know how to keep them in, I wanted to use these to exercise but now I can’t because they keep falling out and I have to keep retrieving them. Then when I try and fix it in my ear my music keeps stopping etc because of the button to stop and pause. The mic quality is CRISP apparently because my friend said the microphone was very crisp when I was on the phone with him. I would recommend these if you aren’t moving a lot because they will fall out. It’s good for desk work or sitting down, reading, watching things on phone etc.

product_name: kurdene Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 in Ear Buds Light-Weight Headphones,Deep Bass Sound,Built-in Mics Headset,Clear Calls Earphones for Sports Workout
description: I love the way these fit and stay in my ears.  I love the sound quality.  I love how long the battery lasts.  BUT!  Apparently the audio is not very good.  When I try to use them for phone conversations, the folks on the other end say my voice is quiet and muffled.  They did not come with any kind of instructions that tell you how to adjust this??

product_name: kurdene Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 in Ear Buds Light-Weight Headphones,Deep Bass Sound,Built-in Mics Headset,Clear Calls Earphones for Sports Workout
description: Easy  to the set up , fits in my ears well. Nice little case with charge. It’s just that you can’t turn it up very much even maxed out. It’s about half of what I think it should be . would be good in quiet environments.

product_name: kurdene Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 in Ear Buds Light-Weight Headphones,Deep Bass Sound,Built-in Mics Headset,Clear Calls Earphones for Sports Workout
description: Sound is good but they definitely fall out even with the different sized ear pieces. But for the price they get the job done, just don't think you'll be able to walk or go to the gym with them.

product_name: kurdene Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 in Ear Buds Light-Weight Headphones,Deep Bass Sound,Built-in Mics Headset,Clear Calls Earphones for Sports Workout
description: If you are looking for something that can play for longer than 45 minutes to 1 hour this is not the ear buds for you. Good sound…. Just the battery life is nothing like stated

product_name: kurdene Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 in Ear Buds Light-Weight Headphones,Deep Bass Sound,Built-in Mics Headset,Clear Calls Earphones for Sports Workout
description: Even using the smallest earbuds, they still constantly fall out. I could never use them working out or doing anything where I am moving much. That is a bit dissapointing.

product_name: kurdene Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 in Ear Buds Light-Weight Headphones,Deep Bass Sound,Built-in Mics Headset,Clear Calls Earphones for Sports Workout
description: The sound quality is great, worth the price. The charge for the buds themselves lasts but the charge for the charging case doesn’t last long and the distance is not the best..

product_name: kurdene Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 in Ear Buds Light-Weight Headphones,Deep Bass Sound,Built-in Mics Headset,Clear Calls Earphones for Sports Workout
description: I recently purchased these Bluetooth earbuds, and they have completely blown me away! Here’s what I love about them:Exceptional Sound Quality: The audio is clear and balanced, with great bass and crisp highs. Whether I’m listening to music or taking calls, the sound quality is top-notch!Comfortable Fit: They fit snugly in my ears and come with multiple ear tip sizes, making them comfortable for extended wear. I can easily wear them for hours without any discomfort.Long Battery Life: The battery life is impressive! I get hours of playback on a single charge, and the charging case provides additional power for on-the-go use.Easy Pairing: Connecting them to my devices was a breeze. They sync quickly, and the Bluetooth range is excellent, allowing me to move around freely.Stylish Design: The design is sleek and modern, which I love. They look great, and the compact case is perfect for carrying them around.Overall, I highly recommend these Bluetooth earbuds! They offer fantastic sound quality, comfort, and convenience, making them a must-have for anyone who loves music or podcasts. Definitely worth the investment

product_name: kurdene Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 in Ear Buds Light-Weight Headphones,Deep Bass Sound,Built-in Mics Headset,Clear Calls Earphones for Sports Workout
description: I needed an extra pair of ear buds to keep at work. These are great, very comfortable, easy to use, hold charge for quite a while, and have good sound. Great product for the price.

product_name: kurdene Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 in Ear Buds Light-Weight Headphones,Deep Bass Sound,Built-in Mics Headset,Clear Calls Earphones for Sports Workout
description: Deep bass, good highs, easy to pair with your device, earbuds fit snug, quick charging, wish the volume was a little higher but what can you expect for the money. Would definitely buy again!

product_name: kurdene Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 in Ear Buds Light-Weight Headphones,Deep Bass Sound,Built-in Mics Headset,Clear Calls Earphones for Sports Workout
description: After losing a set of AirPods I decided to go for a more budget friendly option. I have been pleasantly surprised. The case is sleek and small, and a charging cable is included as well. They also provided additional earpieces of various sizes so you can find your perfect fit, I went with the smallest size. They charge quickly and last hours. The earbuds are durable while still being small/sleek, and they stay in my ears better than my AirPods did. Sound quality is great and outside noise is blocked as well. First pairing is very easy and the directions are clear. After the initial pairing they will connect to your device automatically when removed from the case. One downside is that it has been disconnecting when I answer calls (which means I haven’t been able to verify microphone quality) but other than that issue it has been smooth sailing. Can’t beat these for the price!

product_name: kurdene Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 in Ear Buds Light-Weight Headphones,Deep Bass Sound,Built-in Mics Headset,Clear Calls Earphones for Sports Workout
description: I have recently got into listening to Audible books since I have a toddler and can’t indulge in a physical book. I listen to them mostly on walks, and sometimes in bed. I am ok with there being little noise cancelling, because I still need to be aware of my surroundings. I can still multi task. With both headphones in, it does pretty well at not letting outside noise through. They’re very comfortable. I find that most wireless ear buds don’t stay in my ears, these do!! It came with a very small charger cord so, that’s not great but it works. And if u have android chargers it’s the same thing.They’re very light I almost thought there was nothing in my package. As far as durability I can’t give a fair review on that yet. But, I’d assume they’re not going to withstand too much since they’re little and very light: the case is small and sleek. The only thing I don’t like and this goes for pretty much all wireless earbuds is the touch feature. You have to touch the ear piece a certain amount of times to pick up a call, change the volume, reject a call. EtcIt can get confusing. Haven’t had a problem with these as I just use my phone to control everything. And they’re not too sensitive which is a huge bonus. I had pairs where the slightest touch from readjusting them in your ear would change the features. I also am very impressed with how easy they connected to my iPhone. I didn’t need to do all that “take the R one out, pair it. Take the L one out then pair it. nonsense. They both connected right away: all I had to do was take them BOTH out at the same time and good to go. Sound is great IMO! Very clear and gets loud. I’m happy with these, definitely consider buying if you don’t want to invest in the expensive versions who also IMO don’t work that great anyway.

product_name: kurdene Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 in Ear Buds Light-Weight Headphones,Deep Bass Sound,Built-in Mics Headset,Clear Calls Earphones for Sports Workout
description: So the price is awesome and they seem to work awesome! On top of concealable nature because they're small and black hide in plain sight pretty good!My problem is that this is all a second-hand review. My package got sent to an old address and the porch piracy is a very real problem there. The perpetrators denied having anything to do with it while listening to their bops!So here's your reminder that I've gotta get a second pair, but you don't have to! Update your address or you'll miss out on this truly awesome product!(Update)Bought a second pair, they are indeed amazing! I've never had anything like this before and a lot of this was new to me. I say this as preface if this is a standard feature, but it comes with no instructions and you can pause what you're listening to with a tap on the ear bud itself. You can also cycle through your playlist somehow, I haven't quite figured it out yet.Good and clear noise, really good quality, magnetized case for charging... Honestly I'm just so happy to listen to some audiobooks while I'm working my long and monotonous shift on the job with these on

product_name: kurdene Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 in Ear Buds Light-Weight Headphones,Deep Bass Sound,Built-in Mics Headset,Clear Calls Earphones for Sports Workout
description: I love how they fit comfortably in the ear. It was very easy to connect to my Apple devices. It functions as it should. The sound it very clear . The color is just as the picture. I got the black for a sleek look. It’s a good bang for your buck! Also comes with charger and additional earbud rubber thingies for your ear.

product_name: kurdene Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 in Ear Buds Light-Weight Headphones,Deep Bass Sound,Built-in Mics Headset,Clear Calls Earphones for Sports Workout
description: There's nothing particularly special about the sound of these earbuds, but they offer perfectly adequate reproduction with very little noticeable Bluetooth hiss... probably no more than you'd hear plugging wired headphones directly into the on-motherboard audio jack of a typical PC or laptop.The buds are quite comfortable to wear in any normal position, and are even comfortable enough to wear while sleeping with my ear against them pillow. The manual says they offer 5 hours of play time between charging sessions in the clamshell case, and while I haven't pushed them to that limit yet, I believe that they will last that long.The only thing that annoyed me about them at first was the fact that touching them at all caused my Youtube videos to pause. However, it turns out that can be fixed in Firefox by setting `media.hardwaremediakeys.enabled` to `false` in `about:config` so that any taps will be ignored. Something similar can probably be done with phones and with other media-playing software, but I have not had to try it yet.

product_name: kurdene Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 in Ear Buds Light-Weight Headphones,Deep Bass Sound,Built-in Mics Headset,Clear Calls Earphones for Sports Workout
description: I was kind of surprised after ordering these earbuds for $10 that they had as good quality sound as they do. After changing out the default medium sized nibs for the large size, the bass showed up really well and the sound was actually quite full. I bought an extra pair for my son who's kind of an audio snob when it comes to headphones. He needed to replace a "high quality" set of earbuds (read: "much more expensive") with battery life issues, but he's now a college student on a tight budget. Me, I'm just cheap. He skeptically put these buds in his ears, turned on one of his favorite songs, looked up from his phone quizzically when the song started playing, and said "These were 10 bucks? Huh." He was more than a little shocked at the sound quality, especially given the price. Bluetooth connects quickly and battery life is great too. You can certainly find higher quality earbuds out there, but for the price, these are in a league of their own.

product_name: kurdene Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 in Ear Buds Light-Weight Headphones,Deep Bass Sound,Built-in Mics Headset,Clear Calls Earphones for Sports Workout
description: Generally they work well. However at some point they stopped synchronizing with each other, which was frustrating. You can identify this situation if any:1. your phone identify 2 separate s8 Bluetooth devices.2. When you take them out both would stay blinking red-blue.3. When you take them out, you would hear 'pairing' NOT follow by 'connected'.How to resolve this? I'm not 100% sure.Manuel say to reset them you need to tap 4 times on each. I tried multiple times and it didn't seem to resolve the issue even after reset.I think at some point I tapped them less than 4 times, maybe 3 times? And I got them to sync with each other. I hope this would help you if you find yourself in such situation

product_name: Skylight Digital Picture Frame - WiFi Enabled with Load from Phone Capability, Touch Screen Digital Photo Frame Display - Customizable Gift for Friends and Family - 10 Inch Black
description: I'll start by saying I barely write reviews.  Only when something is really good or really bad.  This product was the latter.  It started off ok...nice looking frame.  Very quick set-up.  We purchased as a holiday gift for my mother (65 y/o and somewhat tech savy) who lives a plane ride away so we could surprise her with pictures of our family now and then.  We really liked the email option.  Our kids set-up the custom email address and it was somewhat inappropriate, so I reached out to customer service to see how to delete it and set-up another.  It took a day or so, but they got back to me and reset the frame.  I thought this was inconvenient that we couldn't do it ourselves especially since all the uploaded photos on the old address were now removed, but wasn't that concerned at first.We started to upload photos to the new address and noticed that the mail icon and timer appeared in the upper right hand corner.  It didn't go away for over two weeks that we had the product.  Meaning that it was trying to download and couldn't.  The photos also lagged in spots and I received messages that "ourskylight is not responding".  Also the menu button on the back was not responding at all.  Clearly something was wrong.  I turned the frame on/off, reset my wifi router, placed the frame by the router, etc, etc.  Everything the website said on their troubleshooting section.  I even deleted every photo assuming we sent too many than the storage could handle.  No luck.  I have a home office so it's not like I had issues on my end with WiFi.  There was no actual customer service number to contact, which is the norm these days and fine, but email customer service did't get back to me for almost a week.  I wanted this all set-up for a gift and needed time to return, receive new and set-up in time for Christmas.  Thank goodness Amazon stepped in immediately and sent me a shipping label and full refund (even though this was a 3rd party vendor).As I wasn't going to make the same mistake twice, I started to do some more research on similar products.  There are much better and more economical frames out there.  Getting down to the basics:1.  There aren't a whole lot of "customized" options on here.  The settings button is kind of a joke and only lets you select a wifi address or tell you "how it works" email address.  No other real settings.
