You can select a different speed (in seconds) but I noticed it reset from my 5 seconds per frame to 10 seconds.  Perhaps part of the original defect.  Another review called this a "One Trick Pony" and boy were they right.2.  To delete photos, you have to go to each and do it one at a time.  Select...delete.  Select...delete.  Kind of archaic.3.  Other frames have motion sensor on/off.  Nice as this frame requires a hard wired outlet and you would need to manually turn off if this was, say, next to your nightstand and you didn't want the frame on when you slept.4.  The touchscreen is worse than the first version of whatever touchscreen device rolled out.  Slow, pressure sensitivity was terrible, etc.  Again archaic.5.  Does not play video.  Many of them don't and the ones that do are more expensive.  But just saying don't buy if you want to play video.In short, this was one of the more expensive frames out there.  The lack of features, seemingly "old fashioned" tech and poor customer service makes this a hard pass for me.  That is on top of the fact that mine came defective.  I'll say they did finally get back to me on how to return for a refund, but too late for me.I'm hoping I have better results with NixPlay.

product_name: Skylight Digital Picture Frame - WiFi Enabled with Load from Phone Capability, Touch Screen Digital Photo Frame Display - Customizable Gift for Friends and Family - 10 Inch Black
description: There are a lot of picture frames out there today.  This is one of the most popular and that must be due to marketing because quality wise it is not the best.  Features wise it is okay, but some of those features are locked behind a paywall.What is good about this frame is that it is easy to send pictures, you can  use it in portrait and landscape and it has pretty easy to use touchscreen controls.  Overall it looks good and is easy to setup and use.However, the build quality is pretty low. Clearly this frame is lit from one edge.  That becomes apparent in landscape mode when many of the pictures have a lighter band down the right hand side and ghosting is visible when the picture changes. Also, it clearly hasn't been color calibrated as the colors come off as cool, or yellowish depending on the frame.  And picture storage? This frame only has 8gig of ram.  Ram is cheap enough this should have been minimum 64gig.  8 gigs does not hold a lot of photos.Additionally, the screen only allows 1200x800.  Nobodies camera takes photos that low quality and so when you send pictures the system compresses and crops your photos.  So you end up with some very fuzzy pics, and peoples heads cut off.Finally, many of the features are behind a paywall.  Want to add a second frame to the same email?  Paywall.  Want to make albums?  Paywall... you get the idea. If you can get it on sale and significantly cheaper than it's competition then it is okay, otherwise grab one of the competitors for better quality and no paywalls.

product_name: Skylight Digital Picture Frame - WiFi Enabled with Load from Phone Capability, Touch Screen Digital Photo Frame Display - Customizable Gift for Friends and Family - 10 Inch Black
description: It's nice if you just need to send a handful of pictures.  But I find icloud email is limited to sending 5 photos per email. And the skylight app is hit or miss when I use it to upload pics.  I have to keep it to about 5 photos or it fails.  And sometimes it fails with just 5, and then it will succeed when I retry it.  So if if I want to upload say 30 or more older photos, it's going to be a huge pain in the rear.  It might take hours.I'm wondering if it's possible to plug my phone into it directly and transfer the photos, instead of having to go online to do it.  There's another plug on the back, but I'm not sure what it's for, because my box didn't come with a book showing the buttons and plugs on the device.  It doesn't look like a usb plug.  Just that this is way too painful and time consuming if you want to upload a lot of photos at once.

product_name: Skylight Digital Picture Frame - WiFi Enabled with Load from Phone Capability, Touch Screen Digital Photo Frame Display - Customizable Gift for Friends and Family - 10 Inch Black
description: Purchased to replace another digital frame that quit working - It's OK. More expensive and doesn't have as many settings/options as my other one. Was slightly disappointed after comparing it with my other one.

product_name: Skylight Digital Picture Frame - WiFi Enabled with Load from Phone Capability, Touch Screen Digital Photo Frame Display - Customizable Gift for Friends and Family - 10 Inch Black
description: The application on the iphone was very buggy. When clicking the link sent in the email it would go to the application but freeze for a while. I had to close out and reopen several times. It was only initially doing this upon linking the frame to the app, but since then I have not seen any more buggy interactions.

product_name: Skylight Digital Picture Frame - WiFi Enabled with Load from Phone Capability, Touch Screen Digital Photo Frame Display - Customizable Gift for Friends and Family - 10 Inch Black
description: I ordered this product, because I liked the simplicity of it  and had difficulty with it staying connected to my network.  Called their customer helpline.  They sent me a new device and the same thing happened.  Tried to reset it to factory settings.  Still didn't work.

product_name: Skylight Digital Picture Frame - WiFi Enabled with Load from Phone Capability, Touch Screen Digital Photo Frame Display - Customizable Gift for Friends and Family - 10 Inch Black
description: I received one and it was great! I bought one as a gift… and it won’t connect to the internet at the location it was intended for. I’m trying to get a new product … the company has asked me to send pick of back of frame.( twice) and twice I’ve told them: it is in OH and I’m in FL… hope this gets resolved soon taking way too long for customer satisfaction

product_name: Skylight Digital Picture Frame - WiFi Enabled with Load from Phone Capability, Touch Screen Digital Photo Frame Display - Customizable Gift for Friends and Family - 10 Inch Black
description: The frame is great, but the ad in Amazon suggests adding a power supply and SD card to your order. Neither is necessary because the frame comes with a power supply and an internal 8G SD card.

product_name: Skylight Digital Picture Frame - WiFi Enabled with Load from Phone Capability, Touch Screen Digital Photo Frame Display - Customizable Gift for Friends and Family - 10 Inch Black
description: Our old skylight broke and after a series of emails and excessive “asks” by the manufacturer, we discarded it and bought a new one.  But the latest version is overly complicated and after downloading the app and spending over an hour trying to upload our saved images, and confronting multiple requests to subscribe, I am returning the new unit. I simply want to see my digital photos, not subscribe, not use a calendar or list my chores or see videos.  Furthermore, the viewing area is much smaller than the frame, which may have been similar on the old unit but seemed more obvious now, perhaps because I became so frustrated.  I will look for another option to view my digital photos without all the hassle of the Skylight.

product_name: Skylight Digital Picture Frame - WiFi Enabled with Load from Phone Capability, Touch Screen Digital Photo Frame Display - Customizable Gift for Friends and Family - 10 Inch Black
description: My kids bought this frame for me on Amazon (on a Black Friday sale). The model number on the back is SKYV3. The color of the plastic on the back is black.I in turn wished to purchase this exact item (model SKYV3 digital frame) for my parents. However, when the item arrived, it had a white plastic back, a much longer and completely differently designed stand (like a pencil that screws in, rather than a flat magnetic stand like the SKYV3). I then noticed that the model number is different. It is SKY002, an older version, I presume.  Some have commented that the item number listed (916496), is for the newer model SKYV3, but what arrived for me (ordering the item number 916496) was model SKY002, which others have stated they got from Amazon, when they too believed they were purchasing and would be receiving the SKYV3.What I want is to get the SKYV3, but I fear doing a simple Amazon return/exchange will merely get me another SKY002.I originally bought a Frameo digital frame for my parents. It cost much less, yet allowed you to enter captions, allowed you to rotate the frame, and allowed you to send video clips, and other things FOR FREE. This SKYLIGHT frame is more expensive, and only allows these features with a yearly $39 SKYLIGHT PLUS subscription!  The only reason I sent the Frameo back and ordered the Skylight was because the Frameo annoyingly requires a different code be sent to those who wanted to send pics to the frame EVERYTIME they wish to send new pics – and said code was only good for so many hours.

product_name: Skylight Digital Picture Frame - WiFi Enabled with Load from Phone Capability, Touch Screen Digital Photo Frame Display - Customizable Gift for Friends and Family - 10 Inch Black
description: Big fan of the Slylight frame. After this purchase, I’m connected to four frames, and purchased two of those four. The setup is incredibly easy, and it’s also very simple to invite others to share pictures to the frames as well. Photos can be uploaded to the frame and will work without WiFi, which is nice. But WiFi is required for frame owner to receive any new uploads from others. The frame looks well made, and the matte touch looks nice in any room. The size is also good, as it doesn’t look like you’re having to squint at a 4x6 from across the room. You can actually see the photos. I already thought the price was more than fair for the quality, but considering the joy they’ve brought to the people I’ve gifted them too, they’re worth every penny!

product_name: Skylight Digital Picture Frame - WiFi Enabled with Load from Phone Capability, Touch Screen Digital Photo Frame Display - Customizable Gift for Friends and Family - 10 Inch Black
description: You’ll see several of these digital frames on Amazon and even at retailers. nothing compares to the GOAT, skylight. The app is super easy to use, picture show up right away, and If you have kids that like to scroll through touchscreens, then this is for you.  If it’s perfect with any decor, the quality is second to numb, and don’t take my word for it… Get one yourself and you will agree.

product_name: Skylight Digital Picture Frame - WiFi Enabled with Load from Phone Capability, Touch Screen Digital Photo Frame Display - Customizable Gift for Friends and Family - 10 Inch Black
description: This was purchased as a gift, and I would love to get one for myself as well.  It was easy to set up, classy looking and the photos were vibrant.  I like the app and find it easy to use, upload photos and add comments.  I also like that it has an email option for those that don't use apps.  In the app, you can see photos that other people have uploaded, so if you are sharing the frame with extended family you can see their updates even you don't personally have the frame.  One thing I didn't love as a default setting was that it combined 2 vertical photos on the screen at one time, so if you also prefer single photos to be displayed, go into settings to change "side-by-side" to "no".

product_name: Skylight Digital Picture Frame - WiFi Enabled with Load from Phone Capability, Touch Screen Digital Photo Frame Display - Customizable Gift for Friends and Family - 10 Inch Black
description: Way to set up. Great gift for parents who live far away.

product_name: Skylight Digital Picture Frame - WiFi Enabled with Load from Phone Capability, Touch Screen Digital Photo Frame Display - Customizable Gift for Friends and Family - 10 Inch Black
description: Easy to set up and preload photos ahead of time, though I did download the app on my phone to be able to manage the account until I transferred it to the gift recipient. Haven't run into issues with storage yet, but we are only several months into use so far.

product_name: Skylight Digital Picture Frame - WiFi Enabled with Load from Phone Capability, Touch Screen Digital Photo Frame Display - Customizable Gift for Friends and Family - 10 Inch Black
description: I love this electronic photo frame. I learned one thing to keep in mind for future photo shoots… the frame will work in horizontal or portrait orientation. I prefer the frame to be in horizontal position, so in the future I will take at least one horizontal shot of any photos I am taking. If the frame is in horizontal position, any photos that are in portrait orientation will be put in 2’s if there is an even amount of photos.Easy to set up, great picture quality, and it works on an electric power cord.

product_name: Skylight Digital Picture Frame - WiFi Enabled with Load from Phone Capability, Touch Screen Digital Photo Frame Display - Customizable Gift for Friends and Family - 10 Inch Black
description: I got my Skylight yesterday and it does what it says it does: display pictures. Getting the app up and running was simple, and the frame connects to WiFi so the communication with your phone is instant. You do have to set up an account with its own email address to get pictures on to it. Image quality is good but not up to screens on iPads, for example (less resolution and at extreme angles colors fade).The issue is several features like even how to control the slideshow is controlled by a subscription service. I think a lot of people are tired of these. Not everything should come with a monthly fee.

product_name: Skylight Digital Picture Frame - WiFi Enabled with Load from Phone Capability, Touch Screen Digital Photo Frame Display - Customizable Gift for Friends and Family - 10 Inch Black
description: We bought this for a Mother’s Day gift for a grandmother who can’t travel to see her grandkids. This has been a great tool to help keep her apart of our lives by simply uploading pictures weekly. It is very simple and easy to navigate even if you aren’t great with technology. For us this was a great purchase.

product_name: Skylight Digital Picture Frame - WiFi Enabled with Load from Phone Capability, Touch Screen Digital Photo Frame Display - Customizable Gift for Friends and Family - 10 Inch Black
description: This is the second time we have purchased this item. The quality of the photos is perfection, and the coloring matches our phones exactly how we took the photos. We love how classy it looks and how many photos you can store on it.

product_name: Skylight Digital Picture Frame - WiFi Enabled with Load from Phone Capability, Touch Screen Digital Photo Frame Display - Customizable Gift for Friends and Family - 10 Inch Black
description: I’ve ordered from other Frame companies on Amazon for Christmas gifts for all of my family. They have all stopped working after one year and I’m quite embarrassed. This frame was more expensive, but it’s much nicer. I feel confident that the company will take care of any problems should they arise, the other company that doesn’t even work anymore.

product_name: Raynic Emergency Radio, 5000mAh/18500mWh Weather Radio, Solar Hand Crank Radio with AM/FM/SW/NOAA Alert, Cell Phone Charger, Headphone Jack, Flashlight and SOS Siren
description: I wanted to buy the Midland - ER310 ($50 on sale) based on great reviews from The Wirecutter and CNET.  However, it’s only available for $101+ from an Amazon seller (way overpriced).  Look around and you can find it for $50 at other stores.I didn’t want to wait as we have bad weather in our area now and I wanted to be prepared ASAP.  This radio arrived the next day for $35.* What I like:Small size; very compact and it feels solid & durable (also IPX3 waterproof). The buttons to select options/change channels feel very nice and have a satisfying click.  The reading light and flashlight work well.  Very nice carrying strap.  Digital tuner makes it easy to select stations. Loud SOS alarm.  The unit came fully charged and ready to use. The ability to power the device from standard batteries (3 AAA’s), hand crank, or AC adapter.  It has a solar panel but the manual notes it’s not intended to fully charge the unit but to “keep it operational” (my interpretation of the instructions).Speaker quality isn’t too bad for such a small unit.  It’s not amazing, but it will do fine for news and weather alerts.  The unit will use its rechargable battery for power first, then use AAA batteries if they are installed.  This is a great feature and extends the runtime of the device. Radio also has a clock so you can check the time at a glance while using the radio.  Headphone jack to listen to audio privately; ability to charge a device via USB.  A plastic cover for the charge/power ports, to protect from dust/dirt. And I like the green colored case!  I didn’t want bright orange so this is very nice. LCD screen backlight so you could use the device easily in the dark.* What I don’t like:Solar panel isn’t as usable for charging as I would like.  I have not tested it but the manual specifically states the panel is not intended to fully charge the unit.  There is no ability to save radio stations to memory/presets.. would be very useful.  Now I just keep a piece of paper near the unit with radio stations written down, so I know which to tune to for news/etc.  The radio antenna is quite short, so some stations won’t come in as clearly (but it works OK).While the fabric strap feels nice and provides a good way to carry the unit, the strap gets in the way of the flip-up reading light.  One can move the strap out of the way but it does feel like this could have been designed better.* To be determined:I have no idea yet if NOAA Weather alerts work. If there’s a weather alert the radio is supposed to sound an alarm and flash a light, so you know to turn the radio on to listen to the weather alert.  I haven’t received any alerts yet, but have only had this about 6 hours.When the device is set to receive weather alerts (by default it is set to do this), when the radio is on standby (powered off) a red LED on the side of the radio flashes once every 7 seconds.  This is a nice way to confirm the setting, but until I receive an alert I won’t know if that works or not.  (And it’s one of the reasons why I bought it!)* SummaryA nice, compact unit that seems to work well based on what I have been able to test so far.  Once I receive a weather alert I’ll know for certain this works as expected; will update review if possible when that happens.  Until I can verify the device fully functions I’m rating it 3/5 stars.Provided the weather alerts work, I think this is a good unit for $35.  The Midland is $15 more but may be worth the cost, if you don’t want to take a chance on a company you have never heard of before.

product_name: Raynic Emergency Radio, 5000mAh/18500mWh Weather Radio, Solar Hand Crank Radio with AM/FM/SW/NOAA Alert, Cell Phone Charger, Headphone Jack, Flashlight and SOS Siren
description: UPDATE: I changed my review from one star to three because the seller is awesome. They saw my review and wanted to make it right. It's rare to find that these days! So, if you purchase this and something goes wrong like it did with me, they really will do their best to rectify it! Highly appreciated! (And, no, they did not ask me to change my review like some do, they really just wanted to make it right.)I really wanted to like this. I ordered one, and the solar panel was scratched up, which isn't a huge deal, but the USB-C was really loose and non-functional. So, I ordered another one. This time, the USB-A didn't work at all, and it wouldn't turn off. There was also a blinking key on the display on this one, which I didn't even get to find out what was happening with because of the other problems requiring a return. The lights are really bright, it looks nice and not bulky, the radio is easy to use and tuning is good enough. For whatever reason, the packaging was entirely different for the same product? That's not really a big deal, just strange. But, if pivotal parts of it don't work, especially on two different units, I just can't recommend it.

product_name: Raynic Emergency Radio, 5000mAh/18500mWh Weather Radio, Solar Hand Crank Radio with AM/FM/SW/NOAA Alert, Cell Phone Charger, Headphone Jack, Flashlight and SOS Siren
description: First off, for this price one would expect a decent amount of attention paid to the radio band functionality, but for intensive purposes, it appears as though the radio bands were the least important area of design in this particular model.I liked the flashlight and top flip-up lantern and the siren function is pretty loud, which one would expect it to be, now for the big let-down, the Am has virtually no selectivity as the lower range of frequencies are jammed together, for example 600, 640 and 690 khz are virtually right on top of each other, (maybe a hair-thin distance) and to tune to them requires turning the tuning dial very slowly around "520" on the dial!  Now further up the dial, the stations are spaced a little more but still I have a QFX radio that cost less than 1/3rd the cost of this model and it has the same, (but better engineered)  DSP base circuitry and yet aside from having to manually readjust the tuning pointer, the QFX has sensitivity and selectivity on AM ,something this model does not even come close to accomplishing.  FM is slightly better in the dial inaccuracy, (it's off by 2-3 Mhz on most stations)  I tried out SW both during the day and at night, (when it's easier to pick up most stations and I did this test outside to eliminate house wiring interference) and turning the tuning dial as slowly as possible, I could  not pick up any discernible signals, I could not even pick up the time standard signals either and I tried to anticipate the dial inaccuracies when tuning as well, and "no Joy".  The only band that worked was the NOAA and only if I extended the whip fully did I pick up a clear signal.So, if all you need is a crank lantern/flashlight/siren and a NOAA radio, this is probably a bit overpriced but it does do those things adequately, but for me that's not why I bought it, I bought it for the bands that on this model do not perform as expected and I would advise anyone interested in this series of radios, (different colors) to keep looking.Although I don't care for this model and I'm returning mine, at the very least, this radio does not have the dreaded sticky rubber coating that eventually makes handling the "Red Cross " series such an annoying PITA.I can recommend some other radios that perform basic AM/FM/SW quite well for around the same price as this model and in some cases, significantly less, (these are all DSP based radios).QFX - R-24 - Runs on 3 "D" cells and goes really loud as soon as you turn it on.  (only drawback is the need to open it up and move the dial pointer to match the dial position as both samples I've bought have this issue) I usually move the dial into place once I've tuned to a lower band station, then move the dial pointer to the correct frequency on the dial "cord" as it's not well glued, so it's easy to slide up or down the cord into an approx position.Kaito KA-29An excellent AM/FM/SW digital radio with direct frequency entry and a smooth movement tuning knob on the right hand side, although it only tunes in 5 khz increments on SW, it is still easier to tune to a frequncy quickly without having to spin the tuning knob, it will only allow increments of 5 khz on SW, (so no numbers between 0 and 5 allowed, it will always tune to the nearest 5khz increment to what is entered.Even though the TIVDIO  V-116 is similar to the Kaito KA-29, it has fewer accessible functions and the selectivity on AM is almost as bad as the crank radio being reviewed here, FM is ok and it's forte is playing MP3's as no matter what time of day I try it, the V-116 does not appear to be designed to actually pick up any SW signals, so if you're torn between the KA-29 or the V-116, avoid the V-116 if you want a functional SW pocket receiver that can pick up a lot of signals without an added wire , get the Kaito KA-29 or if you're in for a Chinese challenge, the Degen DE-29 is the same model with Chinese buttons.

product_name: Raynic Emergency Radio, 5000mAh/18500mWh Weather Radio, Solar Hand Crank Radio with AM/FM/SW/NOAA Alert, Cell Phone Charger, Headphone Jack, Flashlight and SOS Siren
description: I previously owned a different version of this radio that had analog radio tuning and no way to auto scan for stations. But otherwise it was almost identical, including side button placement, LED lights, and solar panel. This one has digital tuning and does have auto-scan and can also auto-wake on weather alerts. And this one is styled to look at lot like the Kaito A6000L, although it much smaller and has FAR fewer features (but is also a lot cheaper).What I like: It's got an internal battery that can be charged via USB, hand-crank, or included solar panel. It also takes 3x AA batteries for power. It picks up AM, FW, shortwave, and weather bands, as well as weather alerts. It's got a flashlight and lamp/reading light function. It has a headphone jack. It can serve as a charger for low-voltage digital devices. It remembers the last band and station you were tuned to when powered off. The antenna is fully articulating.What I don't like: The internal battery is not designed to be user replaced. There's a door on the bottom right where the internal battery is, but it just opens up to a plastic shield under the battery and you can't get to it without taking the whole radio apart. AM and SW reception is abysmal. The volume and tuning buttons are clacky-clacky sounding and loud. And my #1 dislike is that there is an "SOS" loud alarm function that is turned on by a button on the side of the radio and it is VERY easy to accidentally turn this on and annoy everyone within 100 feet of you or wake up sleeping camp-mates.

product_name: Raynic Emergency Radio, 5000mAh/18500mWh Weather Radio, Solar Hand Crank Radio with AM/FM/SW/NOAA Alert, Cell Phone Charger, Headphone Jack, Flashlight and SOS Siren
description: I mean, it's OK. Having a hand crank radio seems like a good idea to me. I wanted to give it 1 star, but decided, in fairness, I did not know much about Weather Alert Channels. 50% of my frustration with this item arose from the way the alert stations do what they do. The radio itself receives the alerts properly and faithfully delivers them with half decent audio. Having said that, it is very difficult to get AM or FM stations dialed in. This could be an issue specific to my area/location, but I have other cheapo radios that sound just fine. The difference between them being the antenna. Someone told me I could mash a 'french fry' on the end of the antenna and improve it. I have not tried that yet.

product_name: Raynic Emergency Radio, 5000mAh/18500mWh Weather Radio, Solar Hand Crank Radio with AM/FM/SW/NOAA Alert, Cell Phone Charger, Headphone Jack, Flashlight and SOS Siren
description: Very disappointing, During oncoming hurricane I couldn't tune in to any weather stations.Nothing but static.

product_name: Raynic Emergency Radio, 5000mAh/18500mWh Weather Radio, Solar Hand Crank Radio with AM/FM/SW/NOAA Alert, Cell Phone Charger, Headphone Jack, Flashlight and SOS Siren
description: The bottom battery door for the lithium battery, which I was under the impression to be an 18650, goes to nothing, there's just another plate, it's an internal rectangular soft cell like you'd find for an RC car, not an 18650.why a plate to nothing?still does the job though

product_name: Raynic Emergency Radio, 5000mAh/18500mWh Weather Radio, Solar Hand Crank Radio with AM/FM/SW/NOAA Alert, Cell Phone Charger, Headphone Jack, Flashlight and SOS Siren
description: (Update) After contacting the owner they sent a replacement radio free of charge. They were very responsive and efficient. Now I have to see how long this one lasts.The radio seemingly worked fine for the two times that I had used it (about 10 mins per session). Months later, it won't power on no matter what charging method or even using batteries. The replacement panel for the battery is supposedly on the bottom, but once accessed there's only a piece of plastic. I've gone back and forth with support, but even after explaining what I listed above they continue to list the different charging methods that I already explained do not work..

product_name: Raynic Emergency Radio, 5000mAh/18500mWh Weather Radio, Solar Hand Crank Radio with AM/FM/SW/NOAA Alert, Cell Phone Charger, Headphone Jack, Flashlight and SOS Siren
description: The attached pic is from the instruction manual.  It would take 5 hours of hand cranking to charge 30%, 17 hrs to get 100%.Solar is  36 hrs to charge 30% and 120hrs for 100% charge.

product_name: Raynic Emergency Radio, 5000mAh/18500mWh Weather Radio, Solar Hand Crank Radio with AM/FM/SW/NOAA Alert, Cell Phone Charger, Headphone Jack, Flashlight and SOS Siren
description: Had this over two years. Never tried to charge my phone until today. Won't do it. Tried a USB led light, too, it doesn't work either. That feature seems to be dead. Bummer for sure.

product_name: Raynic Emergency Radio, 5000mAh/18500mWh Weather Radio, Solar Hand Crank Radio with AM/FM/SW/NOAA Alert, Cell Phone Charger, Headphone Jack, Flashlight and SOS Siren
description: Love it, flashlight, plugs in for all kinds of electric powering, solar panel, hand crank, and the radio, alarm, and it's so cute and small.

product_name: Raynic Emergency Radio, 5000mAh/18500mWh Weather Radio, Solar Hand Crank Radio with AM/FM/SW/NOAA Alert, Cell Phone Charger, Headphone Jack, Flashlight and SOS Siren
description: I won't do a video due to the fact there are several already that I found to be accurate.  This little device is very handy to have around especially when you live in an are that gets storms often.  I just ordered mine and have been testing it out.Solar Panel:I won't give 4 stars on the charging via solar panel due to the fact they make it very clear that it's a backup method for charging as it's slow to charge because the panel is small.  It does work and will get you through in a clinch.Lights:The light on the end is very bright and has a nice dimmer for times when you don't need the full brightness.  The top light is handy for adding a nice amount of light to a dark room rather than just being a direct light.  I'm happy with the lights they work nicely and the brightness is great.Radio:I found the radio to be clear and the volume good as well.  I was able to find a station that gives good info on my area, which is important when hurricane season comes around.Alarm:The alarm is loud but it's not going to deafen you if you need to use it close to you in an emergency when you may want to be found or easily located.Charging:With the power cord it charges pretty quickly, USB also charges it pretty quickly if you have a battery pack charger.  The Crank is slower and tiering but that's to be expected.  The solar panel is slower as well as I mentioned above both have been clearly outlined by the seller.  They are for emergency use to give you enough power to use the radio, light, charge something up.I do appreciate the fact that you can charge it with several different methods as well as a battery backup I believe it's 3 AAA batteries.Crank, Solar, Electrical Outlet, USB, 3 AAA Batteries and rechargeable batteryIt's very sturdy!  It's about the size of a brick.  The case seems to be a very sturdy well made plastic.  It has a carry strap.  It's not heavy but it's not feather light either it's just right.It has ports to charge your phone, tablet etc. which is always helpful in an event you lose power.I recommend this product for anyone that needs a little extra piece of mind should you lose power or just enjoy camping or to keep in your vehicle.

product_name: Raynic Emergency Radio, 5000mAh/18500mWh Weather Radio, Solar Hand Crank Radio with AM/FM/SW/NOAA Alert, Cell Phone Charger, Headphone Jack, Flashlight and SOS Siren
description: The first day we got this item it alarmed before we even knew bad weather was on its way. Nice to be informed so you can be aware and plan. This is a nice unit but being older I tried to set clock and the + / - buttons wouldn’t work for me. However my husband did get it to work pushing the buttons harder than I could do. The lights are nice and bright. Siren for alerts is very loud which is good if your a heavy sleeper. Do like the compact size for storing. Overall we would buy this product again. Living out in the country where we don’t have city sirens, glad to have this system.

product_name: Raynic Emergency Radio, 5000mAh/18500mWh Weather Radio, Solar Hand Crank Radio with AM/FM/SW/NOAA Alert, Cell Phone Charger, Headphone Jack, Flashlight and SOS Siren
description: I had placed this on my deck a few days ago in the sun to charge up the battery.  I forgot to bring it in.  Last night we had a severe thunderstorm with rains heavy enough the streets were flooded with 2-3 inches of water.  After the storm I realized the radio had been sitting out fully exposed to the storm.  It still works after letting it sit inside overnight.I have the analog dial version, so tuning is cumbersome but the station quality is comparable to other radios.  Audio is decent for this type of radio, Not great but it works well enough.  I wish it had a better solar panel for faster charging, and a larger LiIon battery.  The included battery is marked as 21700E - 5000 mAh, 18.5 Wh, 3.7 V.  Not bad, but I'm now seeing these radios with >10000 mAh batteries.  Hand cranking works but is a lot of work for minimal power production.  It is nice the LiIon battery is easily replaceable.Interestingly I just took the LiIon battery out, no AAA batteries installed, and in the sunlight the flashlight still worked just on solar power.  Not sure how useful that is though!  The radio and SOS alert did not work.  I put the battery in my charger (Nitecore UMS4) and it indicates the battery is still in "Good" condition, however I was disappointed it only had ~1900mA of charge after sitting outside in sunny conditions for 3-4 days.  I'll fully charge it on my charger and see what is the max charge it takes.  As I said earlier, the 21700 battery is easily replaceable.  According to Amazon I purchased this radio 3.5 years ago in Feb 2021.

product_name: Raynic Emergency Radio, 5000mAh/18500mWh Weather Radio, Solar Hand Crank Radio with AM/FM/SW/NOAA Alert, Cell Phone Charger, Headphone Jack, Flashlight and SOS Siren
description: This is a great compact all-in-one radio purchased as part of my emergency & hiking kit. I bought this specifically for the hand crank feature, NOAA & the built-in 5000 mAh battery power bank to guarantee a working radio/alerts/flashlight when all other charging options are unavailable or have failed. While the digital version was appealing, a LCD display does use power and will eventually fail which kinda’ defeats the purpose. I also wanted something that was lightweight and portable for me to carry vs the old worldstar “portable” unit my boyfriend insists on lugging around. It wasn’t until recently that we got to compare the two units and this had much better radio reception and we could actually pick up more active bands and NOAA weather channels during a ‘real tropical disturbance’ (Debbie) than his portable! It appears this little radio not only picks up weather alerts and SW bands, but it also picks up a wider range of local radio stations available on our other home units. The sound quality is better than what you’d expect for this size radio. Actually, it’s quite impressive. The audio comes in clear and decent on the internal speaker & on headphones when using the jack (with or without the telescopic antenna extended). I’ve tested pretty much all the functions and have accidentally set off the SOS alarm (it definitely works by the way & so does the red flasher!). Everything works great. Even the flash light & reading lamp puts out good illumination and with the strapped on NSEW compass you might be able to get your bearings. It’s still a hard call of how efficient the unit will be when tested under a live situation, but hopefully it won’t come to that. It charges reasonably quickly for USB and AC, with solar being the more timely followed by hand cranking. With a 5000 mAh battery I should be able to rely on this as a decent backup should my Anker die. Anyway, as the saying goes, ‘it’s better to have and not need, than to need and not have’. I’m happy to ‘have’ the Solar Crank CR1009 as part of my emergency kit to keep me informed during emergencies. It’s takes up little space and weighs under 15 oz, making it extremely portable to carry in your over nighter, sling bag, sport bag, backpack, etc. when hiking, camping, glamping etc. You can also attach or hang it with the carabiner provided. The only feature not included was making it waterproof and that’s easily solved with a ziplock gallon bag.Overall, this is exactly what I was looking for. It’s plain, simple, compact, reliable, well built, and at a good price point. It’s your life line to staying safe and informed during unexpected weather events whether it be blizzard, wildfire, flash floods, earthquake, hurricane, electrical storms, etc.  This is totally worth every penny and 5 Stars! Highly recommend.

product_name: Raynic Emergency Radio, 5000mAh/18500mWh Weather Radio, Solar Hand Crank Radio with AM/FM/SW/NOAA Alert, Cell Phone Charger, Headphone Jack, Flashlight and SOS Siren
description: Four power sources (crank generator, solar cells, lithium rechargeable batteries and replaceable batteries). Good reception, good sound quality. Solid enclosure. Flashlight (spot) and flood light. Digital tuner (my last emergency radio had an old fashioned variable capacitor with terrible resolution).This one checks all the boxes. Even has a clock (but only works in 12h mode).One weakness: when the power button is pushed, the band button must then be pushed to activate the radio. Who thought that was OK? AM stations sound horrible, but maybe that is normal.

product_name: Raynic Emergency Radio, 5000mAh/18500mWh Weather Radio, Solar Hand Crank Radio with AM/FM/SW/NOAA Alert, Cell Phone Charger, Headphone Jack, Flashlight and SOS Siren
description: The pros- long battery run time. Sturdy build. Decent reception. Nice feature set. The cons- misaligned charging port= difficult to insert charging cable and will probably break in time. Long recharge time. Can't swap out the internal battery, meaning, you can't have a spare internal battery charged and waiting to switch. Of course, it will run on Triple AAAs, so it's not a deal breaker. If the Midland radio had shortwave, I would have probably purchased it instead. But I wanted shortwave, because it is an EMERGENCY radio and you never know will be transmitting, so I want as many options as possible. For 40 dollars, it's about the best you can do in that price range. Naturally, the crank and solar outputs are extremely low, but if you have no other options, they are there.

product_name: Raynic Emergency Radio, 5000mAh/18500mWh Weather Radio, Solar Hand Crank Radio with AM/FM/SW/NOAA Alert, Cell Phone Charger, Headphone Jack, Flashlight and SOS Siren
description: Some of the things I like about this radio. It has a flashlight, reading light, solar panel to maintain the charge, hand crank to charge the radio, and the ability to charge your phone from the built-in battery pack. It also has a small compass to help orientate you in the direction you need to go/ or going.Feels like it's durable enough to get the job done.The things I don't like as well: While it could be caused by the distance from the weather stations, I'm unable to pick up any of the weather radio frequencies. I can pick up FM frequencies, but not any AM, or Weather radio frequencies.Overall, I figure the inability to get many radio stations/ weather radio frequencies is due to the distance. As other weather radios I have, don't work very well in my area.

product_name: Raynic Emergency Radio, 5000mAh/18500mWh Weather Radio, Solar Hand Crank Radio with AM/FM/SW/NOAA Alert, Cell Phone Charger, Headphone Jack, Flashlight and SOS Siren
description: The SW band is 2.3-23 Mhz.  I was playing around with it, and got some foreign stations.  Not the best reception.  As far as the WX band, it's pretty standard.  It has a passive alert that you can turn on and set a timer.  This radio has a lot of features my old weather hand crank radio didn't have, like rechargeable lithium batteries and AA backups.  Apparently it can switch between the two is one is low.  I have not played with the solar charging, but it looks like it's for emergencies only.  Overall, I'm happy with it.  I got it to replace my old one, which wouldn't take a solar charge anymore.  I just keep it charged all the time.

product_name: Raynic Emergency Radio, 5000mAh/18500mWh Weather Radio, Solar Hand Crank Radio with AM/FM/SW/NOAA Alert, Cell Phone Charger, Headphone Jack, Flashlight and SOS Siren
description: Not to worry.  Sometimes resolution to a product failure is dependent on the customer's input or follow-up.  As with buying from Amazon, for the most part a 30 day return is standard.  We purchased more than 2 of these products at different intervals from the seller.  One of them, after a few months, had an issue with charging.  When contacting the seller directly, the fix the issue by replacing it promptly.  I get a sense that the company truly wants satisfied customers and promotes themselves as being honest and attentive to customer complaints, needs or dissatisfactions.  Just wanted to put in my two cents.  Stay safe!Thank you Raynic

product_name: Sonos Era 100 - Black - Wireless, Alexa Enabled Smart Speaker
description: What a shame. When they work the sound is amazing. The problem. They never work for streaming music because of a woeful update to its software. Even the NYT, which once recommended the system as the best has changed its mind. About three months ago Sonos updated its system software that literally rendered my entire Sonos speaker system (This Sonos Era 100 included) useless. To use this system as a music streaming device, you must use the Sonos App. Sonos used to have one of the best apps in the business. Intuitive with amazing functionality. A few months ago they tried to update it, basically trying to make it look more like Amazon music. It was an utter failure. Folks like me are wanting to sell their entire system. I stayed with sonos for three months now since they promised they would make things right. They have not. The speakers stop streaming music after playing just one song. Nearly no commands work correctly. When I tell it to stop playing a song. It does not listen. I manually have to press the button on the speaker. This system was developed so you could talk to it and play all music across an entire CD. That used to be possible. Now it is not. Literally stops playing after one song. Via voice prompt, when you tell it to go to the next song, it cannot. We Sonos music streamers have lost the capability to stream music directly from our device's own music library. Many of us bought Sonos because we wanted to have great speakers that would directly play music from our phones or our shared music library folders on our computers. That functionality has ceased to exist. Run! Don't walk. And return these speakers. Their only use today is as a bluetooth device where you have to physically press each song you want to move onto via whatever controlling system you have for bluetooth. The Sonos incompetence here I cannot overstate. A once great company and music system has fallen. Such a shame. It did not have to be this way.  If I could speak to the CEO of Sonos I would tell him this:  Your bread and butter was your speaker system, not headphones, not other products. Get back to the basics. Restore the streaming functionality that allowed us to enjoy music via touchless voice commands and software that was once top notch. I have five Sonos speakers for sale. I hate to do it, but I am making all my speakers Amazon speakers. At least Amazon respects it customers by doing research before launching new products that destroy the functionality of what used to be. Goodbye, Sonos. Forever!

product_name: Sonos Era 100 - Black - Wireless, Alexa Enabled Smart Speaker
description: Purchase:Sonos Arc, Sub Gem 3, (2) ERA 100 Home Theater, Samsund UN55DU8000F 4K Curve TV.  I have been searching and testing different home theater solutions for our master bedroom.  I was injured and have been spending time recouperating so I wanted to splurge a bit.Let’s start with the TV.  The Samsung Curved 4K HDTV came in at a price point of only $550.  It’s connectivity to Alexa, Samsung Cloud and other supporting technology had my attention.  It has plenty of connections on the backside for you to add a lot of components and includes eArc so you can connect it to your AV system as a one and done.I found myself connecting to the ears and moving on. I have an Apple TV.  Because of my quadriplegia, in rough Best Buy in to mount the TV and help me run cables.For the speakers:I chose the Sonos Arc, Sub Gen 3, and torches ERA 100’s as my rear speakers.  Since everything is wireless and Bluetooth I was pretty excited.I am a developer in real life and though this would be pretty straight forward.  I added the sound Bar first to my TV and wireless.  Right off I noticed the sound bar would not discover the 5G network.  After some reading, it only communicates on standard wireless networks.  And you have to use your iPhone or Apple device on that same network.  Ok, don’t panic, let’s keep going.I then made sure the TV could interface the sound bar.  So far so good.Now let’s add the two rear speakers and sub.  These were able to see the 5G network but not the standard wireless.  So now I have 3 speakers on bedroom 1 and 1 speaker on bedroom.  The directions tell you can merge these.I purchased a new Logitech Harmony 915 remote with hub.  The Samsung remote is useless.The speakers use the Sonos app to connect to each other and allow you some other fine control. The app is horrible.  I’m constantly fighting to keep the speakers connected to each other, and when you have to reconnect the bar to the other speakers you totally loose sound and have to use the remote to bring the sound back.  At the same time the sound control coming from your iPhone app could be at a level that is blowing you away.For the Sonos speakers I’m in at a cost of around $1600, the fact that an app can make it feel like a total waste or at least the price point is over by $1000, I’d say don’t waste your money until Sonos fixes the app.  All the speakers should be on the same network.  I’m learning how to use the Logitec remote to control the speakers, but since Sonos is using an app.Overall, it’s not a bad purchase but I feel like each company tried build in technology that leaves the user in a fight.  I’d recommend you do more research.  I would have returned all this but I had an unexpected hospital stay that put my return time past the allowed window by 4 days.I’ll learn it, if I just can’t make it work, I’ll sell it.  Maybe I’ll get lucky and Sonos will step in and help.I hope this detail helps someone.

product_name: Sonos Era 100 - Black - Wireless, Alexa Enabled Smart Speaker
description: I’ve been a loyal Sonos user for years, having owned three Sonos One speakers that I’ve been very happy with. Naturally, when I decided to get a new sound device, I turned to Sonos again. While the sound quality of this new model is comparable to or even slightly better than my existing Ones, the setup experience was incredibly frustrating.The sound quality is exactly what I was looking for, but the setup process through the Sonos app was so problematic that I almost returned the device. I’m still not entirely sure how I eventually managed to add it to my Sonos app—whether through persistence or luck. Unfortunately, the poor setup experience overshadowed what would otherwise be a fantastic product. This will be my last attempt with Sonos if the setup issues aren't addressed.

product_name: Sonos Era 100 - Black - Wireless, Alexa Enabled Smart Speaker
description: Wasted an hour trying to use the app on my samsung phone. App kept glitch ingredients back to main menu. Borrowed my wife's iPhone and the app there functioned as advertised. The speaker was a gift for my son. I'm still on the fence if it was worth the bother and money. It does sound better than the echo dot, but that's a low bar for a $200+ speaker.

product_name: Sonos Era 100 - Black - Wireless, Alexa Enabled Smart Speaker
description: Well, this product comes with the rich base Lydon sound that I’ve come to expect from Sonos, there was absolute intentional misdirection with the marketing of this product. It is self described as wireless, so you can imagine my surprise when as soon as I tried to treat it like a portable device, and unplug it from the wall, the audio promptly cut off. Instead of wireless meaning, portable, they simply mean it’s a Bluetooth Wi-Fi speaker. I couldn’t be more frustrated with this buy . I was looking for portability, and instead, I have yet another wired speaker.

product_name: Sonos Era 100 - Black - Wireless, Alexa Enabled Smart Speaker
description: Looks great, easy to setup but the sound is absolutely nothing special.

product_name: Sonos Era 100 - Black - Wireless, Alexa Enabled Smart Speaker
description: The speakers are outstanding - when they connect and work. Therein lies the problem. I would like to purchase more for another room but I will not until the ones I currently have work consistently. I would recommend anyone considering to hold off for now.

product_name: Sonos Era 100 - Black - Wireless, Alexa Enabled Smart Speaker
description: The speakers are beautiful and the sound they produce as a stereo pair is simply amazing. The hardware is so sleek and fits the style of my space. Unfortunately, the speakers keep disappearing from the app and I’m tired of resetting and retuning and adding them repeatedly. I rebooted my entire home network, which has the fastest speed available from my provider. The other devices on my network work flawlessly alone and with each other on the same network. These speakers are the only devices that are problematic. Sadly, I bought a record player that will only play on Sonos through WiFi and now I’ll have to wire them to other speakers because these are being returned. If I have to listen wirelessly from my streaming services via Bluetooth, then there’s really no point in sticking with the Sonos if they can’t all communicate on my network. I even tried doing a soft reset on my phone and that only worked for two days before the app started dropping one speaker. One week later, I ended up returning the turntable as well, and the refund was in my account three days later. It’s been 11 days and although the return was received, I have yet to receive a refund. I’d suggest purchasing these in person if you want the assurance of an easy return.

product_name: Sonos Era 100 - Black - Wireless, Alexa Enabled Smart Speaker
description: A minute ago I said "Alexa, play music by Brian Eno." The "I hear you" sound to show the wake word was heard, then nothing. That's typical. So I tried "Alexa, play music by Brian Eno in Spotify" and music started. But five seconds later it stopped. So I said "Alexa, play" and it restarted for a few seconds. Then it stopped and I got a random podcast.That's if you use the Alexa voice control module. If you use the Sonos voice control module it might be better, but that doesn't support Spotify.Then there's the problem that the volume on speech responses from the device is a couple steps higher than for music, so things like error responses come blasting out at a god-like level. It's terrifying and annoying as hell.I bought this to improve on the sound on my $50 Echo Dot, and the Era 100 does deliver there, even though it is a lot dumber. I'm going to pick up a USB C to 1/8" cable and use the Sonos as a passive speaker.UPDATE: I ordered a "UGREEN USB C to 3.5mm Audio Adapter". I connected the Echo Dot. It worked for a couple minutes then stopped. It may still be possible if I order the official Sonos Line-In Adapter sold by the company, but they are out of stock.

product_name: Sonos Era 100 - Black - Wireless, Alexa Enabled Smart Speaker
description: I spent 45 minutes on hold for TWO DIFFERENT customer service calls. Each call ended up being TWO hours long. The set up is not easy. At first it was and I thought I was good to go, but with the App updates several of my speakers could not get connected/registered to my Sonos System. I am working with Sonos Era, Sonos Play, and Sonos Roam speakers. I had to start restart my router and phone multiple times and factory rest all the speakers. Some wouldn't even Factory Reset. One Customer Service Lady said that my Router was the issue and I needed to call Spectrum and have them manually reset it fromWiFE6 default bandwidth 802.11 AXN because my bandwith is not supported by Sonos.  WHAT???!!! That's a serious design issue. So I called Spectrum and of course their routers are unable to do the thing that Sonos needs. So they reccomended I buy a Dual Band Router. Now COME ON! Do I really want to do that? So I called Sonos Customer Service again, waited 45 minutes on hold. Then we were able to get all my speakers correctly set up to the system and everything was playing correctly. For one hour. Then the music stopped out of nowhere. The phone was near the router and I didn't touch anything. Now it's stuck in Glitch mode. I was able to get it to play music but the App isn't displaying that the speakers are playing anything and its giving me an Error Message saying Unable to Work. Try again. Well for a brand whose whole gimmick is ease of set up and use, this is a total Fail. Am most likely going to return them all which is unfortunate because the sound is great.

product_name: Sonos Era 100 - Black - Wireless, Alexa Enabled Smart Speaker
description: I already have 2 Era 100's and a Sub mini in my Family room. They sound fantastic.  Some times I like to sit in my Living room and read, or meditate. But I would turn the volume up in the family room so I could hear those speakers. So I decided to get a third  Era 100 for my living room. I put it on a small decorative shelf.  I must say it is everything I imagined it would be. When setting it up I didn't know I could turn off selected speakers. This was a unexpected plus for me. So if I am in my living room I could just have the one Era 100 speaker play and vice versa. Or I could have all three and the sub mini playing at the same time. After having the 2 Era 100's and Sub mini for a couple of months now, I had forgotten how good just 1 Era 100 speaker sound. I did notice the two Era 100's paired with the sub sound more clear and crisp than the single Era 100's. That's because the Sub mini is using the low that the Era 100's would had normally played. Great concept in sound and speakers.  I just turned the treble up a little bit more in the single Era 100 to get more highs. Sounds good. It's too bad Sonos doesn't allow for multiple Sub minis connected in the same group, it would be phenomenal. I had read somewhere that it wasn't cost effective for the consumer to buy 2 Sub minis when 1 Gen 3 Sub woofer has more output than two Sub minis. I say who cares Sonos? If a consumer wants to spend their money on a second Sub mini and put in in another room in the same speaker group it's their prerogative. If that's true then their business model doesn't make since to me. Set up was a breeze too. Because I didn't use a tutorial to set this up, it took me a few minutes to figure out how to select the speaker, because at first the single Era 100 didn't play although it was connected.  But the setup was a breeze. Very easy. I may get another Era 100 (this time used) and put it in my kitchen and I'll have sound throughout all of downstairs. I've been fortunate to not have problems with the app, unlike many others. I am very impressed and satisfied.

product_name: Sonos Era 100 - Black - Wireless, Alexa Enabled Smart Speaker
description: Sonos make well built quality sound equipment that last.  The original Sonos speaker has been given us reliable quality audio for nearly a decade of use, so it was a no brainer when we needed a second WiFi speaker we'd get another Sono's.  The new speaker was easy to connect up to our network and the phone app worked flawlessly.

product_name: Sonos Era 100 - Black - Wireless, Alexa Enabled Smart Speaker
description: These were the ending pieces to my Sonos set up. The set up with soundbar and sub is perfect. Happy to say I'm glad I went with Sonos line. All the pieces just work well together and pairing wasn't a headache.

product_name: Sonos Era 100 - Black - Wireless, Alexa Enabled Smart Speaker
description: Bought for use in bathroom in mornings and evenings, and delighted with result.  I have a gifted Sonos One in my exercise room, and portable radio in bathroom is struggling due to radio interference.  This allows me to play news stream, favorite podcasts via bluetooth or music from my favorite streaming app with excellent sound quality.  Bought at nice discount during Labor Day sale, a great value for a high quality speaker.  SONOS voice control is nice plus when I'm exercising or in the shower.

product_name: Sonos Era 100 - Black - Wireless, Alexa Enabled Smart Speaker
description: First of all, I'm admittedly an audiophile snob. So keep that in mind when reading my comments. This fit, finish, and execution of this product is excellent. The app and setup process was completely troublefree and I had the pair of these configured and playing in stereo in about 10 minutes. I really appreciate the tactile control on the top of the speakers for pause, play and volume up and down.The sound quality was a mixed bag for me. The top end is very even and without any stridency. There is a modest amount of mid range suckout. This was somewhat disappointing for me as I listen to a lot of female jazz singers. Vocal reproduction is often missing the natural timbre that you get from higher end speakers and headphones. Vocalist can sound "thin" and somewhat nasley. And then there is the bass.Once these speakers are placed properly (8-10 feet apart) and the listener is positioned to create a triangle from the speakers, the bass is somewhat shockingly good for speakers of this size. I had to turn the loudness feature off and dialed the bass down (-2) in the EQ setting. The response from the bass with these settings is still stong and punchy, and there is even a bit of texture to the sound. How Sonos is able to accomplish this with a speaker these size, I just don't understand.The convenience of the stereo pair and overall performance of the speakers make these a keeper for me despite being an audiophile. I'll probably look to add a Sonos sound bar in the future.

product_name: Sonos Era 100 - Black - Wireless, Alexa Enabled Smart Speaker
description: I listen to music for a large part of the day at home.  I have had a jam box for 8-9 yrs and thought it was the best until I got the Sonos!! The quality, the bass is just a step above the jam box!  What I don’t like about it… it is not battery operated for portability and it doesn’t stay connected to my iPhone.  So every time I use it I have to connect to my phone and who knows, that could be something I’m doing wrong. Anyway, just an extra step for me to use it which it’s so worth it in my opinion.  I highly recommend this speaker if you are a music lover!

product_name: Sonos Era 100 - Black - Wireless, Alexa Enabled Smart Speaker
description: Replaced my old port system connected to Bose speakers with stereo pair 100s, a sub mini and an era 300.  Nice sound but find the new Sonos app to be quirky.  Volume con unexpectedly increase, the app is slow on volume adjustments whereas the earlier version had no similar issues.  Apparently the new version of the app was released before a proper shakedown. Speakers are high quality.

product_name: Sonos Era 100 - Black - Wireless, Alexa Enabled Smart Speaker
description: Added an additional speaker to our home gym. Our other Sonos (same model) is hardwired and they seem to sync and play music without issue.Our home gym relies on 4 industrial fans to combat the Texas heat and Alexa is reliable 80-90% of the time which actually isn’t hateful.I have yet to have any issues with connectivity aside from Airplay.Obviously the app is garbage which is why I took off one star.

product_name: Sonos Era 100 - Black - Wireless, Alexa Enabled Smart Speaker
description: I'm a multiple Sonos speaker owner (10), I love the units. The App seems to be average thou. Buy the speaker.

product_name: Sonos Era 100 - Black - Wireless, Alexa Enabled Smart Speaker
description: Added 2 x to my existing Sonos group of speakers. Have 4 x of the original 3’s that still sound perfect.

product_name: JBL Tune 510BT: Wireless On-Ear Headphones with Purebass Sound - Black
description: overall: for the price, good headphones if you are not using them for the mic and/or calls. there’s some connection issues (but that may not happen with every pair, it may just be mine!)i bought these headphones november 2023 and as of today, august 2024, they won’t connect to my phone anymore. the audio still works and it’s a decent audio, but it definitely is not the same as it used to be. the audio was the best for the first 4-5 months of having them. now, they do not have as clear or loud of a sound and the bass is nowhere near as good. they still connect to my laptop, but i’ve tried everything possible and they will not connect to my phone anymore. ever since i got them, ive had random small issues with connections, audio, and the built in mic. i’m gonna make a list of the random things that have happened off and on ever since ive bought these headphones (just cause lists are easier!):- when in a call (specifically when watching someone screen share), the audio will randomly become extremely static and distorted and i can’t understand a single word. i have figured out no way to fix this other than waiting for it to stop.- the mic is just not good at all and never has been good. either no one can hear me or im breaking up. the only way people can hear me is if i take the headphones off and speak directly into the tiny hole where the mic is.- when i’m in a call with someone and trying to watch something in the background, the audio of the video or the music is HORRIBLE. i don’t know how to describe it other than a muffled deep fried distortion (if you know what i mean.) this is possibly normal but i’ve not experienced this with other headphones/earbuds.- the headphones occasionally will say they’re connected to my phone and/or laptop, yet they’ll actually be connected to neither. i’ll turn them on and the blue light will stay solid (indicating it’s connected) and on my laptop and phone it’ll say the headphones are connected via bluetooth, but when i go to play something, it doesn’t play through my headphones. it will either play through my devices’ speakers or play nothing at all. to fix this i turn off my bluetooth and turn off the headphones, then turn both back on and it will usually connect and play correctly- lastly, there have been a few times where i just couldn’t get my headphones to connect to anything at all. i’ve figured out that this only happens when the headphones are around 15-30% charged. on top of this, i will have to say that i feel like the battery life has diminished a LOT since i first bought them.i wanna add that ive done research and tried lots of things and troubleshooted lots to figure out if this was a device issue or headphones issue, and it is indeed a headphones issue. specifically these connection issues have never happened with any of my other bluetooth headphones or earbuds. i DO recommend these if you only need them for music or maybe streaming shows, movies, youtube. but these headphones are not the best option if you are looking for a good mic.

product_name: JBL Tune 510BT: Wireless On-Ear Headphones with Purebass Sound - Black
description: I'm not an audiophile and these headphones sound good enough for my needs. I am satisfied with this aspect of these headphones. My main complaints are:The non-stop clicking sound when there isn't any audio data being transmitted, when the headphones are idle. I say "audio data" because if I play muted or silent sound, the clicking goes away. If there hasn't been any sound within a few seconds and you do something that generate sound, there is almost a half-second of sound cut-off while the phone comes out of its idle state. This is most likely something to do with bluetooth power-saving.Speaking of power-saving, the timeout for the headphones to power off is too short for me and I keep having to turn it back on. And the duration that you have to hold the power button to turn it back on is weirdly long, sometimes 3 seconds, sometimes 5 seconds. I actually made a script to play a silent sound in the background to get rid of the clicking and to keep the headphones turned on while I'm working.Overall, decent headphones for the price if you aren't bothered by the issues I mentioned.

product_name: JBL Tune 510BT: Wireless On-Ear Headphones with Purebass Sound - Black
description: 1/  It allows a computer and a phone to be connected at the same time, but it does not know how to switch back and forth on its own.  You need to reconnect the headphones by hand pretty much after each call (Win 10 Pro Lenovo / Google meet and IPhone Max).2/  No mute button.  This is a big issue, as the microphone will pick up noise from the environment during conference calls, and you have to use the mute button on your phone or computer as there is none on the headphones.  This limits your freedom of movement as much as a wired headphones set would.3/  It turns itself off if not in use - this is a problem if you are waiting for a call or a conf call to start - by the time the call comes in, the headphones are off and you need to power them on and reconnect them before you can use them.4/  Headband a little too short (on max extension) for my head5/  Good battery life, quick recharge, as mentioned in other reviews

product_name: JBL Tune 510BT: Wireless On-Ear Headphones with Purebass Sound - Black
description: The JBL Tune 510BT headphones are a decent option for casual listening, offering that signature JBL bass-heavy sound.  They're comfortable enough for short periods and the battery life is impressive. However, the lack of noise cancellation is a significant drawback, making them unsuitable for noisy environments or important calls where background noise is an issue.  If you prioritize sound quality and long battery life over noise isolation, these could be a good fit.

product_name: JBL Tune 510BT: Wireless On-Ear Headphones with Purebass Sound - Black
description: When listening to audio (music, videos, etc.) the headset performed great. It has good, clear sound and connects easily to all of my devices. Unfortunately, in the left earpiece, whenever I wasn't playing any audio, it would begin to click incessantly with an irregular rhythm.I reached out to Harmon/JBL tech support, and they quickly replaced it, but the replacement headset had the same issue. So, I'm looking to buy a different brand instead.

product_name: JBL Tune 510BT: Wireless On-Ear Headphones with Purebass Sound - Black
description: 1. I cannot seem to answer my cell phone with these on.2. I listen to a lot of metal music; I can't seem to get the volume or eq right.3. I love how they fold flat.4. I love how the charge ports are concealed under the ear brackets.Overall they are ok, not necessarily bad. I am giving these to my son and buying my typical cheap brand.

product_name: JBL Tune 510BT: Wireless On-Ear Headphones with Purebass Sound - Black
description: It's been 6 months and they were great! Just what I needed. Just enough noise cancelling without me being too unaware of my surroundings. But now they don't work well. They show as connected to the Bluetooth but there's no sound. I have to keep disconnecting and reconnecting multiple times for it to stick and work. Disappointed.

product_name: JBL Tune 510BT: Wireless On-Ear Headphones with Purebass Sound - Black
description: Great budget headset, but after a few months it started to disconnect randomly.It's not as simple as re-connecting, as you have to go back into your BT settings, forget the device, power off then back on and pair again, and sometimes that doesn't even work.A lot of the time it's way more of a hassle than it's worth, as it pulls me away from whatever I'm doing. They're a good cheap headset but they're inconvenient. (Imagine being at the gym, or working on your computer, and you have to stop and jump through hoops to get your music/podcast back on 👎🏻)Other than that the sound quality and volume is good, the build is good, as well as battery life. I'm not a sound snob so take that as you will.

product_name: JBL Tune 510BT: Wireless On-Ear Headphones with Purebass Sound - Black
description: These sound great but there are a few things that I did not consider:1. They hurt my ears when I wear my glasses.2. They hurt my eyes due to puling my glasses.3. They feel small like made for a small child or small adult.4. The issue above are more due to people stuff. The biggest complaint would be blue-tooth drops periodically or when I pause a video on my my firestick. The video remains silent until they reconnect. Reconnection is not always consistent. Sometimes automatically, sometimes after rebooting the device. Sometimes powering off the headset for a time. Then I rewind my video.Just something to consider.Good sound but not really usable by me as the issues are frustrating. Returning.

product_name: JBL Tune 510BT: Wireless On-Ear Headphones with Purebass Sound - Black
description: The sound is pretty decent for the price, however they appear to be normal size in the pictures, but the headphones are too small. After a couple of hours, they start to hurt the outer ear because they don't fully cover the outer part.

product_name: JBL Tune 510BT: Wireless On-Ear Headphones with Purebass Sound - Black
description: The JBL Tune 510BT wireless on-ear headphones are a fantastic choice for those looking for affordable, high-quality sound. They offer crisp, balanced audio with strong bass, which is typical of JBL’s sound signature. Whether you’re listening to music, podcasts, or taking calls, the clarity is impressive for the price point.The Bluetooth connectivity is smooth, and pairing with devices is quick and easy. The battery life is a huge win, offering up to 40 hours of playtime on a single charge, which is great for long commutes or extended use. Plus, the quick charge feature gives you 2 hours of playback from just a 5-minute charge.In terms of comfort, the on-ear design is lightweight and comfortable for extended wear, although after several hours you may feel slight pressure, as is common with on-ear headphones. The controls are conveniently placed on the ear cup, making it easy to adjust volume or skip tracks without having to reach for your phone.For an affordable, wireless option with solid performance and long battery life, the JBL Tune 510BT is a great buy. Perfect for casual listeners and those on the go!

product_name: JBL Tune 510BT: Wireless On-Ear Headphones with Purebass Sound - Black
description: These are very comfortable to wear on a walk and has great bass for the price.I'm very happy with these headphones, they are completely wireless connects with Bluetooth, and the battery is rechargeable and never an issue, maybe lasts 2 weeks. They do have great bass but they sound loud to others not wearing them.

product_name: JBL Tune 510BT: Wireless On-Ear Headphones with Purebass Sound - Black
description: I am pretty impressed with these headphones. They are super comfortable on the ears. Material is soft but, sturdy. Worked out in them and they stayed in place. Sound quality is great,  nice bass. Super easy to connect to Apple phone. Very happy with this purchase could not beat the price.

product_name: JBL Tune 510BT: Wireless On-Ear Headphones with Purebass Sound - Black
description: I recently purchased the JBL Tune 510BT wireless headphones and I have to say, JBL is truly an amazing brand that never disappoints. These headphones are not only comfortable to wear for extended periods, but they are also incredibly easy to use.The sound quality of the JBL Tune 510BT headphones is exceptional, delivering crisp highs, rich mids, and deep bass that truly immerses you in your music or podcasts. The wireless connectivity is seamless, allowing me to move around freely without any tangled cords getting in the way.I love how lightweight and comfortable these headphones are, making them perfect for long listening sessions or workouts. The adjustable headband and cushioned ear cups provide a snug and secure fit, ensuring that they stay in place no matter what I'm doing.Overall, I am thoroughly impressed with the JBL Tune 510BT wireless headphones. JBL has once again proven why they are a trusted and reliable brand in the audio industry. If you're looking for headphones that deliver exceptional sound quality, comfort, and ease of use, look no further than the JBL Tune 510BT. They are a true standout in the world of wireless headphones.

product_name: JBL Tune 510BT: Wireless On-Ear Headphones with Purebass Sound - Black
description: I LOVE TJIS HEADPHONES!!! I have always had trouble with normal ear buds and getting them to stay in my tiny ears. BUT these JBL headphones for around my ears and I can adjust the length. Also they fold up so it's a little bit easier to protect the speakers.It is noise cancellating connects to my phone easy via Bluetooth so no long annoying cord. It doesn't need one of those apps you get to mess w the clarity like treble bass etc it's pretty awesome! And I also want to say I received one pair and I was first doaapp because I turned it on and the right hand side of the headphones the speaker was popped it was so bad it rang my ear drum. So I went to return it and I had issues so I talked to a customer service person and explained my situation they sent me a new pair in fast delivery kid you not it came later that day! I recommend this to anyone who wants noise cancelling clear quality and for a decent price! You will not be disappointed!!!

product_name: JBL Tune 510BT: Wireless On-Ear Headphones with Purebass Sound - Black
description: The JBL headphones I recently acquired are nothing short of a sonic revelation. From the moment I slipped them on, I was transported into a world where every note is crystal clear and every beat pulsates with life.The sound quality is exceptional, with rich bass that doesn’t overwhelm the mids and highs, creating a perfectly balanced audio experience. Whether I’m diving into my favorite playlists or immersing myself in a gripping podcast, the clarity is simply unparalleled.Comfort is another standout feature. The plush ear cups and lightweight design allow for hours of wear without any discomfort, making them perfect for long commutes or extended listening sessions. Plus, the battery life is remarkable; I’ve gone days without needing to recharge.The sleek design and premium materials elevate the overall aesthetic, making them as stylish as they are functional. Whether I’m at the gym, on a flight, or just lounging at home, these headphones have become my go-to audio companion.In short, the JBL headphones deliver an extraordinary listening experience that’s hard to match. They redefine what it means to enjoy music, and I can’t recommend them enough for anyone seeking audio excellence.

product_name: JBL Tune 510BT: Wireless On-Ear Headphones with Purebass Sound - Black
description: I love this headset. Can't go wrong spending 40 usd. I have another headset that requires charging after 1 to 2 hours.I spent a total of 8 hours in the airport playing music and no issues. Didnt need to charge, even when I reached to the hotel.Value for money, clear sound,  no issues with bluetooth connectivity between my samsung and iphone. Appears to be ofgreat quality.

product_name: JBL Tune 510BT: Wireless On-Ear Headphones with Purebass Sound - Black
description: the battery on these is literally crazy. i’ve had them for months, use them at least 3 times a week for over an hour and i’ve only had to charge them 3 times. two of those times being on a road trip for 10 hours. they also charge fully in under an hour. connecting to bluetooth is so easy, the volume buttons work perfectly. the sound is amazing. you could have it loud if you want them to be & not hear anything around you. or you turn them down & still hear crystal clear while also being aware of your surroundings. i got these on sale for about $30 i believe and even if i spent $100 on them, it would still be worth the money.

product_name: JBL Tune 510BT: Wireless On-Ear Headphones with Purebass Sound - Black
description: I got these yesterday, on sale for $28 or so. I wanted something to use while doing work/chores/phone calls. I’ve been using Bluetooth Skullcandy in ear headphones, but they annoy my ears after wearing a long time, or daily. Also, no one can tell you have headphones in, so I wanted something OBVIOUS. People tend to leave you alone then!! :)Summary at bottom if you don’t want to read my words!First out of the box, I charged 5 minutes and tried them. Initially, I was impressed, bass was good, sound was pretty clear. I listen to a lot of metal, and I’m very particular in what I am able to hear. All around it seemed pretty good! Could be better in some areas, but again I’m trying to keep in mind they were 30 bucks.CONSAfter wearing for the rest of the day to test it out, some things came up. The louder you turn it up, the more flat or muddy/messy the sound gets. Bass in general seems to wash out a bit? I want to hear my drums, man! And one does not *quietly* listen to metal music. Not possible!It will NOT cover the noise of weedwacker/mower, but I wasn’t fully expecting them too. I’d say it cut half the sound out. Also it seems to pick up sound? My in ears have a “stay aware”option, where it plays the ambient noise while wearing. While this isn’t equipped with that, it sure seems to let certain noises through loudly. It’s odd. Like my dog barking, I can hear that almost clear as day. Might just be me?PROSPhone calls? Perfect. I can hear other person clearly, they can hear me clearly. Have no issues with that area at all.Super comfy, no ear discomfort at all.Battery kicks assLight weightButtons are nice, not too close together to fat finger the wrong one.So I’m mixed, I know it’s a lower end headset but was hoping to keep true sound, and bass, the louder it got. Love the phone calls and comfort, battery is great. If you’re looking for a starter, or for kids, these are great! Or just something to make calls with, this is fantastic.

product_name: JBL Tune 510BT: Wireless On-Ear Headphones with Purebass Sound - Black
