description: The sound quality is absolutely amazing. Very clear and has a lot of bass. The battery life on these are just flawless. I can listen to music for hours upon hours and the battery doesn’t budge much. To give reference, I can listen to music for most of the day for a few days before I will need to charge it. Easy to connect by Bluetooth. Volume control and pause buttons are on the right ear side. You can skip and go back between songs by holding the volume up and down buttons as well. The ear cushions are soft and durable.

product_name: Surge Protector Power Strip - 8 Outlets with 4 USB (2 USB C) Charging Ports, Multi Plug Outlet Extender, 5Ft Braided Extension Cord, Flat Plug Wall Mount Desk USB Charging Station for Home Office ETL
description: Seems safe, and haven’t had any real issues with it. Only problem is that my devices charge really slow when connected to here. I wouldn’t buy it again. This is probably fine for older devices.I wouldn’t get it again for my devices that need to charge. I’m going to look for another brand that has real fast charging watt output. But for things that just need to plug in like lights, fans, tv, Alexa, etc. this would be fine and seems safe. No overheating or catching fire or going out randomly.

Suddenly it was back to normal. The culprit, out of all the multiplugs I use around the house, was this one. When it trips it causes a reversed polarity in the whole circuit. It went back to normal when I reset it and works but now I don't trust it.

product_name: Surge Protector Power Strip - 8 Outlets with 4 USB (2 USB C) Charging Ports, Multi Plug Outlet Extender, 5Ft Braided Extension Cord, Flat Plug Wall Mount Desk USB Charging Station for Home Office ETL
description: Are you tired of juggling multiple chargers and battling with tangled cords? Meet the Surge Protector Power Strip—the all-in-one solution to your power needs! With its 8 outlets and 4 USB ports (including 2 USB-C), this power strip is designed to keep your devices juiced up and protected, all while making your life a bit easier. Here’s why this power strip should be your next home or office essential:12-in-1 Power Strip: A Plug for Every NeedWhy settle for a regular power strip when you can have a 12-in-1 powerhouse? With 8 AC outlets and 4 USB ports (2 USB-C), this surge protector lets you power up to 12 devices simultaneously. The innovative 3-side design ensures that each outlet is spaced out with 2.2 inches of clearance between them. Say goodbye to that frustrating game of “which plug to unplug next?”—even your bulky adapters fit without blocking other sockets.2 USB-C Ports for Lightning-Fast ChargingTired of slow charging? The two USB-C ports on this strip deliver up to 5V/3A, perfect for quickly powering up your iPhone, iPad, or any USB-C device. And if you have other gadgets that use USB-A, don’t worry—the USB-A ports offer up to 5V/2.4A Max, making your charging 30% faster than standard USB hubs. With smart charging technology, your devices get the juice they need as quickly as possible.Robust Overload Surge ProtectionKeep your precious electronics safe with the surge protector’s 1080 Joules energy-absorbing capacity. Whether it's lightning strikes or sudden power surges, this strip has your back. The built-in lighted on/off switch and integrated circuit breaker offer added security, making sure you’re always aware of your protection status. The “Surge Protected” indicator light will glow reassuringly, showing that your devices are shielded from harm.Space-Saving Wall-Mountable DesignLimited outlet space? No problem! The flat plug design fits snugly in tight spaces and won’t block other outlets. Plus, the 5ft braided extension cord is both thick and durable, ensuring a reliable power flow. With two mounting holes on the back, this power strip can be easily installed on walls or desks, keeping your workspace tidy and organized.Comprehensive Multi-Safety ProtectionSafety first! This power strip isn’t just about delivering power; it’s also about protecting your devices. Equipped with overload protection, short-circuit protection, over-current protection, over-voltage protection, and overheating protection, it’s designed to automatically cut off power if things get too hot to handle. The environmentally friendly, flame-resistant PC shell can withstand temperatures up to 1382℉, ensuring durability and a long service life.Final VerdictThe Surge Protector Power Strip is more than just a power source; it’s a complete solution for all your charging and protection needs. With its generous number of outlets and USB ports, fast charging capabilities, and top-notch safety features, it’s the perfect addition to any home, office, or dorm room. Upgrade your power setup today and enjoy the convenience and peace of mind that comes with top-tier protection and performance. Plug in and power up with confidence!

description: This little doodad was a pleasant surprise. It is quite entertaining to me how small things can have a big impact. This is simply one of those items.FIirst I would like to draw your attention to the cord itself. See how neat and rolled up it is? Yeah, you know the power strip with the thick and hardly bendable cord that resides under your desk is?Oh yeah, we are starting to get into braided styled cords on surge protectors.I know many could care less, a lot of surge protectors are usually hidden under or beneath something. But, let us ponder for a moment. TV hanging on the wall, fire TV connected to it, a DVD player for some old random reason, that's 3 chords. Now we have 3 chords traveling down a wall to a surge protector. Looks so good doesn't it? Not at all!Put this little guy right behind the TV, all cables follow 1 line right to this. 1 braided style cord goes down to your socket. Now we are looking organized. Hmm, I think I want to add a sound bar, oh look I still have more plug-ins available. I can even plug it straight to the side so it doesn't look all bulky.I give you simple items that make bigger impacts then what they are. I even use 1 of these on top of a dresser and it still looks sleek by using all the side connection. It actually kind of looks like a puzzle.Everything works no problems at all. product_name: Dragon Touch 10.1'' WIFI Digital Picture Frame - 1280*800 HD IPS Touch Screen Digital Photo Frame Display, Auto-Rotate, Share Photos/Videos Instantly via Free App Best Gifts for Birthday, Wedding, Mom
description: I bought two of these frames for $129 each, and ended up with two expensive paper weights and hours of frustration.I'll start off with my specific use case for these frames, because maybe I'm expecting too much. All I wanted was the ability to randomly display family photos. I have a lot of them (like 2,000), so I kept them stored on a USB disk. The plan was to plug in the USB disk to the frame and have it randomly select the photos from the disk.That plan didn't work, because the frame would periodically stop reading the disk. Sometimes after unplugging the disk and plugging it back it I would recognize the drive again, but eventually it stopped reading the drive altogether. To the company's credit, they did respond to my customer service email request and suggested a factory reset. Multiple factory resets solved the continued problems for a while, but eventually that stopped working too and the frame quit recognizing USB drives entirely. I tried different drives with only a few photos on them, and that didn't work either. Finally the company sent me a replacement frame, which solved the problem...for about 3 months. Then the new frame had the same problem. Wash, rinse, repeat with the factory resets.Eventually I was advised to stop trying the USB route and instead load all the photos directly onto the frame. Apparently it didn't have enough memory to hold all of my photos, nor is the software smart enough to prevent someone from trying to load too many, because when I tried to transfer them over the new frame seized up and never booted up again. At that point the company sent me yet another frame. This time I loaded the files I wanted individually (which took hours of effort) and things seemed to settle down for a while.Then the random screen saver problems started. Apparently the frame has a screen saver function that cannot be adjusted in the menus and it randomly starts coming on. I should add that the screen saver turns on after less than 1 minute of operation, where the frame just goes dark. You have to push the power button to get the frame to come back to life, but it just goes dark a minute later. Once it starts doing this, the only option is a factory reset where you then have to reload all of your photos from scratch. No thanks, the frame goes in the trash at this point.So what else do I hate about this frame beyond the fact it stops working all the time, can't read USB drives, and has a screen saver that basically precludes it displaying photos? Well, the wifi receiver range is terrible. I measured both frames at about 5 feet from my router before they couldn't detect the signal, so if you plan to email photos to your frame, it had better be located right next to your router.Also, the random photo feature is far from random - as I mentioned above, I have a few thousand photos and typically see the same 100 or so each day when I turn it on. Of course, once the screen saver problem starts up again, I see maybe 5 pictures in a day before I just turn the stupid thing off.Finally, I can't stand that the frame has to be connected to wifi in order to factory reset it. I have a frame in my office at work, and our workplace IT policy wouldn't permit this device from being connected to our work wifi (with very good cause I'm certain). So each time it craters, I have to drag it back home, get it connected to my home wifi, reset it, and then spend hours loading all the pictures back on the frame to get about 3 months of use before the stupid screen saver problem randomly starts up again.I should note that the company did try to help me on multiple occasions after I wrote a previous poor review. They sent me two new frames, but as I mentioned above, both of them also failed. Finally they asked me to send back one of the frames that had completely seized up (couldn't power it on), at which point I agreed to delete my old review because they had been so helpful. I never heard from them again once the review was deleted, and never got the frame I sent back replaced. Frankly I don't care, it's more trouble than it's worth to try to set up another one just to have it fail.In conclusion, this frame is terrible and it has stolen many hours of my life for which I paid $260 (for two frames) for the privilege. Hopefully this review will help someone out there avoid the same fate. Pick a different brand of frame...any frame but this one. I can't imagine you could do worse with another brand.

product_name: Dragon Touch 10.1'' WIFI Digital Picture Frame - 1280*800 HD IPS Touch Screen Digital Photo Frame Display, Auto-Rotate, Share Photos/Videos Instantly via Free App Best Gifts for Birthday, Wedding, Mom
description: I wanted a large screen frame to display our years of photos languishing on my PC.  The Dragontouch 15 seemed like the right frame but it isn’t.  The screen size is big but the software is not smart enough to display both horizontal and vertical pictures properly in full screen mode (the way every PC or Smart TV does)  Additionally downloading photos to it results in really poor resolution, USB stick gives the best image.After spending several hours trying a multitude of options here is what I learned.1. The frame plays .HEIC files, from iPhone (good) but vertical pictures ALWAYS show horizontally reguardless of how rotated on the PC (bad).2. File format must be in .JPG if you want to show vertical files vertical on the frame. It takes time to cover every vertical photo JPG. :(3. If full screen mode is selected.Horizontal Photos - the full screen space is taken up horizontally with a horizontal photo in HEIC or JPG format, as expected.Vertical photos - HEIC vertical photos show horizontally and take up the full horizontal screen, not desired unless you like to tilt your head all the time. A vertical JPG photo will be cropped top and bottom as the photo is zoomed in by the frame until the width of the photo is full frame.4. Full Screen NOT selected. This is the only setting to get a vertical photo displayed vertically without cropping and zooming  An unused, blurred area is on both left & right sides if any picture. The larger 15” frame size is effectively reduced and a smaller picture rendered.Horizontal photos - photo is smaller in HEIC and JPG with blurred bars right and left.Vertical - JPG photo will show full height with blurred areas right and left. This is Theo not way to show a vertical picture vertically but at the expense of smaller horizontal photos.With a bit more effort in writing the software I’m sure this issue could be addressed as it is on smart TVs and PCs,  but nope, didn’t happen. Yes, I’m running the latest version of software 1.1.43. After figuring this out, sadly my return period is expired.If all your photos are exclusively vertical or horizontal, this frame is for you. If you have a mix of vertical/horizontal like 99.9% of people, look elsewhere if getting a full screen image on a more expensive large screen device is important to you.DragonTouch developers - open to solutions to fix this issue. Please fix this issue and send out an updated software push!Finally, the screen surface is plastic and not glass, so go easy on it when cleaning to prevent scratching. While it is a touch screen, using the remote is quicker and eliminates the need to clean the screen and potential to scratch it.

product_name: Dragon Touch 10.1'' WIFI Digital Picture Frame - 1280*800 HD IPS Touch Screen Digital Photo Frame Display, Auto-Rotate, Share Photos/Videos Instantly via Free App Best Gifts for Birthday, Wedding, Mom
description: Love the look of the frame, nice, elegant, yet still casual enough for anywhere. I really wanted to love this since I read all of the reviews on similar products and thought this one would be easiest to use. I bought this for my parents who are in their 90's. I set it up per the instructions and sent the registration info to all of the relatives. Worked great, as many of them were sending photos and once they were accepted on the frame, their pictures started showing up in the slide show. I was a happy camper!  Gave the frame to my parents for Christmas and thought - "I'm done". They'll get updated pictures and can keep up with the family. Well, I was wrong. I went over for New Year's and saw that the frame was display a white screen. It had happened a couple of days after I had set it on their table and they didn't know what to do. It was unresponsive, so I power cycled it. It started working again - Good news.  I asked them to call me if it happened again. It did, power cycled, and froze again. Emailed the mfg, they said they would replace it, which they did. Great! I think. Got the new one in week - great customer service. Find out I have to register this frame - no way to transfer the data, so had to get all of the relatives to register their emails again.  Happy to get the replacement working.  Update May - the replacement freezes with a black screen now, not white. Still have to power cycle to get it to work. It lasts for a day or two and freezes again.  The re-registration process was such a pain to get the relatives to resend all of the pictures, that I've decided not to replace it. - Oh and btw, I did check the settings to make sure it isn't set to go to sleep or anything like that. In fact it froze within 5 minutes of being power cycled one time. It's random and you don't know how long it will last before freezing. I'm really frustrated with the product, but it's the only one I found that didn't require me to have a subscription and came with enough storage to hold a lot of pictures.

product_name: Dragon Touch 10.1'' WIFI Digital Picture Frame - 1280*800 HD IPS Touch Screen Digital Photo Frame Display, Auto-Rotate, Share Photos/Videos Instantly via Free App Best Gifts for Birthday, Wedding, Mom

description: Updated review:The frame will better handle your pictures if you simply fix the orientation using Windows Paint and forget about orientation metadata. Just changing the orientation in a picture viewer won't really change anything, Windows or your phone will simply "remember it" in the cache, but won't actually modify the picture itself. Windows Paint on the other side, will rotate the picture itself, that was the final solution for me with this Frame, and probably many others frames out there.Now I'm finally enjoying the frame properly, it gives you the option to turn off the screen at specific periods of time which saves some energy.1st review:This is a good digital frame in the sense that it does what it is expected, display pictures one by one, and use some effects for the transitions.The main problem it has is that it won't rotate the pictures correctly, some pictures will be displayed upside down, while pictures that are taken vertically with your phone are displayed horizontally.Some people may think this is expected, but pictures actually have metadata in them to help applications display the picture correctly, with the correct orientation, so that if it has to be rotated 90 or 180 degrees, the application will do it.All my pictures look perfect in the computer using any picture application, because all these applications know how to use the metadata, but the frame does not. They do have a manual rotation button, but as soon the frame us turned off, the settings are all reset and the pictures are all displayed with the wrong orientation again.I've been waiting for a firmware update for a long time, years, but the issue is still there (Jan 2023).

product_name: Dragon Touch 10.1'' WIFI Digital Picture Frame - 1280*800 HD IPS Touch Screen Digital Photo Frame Display, Auto-Rotate, Share Photos/Videos Instantly via Free App Best Gifts for Birthday, Wedding, Mom
description: I am a tech savvy millennial buying this for my less tech savvy boomer parents.  If you're like me, you the perfect digital picture frame will:> Allow you to be set this thing up and walk away from it, confident it will work without further intervention.> Make it easy for family members to contribute photos to the frame.The achilles heel of this frame is that it struggles on these points.  For one, there's a little-advertised limit to the amount of data that you can transmit to the frame.  I'm not talking about the internal storage space on the device, that's obviously limited.  I'm talking about using the 'OurPhoto' App to send pictures.  Purchasing the frame gives you 10 Gb of complimentary 'traffic data'. That means after sending 10Gb worth of information to the frame, you're going to have to pony up at least $10 for an additional 10Gb.  10Gb is realistically about 2,000 photos of sufficient quality to actually enjoy looking at on the frame.  If you have maybe a few family members contributing to the frame you will hit your limit and you will need to buy more storage.  Kind of a bummer.  Wish I had known.  Now you do.On the second point, one feature that made me want to go with this frame was the ability to set up a unique email address for the frame and simply send photos to that email address.  That way you don't need a stupid app on your phone (by the way, the OurPhoto app is not well designed), you and your parents' boomer friends can just fire off emails and the pictures will show up.  But in my two weeks of setting up and fiddling with this frame, I've only gotten one email to actually make it all the way to the frame.  I called tech support on this and they walked me through their script (of course the call center you get isn't actually the company that made the device, it's an outsourced call center who can do little more than read you the troubleshooting pages from the manual).  None of their tricks worked.  Why? Likely (I'm making a guess here) because Dragon Touch is having network/server issues in China and for reasons I can't control that feature is just not working now (12/7/2020).  Maybe a rush of holiday purchases have overloaded their capacity.  Probably they'll get this straightened out some day down the road but for now that method is not working and I can't do a thing about it (except write this honest review and contemplate a return).If you don't care about getting bilked for more money to send photos to YOUR frame, and you trust that they'll fix the email issues eventually, this frame isn't terrible.  It's got a decent enough screen and I like the frame and mat board appearance instead of the tablet-on-a-kickstand appearance of other photo frames.  The frame feels plasticky and cheaper than it costs, though.  Also a remote would be nice so you don't smudge up the glass all the time.

product_name: Dragon Touch 10.1'' WIFI Digital Picture Frame - 1280*800 HD IPS Touch Screen Digital Photo Frame Display, Auto-Rotate, Share Photos/Videos Instantly via Free App Best Gifts for Birthday, Wedding, Mom
description: You get the product that was advertised, but you cannot guarantee its the same software/app used on each picture frame.The first frame I bought used an app called VPhoto.  It allows the app user to pair with the frame, but to be able to use the email feature on the frame, you need to manually input the sender's email onto the frame itself.  This is only an annoyance if you plan on giving this frame to someone who doe not understand technology.The second frame I bought (from this same seller) used an app called OurPhoto.  This app has you send a connection request to the frame and connect a unique email to the frame at the same time.  You need to approve of the user connection on the frame itself to be able to send photos through the app or the created email.Both need the user to either add the email or approve the app user in the frame itself.  The main annoyance is now having to use two different apps, so if you're buying multiple frames for different people, keep that in mind.Otherwise both frames provided the functionality specified.Update to my review.The frame that uses the OurPhoto app is disappointing.  You still need to use the app to register a new email address for people to add photos with.  I couldn't get the email address function working.  The reason I wanted the email address function was for family member to add photos that are not tech savvy.  Since you cannot guarantee that you will get the Vphoto version (that works how I wanted it too), I cannot recommend this frame.

product_name: Dragon Touch 10.1'' WIFI Digital Picture Frame - 1280*800 HD IPS Touch Screen Digital Photo Frame Display, Auto-Rotate, Share Photos/Videos Instantly via Free App Best Gifts for Birthday, Wedding, Mom
description: This frame is awesome in so many ways.  The picture viewing quality in my opinion is equal to viewing pics on my Ipad which is really good.  The flexibility and the ease of use with the phone apps is what makes this best in class.  The app "Vphoto" is easy to use and starting using instantly.  The frame is paired with a code through manual entry or GR code.  You do not have to be physically at the frame to get this pairing accomplished.  You can also send videos to the frame for viewing.This will make a great gift for Grandparents that are not tech savvy.  When an authorized user sends photos to the frame, it has an audible bell to let the viewers know there is new content.  Can you imagine the excitement of getting family photos from a special event or vacation in real time without interacting with the device (frame).  You can have an unlimited number of authorized users sending content to the frame.  The users can also control when to revoke or release the photos that have been sent to the frame to allow the slideshow to be for new content only.  The owner of the frame can also delete pictures at their discretion by touching the screen.  The settings of the frame can be accessed by touch screen and don't require another device to operate it.You can orient in landscape or portrait mode by simply turning the frame.  No settings need to be adjusted.  In both orientations, the frame automatically will size the picture to auto fit.We have found it to be a fun way to view pictures around our house that were limited to just the phone at times.  It is a great way to reflect on past pictures.This is a well designed product and the unit displays well in your home.This unit will also play videos & music if you uploaded to the unit.  The quality of the video is also very good.

product_name: Dragon Touch 10.1'' WIFI Digital Picture Frame - 1280*800 HD IPS Touch Screen Digital Photo Frame Display, Auto-Rotate, Share Photos/Videos Instantly via Free App Best Gifts for Birthday, Wedding, Mom
description: I bought this to replace a digital picture frame that had stopped working. There are lots of things I really like about this device. First, it has a touch screen, which make it far easier to use than my previous one that just had a few buttons. Second it connects to Wifi (2.4GHz which is 802.11b/g, so no issue for me). This means I don't have to keep moving a USB drive or SDcard back and forth. You can also email photos to the frame, which would allow you to send photos to a remote relative with the device.It was very easy to add the device to my Wifi network. I was pretty excited about the fact that it came with an app. I don't like reading manuals, but I wasn't able to get the app working without reading the manual. The instructions are pretty clear in the manual- you have to look in the settings to find the device ID, but the screen seemed to be showing me a device ID in explaining what to do, so I used that a few times unsuccessfully. It would have been better if this screen didn't show me an ID.There are several things which prevent me from giving this 5 stars:First, using the app to upload photos counts against a 10GB quota. Once you use that, you have to buy more data at $10/10GB. (Looking at my latest photo, this does mean I could upload about 3000 photos before I hit my data limit, but I'm sure videos would eat that up quickly). Since my app is on the same Wifi as the frame, I'd prefer it to interact directly with the frame. This means that I might end up using the FTP interface, which feels pretty ancient for 2021 (and the manual says it only works for Windows, but I can't understand why that would be true, but I have a Windows machine so I didn't test others). I was able to upload a photo using FTP easily.Second, it can only handle SDcards up to 32GB.Third, I have to use the touch screen to delete photos. I can't delete them using the app, or the FTP interface.Overall, it is a nice device and we really like having a slideshow of family photos being displayed.

product_name: Kasa Indoor Pan/Tilt Smart Security Camera, 1080p HD Dog-Camera,2.4GHz with Night Vision,Motion Detection for Baby and Pet Monitor, Cloud & SD Card Storage, Works with Alexa& Google Home (EC70), White
description: I bought two of these to keep tabs on my kitten and house while I travel. There are good and poor "features" as well as inconsistencies between the two.TLDR: For the price and fact that there is no subscription fee to use remotely, they are a decent purchase. I would buy them again.The long of it:The good:Great little design, quiet motor, reasonable coverage, good signal and response.The Poor:One of the two cameras tends to have a meltdown if used for too long and will disconnect from wifi. At this point you have to be there in person to reset via unplugging the unit and plugging it back in. I've tried firmware updates and resetting the unit back to factory settings to no avail. It doesn't overheat as often on low resolution, so I keep it on the 360p until notified and I want to see the scene, when I raise the rate to full 1080 (and reduce back down when I leave). I also keep it close to the router, for now this seems to have stopped the disconnect issue. I'm weary to leave it on for long periods of time unattended.Even when the camera is shut down (privacy mode) the unit is still cranking out data and heating up. This usage should be minimized, just enough to keep a connection and receive signal to turn back on.There is no volume setting for the speaker on the unit itself, I've found from my iphone, speaking softly from the phone at 18 inches away the camera blasts my voice and scares off my kitten. Seems to be no point in having a speaker on the unit at all. This applies to both units I purchased. Seeking resolution it looks like Kasa updated the firmware in 2021 to raise the volume of the speaker for galaxy users who had the opposite problem. So they fixed one issue, caused another.Wants:Fix the speaker volume issue.Fix the overheating issue and reduce the wifi usage when in privacy mode.Allow more personalization modifications within the app software.Upgrade app software so our shortcuts have nicknames on them.Allow access to different view shortcuts from widescreen mode

product_name: Kasa Indoor Pan/Tilt Smart Security Camera, 1080p HD Dog-Camera,2.4GHz with Night Vision,Motion Detection for Baby and Pet Monitor, Cloud & SD Card Storage, Works with Alexa& Google Home (EC70), White
description: I’m a really big Kasa fan, and I’m pretty integrated in the system at this point. I had previously been using some off brand pan/tilt pet cameras, but I wanted to be able to manage all of my smart devices within the Kasa app.I purchased 2 of these, and while on the outside they look the same as my existing ones, and based on the camera should have been the same, but I was sadly mistaken.The video quality of these Kasa cameras is not good. It’s pretty fuzzy regardless of where I place them, despite having strong WiFi connection. If that was all, then I could live with it. But the control of them is terrible. When I go into the app, and use the on screen joystick, it’s awful. I drag left, they go right, if I drag right and up, they go down. Sometimes they go where I tell them to which confirms they’re not on some inverted setting. And I made sure when setting them up to specify I was not hanging them upside down.I’ve since moved back to my “no name” cameras because they’re quick, responsive, clear and easy to control. I still love Kasa for all my smart bulb and plugs, but this just isn’t it.

product_name: Kasa Indoor Pan/Tilt Smart Security Camera, 1080p HD Dog-Camera,2.4GHz with Night Vision,Motion Detection for Baby and Pet Monitor, Cloud & SD Card Storage, Works with Alexa& Google Home (EC70), White
description: We bought this to replace a broken Nooie camera. Our goals were to use this as our baby monitor camera and be able to watch the feed on a Google nest.All of that worked great - what didn't was both of us using the camera. There is no way to share the camera in the app, so you have to share out your entire user account. Since we are not fans of that security practice, I will be returning this and trying a wyze camera instead.

product_name: Kasa Indoor Pan/Tilt Smart Security Camera, 1080p HD Dog-Camera,2.4GHz with Night Vision,Motion Detection for Baby and Pet Monitor, Cloud & SD Card Storage, Works with Alexa& Google Home (EC70), White

Went to move it to a different location and when I went to plug it back in the Micro B port broke off inside the camera. You can hear it rattle around inside of you shake it too. For the price, what do you expect?

product_name: Kasa Indoor Pan/Tilt Smart Security Camera, 1080p HD Dog-Camera,2.4GHz with Night Vision,Motion Detection for Baby and Pet Monitor, Cloud & SD Card Storage, Works with Alexa& Google Home (EC70), White
description: I've had this now for about a week. I bought it to check in on my new puppy while I'm at work. I'm rating it a 3 because I'll admit, the picture quality is far better than I imagined. I was floored when I saw how good the night vision is! Excellent picture all around .... When it works, that is.I haven't had a second to purchase an SD card, so perhaps the experience will improve once I get that far. As for now, I turn it on before I leave in the morning and turn it off when I get home (the constant notifications drive me crazy with the puppy running around in front of it and I'm not quite sure i want to see a 👻 when I'm in bed lol). But I've found, it glitches A LOT. I have a 20 minute commute and by the time I get to work, it's already cut off. I'm often having to turn it back on. It's rare that I can get the live feed. I'm constantly having to get out of the app and back in again to hopefully force it to work - sometimes it does, sometimes it doesn't. My internet connection is always incredibly good so I don't think it's that, as is my mobile data (IDK if one has anything to do with the other 🤷🏻‍♀️).It's actually a good camera and easy to use. So I'm going to try the SD card and it that doesn't work, I will buy something different.

product_name: Kasa Indoor Pan/Tilt Smart Security Camera, 1080p HD Dog-Camera,2.4GHz with Night Vision,Motion Detection for Baby and Pet Monitor, Cloud & SD Card Storage, Works with Alexa& Google Home (EC70), White
description: This product is carefully setup so that to really use it as you want to, which is triggering recording by motion sense, you have to pay $3 per month per each camera.  Other than that it works pretty good.  I gave it 3 starts because I think they are purposely deceptive by omission.

product_name: Kasa Indoor Pan/Tilt Smart Security Camera, 1080p HD Dog-Camera,2.4GHz with Night Vision,Motion Detection for Baby and Pet Monitor, Cloud & SD Card Storage, Works with Alexa& Google Home (EC70), White
description: I can't tell how the camera works because I cannot link it to my existing account. Unfortunately, my old Kasa broke (after two years). I decided to purchase the pan/tilt for a better experience (hopefully longer). I have not had success replacing it on my already paid for subscription of Kasa Care. They are asking for me to pay more money to add it when I've paid up until March of next year. Customer service is only through email and given the number of misspellings, I think it is AI. I have not been able to speak or chat with a live person as it always refers me back to email. I will not purchase from them again.*Update: I was contacted by customer service and the issue was resolved for one of my cameras. It still was a difficult process, but I am satisfied with the response.

product_name: Kasa Indoor Pan/Tilt Smart Security Camera, 1080p HD Dog-Camera,2.4GHz with Night Vision,Motion Detection for Baby and Pet Monitor, Cloud & SD Card Storage, Works with Alexa& Google Home (EC70), White
description: This camera is listed as having color night vision. It does not..... It does have night vision, but it's only black and white. I already had a night vision camera, but wanted one with color. Guess I'll have to keep looking, this one is going back.

product_name: Kasa Indoor Pan/Tilt Smart Security Camera, 1080p HD Dog-Camera,2.4GHz with Night Vision,Motion Detection for Baby and Pet Monitor, Cloud & SD Card Storage, Works with Alexa& Google Home (EC70), White
description: I gave it 3 stars because it did work very well for us for the first year we’ve had it. Picture is great and was perfect for checking up on our pets when we were out(picture added is fully zoomed in). Today was one of the first times I’ve unplugged it since we got it and unfortunately the power port where the charger goes in snapped right off on the inside. I am now also past the point where I can return it :( If you’re looking for long term durability I’d watch out for this, other than that it is a good budget option.

product_name: Kasa Indoor Pan/Tilt Smart Security Camera, 1080p HD Dog-Camera,2.4GHz with Night Vision,Motion Detection for Baby and Pet Monitor, Cloud & SD Card Storage, Works with Alexa& Google Home (EC70), White
description: I bought this on 5-9-22 and by 6-16 it had stopped working as well. The monthly subscription plan was impossible to find. At one point I got an message in the kasa app about how I can be notified by email when my kasa is turned off daily, but despite it being a good idea I waited, and when I couldn't find the option, kasa customer service in taiwan denied any and all involvement with such a message or feature.On 6-16, a month in, the kasa camera developed an over 60 second delay between the cell phone video shown and the actual direction the camera was pointed. In the same day, my blink mini read 'backup failed for 'MTWTrF'.Almost every time, when arriving home, turning off the kasa camera that had detected my motion and that was pointed at me correctly, took minutes. The app is slow, and the off button takes more than a few presses for camera to turn off. In actually checking the feed, to see if there was any recorded motion while away, the camera often took another minute to load that specific window.The app sort of makes sense, and for $29, and no monthly cost for the camera to operate, its ok. But getting the video off it is harder, while the monthly subscription is hard to find.In signing up for the subscription, $3 is missing from my account monthly, but there isn't a registered transaction that I can find. This implies I have to work with their tech support or replace the initial pan tilt.///More than a year later, the kasa pan tilt still works, but I worry of increases in small problems from a better review. What stands out is the app, and related gadgets. The app itself looks really smart, from scheduled on and off patterns. The kasa pan tilt goes well with kasa light strips, and there are a ton of scheduled features possible that integrate the camera with lights.But, despite the app being quite smart, and well integrated with other devices that similarly work, the pan tilt app could use a lot more smart features in the app. There could be a more complex schedule, so that the pan tilt could turn on at approximately 9 am, and switch to a different area of the room every 10 minutes, with changes in camera direction happening at controllable increments.As it is, its possible to schedule turn on the camera, so it reacts to and tracks motion, and put it in a patrol mode, but its not possible to auto schedule a shifting array. Its not possible to tune the camera so it tracks and follow motion between 9 am and 5 pm, but turn off the track and follow feature once I am likely to get in. Nor it it possible to schedule the camera to patrol the room once an hour, to save the motor.

product_name: Kasa Indoor Pan/Tilt Smart Security Camera, 1080p HD Dog-Camera,2.4GHz with Night Vision,Motion Detection for Baby and Pet Monitor, Cloud & SD Card Storage, Works with Alexa& Google Home (EC70), White
description: Really enjoying this camera so far. Purchased to keep an eye on my sulcata tortoise who has gotten too big to live inside. The quality of the camera is much better than our old one and I really enjoy that it’s adjustable so you can easily adjust the angle if needed. Installation was easy and app download was quick. Overall great price!

product_name: Kasa Indoor Pan/Tilt Smart Security Camera, 1080p HD Dog-Camera,2.4GHz with Night Vision,Motion Detection for Baby and Pet Monitor, Cloud & SD Card Storage, Works with Alexa& Google Home (EC70), White
description: We are using this as a baby monitor, because I like the security features — it requires access to the app to view the camera feed, and if someone tries to log in I get a notification to my phone, and it has the 2 step verification so it’s not easy to hack into. It works extremely well for this purpose, and is very easy to set up and use. The motion detection and noise/sound detection works very well, if baby wakes up and is moving around or crying I get a notification within seconds. The video quality is clear and I love that it basically has “night vision” so even in a dark nursery I can clearly see everything. Being able to control the camera view and adjust the angle via app is an amazing feature so I don’t have to tiptoe in, move it manually and risk waking baby. I also love that it records 24/7 so in the morning I can watch and see how well baby slept (or didn’t sleep!)Overall, I absolutely love this camera and will be purchasing 2 more to keep an eye on the dog while I’m out of the house. I absolutely recommend it and for the price point, I’m amazed at the quality and features offered. This is exactly what I wanted and needed. Thanks again Kasa!

product_name: Kasa Indoor Pan/Tilt Smart Security Camera, 1080p HD Dog-Camera,2.4GHz with Night Vision,Motion Detection for Baby and Pet Monitor, Cloud & SD Card Storage, Works with Alexa& Google Home (EC70), White
description: The Kasa Indoor Pan/Tilt Camera offers clear 1080p video and reliable motion detection, making it perfect for monitoring pets or home security. The pan/tilt feature covers a wide area, and the night vision works well. Setup is easy, and it integrates smoothly with Alexa. The camera uses 2.4 GHz Wi-Fi, which may be a drawback for some, but overall it's an excellent value for its features.

product_name: Kasa Indoor Pan/Tilt Smart Security Camera, 1080p HD Dog-Camera,2.4GHz with Night Vision,Motion Detection for Baby and Pet Monitor, Cloud & SD Card Storage, Works with Alexa& Google Home (EC70), White
description: We recently hired a new petsitter. First time a stranger is used w/our pets. I wanted to scrutinize her behavior w/pets & time of arrival needed 2x daily. The audio in this isnt that great but frankly the video is pretty decent. I told my bestie about it, shes got 2 cats as well. (I always wanted one really to see just what our younger & freshest was up to.) it definitely was a great value for what i got in video. I opted out of Cloud svs & bought a MicroSD 128GB card. It saw my wifi network easily. I downloaded the KASA app off Google as directed first. Plugged it in, it was super easy (intuitive software). Just buy it, im gonna buy another for the bedroom where our oldest resides. This first one is between dining & living rooms and in its 180 degs sweep, it catches all counters, dining table and very importantly, the 3 main door entrances from outside! I got the black one as it blended in well. I get frequent notifications on my cell ea time it catches a pet or persons move't. The build is decent, not heavy..kinda toy like but isnt the worst. I like the plug style. I bought an outlet extender too that allows plugs to plug into its sides so no bump up against furniture. You may want one of those too..theyre here on Amazon as well.

product_name: Kasa Indoor Pan/Tilt Smart Security Camera, 1080p HD Dog-Camera,2.4GHz with Night Vision,Motion Detection for Baby and Pet Monitor, Cloud & SD Card Storage, Works with Alexa& Google Home (EC70), White
description: My Beautiful Golden Retriever Girl is 6 months old and i’ve been using this camera since she was 2 months old! Being able to check on her whenever I want gives me such peace of mind if I’m not home, or shes in another room. I can’t even tell you how many socks, decor, shoes, cabinet corners i’ve saved from becoming this sneaky girls lunch from the other side of the house because of this camera.I went with this one because of the impressive amount of positive reviews while also being so affordable. Setup took all of 10 minutes and finding the perfect spot was easy because of how compact it is.A huge bonus is that a subscription is completely optional, unlike most others that require a fee or have very limited features without one. To this day I have never paid for this subscription because of the value I get without one! I can access the camera from anywhere and the app, i can see live video, it’s impressively clear quality whether day or night mode, sound detection notifications when a sounds made that’s louder than your set noise limit (in my case it’s to know when she’s barking), motion tracking is the most useful feature for us while we’re trialing her freedom moving into the teenage phase. I can keep an eye on her and let her have some more freedom while making sure she’s safe. The two way speaker helps a lot with praising good behavior and correcting undesirable ones. Being able to be consistent whether home or not has made a drastic difference in how quickly she learns.10/10 Just buy it!

product_name: Kasa Indoor Pan/Tilt Smart Security Camera, 1080p HD Dog-Camera,2.4GHz with Night Vision,Motion Detection for Baby and Pet Monitor, Cloud & SD Card Storage, Works with Alexa& Google Home (EC70), White
description: Favorite baby cam good quality. Easy to use. Easy to install. Video quality is good  for the price. Size is about average not to big. Angle view does well can get good amount range. Camera function overall great for the price.

product_name: Kasa Indoor Pan/Tilt Smart Security Camera, 1080p HD Dog-Camera,2.4GHz with Night Vision,Motion Detection for Baby and Pet Monitor, Cloud & SD Card Storage, Works with Alexa& Google Home (EC70), White
description: For the price and quality these cameras are great! Using the KASA app they connect to both Alexa and Google Home. Pan and tilt the camera, talk thru it, get alerts and more. No cloud commitment needed for basic standalone operation. two VERY MINOR concerns... Yes you can hear them move, if you listen closely but it very low. Second concern is not mine but my wife's and that is when I have them activated and you in the view of the camera they can be set to follow your movements. (It can be disabled, but the plus side of that is these cameras can cover a greater area of you home because they pan back and both (patrol) and can send motion alerts. Highly recommended.

product_name: Kasa Indoor Pan/Tilt Smart Security Camera, 1080p HD Dog-Camera,2.4GHz with Night Vision,Motion Detection for Baby and Pet Monitor, Cloud & SD Card Storage, Works with Alexa& Google Home (EC70), White
description: I purchased five of these cameras back in April to help monitor my father, who is in hospice care. Initially, they worked well, but after a few months, three of the five cameras started malfunctioning, requiring constant resets. Recently, a fourth camera has started acting up as well. We considered switching to a different brand but decided to stick with this one for the ease of setup, especially for my mother, who was already familiar with the system.Reluctantly, we purchased four new cameras to replace the ones that are only six months old, as they are now outside the return window. I feel that for the price, these cameras should last longer than half a year. I would appreciate it if the company would consider allowing returns or replacements under these circumstances.Despite these issues, the image quality is excellent, and the cameras are very convenient to use. However, the short lifespan is disappointing. If there are any options for assistance, I would be grateful if someone from the company could reach out..

product_name: Kasa Indoor Pan/Tilt Smart Security Camera, 1080p HD Dog-Camera,2.4GHz with Night Vision,Motion Detection for Baby and Pet Monitor, Cloud & SD Card Storage, Works with Alexa& Google Home (EC70), White
description: The Kasa Smart 2023 New Indoor Pan-Tilt Security Camera (EC71) is a versatile and feature-rich security solution for monitoring your home, pets, and babies. With its 1080p HD video quality, night vision, motion detection, and compatibility with Alexa and Google Home, it offers a comprehensive security package. Its ability to pan and tilt provides extensive coverage, and options for both local and cloud storage add to its flexibility.Key Features:1. 360° Pan/Tilt Field of View:  - The camera's 360° horizontal and 113° vertical range allows you to monitor an entire room or walkway. The Patrol Mode feature lets you set intervals to monitor different regions automatically.2. Motion Tracking:  - The camera can automatically track moving objects or people, providing real-time alerts to enhance your security system's effectiveness.3. Detection & Instant Notification:  - Get push notifications when motion or a person is detected. You can also enable baby crying detection, making it suitable as a baby monitor. Notifications help you discern important events from everyday activities.4. 2-Way Audio with Built-In Siren:  - The 2-way audio feature allows you to communicate with pets or family members remotely. The built-in siren can deter intruders, enhancing home security.5. Secure Local or Cloud Storage:  - Save footage on a microSD card (up to 256 GB, not included) or subscribe to Kasa Care for cloud storage with a 30-day video history and additional features like Video Summary and Activity Notifications with Snapshots.6. Night Vision up to 30 Ft.:  - The integrated IR system provides clear night vision up to 30 feet, ensuring you don’t miss any activity in low-light conditions.7. 1080P Full HD Video:  - Capture detailed 1080p Full HD video, making it easy to see small details like what your baby is holding or what your pet is playing with.8. Works with Alexa & Google Home:  - Compatible with Amazon Alexa and Google Home, you can use voice commands to view live streams on devices like Echo Show or Google Chromecast.Pros:- Extensive Coverage: The 360° pan and 113° tilt provide comprehensive room coverage.- Versatile Monitoring: Suitable for home security, pet monitoring, and baby monitoring.- Real-Time Alerts: Instant notifications for motion, people, and baby crying.- 2-Way Communication: Interact with pets or family members remotely.- Multiple Storage Options: Choose between local microSD storage and cloud storage with Kasa Care.- Clear Night Vision: Up to 30 feet of night vision ensures you don’t miss activity in the dark.- High-Definition Video: 1080p HD video for clear and detailed footage.- Smart Home Integration: Works seamlessly with Alexa and Google Home.Cons:- Occasional Slow Response: Some users report that the camera can be slow to respond at times.- SD Card Not Included: The microSD card for local storage is not included, which requires an additional purchase.- Subscription Cost: Accessing full cloud storage features requires a subscription to Kasa Care.Conclusion:The Kasa Smart 2023 New Indoor Pan-Tilt Security Camera (EC71) is a highly functional and flexible security solution for any home. Its wide range of features, including motion tracking, 2-way audio, night vision, and compatibility with smart home devices, make it a standout choice. While there may be occasional slow response times, the overall performance and ease of use make it a worthwhile investment for enhancing your home security.Recommendation:I highly recommend this camera to anyone in need of a reliable and versatile indoor security solution. Its extensive features, coupled with high-definition video quality and smart home integration, provide excellent value for the price. Whether you're monitoring pets, babies, or general home security, this camera is a robust and user-friendly choice.

product_name: Kasa Indoor Pan/Tilt Smart Security Camera, 1080p HD Dog-Camera,2.4GHz with Night Vision,Motion Detection for Baby and Pet Monitor, Cloud & SD Card Storage, Works with Alexa& Google Home (EC70), White
description: We recently got a puppy and I was excited to find a reasonably-priced camera to be able to keep an eye on her if we weren't in the same room. I was glad to find this camera! We have a set of three big windows in our living room and our 9 month old puppy loves to look out them from the couch and to look out our front storm door when our main door is open. It's also fun to watch her play with her toys by herself.  I really like the phone app that works with this camera and that I can move the camera remotely. This camera has both a mic and a speaker so you can hear what is going on in the room it is in and speak to someone else in the room while you are using the app. You can zoom in with the camera, too. It and the app were both very easy to set up. I have not used the movement alert feature yet, though it is good to know that it is available. I have also not yet installed a micro SD card to record anything but am also glad that feature is available if we want to use it. This is a very good value for this camera and for our needs and I believe it would also work very well as a baby monitor as well.

product_name: Anker Nano Power Bank with Built-in USB-C Connector, 5,000mAh Portable Charger 22.5W, for iPhone 16/15 Series, Samsung, iPad Pro/Air, and More
description: The portability is nice, which is why I bought this, but the capacity is severely lacking. It's too small to really make a dent in a low battery, just barely helping my phone tread water and stop losing charge. I think I get maybe 30% charge out of this, which isn't worth it to me. I'd rather just get one of the big battery bricks and know that I can get several full charges out of it.

product_name: Anker Nano Power Bank with Built-in USB-C Connector, 5,000mAh Portable Charger 22.5W, for iPhone 16/15 Series, Samsung, iPad Pro/Air, and More
description: I was so excited to use it as it is so convenientBut with 100 charge on the power bank it charged my iPhone 16pro max to only 33% in 43 minutesAnd I know exact times because I always find out true capacity in the first use of everythingWell maybe I received a faulty pieceBut I threw everything out cause I trusted that anker wouldn’t let me downSadly can’t even return it backUpdate: anker refunded my amount back after reviewing my review thank you ankerGonna raise the stars from 1 to 3 star for service by anker

product_name: Anker Nano Power Bank with Built-in USB-C Connector, 5,000mAh Portable Charger 22.5W, for iPhone 16/15 Series, Samsung, iPad Pro/Air, and More
description: This portable charger does not stay on. Bought this for a trip to Florida and I’ve dropped it multiple times. I had to ask a local grocery store for a rubber band to hold it together. Does charge but doesn’t charge long, even though it’s at full. I bought the Anker magnetic charger for the case and that worked tremendously!

product_name: Anker Nano Power Bank with Built-in USB-C Connector, 5,000mAh Portable Charger 22.5W, for iPhone 16/15 Series, Samsung, iPad Pro/Air, and More
description: I have always been pleased with Anker products, however, this Nano Power Bank is the exception.Like others  here have mentioned, if you have your phone in a case--even a minimal/thin one, this power bank's USB C male part will not be able to be inserted far enough into the female hole securely (and I tried it on five different phones with various cases).  Even if you do get inserted, or do not have a case, this little power bank's weight is still too heavy to only be supported by the USB C male part.  It will eventually damage your phone's USB C port, or the power bank's USB C part.  At a minimum I highly recommend that if you are using it, to do so only if the power bank itself is supported in someway.I have decided to keep this power bank though, and use it only with the included (short) USB C to USB C cord.Also keep in mind this power bank is only 5,000 mAh and will only fully charge a phone's battery if the phones battery capacity is less than this.  The power bank itself  charges up fine, and  quickly charges any phone that has a battery of less than 5,000 mAh, so I am please with this.  People trying to charge tablets or other items with larger capacity batteries just don't understand this.In summary, I do recommend this little power bank, especially since I purchased on sale here at Amazon.  Just realize its' limitations.

product_name: Anker Nano Power Bank with Built-in USB-C Connector, 5,000mAh Portable Charger 22.5W, for iPhone 16/15 Series, Samsung, iPad Pro/Air, and More
description: I've never had an issue with Anker in the past, so when I first heard about this power bank's ability to pass through charge (charge both your device and the battery simulatenously) I was sold. However, after trying with multiple devices and multiple wattages of input, and reaching out to customer service to return and replace my first power bank in case it was faulty, I have still no luck with this feature. This was the main reason I purchased the power bank, and I'm really disappointed that even my replacement product does not work as advertised, especially considering how much longer I had to wait for the replacement to ship and leaving me power bank-less for a week, since the older Anker power banks are almost rendered inert by the new iPhones because next to no one owns a USB type A to USB type C cable. Will likely be returning if customer service does not respond with a solution.10/30 Update:After a few weeks of correspondence with Anker support, involving two replacements and patience, Anker support was able to offer me a one time exception of a full refund without return for the inconvenience. I still think Anker has great products, and their customer support is also quite solid, although there were moments they were unreasonable (asking me to try a different color as if that had an effect of the pass through charging capabilities).Regardless, the real reason I found behind the pass through charging issue was the fact that the new iPhone pro line is capable of charging other devices like your Airpods, so when plugged into this power bank which is also being charged, the power bank think's it's receiving two inputs and turns off completely to prevent any overheating issues. It would've have been nice to have received this disclaimer in the product description, but hopefully Apple can release an update that allows their phones to recognize when power banks are attempting to charge and receive charge simultaneously.

product_name: Anker Nano Power Bank with Built-in USB-C Connector, 5,000mAh Portable Charger 22.5W, for iPhone 16/15 Series, Samsung, iPad Pro/Air, and More
description: Es bonito, pequeño y con carga rápida pero con un banco de energía muy pequeño, apenas pudo cargar mí teléfono de 20% a 65% y ya se quedó sin batería

product_name: Anker Nano Power Bank with Built-in USB-C Connector, 5,000mAh Portable Charger 22.5W, for iPhone 16/15 Series, Samsung, iPad Pro/Air, and More
description: It’s something i don’t understand i charge it first time delivered but when i use it my phone is not full charged, i don’t understand the way that function or maybe it’s a second hand they send to me 🤷🏾‍♀️

product_name: Anker Nano Power Bank with Built-in USB-C Connector, 5,000mAh Portable Charger 22.5W, for iPhone 16/15 Series, Samsung, iPad Pro/Air, and More
description: This charging bank is great and charges fast. The problem is that the type-c charger flips up and doesn't lock in place, so the power bank rocks a little bit. It also adds significant weight to the phone.

product_name: Anker Nano Power Bank with Built-in USB-C Connector, 5,000mAh Portable Charger 22.5W, for iPhone 16/15 Series, Samsung, iPad Pro/Air, and More
description: Within a few blinks it goes from 5 lights to 2 lights and my phone barely gets any charge. I might have a defective product but im to lazy to ask for a replacement. I'll keep testing more.

product_name: Anker Nano Power Bank with Built-in USB-C Connector, 5,000mAh Portable Charger 22.5W, for iPhone 16/15 Series, Samsung, iPad Pro/Air, and More
description: Very simple and easy to use, convenient for when I don't want to carry around a whole power bank and wire. Fits in one pocket just fine.But battery life isn't that great. Can't charge more than maybe 75%.

product_name: Anker Nano Power Bank with Built-in USB-C Connector, 5,000mAh Portable Charger 22.5W, for iPhone 16/15 Series, Samsung, iPad Pro/Air, and More
Anker Nano Power Bank with Built-in USB-C Connector, 5,000mAh Portable Charger 22.5W, for iPhone 16/15 Series, Samsung, iPad Pro/Air, and More
description: Absolutely love how this is and how it fits in my bag and barely quality is great. But that’s expected with the Anker brand. This charges my iPhone 15 up so fast. I do however wish it would charge a complete charge from 0-100%. I would say it’s more like an 80% so I can’t complain. I am considering buying one more as backup. Great value for the price. Highly recommend and love the cute colors they offer!

product_name: Anker Nano Power Bank with Built-in USB-C Connector, 5,000mAh Portable Charger 22.5W, for iPhone 16/15 Series, Samsung, iPad Pro/Air, and More
description: The Anker Foldable Connector Portable Charger is a compact and efficient power bank, perfect for on-the-go charging. Its foldable design makes it easy to carry, and the built-in connector eliminates the need for extra cables. The charger offers fast charging capabilities, ensuring devices are powered up quickly. However, the battery capacity might be on the smaller side for those needing multiple charges throughout the day. Overall, it’s a reliable and convenient option for quick charges and portability.

product_name: Anker Nano Power Bank with Built-in USB-C Connector, 5,000mAh Portable Charger 22.5W, for iPhone 16/15 Series, Samsung, iPad Pro/Air, and More
description: Compact and fits in a pocket or purse.  A little bulky when connected to the Samsung S24+ however, it is a fast charger.  I like it and recommend it for this model phone.

product_name: Anker Nano Power Bank with Built-in USB-C Connector, 5,000mAh Portable Charger 22.5W, for iPhone 16/15 Series, Samsung, iPad Pro/Air, and More
description: I have had a phenomenal time using this power bank, specifically using its pass through feature to charge my earbuds as well as the power bank on a single type c cable. 5000mah is enough to get a iPhone 15 Pro MAX from 0 to 100% battery.I have used it while having my phone tucked away in my pocket, it can get a tad warm, but mind the side of the hinge, especially if you are at the gym or at work and do a lot of bending. You don't want to risk damaging the folding hinge.My biggest pain point with using this portable charger is in with the spacing of the hinge relative to the rest of the body. The USB-C connector on the body stick out from the rounded body of the charger, making it prone to damaging things perhaps in a purse, and presents an unnecessary risk to the connector.There is also the issue of using the device on a flat surface. Its no ones fault when phones and their cases come in all shapes and sizes, and is something i never considered until using a power bank with a built-in usb. When in use, you may find that the device does not sit flush on either side of the hinge. Or when you prop your phone on its side using a stand to watch a video, the bank may be too large, giving you an unwanted tilt, or in worse cases is thinner than your device and hangs freely placing stress on the charging port of your device and the connector of the bank. I started to bring in dish cloth and folding it up to prop my phone while charging. Even a small amount of height and padding does wonders to alleviate all my issues with charging on a flat surface.All in all, having this power bank has made me keenly more aware of product designs and how they would interact with my own devices. I routinely use this everyday for work using the built in port. Going 4 months of almost daily use and have had no issues with the device. 11/10 for being one of the only portable charges of this profile with a hinge, massive props to the anker product development team.

product_name: Anker Nano Power Bank with Built-in USB-C Connector, 5,000mAh Portable Charger 22.5W, for iPhone 16/15 Series, Samsung, iPad Pro/Air, and More
description: First of all the color is so cute. It is so compact it fits in my fanny pack. Even though it’s compact it has a ton of power to it. I also love this brand because their products are really good and last a long time. Totally recommend!!!

product_name: Anker Nano Power Bank with Built-in USB-C Connector, 5,000mAh Portable Charger 22.5W, for iPhone 16/15 Series, Samsung, iPad Pro/Air, and More
description: It’s a bit heavy, but works great! Used this for my trip to London. It charged pretty quick while in my purse! Nice compact size. Love the lavender color.

product_name: Anker Nano Power Bank with Built-in USB-C Connector, 5,000mAh Portable Charger 22.5W, for iPhone 16/15 Series, Samsung, iPad Pro/Air, and More
description: I like how compact the charger is and that I dont need to carry both a power bank and a cable. However, the charger never entered fast charging mode. I used the fully charged nano to charge my galaxy S22 from 3%. The charger died after about an hour and a half leaving my phone at 80%.Debating on whether it's worth keeping as the bulkier Anker power banks aren't too difficult to carry around and can charge more devices. This would be more useful for a quick day trip where you want to bring a charger just in case or if your running late for work and your phone didn't charge over night for some reason (aka me everyday).

product_name: Anker Nano Power Bank with Built-in USB-C Connector, 5,000mAh Portable Charger 22.5W, for iPhone 16/15 Series, Samsung, iPad Pro/Air, and More
description: Just got this, charged it to full. With my iphone 15 pro (regular) at 10%, after 30 mins, it was at 51%, after an hour it was at 75% and when the last dot on the anker stopped blinking, my iphone was at 92% after about ~1.5 hours. So, this 3.5 oz device roughly doubles the battery life of a 15 pro with no cables.Since the 15 pro's battery life is abysmal, I am hoping this solves my travel problem and won't have to get the new 16 pro max, saving me $1300.Conclusion: It does fast charge at roughly 22W as anker advertises (Apple says 0-50% in 30 mins for iphone 15 pro at 27W wall charger) and I'd say the overall actual transmitted capacity is around 2800 to 3000mah after the heat loss. So if you have a 5000mah android or iphone max phone, expect this to charge it at least 50%. 5 stars since its so small and convenient.

product_name: Anker Nano Power Bank with Built-in USB-C Connector, 5,000mAh Portable Charger 22.5W, for iPhone 16/15 Series, Samsung, iPad Pro/Air, and More
description: I traveled internationally and out of all the items I had (MagSafe chargers, stands etc) this is the most practical. You can simply just attach it and get half of your battery back. I’d recommend not to exceed 80% since you will get more out of it with charging under. Sometimes it does feel a little bit wobbly with the connector on the bottom but overall still easy to hold while connected. It fits easily in the pocket too and not too bulky. Wish it had some extra charge but generally happy with it.

product_name: [2-Pack] USB C Wall Charger, 50W 5-Port PD Fast USB C Charging Block,2USB C+3USB A Multiport Plug,Type C Power Adapter Brick Cube for iPhone 15/14/13/12/11/Pro Max/XS/XR,iPad,for Switch,Samsung,Tablet
description: Compact. Works very well. Like the two different port types. Makes things easy . 5 devices on one ac outlet. Love it.

product_name: [2-Pack] USB C Wall Charger, 50W 5-Port PD Fast USB C Charging Block,2USB C+3USB A Multiport Plug,Type C Power Adapter Brick Cube for iPhone 15/14/13/12/11/Pro Max/XS/XR,iPad,for Switch,Samsung,Tablet
description: I seem to always forget where I last used my chargers if I need to move them. This was a great price for TWO, and they have several sizes of ports.  Charged my devices quickly.  Would recommend.

product_name: [2-Pack] USB C Wall Charger, 50W 5-Port PD Fast USB C Charging Block,2USB C+3USB A Multiport Plug,Type C Power Adapter Brick Cube for iPhone 15/14/13/12/11/Pro Max/XS/XR,iPad,for Switch,Samsung,Tablet

product_name: [2-Pack] USB C Wall Charger, 50W 5-Port PD Fast USB C Charging Block,2USB C+3USB A Multiport Plug,Type C Power Adapter Brick Cube for iPhone 15/14/13/12/11/Pro Max/XS/XR,iPad,for Switch,Samsung,Tablet

product_name: [2-Pack] USB C Wall Charger, 50W 5-Port PD Fast USB C Charging Block,2USB C+3USB A Multiport Plug,Type C Power Adapter Brick Cube for iPhone 15/14/13/12/11/Pro Max/XS/XR,iPad,for Switch,Samsung,Tablet
description: I will try to be as honest as possible because I depend on other people's reviews and feel I want to help the best I can:  I cruise and there are limitations to what is allowed on Cruise Ships.  Very recently Royal Caribbean banned multi plugs from being used aboard their cruise ships. But they do still allow multiplug USB adapters without any electric receptacles in them.  Because most of their older ships only have ONE receptacle and we need to charge all our electronics at the same time..... We bought THIS item to plug into the outlet and be able to charge our phones and iPad and Apple Watch overnight. This worked perfectly to do that for us.  Only odd thing is because it's heavy and sticks out from the wall so far, and because we had to have 4 USB cables plugged in at once, I did find it drooping some time to time and ended up putting a small item underneath it to keep it from drooping.  Worked perfectly after that. I recommend this brand and product.  Good luck.
