description: With electric focus, 4K support, and sharp and detailed images, we use this projector for our home theater and professional presentations. The inclusion of WiFi and Bluetooth capabilities lets me easily connect with various devices, allowing for a seamless streaming experience. The impressive brightness of 15000 lumens paired with a native 1080P resolution can deliver clear and vivid images even in well-lit environments.

product_name: Acer KB272 E0bi 27" IPS Full HD (1920 x 1080) Zero-Frame Gaming Office Monitor AMD FreeSync Technology Up to 100Hz Refresh 1ms (VRB) Low Blue Light Tilt HDMI & VGA Ports
description: I hooked this up to my wife's computer yesterday and almost sent it back DOA. I hit the power button on the back several times and it wouldn't turn on. I even checked to make sure there was power in the end of the plug that goes into the monitor. As I was fussing with it, my wife came over and hit some of the other buttons on the back such as brightness, contrast, etc. and it came to life! I find that strange & pretty much unacceptable. After it started showing the home screen and browsing a bit we didn't think the color was all that great. It had a too bright look to it. After messing with the brightness and contrast we have it looking better (let's say acceptable), but certainly not great or even very good. For a better inexpensive monitor I'd recommend checking out a comparable Spectre monitor. Not recommended for a number of reasons.

product_name: Acer KB272 E0bi 27" IPS Full HD (1920 x 1080) Zero-Frame Gaming Office Monitor AMD FreeSync Technology Up to 100Hz Refresh 1ms (VRB) Low Blue Light Tilt HDMI & VGA Ports
description: Two issues, first, when scrolling black text on white background, there is a light green shadow that follows the text until you stop scrolling, it's very annoying. second the border about 1 inch around the edges is noticeably darker than the rest of the screen. do not recommend this.

product_name: Acer KB272 E0bi 27" IPS Full HD (1920 x 1080) Zero-Frame Gaming Office Monitor AMD FreeSync Technology Up to 100Hz Refresh 1ms (VRB) Low Blue Light Tilt HDMI & VGA Ports
description: I bought this monitor in May (5 months ago) and even though it was great at first, it has come to disappoint me more and more as time goes on. I guess for the price you can expect a plastic monitor, but the connection for the HDMI cable is terrible. At the beginning it only happened a couple times that I lost video because I moved the monitor (which shouldnt happen either) but quickly came back up after moving the cable.Now its almost every day that I cannot even touch the monitor because it will mess with the HDMI connection. I try unplugging and plugging back in, I even try using another cable, and nothing seems to work. It dies for like 20 minutes and then comes back up after moving the cable to a VERY specific position. It’s impossible to work like this and I feel like I lost my money.

product_name: Acer KB272 E0bi 27" IPS Full HD (1920 x 1080) Zero-Frame Gaming Office Monitor AMD FreeSync Technology Up to 100Hz Refresh 1ms (VRB) Low Blue Light Tilt HDMI & VGA Ports
description: The monitor's display doesn't work for a MacBook; it is too blurry. Unfortunately, we are stuck with it as our return window has closed.

product_name: Acer KB272 E0bi 27" IPS Full HD (1920 x 1080) Zero-Frame Gaming Office Monitor AMD FreeSync Technology Up to 100Hz Refresh 1ms (VRB) Low Blue Light Tilt HDMI & VGA Ports
description: I needed a larger screen because my eyes are bad so i ordered this monitor. To my surprise it comes without sound. I just got off the phone with Acer support, ( #1352110us), and they confirmed no speakers on this model. TIME TO RE-ORDER.

product_name: Acer KB272 E0bi 27" IPS Full HD (1920 x 1080) Zero-Frame Gaming Office Monitor AMD FreeSync Technology Up to 100Hz Refresh 1ms (VRB) Low Blue Light Tilt HDMI & VGA Ports
description: When I first set up the monitor it was great, but after my system went to sleep it stopped working (see picture). Dell support tells me that the newest driver on their website (4953) is not a supported driver (even though Windows Update installed the driver on my system and the driver is available for download on the Dell support site). When I installed the previous driver (4502) the monitor worked briefly until Windows (version 11 Home) detected the 4502 driver and re-installed the 4953 driver. Eventually I figured out that I needed to use the 'Roll back driver' button in the Windows Device Manager. This prompted me to explain why I was rolling back the driver and apparently 'flags' the driver so Windows Update won't keep re-installing it.I've been running the 4502 driver for over a week now and the monitor seems to be working fine but it was a frustrating set up.

product_name: Acer KB272 E0bi 27" IPS Full HD (1920 x 1080) Zero-Frame Gaming Office Monitor AMD FreeSync Technology Up to 100Hz Refresh 1ms (VRB) Low Blue Light Tilt HDMI & VGA Ports
description: You get what you pay for.  If I had known where the power button and other controls were located, I would have bought a different monitor.

product_name: Acer KB272 E0bi 27" IPS Full HD (1920 x 1080) Zero-Frame Gaming Office Monitor AMD FreeSync Technology Up to 100Hz Refresh 1ms (VRB) Low Blue Light Tilt HDMI & VGA Ports
description: I mistakenly bought these, not paying attention to the resolution. I have become used to using a 4k monitor and I noticed the resolution immediately. For the price, these are good monitors, just be aware that the resolution isn't 4k. I replaced them with 4k monitors and the difference is substantial.

product_name: Acer KB272 E0bi 27" IPS Full HD (1920 x 1080) Zero-Frame Gaming Office Monitor AMD FreeSync Technology Up to 100Hz Refresh 1ms (VRB) Low Blue Light Tilt HDMI & VGA Ports
description: The monitor is very good, but I have to prop up part of the front of the base because the monitor angles downward in the front and is not easy to view. This makes the base very unstable and I'm nervous that it will tip over easily. There is no way to adjust the monitor to make this better. Right now, I have a stack of papers under the front to tilt it up, but I think I may have to get creative to figure out something more stable.

product_name: Acer KB272 E0bi 27" IPS Full HD (1920 x 1080) Zero-Frame Gaming Office Monitor AMD FreeSync Technology Up to 100Hz Refresh 1ms (VRB) Low Blue Light Tilt HDMI & VGA Ports
description: I bought 3 of these monitors together.  2 have been fine but the 3rd continues to go black for a few seconds while in operation.  Not real sure why that is happening but I have had trouble getting customer service help on it so the warranty and return features are a challenge on this one.Overall the monitors are lightweight and decent for the price.  Size is great and the picture is relatively clear.  If they just did not die every few minutes it would be great.

product_name: Acer KB272 E0bi 27" IPS Full HD (1920 x 1080) Zero-Frame Gaming Office Monitor AMD FreeSync Technology Up to 100Hz Refresh 1ms (VRB) Low Blue Light Tilt HDMI & VGA Ports
description: These reviews are mixed together; I have the 27" IPS 100hz version.  I use the HDMI (digital) port for connection, but it's nice that this monitor also has a VGA (analog) input option as VGA is a past standard for older computers.  To my eyes the brightness and colors are great right out of the box, and the picture is very clear.  I don't play fast-action video games, so I can't comment on how well it works for those.  But for text, spreadsheets, and normal web browsing (including YouTube) this works very well.Positives:IPS (for me) is preferable to VA type monitors.  It's a small difference but if you are picky, here's IPS.The border is very thin, thus you've got maximum usable screen space with almost no waste.The price was incredible at $120.  I see that it's now $160 and I think still a good value there.Great picture right out of the box.VESA wall (or arm) mountable.Choice of HDMI or VGA input.Looks good with the power on or off.Potential negatives (for some people):Provided base is very wide at the bottom, and possibly difficult to attach to monitor.  I tried briefly to attach the screen to the base, instructions say something about turning it to attach securely - I couldn't figure out how to attach it securely.  This didn't matter to me because I planned to use a "monitor arm" (I have one from MOUNTUP) and that works great on my computer desk which is about 1" thick.  But if you want to use the included base, I'm not sure how to attach it securely, and I might ding it a star for that.The AC to DC power convertor (aka power supply) is inside the monitor, which gives it an elegant look vs. a separate power supply.  However, if the power supply dies, good luck replacing it.  At the price paid this is ok, and might even be preferable for some people.The power cord and connections to the computer (HDMI or VGA) attach upward from the bottom, rather than straight into the back.  Again this looks more elegant but I would prefer straight into the back, as that is easier to attach.  You might need to do some fumbling around before you get it all connected.The monitor is adjustable for brightness, colors, on/off etc. from the back of the unit on the right side.  These are easily reached by "feel" once you know where they are, and which is which.  One of the switches starts an on-screen "menu" that you can navigate.  I made it appear but haven't tried to adjust it.  This is probably how all monitors adjust now, but I preferred the old days when monitors had 5 or so physical switches on the front or bottom edge, so you could change brightness, color hue, etc.  Of course those monitors were also much more expensive than today's monitors, for a smaller picture that wasn't as good as today's.  Just saying that if you want to change the settings, it may take some fumbling to get the hang of it.It doesn't have the pixel density of more expensive monitors, but for my use I don't need it the higher density.  To me the picture and text looks really good from where I sit, which is about 2 feet away.Overall this is fantastic for my uses as a VESA-mounted non-gaming monitor, and incredible at the price I paid.  The only frustration I can imagine is if you use the included base/stand and can't figure out how to secure it to the screen (there must be a way, I would think, but I didn't try very hard since I was going to use an external "arm" mount anyway).  Or if you do fast-action gaming, maybe it's not as good as some, but I have no idea about that.

product_name: Acer KB272 E0bi 27" IPS Full HD (1920 x 1080) Zero-Frame Gaming Office Monitor AMD FreeSync Technology Up to 100Hz Refresh 1ms (VRB) Low Blue Light Tilt HDMI & VGA Ports
description: This Acer KB272 Ebi monitor is a fantastic value for the price. The 27-inch display offers sharp visuals and a wide viewing angle. The 100Hz refresh rate and 1ms response time make it perfect for gaming and fast-paced content. The design is sleek and modern, and the monitor is easy to set up. Highly recommend for anyone looking for an affordable and reliable monitor!

product_name: Acer KB272 E0bi 27" IPS Full HD (1920 x 1080) Zero-Frame Gaming Office Monitor AMD FreeSync Technology Up to 100Hz Refresh 1ms (VRB) Low Blue Light Tilt HDMI & VGA Ports
description: Please keep the price in mind when you read this review. With that in mind:This is a remarkably good monitor. It has in its favor:1. The picture is very sharp. I have bad vision and I can read it without my glasses!2. The picture is more than bright enough, even in a well lit room.3. The blacks and contrast are wonderful.4. The color is beautuful. Maybe if I was doing PROFESSIONAL photofinishing or video production I might quibble, but then again maybe not.5. It is excellent even for my style of gaming (Quake2, Alien Arena, Super Tux Cart, etc.) so the drop to 100 Hz from 144 Hz really isn't very noticable.6. Even though I have the VA panel version, I have not been bothered by "ghosting" at all, even at 100 Hz.7. Although I would have liked a metal stand, the plastic with some metal stand that comes with it is quite sturdy. And its easily wall mountable. (In fact, I now have it VESA mounted on a desktop stand that rotates it between landscape and portrait orientation.)Against it:1. If I really try I can tell a slight difference between it's 100 Hz and my Nitro 5's built in 144 Hz, but only using the type of really intense games that I do not generally play. And even then I can still play them.2. I have no need for a VGA port, and it has only 1 HDMI port. But, an external HDMI switch can be quite inexpensive, even with remote control, especially considering the low cost of the monitor. I got a 3-1 switch so I could connect my computer, a TV tuner and an Amazon Fire stick.All in all, for me, this is a really great monitor. I will almost certainly end up with one or two more in the series. I have to say that Acer really outdid itself with this one as to value for $$$. Well done Acer!Addendum. I should have mentioned this. This monitor has no speakers/sound, To use the HDMI switch and use this to watch TV I had to put a HDMI audio extractor between the switch and the monitor and connect the audio output to a small external amplifier. Ended up with very good sound. Much better than any computer monitor I've ever had.

product_name: Acer KB272 E0bi 27" IPS Full HD (1920 x 1080) Zero-Frame Gaming Office Monitor AMD FreeSync Technology Up to 100Hz Refresh 1ms (VRB) Low Blue Light Tilt HDMI & VGA Ports
description: Needed a monitor so I could do some remote work without sacrificing screen-estate. This is perfect. Great size, excellent quality, and terrific price.

product_name: Acer KB272 E0bi 27" IPS Full HD (1920 x 1080) Zero-Frame Gaming Office Monitor AMD FreeSync Technology Up to 100Hz Refresh 1ms (VRB) Low Blue Light Tilt HDMI & VGA Ports
description: This monitor was a really good purchase, the size and brightness is amazing. The only issue for me was the resolution. Being a 1080p display in such a big form factor, makes the pixels obviously more visible, so you gota be a bit far from the display. It has great brightness and great colors. It's a good product and i'd recommend buying for producing, office, and watching series. For gaming, the 100hz is noticeable but i'd rather a higher resolution. Overall a good purchase.

product_name: Acer KB272 E0bi 27" IPS Full HD (1920 x 1080) Zero-Frame Gaming Office Monitor AMD FreeSync Technology Up to 100Hz Refresh 1ms (VRB) Low Blue Light Tilt HDMI & VGA Ports
description: I’ve purchased three of the Acer KB272 EBI 27" IPS Full HD monitors, and I’m thoroughly impressed with their performance. The picture quality is incredibly sharp, making them perfect for both gaming and office use. The 100Hz refresh rate is a noticeable upgrade, providing smooth and fluid visuals that enhance the overall viewing experience. The zero-frame design adds a sleek and modern touch, and the monitors have performed flawlessly with no issues at all. Whether for work or play, these monitors deliver excellent clarity and responsiveness. Highly recommend for anyone in need of a reliable and high-quality display that combines great picture quality with a smooth refresh rate!

product_name: Acer KB272 E0bi 27" IPS Full HD (1920 x 1080) Zero-Frame Gaming Office Monitor AMD FreeSync Technology Up to 100Hz Refresh 1ms (VRB) Low Blue Light Tilt HDMI & VGA Ports
description: As a 100% remote worker in IT for over 6 years, I prioritized my eye health when setting up my office. I use these monitors well over 10 hours/day, so had no reservations in getting the larger displays.The lower tier are all Acer 27” monitors, 3 of which are over 4 years old and the 4th just added. All perform equally well, with no difference in color or brightness. Can you spot the newest unit? Appearance-wise, physical and image quality, they’re identical (lens distortion makes the middle 2 seem narrower)! If you guessed the one on the far left, it’s actually the far right one ;-) .  I use dual docking stations and mix/match between Windows (Lenovo work laptop) M2 MacBook Pro, and occasionally a Linux.The Acer monitors are also my travel monitors. (Hint: Keep your Boxes!) Three, packaged together as one unit (custom fit in an outer box), is just small and light enough to qualify as checked luggage! The original 3 27” Acers have traveled across the US multiple times.  I absolutely rely on these Acer 27” monitors daily for work and off-hours for content creation.So what changed in 4 years with the Acer?- The original ones are super thin but rely on an external small and light power brick; the latest version has the power supply built in, so you only get a power cable and the lower base depth, front-to-back, is thicker but not a show-stopper for most uses.- The original 3 have audio pass- through control, (which I’ve never used); no audio port on the new one- Power and image buttons on the bottom right edge on the older model, moved lower right edgeAnd since you’re curious, the upper 3 displays are 6-year old LG 32” monitors … not nearly as good as the Acers, if I’m being honest.

product_name: Acer KB272 E0bi 27" IPS Full HD (1920 x 1080) Zero-Frame Gaming Office Monitor AMD FreeSync Technology Up to 100Hz Refresh 1ms (VRB) Low Blue Light Tilt HDMI & VGA Ports
description: Moved up from a older dell 24" starting to do the pink screen two step to this acer 27". Price was too good to pass by and I've had Acer monitors in the past that were good units. So far a nice monitor for my needs (basic PC and internet no gaming) Super easy setup, size is perfect for older eyes lol. crisp vibrant colors and super sharp images. Some have complained about controls on the back no problem here and it was an auto startup anyway. I give this unit a thumbs up!

product_name: Acer KB272 E0bi 27" IPS Full HD (1920 x 1080) Zero-Frame Gaming Office Monitor AMD FreeSync Technology Up to 100Hz Refresh 1ms (VRB) Low Blue Light Tilt HDMI & VGA Ports
description: I don't really know much about monitors, but I REALLY like this one.  I had a 24" Samsung that seemed to be dying and replaced it with this 27" (the largest my desk will reasonably take).  I like the super thin frame and although I don't play video games I assumed a gaming monitor would be pretty high quality - and it is (especially for the price).  And my camera fits on the top of the monitor very well (better than previously).  I have used Acer stuff in the past with good reliability and even though most of my "screens" seem to be Samsung, I needed a monitor with a VGA port as my desktop computer has no HDMI ports.  Delivery was one day.

product_name: Acer KB272 E0bi 27" IPS Full HD (1920 x 1080) Zero-Frame Gaming Office Monitor AMD FreeSync Technology Up to 100Hz Refresh 1ms (VRB) Low Blue Light Tilt HDMI & VGA Ports
description: I purchased this monitor to replace a (very) old Dell monitor which told me it was time to retire. I have 3 - 27" monitors in front of me, and the only thing I did was hook this Acer up to the existing cables. PERFECT!!

product_name: Koilboane Compressed-Air-Duster 150000RPM Electric Air Blower, Mini Powerful Cordless Rechargeable 8000mAh Battery Jet Dry Portable Jet Turbo Fan Dust Snow Blower for Cleaning Car/Keyboard/PC/Home
description: This compact, handheld fan is surprisingly powerful and did a great job cleaning my keyboard, which I hadn't cleaned in over 7 years. I appreciate its small size—it fits easily in my drawer for quick access. It also comes with various brushes in different shapes and sizes, perfect for getting into tight crevices before blowing debris out with the fan. The fan offers multiple speed settings, including high and low. So far, I haven't encountered any downsides.

product_name: Koilboane Compressed-Air-Duster 150000RPM Electric Air Blower, Mini Powerful Cordless Rechargeable 8000mAh Battery Jet Dry Portable Jet Turbo Fan Dust Snow Blower for Cleaning Car/Keyboard/PC/Home
description: This Electric Air Blower is a fantastic tool for quick, efficient cleaning. Its high-speed 150000 RPM motor provides strong air pressure, easily clearing dust from keyboards, PCs and more. It’s a great alternative to traditional compressed air cans, saving both money and the environment. What I love most is its portability. The cordless design, powered by an 8000mAh rechargeable battery, means I can use it anywhere without being tethered to an outlet. The battery life is impressive, offering plenty of use before needing a recharge. The compact size also makes it easy to store or carry with you, which is perfect for cleaning on the go.

product_name: Koilboane Compressed-Air-Duster 150000RPM Electric Air Blower, Mini Powerful Cordless Rechargeable 8000mAh Battery Jet Dry Portable Jet Turbo Fan Dust Snow Blower for Cleaning Car/Keyboard/PC/Home
description: Air blower is very powerful. Cleaned window sills and patio sliding door tracks in no time. Also used in other areas of house. Great product with many uses. Can use the Dust Gun at home, office, car, and many other places. Speed is impressive. Portable and easy to use. Took Dust Gun on a trip and was amazed how mush dust is in a hotel room.

product_name: Koilboane Compressed-Air-Duster 150000RPM Electric Air Blower, Mini Powerful Cordless Rechargeable 8000mAh Battery Jet Dry Portable Jet Turbo Fan Dust Snow Blower for Cleaning Car/Keyboard/PC/Home
description: This Koilboane electric air duster is surprisingly powerful. Its high-efficiency brushless motor can reach up to 150,000 RPM, achieving wind speeds of up to 74 m/s, making it highly effective for cleaning car interiors and removing dust from computer keyboards. Additionally, its large-capacity battery allows for extended use on a full charge. I am looking forward to using it for a variety of purposes as the seasons change, not just for cars and keyboards, but also for clearing fallen leaves and snow, and accelerating the start of BBQs. The inclusion of a Type-C cable, storage bag, and eight different brushes also greatly enhances the product's value, making it even more convenient.

product_name: Koilboane Compressed-Air-Duster 150000RPM Electric Air Blower, Mini Powerful Cordless Rechargeable 8000mAh Battery Jet Dry Portable Jet Turbo Fan Dust Snow Blower for Cleaning Car/Keyboard/PC/Home
Koilboane Compressed-Air-Duster 150000RPM Electric Air Blower, Mini Powerful Cordless Rechargeable 8000mAh Battery Jet Dry Portable Jet Turbo Fan Dust Snow Blower for Cleaning Car/Keyboard/PC/Home
description: Canned air is 6 to 8 dollars a can. It is no longer needed with this product.Armed with my new toy I proceeded to go on a cleaning binge. First the PC. It work edgreat to get all the little dust bunnies out. Second, I hit the keyboard with a blast of air Again, a fair amount of stuff was blown out. I was pleasantly surprised how quiet this unit is and how well it cleaned.I have some air purifiers so I used it on those too. It did a great job.Next on to the car. We all know the little cracks and crevices that collect all kinds of stuff. I held a vacuum nozzle in one hand and used this blower to literally blow the dirt out of the crevices and right into the vacuum. I did this because I did not want it blowing around the car. It worked great on the center console and door handles.Next I took it to work. Time to clean the server closets. If you have ever seen one there is a ton of wire to contend with. That limits how much air can be blown as the wire acts as an obstruction. With the power of this unit I did not have to worry about that. It cut my leaning time by 30%.It charges in a timely manner and you get a good amount of run time. It is also small and light to pack with the included bag.I was surprised at the amount of air this unit pushes out. It has 3 speeds so it is nice to be able to regulate the flow to your desire. This will pay for itself by not having to buy canned air. I use canned air in the shop to just do general dust offs. No more as this unit will replace that. This product is a keeper.

product_name: Koilboane Compressed-Air-Duster 150000RPM Electric Air Blower, Mini Powerful Cordless Rechargeable 8000mAh Battery Jet Dry Portable Jet Turbo Fan Dust Snow Blower for Cleaning Car/Keyboard/PC/Home
description: When I search these, I was so excited to find this duster. It does an incredible job of creating a steady stream of air without the condensation you get from canned air. I can use the device to clean electronics without concern of the humidity damaging or shorting out anything. I also discovered that I can use it to clean my Tiffany lamps safely. It allows me to get the dust out from around the soldering without any pressure. Another fine use for this handy device is I have a mineral collection which gets dusty, but is next to impossible to clean unless you use canned air, which can get very expensive.The charge lasted for extremely long time, allowing to clean various items at one time. It recharged quickly, so little down time. The device has three settings, allowing me to decide how much air and how safe when I’m cleaning can be.

product_name: Koilboane Compressed-Air-Duster 150000RPM Electric Air Blower, Mini Powerful Cordless Rechargeable 8000mAh Battery Jet Dry Portable Jet Turbo Fan Dust Snow Blower for Cleaning Car/Keyboard/PC/Home
description: This turbo fan is a convenient, compact, smooth-running, tool that puts out a very powerful blast of air, exceeding anything I’ve seen from traditional cans of compressed air.  There are three speeds, and the battery life between charges (up to 4 hours of continuous use at the slowest speed) has been more than adequate.  After using it on a variety of tasks (cleaning electronic devices, air filters, sawdust from woodworking, etc.), it’s proven to be a valuable addition to my workshop.  I couldn’t be happier with its performance.

product_name: Koilboane Compressed-Air-Duster 150000RPM Electric Air Blower, Mini Powerful Cordless Rechargeable 8000mAh Battery Jet Dry Portable Jet Turbo Fan Dust Snow Blower for Cleaning Car/Keyboard/PC/Home
description: My husband and son use cans of air to clean their keyboards.  I thought getting this would be a good replacement.  So, it is - it works great on keyboards BUT I discovered that I can use it for sooooooo many things!!!  I went on a crazy cleaning spree.In my craft room, there's crap all over the work table.  I usually wipe it with my hand, on to the floor, to vacuum later.  Now I can use my handy blower to blow EVERYTHING away.And--- I have to vacuum my stairs way too many times, including under the stairs.  Its annoying. I just blew everything off the stairs and onto the floor so I can just vaccum the floor.  Its pretty amazing.  I have tried to use my small outdoor blower for that purpose, but it blew everything way too crazy and all over the place.  This little guy was PERFECT.  I will never vacuum my stairs again.  I can even blow the cat hair and crap onto the floor and under the stairs and I really don't have to vacuum immediately cause you can't see it.  ;) I found my new best friend.  I need to find more things to blow.  That's what she said.

product_name: Koilboane Compressed-Air-Duster 150000RPM Electric Air Blower, Mini Powerful Cordless Rechargeable 8000mAh Battery Jet Dry Portable Jet Turbo Fan Dust Snow Blower for Cleaning Car/Keyboard/PC/Home
description: I've been doing IT for over 30 years. That's a lot of compressed air. This is much more compact and I don't have to worry about spray or spraying too long. I'm also able to get in closer because I don't have to worry about the spray. This set also comes with brushes. For myself this is actually very useful as the insides of a computer being actual dust a can of air (should it accidentally spray) could possibly cause the dust to stick and I wouldn't want to try to brush that around. With this kit I'm able to brush stuck dust loose (dryly) and let it blow out safely. The multiple speeds are very useful for using around computer fans or a home fan as computer fans are very delicate and don't want them to spin on their own.  I've even done some dusting around the house which worked out great also. I can't remember how long it lasted exactly but I was playing with it all day mostly on high. 2 house fans, around the house, a few computers (on low), 2 air cleaner screans ( that was great). I went into it as a can of air replacement and I feel I upgraded for sure.

description: These phone charger cables are a mixed bag. On the plus side, the MFi certification ensures they work perfectly with my iPhone, providing fast charging and high-speed data sync without any compatibility issues. The 3-foot length is convenient for everyday use, whether at home, in the car, or at the office. Plus, having a four-pack means I can keep a charger in multiple locations without constantly moving cables around.However, I did notice that the build quality isn't as robust as I'd hoped. After a few weeks of use, one of the cables started showing signs of wear near the connector. While they still function, I worry about their long-term durability.Overall, these cables are a decent value for the price, but they might not hold up to heavy use over time.

product_name: JSXKYNVTE for iPhone Charger Cord 10 ft 5Pack, Long USB to Lightning Fast Charging Cable 10ft Compatible with iPhone 14/13/12/11 Pro Max/XS MAX/XR/XS/X fits iPad Pro/Air/Mini 10 Foot
description: Nothing really to say much about these cables besides the fact that they offer great performance for the price. As expected, the transfer speed on these are USB 2.0 rated at 480Mbps. The quality is similar to the ones Apple sells, just imagine it extended to 10 feet! I can finally use a cable connected to my bedside and have it dragged across my bed while using it. See attached photo as I plug the cable through a cable tester and compare it to a standard Apple cable. (Slightly different in charging speeds)

product_name: vibeadio Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones, Headphones Wireless with Transparency Mode, Deep Bass, Comfort Fit Ear Cups, 30 Hrs, for Home Office Travel
description: I have no problem with sound quality and noise cancelling performance, considering the low price, as long as these headphones are connected via bluetooth. However, when connected to an audio source via a cable, these headphones just function as ordinary non-powered headphones. There is no volume adjustment or active noise cancelling. Forget using these headphones connected to the in-flight entertainment system via cable on an airplane. If you want noise cancelling in an airplane you will need to bring along a bluetooth transmitter. This very much makes these headphones unusable for airplane travel. I will return them for this reason.

product_name: vibeadio Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones, Headphones Wireless with Transparency Mode, Deep Bass, Comfort Fit Ear Cups, 30 Hrs, for Home Office Travel
description: The only thing good I can say about these headphones is they fit comfortably. They are not noise canceling at all. Volume is not that loud if your trying to quiet out background noise. They are definitely not worth the full price they are listed for. I got them on sale and still not worth the price I paid. If you're looking for noise canceling headphones these are not it. Keep looking.

product_name: vibeadio Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones, Headphones Wireless with Transparency Mode, Deep Bass, Comfort Fit Ear Cups, 30 Hrs, for Home Office Travel
description: I was extremely skeptical, bc if you're anything like me, you're tryin 2 find a good deal, w/out havin 2 pay these OUTRAGEOUS prices for Sony, Beats by Dre, JBL, Bose @ like $200 or MORE for some, even on sale...but these will utterly shock u, they did me for SURE. If you're reading this, I'm guessing you're doin same thing I Was, basically lookin for ANY bad review, bc usually the only folks who comment on products are the UNhappy ones, but I had to scroll through literally like, 40 or 50, & STILL couldn't really find a SINGLE bad review, overwhelmingly positive. They charge quickly, u get USB-C charging, so it's fast, not sure If they do that "quick charge" thing the high-end ones do, where u can charge for like 5-10 minutes & get like 8 MORE hours, even from a partial charge, but even if not, these are STILL, WELL worth it.  The one downside, is minor, the "transparency" mode, does kinda sound like you're underwater. If you're not familiar w/the newer tech, it let's u press a button, switches from 1) regular sound 2) Noise-cancelling mode 3) "Transparency" mode, which allows you to hear what's goin on around u, w/out havin to take the unit 🎧  itself, off your head. I totally get what people meant by it sounding like you're underwater, but it still works relatively well...plus it's not really the type mode you're gonna spend much time in, kinda more for minor emergencies, or just an additional convenience to hear another person for example, w/out havin 2 physically take em off your 👂 ears. I'm sure like nearly all products, if you're not happy, u can return, but I can't imagine why u would. Oh, 1 thing, be CAREFUL about the color, for some reason, they had a few colors like Blue, I think like red or pink, & one other, they were 10$ cheaper I believe, but the black ones I think look better, & had a sale which saved quite a bit, I think it was like 50% off or somethin, PLUS ➕️ an ADDITIONAL 10% off coupon, not sure if that would be eligible for everyone, but was for me, which made it even MORE of a no-brainer 🧠 to buy. The sound, even in "normal" mode, is SURPRISINGLY good, even it blocks 🚫 out a decent amount of sound on its own, but when you hit into the Noise-cancelling mode, they sound EVERY bit as good, as my much older Bose ones, from back in the day. They were like maybe, 7 or 8 years old I guess, give or take, if anything these might be BETTER.  I'm sure there's a few things the Sony/Bose ones do better, but here you're paying LITERALLY like 10% of that. I thought for SURE it sounded "too good to be true", but so far, I now understand why the reviews were so overwhelmingly positive, I had a hard time finding even ONE bad one. They fit well, pretty comfortable, my major in college basically required 🎧, & these sound just as good as the numerous Sony models we used. Of course the highest level ones, that cost like $250 or MORE, will probably sound a LITTLE better, but I've used probably a dozen or so different brands & models over the years, & if u did a "blind sound test", I'd say easily 9/10 people wouldn't be able to even tell ANY substantial  difference. JBL has a pair for like 100$, I think that was even the sale price, but had MANY reviews that were horrific, & people even had several photos or videos showing how cheap they looked, & broke w/a QUICKNESS, I was honestly surprised 😮 the MORE expensive ones, had VASTLY worse overall reviews. I can't speak on Longevity yet, but they charge quickly, sound VERY good, feel comfortable enough to use for long time, & of course, the price is UNBELIEVABLY good. Others @ this price, have MANY bad reviews from unhappy customers, but here I struggled to find ANY. I don't even usually do many reviews, unless I'm VERY happy/surprised, or very unhappy w/a product, these are DEFINITELY worth taking a chance on. I recommend waiting on a sale, & keep an 👁 eye out, for the additional coupon thing u have to hit the ✔️ ✅️ check mark button to receive, but ANY price around 30$, you're gonna be straight up SHOCKED w/these, I was. That's about all I can think of, bass is solid, price is fantastic, comfortable, not very heavy or anything, even WITHOUT the Noise-cancelling, the sound is great & even STILL blocks a decent amount of sound, WITHOUT even activating the Noise-cancelling mode. I wasnt familiar w/the developers who made these, but so far, @ least short-term, I Would give em literally like a 9 to 9.5 out of 10. Even the higher end ones, like beats by Dre, have more bad reviews than these...possibly bc more people bought em overall? Not sure, but you'll not find a better set of headphones 🎧 anywhere CLOSE to these, for this price. Very impressive.  If anything, I'm usually MORE skeptical than most people, but I don't see how anyone could be disappointed w/these, especially for the price. Two thumbs 👍 up

product_name: vibeadio Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones, Headphones Wireless with Transparency Mode, Deep Bass, Comfort Fit Ear Cups, 30 Hrs, for Home Office Travel
description: I was skeptical because of the price and well, because it’s Amazon, and sadly, we can’t always trust the reviews. But, I am pleasantly surprised by the quality of these headphones. I just got them, so I don’t know about the durability just yet, but so far, comfortable fit, sleek look, great sound quality, and great easy to use functions. Charged fast. Hoping for long battery life, but so far, worth the money!!

product_name: vibeadio Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones, Headphones Wireless with Transparency Mode, Deep Bass, Comfort Fit Ear Cups, 30 Hrs, for Home Office Travel
description: I use Sennheiser headphones for mixing music. These don't sound too far off from that. I wouldn't mix with them, but I would definitely record with them. The bass is amazing. The mid range isn't superb but it's really good. Plus, they are definitely the most comfortable headphones I've tried. Great for music, audiobooks, meditating, running, etc. The battery lasts all day and then some. Just an incredible purchase at this low price point!

product_name: vibeadio Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones, Headphones Wireless with Transparency Mode, Deep Bass, Comfort Fit Ear Cups, 30 Hrs, for Home Office Travel
description: Fit: These are very snug over your ears. They seal out external sound very well.This is mostly positive, but also can cause sweat accumulation in hot/humid weather.Sound: They are a little muddy sounding, but not too bad. You would get better sound quality with a set of earbuds, but these are a comfier style.Battery: Good, many hours. Goes into standby, per bluetooth standards, and extends battery life. It can last nearly a whole day of use on full charge.Sound cancellation: It's decent, but eats into battery life. It's a nice-to-have in noisy environments, but not the best version I've heard of it. Good version for this price though.Build quality: Can't say yet. Brief ownership, it has yet to stand the test of time. Feels pretty sturdy though, because of less articulating joints than some models.

product_name: vibeadio Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones, Headphones Wireless with Transparency Mode, Deep Bass, Comfort Fit Ear Cups, 30 Hrs, for Home Office Travel
description: Using them right now and I’m happy with how they perform. Pairing is practically automatic, and the sound is pretty good at this price point. They’re lightweight and feel comfortable on the ears. No issues at all.

product_name: vibeadio Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones, Headphones Wireless with Transparency Mode, Deep Bass, Comfort Fit Ear Cups, 30 Hrs, for Home Office Travel
description: Good active noise cancelling. Used on a couple of long flights and really makes a difference. Sound quality is good, maybe not “audiophile” grade or as good as big brand headphones that cost 5x - 10x more, but definitely adequate for a nice listening experience. Build quality seems good so far, and battery life meets expectations…still have 80% battery after 5 or 6 hours use with noise cancelling on. I thinks 30 hours battery life is realistic. I like that these have a jack to connect via wired connection, but note that active noice cancelling does not work with wired connection. It would be nice if these folded to save space, and came with a protective case, but not a big deal. At the price I paid, these are an excellent value. I found a good case for $8. Total cost including case purchased separately was under $40. Very happy with purchase.

product_name: vibeadio Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones, Headphones Wireless with Transparency Mode, Deep Bass, Comfort Fit Ear Cups, 30 Hrs, for Home Office Travel
description: I'm a professional audio engineer and I had a pair of inexpensive Bluetooth headphones I would recommend to my studio clients to listen to mixes and could even used in recording sessions. Unfortunately that model that I really liked and recommended a lot has been discontinued. I've been on the search for a replacement for awhile and these are it! Build quality is not bad, very light and comfortable to wear. Sound quality is very good overall, a tiny bit heavy on the low end but very nice representation in the higher end, especially considering the price. Noise cancelling is very good, better than our old headphones. Packaging is minimal, doesn't come with a case or even a drawstring bag to keep them in but that's fine considering the price. Don't have any feedback as far as long term durability as that remains to be seen. Bluetooth pairing is very good and battery life seems on par with most other headphones I've used. Can't really recommend these enough, especially if you can get the under $20 like I did.

product_name: vibeadio Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones, Headphones Wireless with Transparency Mode, Deep Bass, Comfort Fit Ear Cups, 30 Hrs, for Home Office Travel
description: Value: 11/10Sound Quality 12/10Comfortable: 7/10Noise Cancellation: 10/10Battery Life: About 28 hoursBattery Charging Time: About 3 HoursVerdict: If your looking for the best sound quality without spending a lot, these are the headphones your looking for.I’m an audiophile that heard music from a variety of good and poor quality headphones.The headphones cancel a lot of sound nearby to the extent that when no sound is played, I don’t hear people walking past me.The sound quality is the number one advantage of these headphones, The bass is balanced while still having that punch just were you want it to be which transitions into a full midrange which tends to be lacking for headphone users. I heard mid frequencies that aren’t on many other headphones. It surprised me how refined it was for this range and the higher frequencies were crisp and clean. To better explain it, the upper range was crystalline while also sounding like genuine strings on a guitar.In terms of comfort, the headphones are above average. The headphones “hug” your ears which is needed to make headphones noise canceling. There are more comparable headphones out there, but for 34 dollars these are still pretty good.In short, the sound quality is better than many 300 dollar headphones in the market, it’s what to me makes this the best headphones for it’s price range.

product_name: vibeadio Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones, Headphones Wireless with Transparency Mode, Deep Bass, Comfort Fit Ear Cups, 30 Hrs, for Home Office Travel
description: This is my first pair of noise canceling headphones, so I have nothing to compare them to. I do love them, though. There is nowhere I can go at work to get some quiet time away from people other than hiding in the bathroom. I am an introvert doing 10 hour shifts in a call center, I need to get away from people on my breaks. I can still hear conversations in the break room, but people see me wearing them and will respect my need to be alone. Several people at work use them in this way. I never realized how much the noise from my fans and a/c bother me until this blocked it out at home, too. The relief is intense. My music and audiobooks sound great, and they seem to do fine with the very infrequent phone calls I make. Overall, I am very happy with them!

product_name: vibeadio Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones, Headphones Wireless with Transparency Mode, Deep Bass, Comfort Fit Ear Cups, 30 Hrs, for Home Office Travel
description: I have ear buds, headphones, and bone conduction headphones in various price ranges, so I am always looking for quality at a reasonable price.This particular purchase was for a good quality noise-canceling headphone that I could use while sleeping. I listen to music, audiobooks, or ambient sounds to mask the sounds of three dogs and one husband, all of whom snore.This was not the time for a luxury investment, since sleeping in them could be damaging on its own. This, when I saw the number of good reviews, I thought these would be worth a gamble. I have not been disappointed.The sound is quite good for my purposes, and the noise-cancellation function is as good as the ear plugs I used to wear. The buttons are easy to locate and use; the charge time is reasonable and I can get several nights’ sleep at my chosen volume on one charge.The Bluetooth connection is quick and sure. My only complaint is the constant flash of the connection light, but a small piece of electrical tape covers it—as well as dozens of other indicator lights throughout the house.I have only had these a couple weeks, but they’ve already put in over a hundred hours of use. We will see what comes!

product_name: Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 Headphones Sport, 2024 Wireless Earphones with Earhooks, HiFi Stereo Deep Bass with ENC Mic, 40H Dual LED Display, IPX7 Waterproof Ear Bud for Small Ear Running/Workout
description: This is my second pair of Bluetooth headphones and these are far superior to the first pair I had from a different brand. They are easy to connect, fit comfortably, have great sound, the display inside the storage case is great and they’re a great price point. I’d love to give these five stars however, I’ve only used these about a dozen times since I got them in early June 2024 and there have been a handful of times when my left earbud doesn’t work. I’ve tried plugging it back in, taking it out first when I want to use them, looked through the manual for tips but nothing has worked. A little disappointed that it’s been just over a month and this is an issue and I’m three days outside the return window. I know they weren’t expensive but for the price I would have expected a little more from them.

product_name: Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 Headphones Sport, 2024 Wireless Earphones with Earhooks, HiFi Stereo Deep Bass with ENC Mic, 40H Dual LED Display, IPX7 Waterproof Ear Bud for Small Ear Running/Workout
description: These are comfortable to wear. I mainly wear them while I mow my lawn. Sound quality isn’t the best, but decent and loud enough to drown out the mower

product_name: Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 Headphones Sport, 2024 Wireless Earphones with Earhooks, HiFi Stereo Deep Bass with ENC Mic, 40H Dual LED Display, IPX7 Waterproof Ear Bud for Small Ear Running/Workout

product_name: Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 Headphones Sport, 2024 Wireless Earphones with Earhooks, HiFi Stereo Deep Bass with ENC Mic, 40H Dual LED Display, IPX7 Waterproof Ear Bud for Small Ear Running/Workout
description: Let me preface this by saying I don’t spend a lot on ear buds. So my comparisons are not $$$. I ordered bc my ear holes are small and these seem to be lower profile. While they do fit in my ears they are kind of boxy in shape. They are not uncomfortable and will stay in so if you are a runner they would be handy.  The problem is it muffles the sound no matter which ear suction I used. The sound quality  is really not good. They are great for keeping noise out/canceling, riding with my children in a car for vacation 10hrs, that part came in handy. I think even at this price point there has to be a better product out there.

product_name: Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 Headphones Sport, 2024 Wireless Earphones with Earhooks, HiFi Stereo Deep Bass with ENC Mic, 40H Dual LED Display, IPX7 Waterproof Ear Bud for Small Ear Running/Workout
description: Final Update.The one working left earbud quit on Tuesday this week.Hard to make a recommendation about earbuds in this price range - I haven’t had a set last more than 9 months - and at that po8nt there is usually only one functions.Spend more? Stick with expensive brands? Or just figure these are disposable items destined for the landfill.Bought these in June of this year, but did not start using them until late July. I have bought several (at least 4) sets of similar earbuds over the tears - used solely for running 3 times a week.This morning I pulled them out for my run, and the right earbud was non-functional.In my last few sets, it was the left bud that failed early, so that was different.In any case, I had resolved to not spend much and figure I’d get about a year of full use out of any of these level earbuds - the 3 month life is pretty disappointing.Just a word of warning.

product_name: Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 Headphones Sport, 2024 Wireless Earphones with Earhooks, HiFi Stereo Deep Bass with ENC Mic, 40H Dual LED Display, IPX7 Waterproof Ear Bud for Small Ear Running/Workout

product_name: Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 Headphones Sport, 2024 Wireless Earphones with Earhooks, HiFi Stereo Deep Bass with ENC Mic, 40H Dual LED Display, IPX7 Waterproof Ear Bud for Small Ear Running/Workout

product_name: Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 Headphones Sport, 2024 Wireless Earphones with Earhooks, HiFi Stereo Deep Bass with ENC Mic, 40H Dual LED Display, IPX7 Waterproof Ear Bud for Small Ear Running/Workout

product_name: Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 Headphones Sport, 2024 Wireless Earphones with Earhooks, HiFi Stereo Deep Bass with ENC Mic, 40H Dual LED Display, IPX7 Waterproof Ear Bud for Small Ear Running/Workout
description: The sound is flat and muffled. Terrible. I know these are "lower-end" ear phones, but even compared to my previous low-end Chinese pair, the the sound is bad. I wish there was a way to adjust this somehow.Also, they don't align well with my actual ear opening. The angle is off, like they're partially out of my ear. They're secure, they won't fall out, they just don't sit properly in my ears. (But even when I hold them into my ear with my hands the sound is still dull and muffled-sounding.)Even though they're fairly cheap, I'll be returning them. It's too bad, I like their design.

product_name: Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 Headphones Sport, 2024 Wireless Earphones with Earhooks, HiFi Stereo Deep Bass with ENC Mic, 40H Dual LED Display, IPX7 Waterproof Ear Bud for Small Ear Running/Workout
description: I previously owned apple earbuds which were quite expensive. My main complaint was that they didn't stay securely in my ears. But I also had many instances in which they simply didn't connect to my phone.  Well I lost those, quite easy to do, because the case is so small and was reluctant to fork over the high price again. I then thought it might be worthwhile to get earbuds with the over ear attachment so I wouldn't worry about them falling out. These Jesebang buds came in at a really good price and had great reviews so I gave them a try. I am thrilled with them. They are a secure fit, so when I'm bending over in the garden, I never worry about losing them. The sound is perfect. And they hold a charge forever. I've been using them for about three hours daily for the last two weeks and I'm still at 69%. The connection to my apple phone was a snap. I've already convinced two friends to purchase these.  Go for it, you won't be sorry.

product_name: Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 Headphones Sport, 2024 Wireless Earphones with Earhooks, HiFi Stereo Deep Bass with ENC Mic, 40H Dual LED Display, IPX7 Waterproof Ear Bud for Small Ear Running/Workout
description: I recently got Jesebang Earbuds, and they’ve blown me away! The battery life is fantastic, lasting for hours on end. Phone conversations are crystal clear, making it easy to communicate. Plus, they’re super comfortable to wear for long periods. Honestly, I prefer these over my Apple AirPods! If you’re looking for quality earbuds with great sound and comfort, definitely give Jesebang a try!

product_name: Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 Headphones Sport, 2024 Wireless Earphones with Earhooks, HiFi Stereo Deep Bass with ENC Mic, 40H Dual LED Display, IPX7 Waterproof Ear Bud for Small Ear Running/Workout
description: I use these earbuds with my Galaxy S20 phone and they work great. They hold a charge much longer than my previous pair. I like the over-the-ear design - they stay in without having to jam them deep onto my ears. They come with a good selection of different-sized rubber ends - they can even fit my son's ears without a problem.

product_name: Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 Headphones Sport, 2024 Wireless Earphones with Earhooks, HiFi Stereo Deep Bass with ENC Mic, 40H Dual LED Display, IPX7 Waterproof Ear Bud for Small Ear Running/Workout
description: I love these ear buds!! The only problem for me is that other than turning them on, I don't know how to use them. Like, I don't know how to pause them or turn them off. I bump it once and it beeps but then nothing else happens. The sounds just keeps playing. I'm just not very good with electronics. It sounds great. They fit my ears perfectly!

product_name: Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 Headphones Sport, 2024 Wireless Earphones with Earhooks, HiFi Stereo Deep Bass with ENC Mic, 40H Dual LED Display, IPX7 Waterproof Ear Bud for Small Ear Running/Workout
description: These lil bud are so adorable, and works perfectly for me. I needed ones with the over the ear piece cause that's the only way ear buds stay in my ear. The sound is clear, holds charge for hours. I use it to listen to music at work for a couple hours and they have delivered. haven't had them die out on my as yet,  and I haven't needed to charge 'em every day at all so far either. I love that you can see charge percentage when you open the case so you know where you're at. for this price, I'm so winning!

product_name: Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 Headphones Sport, 2024 Wireless Earphones with Earhooks, HiFi Stereo Deep Bass with ENC Mic, 40H Dual LED Display, IPX7 Waterproof Ear Bud for Small Ear Running/Workout
description: I am technologically lacking. There was zero set up involved with these, thank goodness. I opened them and by the time I took one out and got it placed in my ear, it was connected and working. At one point I received a call and couldn’t remember how to answer using them so I just took them out. They immediately disconnected with me doing nothing. Upon ending my call I put them in to try to start them again, But they were already connected the second I put them back in. It was wonderful to have something be so simple. I actually purchased these for my monthly infusions I’m now receiving. I’m at the infusion center for about 1.5-2 hours a month. So far, this is the only time I use them. I have had 3 infusions and still have 89% battery and have only charged them the day I received them. They weren’t expensive so I really wasn’t expecting much out of them. I am so glad I’ve been proven wrong! Also, I have smallish ears so when I shopped I was looking for some that indicates they would fit. They came with two pairs of inserts. Small and smaller. The larger of the two fit perfectly.

product_name: Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 Headphones Sport, 2024 Wireless Earphones with Earhooks, HiFi Stereo Deep Bass with ENC Mic, 40H Dual LED Display, IPX7 Waterproof Ear Bud for Small Ear Running/Workout
description: I've had these for about a month now and they work great! Sound quality is good and the charging case is great and compact. I like how it tells me the battery percentage. They're comfortable and connect easily to my phone and the touch controls actually work pretty well. The battery life is a lot better than I expected!

product_name: Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 Headphones Sport, 2024 Wireless Earphones with Earhooks, HiFi Stereo Deep Bass with ENC Mic, 40H Dual LED Display, IPX7 Waterproof Ear Bud for Small Ear Running/Workout
description: I keep two sets of these earbuds on rotation (one charged, the other in use) and use them for everything: working out, long runs, office work, studying, chores, bedtime books, etc. They last forever (8 hours without a charge or even longer -- 3-4 days in the case -- before the case needs to charge). The only thing I don't like is the lack of haptic feedback on the buttons (they are touch/fingerprint sensitve but do not "click") and the difficulty of turning up the volume. It's also fairly common I accidentally hang up on someone on a call because I tapped the earbud accidentally. Other than that, for the price, they're great.

product_name: Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 Headphones Sport, 2024 Wireless Earphones with Earhooks, HiFi Stereo Deep Bass with ENC Mic, 40H Dual LED Display, IPX7 Waterproof Ear Bud for Small Ear Running/Workout

product_name: Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 Headphones Sport, 2024 Wireless Earphones with Earhooks, HiFi Stereo Deep Bass with ENC Mic, 40H Dual LED Display, IPX7 Waterproof Ear Bud for Small Ear Running/Workout

product_name: Oura Ring Gen3 Sizing Kit - Size Before You Buy The Oura Ring Gen3 - Unique Sizing - Receive Credit for Purchase
description: I wanted to try the oura ring since my apple watch is like a series 3 from like 2018. After all the hype I gave the oura ring a try. Heres where I liked about it: Long battery life, sleep tracking is really great, not bulky and fits well. I was also interested in the temp tracking which I wanted to use to track my cycles better.Heres what I didn't like and my thoughts.The rings can be exspensive. I initally wanted gold but its almost twice the price of silver. The functionality is the same between the two - but they say the materials for gold is the reason why the price is so high. I opted for silver instead.I found myself missing the utility of my watch. With your ring you can't tell time, you can't use it to find your phone, can't make payments, answer your phone, etc. But also I was disappointed in what oura had to offer.The temp tracking was not quantitative data - it just tells you +/- from your baseline. I was really disappointed with this. I know that the ring can detect patterns and let you know when you might be getting sick, etc. but within the app I wasn't satisfied with this.Oura is not accepted anywhere for motion tracking/fitness tracking, so you miss out on other apps, etc. where you would need to sync up your tracker.Although it detects walking, running, and cycling very well - that's about it. You can live record only those three (indoor/outdoor) - and any other kind of workout you have to add to your activity after the thought. but just adding it what you did and for how long. I didn't like this. They also use a tagging feature - which I understand but feels like its too much effort.Yes you get slightly more detailed biometric data, but I felt the app was kind of lackluster. The interface is nice but felt lacking and slightly overwhelming all at the same time. They do a good job noting optimal levels vs where you need to pay attention, but that's really about it.I will likely return my Oura ring and get a new apple watch. I was initally really only wanted to try oura for the temp tracking and cycling tracking, but I don't like how the temp tracking is done, and there is virtually nothing for cycle tracking aside from just marking when your cycle starts. You also have to pay for an oura subscription and if you wanted more in depth cycle tracking - pay for natural cycles (not required but they partner together).With the newer apple wathces you can now get everything that oura offers, plus the utility of watch, phone, and payment system - and with new features like temp tracking and etc. you can get more out of the already built in apple apps. And then you can download apps where you might need to fill in the gaps.

product_name: Oura Ring Gen3 Sizing Kit - Size Before You Buy The Oura Ring Gen3 - Unique Sizing - Receive Credit for Purchase
description: I got the gen 3 ring about 3 weeks ago. It takes about 2 weeks for the ring to get to know you and give accurate daily insight. It has really helped me see my sleep issues and get a handle on my stress etc.The problem came once the ring wouldn't sync with the app. I followed the generic instructions given on the site but nothing works. So then I get 'help' via the chst. Which is an AI chat bot. Those suggestions don't work so then I get 'technical ' support from a live human who is utterly useless doing the same thing the bot walked me through. Nothing worked. I'm sure it was something simple had I had someone to speak to on the phone could have been trouble shot. The issue is you can not speak to anyone and after all the bs with the chat bot and 'human' I was so frustrated I decided just to send the ring back.Thank goodness I bought it via Amazon because the actual website has no clear cut information on how to return. You have to send an email to the random people that apparently work there. I actually sent an email about my issue with it not syncing and all I received was a transcript of my conversation with the bot.I would love to purchase the Gen 4 ring but with all the trouble just to get something as simple as the ring to sync I couldn't imagine if it broke and you needed to use the warranty.Come on Oura do better. Hire some human tech support!

product_name: Oura Ring Gen3 Sizing Kit - Size Before You Buy The Oura Ring Gen3 - Unique Sizing - Receive Credit for Purchase
description: (Review on Heritage and Horizon black,  stealth and silver versions - all purchased and not part of any promos)Tried 5 different versions of their Horizon and Heritage rings in 3 finishes. This wearable ring is absolutely fantastic in what it promises. The metrics for sleep, activity, and a myriad of other health and wellness data pulled are so impressive. More impressive is how they curate and deliver all that data in a simple app view depending on which tab in the app you’re viewing at that time.The 3 stars (insated of 5) is for their black and stealth finishes. They WILL leave spider mark scratches all over your phone screen, appliance handles, car door handle, steering wheel, etc. And they don’t warn customers about this or about wearing these two finishes on the non-dominant hand that doesn’t pull cell phone from pocket/purse or open doors with. Their customer service is very professional but said in vague terms that these two finishes may cause friction scratches.Two recommendations: 1) buy silver finish (I can’t speak for gold) if you want to guarantee no scratches because I tried it or 2) if you absolutely must have black or stealth, always wear it on your non-dominant hand and get your phone a screen protector at the very least and never wear around the house (ie only when outside or sleeping).Hope this helps and once they fix this one flaw, I’d love to give them 5 stars.

product_name: Oura Ring Gen3 Sizing Kit - Size Before You Buy The Oura Ring Gen3 - Unique Sizing - Receive Credit for Purchase
description: I got this because of Apple’s lawsuit issue with their pulse oximeter. I also wanted to track my sleep without having to wear my watch. It does a good job tracking my sleep but the pulse oximeter feature only works during sleep and is not on demand. This means if I want to check my blood oxygen during the day, I still have to use a regular oximeter. Why not allow on demand testing???Also sizing. I did get their sizing kit and I word the test ring for a day. They say to make a fist and if there’s space above your finger to go to the next size down. I did that and everything seemed fine though the ring was a little tighter than I’d prefer. I seem to be between sizes. 10 is too loose and 9 is too tight. Where this becomes a problem is if your fingers swell during exercise. Mine swelled just enough to concern me but I’m still in the same situation where the ring would fall off my finger if I went a size up. Also, I just got the gen3 ring and 2 weeks later they release the gen4. Any chance for a trade in?? Overall, I like that I don’t have to wear my watch to track sleep and that I do have sleeping blood oxygen readings. Would love to be able to measure on demand.

product_name: Oura Ring Gen3 Sizing Kit - Size Before You Buy The Oura Ring Gen3 - Unique Sizing - Receive Credit for Purchase
description: Recently purchased the Oura Ring 3. I had a question about how to add my heart rate as the instructions were not working. They wrote back to expect a response w/in 24 hrs. The next day they wrote that "due to exceptional interest in the Oura Ring 4 (I thought I bought the latest version!), we've received a significant amt. of inquiries...as such it is taking us longer than usual to respond". Well, it's been 6 days now and only correspondence was telling me my free trial was coming to an end so I will need to start paying! Secondly, I have a question abt. how to make something work and all I get is we are busy answering questions on our Oura 4, but your trial is about to be over so you will need to pay monthly. product_name: Oura Ring Gen3 Sizing Kit - Size Before You Buy The Oura Ring Gen3 - Unique Sizing - Receive Credit for Purchase
description: After 5 months of use here are my conclusions:My guess is that for users that have significant sleep or cycle tracking issues, this might be a helpful product. However, as others have written in their reviews, this is not a good fitness tracker. This is unfortunate, because there are places where Oura has advertised itself as such. There are also really bad issues with syncing fitness data with other apps. The $6 a month service fee they charge is also something that I have concluded is not worth the price. Bottom line: If you're looking for a product that can track fitness, look elsewhere. If you are someone that has relatively good health and sleep, an Oura ring won't be useful. If you are looking to get a handle on sleep problems or with your menstrual cycle, your mileage may vary.More detailed thoughts:-THE OURA RING DOES NOT WORK AS ADVERTISED: Since the Oura ring is an awful pedometer, calorie burn and all-around fitness tracker, you need to be able to incorporate fitness data from other apps (for example, Google Fit). When data syncs from Google Fit to Oura, it incorporates that data for around 3 days. For some mystifying reason that Oura cannot explain beyond "we're aware of the issue and working on it," Oura then discounts all of the synced fitness data (like, it still visible in the app, but the data doesn't count for any of its calculations). It then recalculates all of your "Readiness," "Activity," and "Resilience" data. In my case, it then goes from an 'optimum' score to a 'pay attention' score. Essentially, it renders 3 of Oura's 4 main tracking functions useless. This issue occurred for 3 of the 5 months I used the ring. As described earlier, Oura is aware of this issue, they've just done nothing to fix it.-They don't provide much, if any, context for various readings. The only advice they seem to offer for those actually looking to improve their sleep/health/fitness are pre-recorded  'guided meditations' from various providers. I did not find these to be particularly helpful.-They try to manufacture meaning from their readings with their weekly and monthly "trends." When you have a relatively consistent lifestyle, the "trends" are so small as to be meaningless. For example,  "You're sleep is trending down" looks rather silly when the line graph "trend" is from 8.25 hrs to 8.2 hrs.-The kicker for me is that the tracker has now even stopped tracking my sleep accurately. It seems like they changed up their algorithms for or something. I have kepy the ring on the same finger, wore it in the same way, but last night's sleep tracking was wildly inaccurate. I woke up feeling refreshed and felt I had a normal sleep, but the Oura app reported that I slept terribly. It was 1/2 hour late detecting my sleep and when it did, it showed I was awake for over an hour longer than I actually was. This was the last straw for me, as the sleep tracking was Oura's only decent function.So, I'm taking the ring off now and cancelling the monthly membership. It's too bad, I had high hopes for this ring. It's why I shelled out $300, plus have been paying a $6 monthly fee. But, buyer beware, unless you really need help tracking your sleep (or possibly your menstrual cycle, I can't speak to that), don't buy an Oura ring. Look for a better product.

product_name: Oura Ring Gen3 Sizing Kit - Size Before You Buy The Oura Ring Gen3 - Unique Sizing - Receive Credit for Purchase
description: The ring does what I wanted it to do. Track my sleep and it even picks up when I am out walking. It has a great battery life and is easy to wear.
