product_name: Aux Cord for iPhone 16, 3.3ft USB Type C to 3.5mm Headphone Jack Aux Audio Cable for Car Home Stereo Headphone Speaker Compatible with iPhone 16/16 Plus/16 Pro/16 Pro Max/15/15 Plus/15 Pro/15 Pro Max
description: Kind of short, but still works decently well.Did cause issues in my car and had to fidget with it in the truck, but works great now

product_name: Aux Cord for iPhone 16, 3.3ft USB Type C to 3.5mm Headphone Jack Aux Audio Cable for Car Home Stereo Headphone Speaker Compatible with iPhone 16/16 Plus/16 Pro/16 Pro Max/15/15 Plus/15 Pro/15 Pro Max
description: Works for now. I can’t speak to the longevity of the cord as I have only been using it for a couple of weeks.

product_name: Solar Charger Power Bank Fast Charging - 30000mAh Portable Solar Phone Battery Panel Charger, QC3.0 Dual USB Port Battery Pack Charger for All Cell Phones & Electronic Devices (Orange)
description: This battery is supposed to have 30,000 mAh, but it doesn't.  I received the charger with 3 dots already showing as charged (75% of the battery or 22,000 mAh) .  I charged my phone from about 23% to 100%.  My phone has a 3140 mAh battery size.  Charging my phone from 23% to 100% used up 2 of the 3 dots (capacity 15,000 mAh) on the battery pack.  Now, I'm no electrical engineer but if the battery had 30,000 mAh then 2 dots (what was used up) would be 15,000 mAh.  So, there is no way that this battery bank has a 30,000 mAh capacity. Even if it only transferred the charge at 50% then it should still have only used up 1/4 of the battery, not 1/2.Edit: Further testing of the capacity of this battery bank... I fully charged the battery and charged my Garmin mini and my phone. At full charge ( 4 dots) of the battery bank it charged my Garmin mini (1250 mAh) from 23% to 100%. Then it charged my phone ( 3140 mAh) from 25% to 65% before it was fully discharged.  So the full battery capacity was only able to charge 2222 mAh.  That is not even close to 30,000 mAh that this is supposed to have.Edit:  The solar charging is actually working.  I had it in the sun from sun up, (about 6:30am)  to sundown (about 8:30 pm) and it added one dot (25% of it's capacity) to the battery pack.  I'm not sure how  this is going to work when I'm hiking because it's not really possible to have the unit directed at the sun for the entire day.  Edit.  After 2.5 full days of full sun and managing the battery so that it was always facing the sun, I was only able to add 50% of this battery's capacity (from one dot to three dots).Final: I returned this. If it would have had at least the 30,000 battery bank capacity as advertised I would have kept it but the low battery capacity and the slow charging, this wasn't worth any money.  Completely useless to me.

product_name: Solar Charger Power Bank Fast Charging - 30000mAh Portable Solar Phone Battery Panel Charger, QC3.0 Dual USB Port Battery Pack Charger for All Cell Phones & Electronic Devices (Orange)
description: ***UPDATE: So, I've had this battery pack for just about a year. A few months ago, the wireless charging pad stopped working - tried several phones and nothing. Also, the USB-C charger cord stopped working right after that probably because the wire inside broke. It still holds a large charge and can use it to recharge a phone 4x or 5x as well as my laptop and tablet 1x or 2x. The solar charging takes forever now.I would NOT buy this again. Chargers are getting smaller and better than this one.Original review (was 5 star):Just got the battery pack and tested all the features out. It was already pre-charged to 3/4 bars.1- Solar charging. As I unboxed it in the car, it was blinking (charging) from the sun coming in from the windshield. Check.2 - I plugged it into the wall charger with a micro USB cord then a USB c cord and it charged. Check.3 - recharged a 2500 mah phone twice by itself. Took about an hour each time without using my own non-fast charging cord. Check.4 - Placed two wireless charging phones on it and that worked. Its wireless charging is easier and faster to use than my other wireless charging pad. Check.5 - Maxxed the output by charging 4 devices at one time (and also using the wireless charging) and that's what finally depleted the remaining charge on the battery pack. Check.6 - Don't really need the lights, but they work as described. Check.I estimate the total output actually received by my devices was somewhere just below 30K mah - which is probably due to energy loss in transfer. Also maxxing out by charging multiple devices wastes extra mAh than charging just one device at a time.Pros - It works! It can be charged multiple ways. It has passthrough charging - while it's charging, you can still use it to charge another device. It can fit into an avg size purse and definitely a backpack. Has micro usb, USB c, and has lightning charging cables attached so you're ready no matter what mobile device you need to charge. You can charge multiple devices at a time. Will even receive solar charge while charging a wireless device when that device is placed UNDER the charger with charger's solar side facing up.Cons - This thing is heavy like a brick - 1.3lbs . It will NOT fit into your pocket. It doesn't come with a cover so the attached charging cords can flip out. (I will make a Velcro cover). The attached cords are thin so may not last long. The whole unit should come with a protective cover to keep dust out of the charging cord plugs and to prevent scratches to the solar panel. I always put something beneath it before placing the panel side down on any surface.Also - as with all solar offerings, solar panels can only do so much charging. This unit does not solar charge indoors when it's cloudy outside and only in a bright sunny window or under a bright light. The surface area and capacity of the cells is small, so it will take a while (several days at least) to get a full charge. And with other solar chargers, a trickle charge dissipates while getting a solar charge. Don't expect miracles, but do charge it up fully by plug (takes about 8hrs) and use solar charging as a top up measure.Also as seller states, don't leave it in a car or other possible extreme temperatures to protect the battery. And whatever you do - DON'T ever drop it and expect it to work correctly again. Its weight will cause damage on impact. I dropped one of those portable car battery chargers and after that the charger battery pack started swelling and I had to dispose of it. Never use a swelling or damaged battery pack. They can and do EXPLODE.I'm going to expand the solar surface area with a DIY aluminum foil box which will reflect more light into the panel for faster charging.But loving it so far.

product_name: Solar Charger Power Bank Fast Charging - 30000mAh Portable Solar Phone Battery Panel Charger, QC3.0 Dual USB Port Battery Pack Charger for All Cell Phones & Electronic Devices (Orange)
description: FINALLY received my chargers a week after ordering. Promised dates before the hurricane but evidently Amazon wasn't running delivery trucks and never said anything about delays. I digress. I received the chargers which were DESPERATELY needed and they take forever to charge in the sun and then not enough charge to fully charge my phone. Very very disappointed. I ordered 2 of these specifically because they offered a solar charge. Next time I'll spend my money and buy a solar powered generator. 4hrs out in the sun and minimal recharge. Don't bother wasting your $$$, especially if you need these post disaster.

product_name: Solar Charger Power Bank Fast Charging - 30000mAh Portable Solar Phone Battery Panel Charger, QC3.0 Dual USB Port Battery Pack Charger for All Cell Phones & Electronic Devices (Orange)
description: I actually bought this device several months ago, in the event of another extended power outage - which is something we're becoming known for here in Texas. Thankfully, I haven't had much reason to test it out, until I went camping for a week in Colorado last week. Before heading out, I made sure it was fully charged, which as some have said, does take a minute. I was able to charge my Galaxy S23 Ultra twice, from about 20% to 100%, and my small Amazon Fire tablet twice from about 50% to full. The charger was still just under halfway depleted after all that. This is such a luxury, and a huge upgrade from the portable charger I've been dealing with for the last several years. The flashlight came in handy for trudging from the tent to the bathroom at night. The only drawback for me is that it apparently doesn't have enough output to charge my Surface 7 Pro tablet, which can charge via USB-C as well as the proprietary magnetic charging connection that I usually use. To be fair, the only USB-C charger in my house that will do it is the 45W charger that I use to rapid-charge my Galaxy. I'll make sure my next charger is powerful enough to charge larger devices, but for now, this will be my portable charger.

product_name: Solar Charger Power Bank Fast Charging - 30000mAh Portable Solar Phone Battery Panel Charger, QC3.0 Dual USB Port Battery Pack Charger for All Cell Phones & Electronic Devices (Orange)
description: Could not get the sun to charge it to 100%. Had to plug it into an AC. Then went to use it to charge my phone that was at 15% and it got it to 95% and it had run out of power.

product_name: Solar Charger Power Bank Fast Charging - 30000mAh Portable Solar Phone Battery Panel Charger, QC3.0 Dual USB Port Battery Pack Charger for All Cell Phones & Electronic Devices (Orange)
description: It works for the most part, but the keyring that it comes with broke while I was hiking. I'm so glad it broke in a spot that I could pick it up off the ground and that it didn't fall off the cliff into the river.

product_name: Solar Charger Power Bank Fast Charging - 30000mAh Portable Solar Phone Battery Panel Charger, QC3.0 Dual USB Port Battery Pack Charger for All Cell Phones & Electronic Devices (Orange)
description: While it has been two years since I bought this in 2022 the wireless charger recently stopped working. The battery and plugs still work but the big selling point was the wireless charging...

product_name: Solar Charger Power Bank Fast Charging - 30000mAh Portable Solar Phone Battery Panel Charger, QC3.0 Dual USB Port Battery Pack Charger for All Cell Phones & Electronic Devices (Orange)
description: The product is as described, however, it does not super fast charge as some of the reviews mentioned. Mine seems to have a standard -basic charge. My phone was at 51% and I plugged in the solar charger and it estimated my charge time to be 1hr 21 min... This is fine in the aspects of being on the go and not being able to use a wall charger, but I wouldn't say it has a super fast charge by any means as I have a 45W wall charger that would charge the 51% in 40 min. I like the convenience of the product and how lightweight it is and all the features it offers though. Overall, I am happy with it :-)

product_name: Solar Charger Power Bank Fast Charging - 30000mAh Portable Solar Phone Battery Panel Charger, QC3.0 Dual USB Port Battery Pack Charger for All Cell Phones & Electronic Devices (Orange)
description: Charges quickly, but flashlight / LED lamps don't work.

product_name: Solar Charger Power Bank Fast Charging - 30000mAh Portable Solar Phone Battery Panel Charger, QC3.0 Dual USB Port Battery Pack Charger for All Cell Phones & Electronic Devices (Orange)
description: Left this power bank out for 2 days in the sun for solar charging and it never lit up any of the charge dots and couldn't charge my cell phone, at all.  I have a different power bank with 10,000 mAh that will charge my cell phone twice.  Once this 30,000 power bank was fully charged via an outlet power source, it also only charged my cell phone twice.  A 10,000 mAh power bank is smaller, lighter, and more compact, so why would I keep something bigger that isn't going to work as expected.  I'm returning this and will purchase a different brand.  Don't buy this if you're actually hoping to use it as a solar charger or are expecting for it to really provide more than a couple of cell phone charges.

product_name: Solar Charger Power Bank Fast Charging - 30000mAh Portable Solar Phone Battery Panel Charger, QC3.0 Dual USB Port Battery Pack Charger for All Cell Phones & Electronic Devices (Orange)
description: Battery packs are great - ample power and flexibility.Pros- attached cables- wireless charging- good lights- loads of ports  (charge with USB C, Micro etc.)- Charge and use as a wireless charging pad at the same time (~30 W depending on device)Cons:- Build in cables can 'flop out' leading to potential for damage (say in a laptop bag) I use Magic tape to hold them in place. Going to add a velcro sticky to the back as a strapOTHER:Had on that was damaged/ceased to wireless charge - it was replaced with no issuesKeep the attached cables dry. I leave them charging flat with the cables down by windows, not a good idea if humidity builds up and runs of the windows! Although slightly weather proof (port covers) any damp getting into the the attached ports underneath (especially in the USB C) can lead to a short .Amazingly when I dried it thoroughly in the sun the smell went away and everything started working again!I now balance them on the side facing the window!Again great value for money, exceptionally convenient and a dual purpose (pack and charging pad) for when you are on the road.

product_name: Solar Charger Power Bank Fast Charging - 30000mAh Portable Solar Phone Battery Panel Charger, QC3.0 Dual USB Port Battery Pack Charger for All Cell Phones & Electronic Devices (Orange)
description: We bought this to keep on the boat since our cell phones seem to die if we’re out for a while (or if any of us forget to charge them up before we go). Haven’t used the solar part to recharge the device yet - which was one of the main reasons we bought it - but it also does charge up by plugging it in. Charging cord for the unit is included, just not the adapter which is fine with us, there’s also some lying around. Really like the fact that the cell phone cords are ATTACHED (see pic) to the charger and that there are 3 different types plus a wireless charging pad since we have both iPhones and Samsungs in the family. This way, they can’t misplaced and you can always charge up your phone. It’s heavier and chunkier than expected. It won’t easily fit in your pocket to carry around. Can’t say anything about how long it takes to charge the phone, but did test it out and it works. Also unsure of how long the unit will stay powered, but for our needs, we don’t need days. Feel like it will do a few hours and that’s our minimum. Oh - it’s also a flashlight which is easy to use by cycling through the power button for three different modes. Overall, good buy.

product_name: Solar Charger Power Bank Fast Charging - 30000mAh Portable Solar Phone Battery Panel Charger, QC3.0 Dual USB Port Battery Pack Charger for All Cell Phones & Electronic Devices (Orange)
description: Power bank worked well keeps my 2 ways charged when I'm not near a power supply

product_name: Solar Charger Power Bank Fast Charging - 30000mAh Portable Solar Phone Battery Panel Charger, QC3.0 Dual USB Port Battery Pack Charger for All Cell Phones & Electronic Devices (Orange)
description: There is very little, if anything negative I can say about this product. It's done everything I've wanted to and more!It comes with 3 charging cables for different phone types. I've only used the USB-C and iPhone cables myself, but I assume the micro-USB cable works great too. The wireless charging pad is also quite handy, although it won't charge your phone as quickly as the cables will (which is to be expected).You can charge the device 3 different ways. There's a USB-A and USB-C port and either one can charge the device. To charge it from zero to 100% will take a several hours, but considering the battery size that's to be expected. The 3rd way to charge it is with the solar panel on the front of the device. This is a great feature to have, but it does come with a couple of caveats.Firstly, even if you place the device in direct sunlight on a summer day, the solar charging is pretty slow. It's a small solar panel that can only absorb so much energy at once. So I wouldn't rely on it solely to charge your device while you are on a trip. But if you want to give the battery a little boost while you're outside, it can only help.Second, although it's clearly meant to be in direct sunlight, be careful it doesn't overheat. One time while on a road trip I left it on the dashboard of my car in the sunlight to charge. When I got back to the car later and picked up the charger, it was HOT. I couldn't even hold it for more than a few seconds at a time without burning my hands. I tried turning it on but I couldn't get it to respond. I was worried for a while that I had fried it. But after it cooled down I was able to get it working and it's been fine ever since. But I'm always careful now to not let it get too hot.The battery life on the device is better than I could have hoped for. I can charge my phone from 0-100% 3 or 4 times on one charge. It has fast charging ability and I'm always impressed with how quickly it works. As I stated before, the charging pad isn't as quick, but it's handy if you don't want to plug in.A nice little bonus feature about this charger is the flashlight. It has a strobe light option as well as an SOS morse code feature. I haven't really needed either one (thankfully), but the regular flashlight has come in handy. I went backpacking recently and we were off the grid, hiking through the woods with no trails. We didn't reach our destination before it got dark, and it got DARK. Pitch black, couldn't see a thing. I pulled out the charger and used the flashlight to get us the rest of the way to our campsite. The LED lights are incredibly bright and using it for a while didn't seem to drain much of the battery.Overall I am thrilled with this product and I've already recommended it to a couple of friends. Buy with confidence!

product_name: Solar Charger Power Bank Fast Charging - 30000mAh Portable Solar Phone Battery Panel Charger, QC3.0 Dual USB Port Battery Pack Charger for All Cell Phones & Electronic Devices (Orange)
description: I purchased the Licorne solar charger to accompany me on a 14 day river trip down the Grand Canyon. Being there were no amenities ( electricity, cell service ) on the river, I needed to keep my iPhone charged for the purpose of taking photographs. Unfortunately, I soon discovered that during the most favorable daylight hours, I could not securely attach the device on the Dory boat as we ran the tumultuous Colorado River. Prior to my trip, I did test the solar capacity and discovered that it was very slow to charge and never did completely charge with solar energy. Minus 1 star for that.I was successful at charging the device electrically in my home and from a large battery on the mother ship while on the river. This charge adequately charged my phone ~ 6 times before the device itself needed to be recharged. I was pleased with that performance.The solar charger is well made and waterproof (never challenged that). Weighs about 1# and compact for packing. The 3 different charging cables are a great features as well as the 3 different ports for charging the device. Overall, I would purchase this product again.

product_name: Solar Charger Power Bank Fast Charging - 30000mAh Portable Solar Phone Battery Panel Charger, QC3.0 Dual USB Port Battery Pack Charger for All Cell Phones & Electronic Devices (Orange)
description: This is a fairly large tank of backup power for devices.  LICORNEPros: On the bottom, it comes with 3 short, undetachable common cables for charging phones/devices (Lightning, USB-C, micro USB), then additionally a wireless charger to just set your phone on.  I like that I don't have to find or carry an additional cables just to charge those devices.  It's heavy, but that comes with power it provides.  On the top is a solar shield that assists in charging if you set it in sunlight.  However, you do need to charge it with a power adapter and cable (not supplied).  I use my phone charger and USB-C cable.  Another bonus is the built-in 2-LED lights on one end with 3 different modes.  On the other end is a port cover with 3 ports: a USB 3.0, Micro USB and USB-C.  There is a red power LED on the bottom and 4 blue charge state LEDs on the top.  If you are solar charging, that * LED turns green.  This charger is fantastic for those times you get in a hurry and forget to charge your phone/device or you're out where there's no electricity and you need a bit of power or light.  It's a well made design and it looks good too. They say it's water proof, but I don't intend on tossing it in water.  The water proof might be for times you are hiking or camping and it rains.  It's easy to hold on to and does grip is you set it on a slanted, flat object, with solar facing up.  At just less than $40 it's a great tool to own!Cons:  None so far.At 30000+ mah it believe it's a must have for active people or emergency situations.  Hence, you got to keep it charged for it to be a useful tool.  I keep mine charged, hanging from my go bag.  Never know when you might be without power.

product_name: Solar Charger Power Bank Fast Charging - 30000mAh Portable Solar Phone Battery Panel Charger, QC3.0 Dual USB Port Battery Pack Charger for All Cell Phones & Electronic Devices (Orange)
description: This portable battery pack was everything we could have hoped for, albeit with one minor issue (I’ll explain shortly.) I’ll preface this review by stating we previously purchased a couple of other solar-rechargeable battery packs, neither of which met our expectations. One of the products, while lightweight, required four full days of DIRECT sunlight to achieve a full charge. Anything less than direct sunlight and the pack failed to hold a significant charge. The other pack held a solid charge for a few days, but it was a bit on the heavy side and after a drop of roughly two feet it barely held a charge and eventually stopped working.As for the LICORNE 36800mAh solar power bank, it met all our needs over a week-long hiking trip in Patagonia. We needed only the lightning cable for our iPhones and the USB port for charging our Garmin watches, and occasionally we used the flashlight feature. Taking so many photos with our phones required they be charged every night, as did my wife’s watch (it doesn’t hold a charge like it used to.) We were able to charge those devices every night, and we did so on a single charge of the battery pack (it was fully charged prior to departing for the trek.)The only issue of any concern is the weight of the battery pack. By far the heaviest of the three battery packs we’ve tried, it definitely is something to consider when hiking, especially with a full backpack over uneven, hilly terrain (as experienced in Patagonia). That said, we recognize the weight is a trade-off between its other qualities, including the long battery life, the bright flashlight, the device charging options (via multiple cables and the USB port), and the product sturdiness. And, let’s face it, if you want a battery pack that will carry a substantial charge over several days, you have to expect it to be somewhat heavy.The pros far outweigh the one issue we experienced, but that issue is not enough to rate this product anything less than five stars.

product_name: Solar Charger Power Bank Fast Charging - 30000mAh Portable Solar Phone Battery Panel Charger, QC3.0 Dual USB Port Battery Pack Charger for All Cell Phones & Electronic Devices (Orange)
description: The charger arrived a day early which is always nice.  I put the charger in the sun on the bed of my truck. I leaned against the cab.  I forgot it was there and drove away an hour later.  When I came home it was in the road in front of my house.  It had been ran over a few times.  It worked!!  The flash lights cycled through.  The status lights were a little hard to see but the thing worked.  Buy one or two.  Think how great it will work if you don't let it get run over !!!

product_name: Solar Charger Power Bank Fast Charging - 30000mAh Portable Solar Phone Battery Panel Charger, QC3.0 Dual USB Port Battery Pack Charger for All Cell Phones & Electronic Devices (Orange)
description: This is a great power bank. I cannot tell the exact capacity but it can charge my iPhone 12 three or four times before it's drained. The only con it has so far is solar panel. Left it lying under the sunshine for days but the charge level didn't change. Otherwise pretty good travel power bank.

product_name: Solar Charger Power Bank Fast Charging - 30000mAh Portable Solar Phone Battery Panel Charger, QC3.0 Dual USB Port Battery Pack Charger for All Cell Phones & Electronic Devices (Orange)
Gixxted Open Ear Headphones with Mic, Bluetooth Headset with Microphone, Dual Connect Bluetooth 5.3 Headset with AI Noise Cancelling Mic & Mute Function, Wireless Headset for Work, Sports, Drive
description: I think this was made for a child’s head. When I put it on I thought I could pull the right and left side out to cover my head so I could place the ear pieces around my ears. Instead I pulled one ear piece out and it broke. Pictures shows broken piece and how small it is compared to my hand.

product_name: Gixxted Open Ear Headphones with Mic, Bluetooth Headset with Microphone, Dual Connect Bluetooth 5.3 Headset with AI Noise Cancelling Mic & Mute Function, Wireless Headset for Work, Sports, Drive
description: The headset is amazing. Very light and I don't even feel I'm wearing it. Calls are crisp and clear. I listen to music as I write this review. Perfect headset. Pairing took exactly 5 seconds.The charging cable is magnetic and as shown in the picture the connection is very strong.I am listening music and make phone calls since few hours now and with the original charging they still have plenty of juice left.The boom mic comes right to my mouth and I've been told by the other side they hear me like I'm in their ear, clear and with no distortion.The fit for me is perfect.I'm really happy with my purchase.

product_name: Gixxted Open Ear Headphones with Mic, Bluetooth Headset with Microphone, Dual Connect Bluetooth 5.3 Headset with AI Noise Cancelling Mic & Mute Function, Wireless Headset for Work, Sports, Drive
description: My initial impressions were that this headset is lightweight and comfortable, with a soft, rubbery coating that makes it flexible and easy to wear. After using it for a couple of weeks, I was really impressed with how useful it was, particularly with the noise cancellation on the microphone. People on my calls said they could hear me clearly, which was a great bonus.The speakers are clear, delivering excellent sound without any audio leaking out, though I wish the max volume was slightly higher in noisy environments. The open-ear design is a standout feature, allowing me to hear myself on calls and enjoy music while still being aware of my surroundings, even when driving. I’m confident it would also work great for jogging, though I haven’t tried that yet.Overall, it’s a fantastic product with great sound quality and comfort—definitely recommend it for anyone looking for a dependable headset! And a great price!

product_name: Gixxted Open Ear Headphones with Mic, Bluetooth Headset with Microphone, Dual Connect Bluetooth 5.3 Headset with AI Noise Cancelling Mic & Mute Function, Wireless Headset for Work, Sports, Drive
description: I’ve been using the Gixxted 03 AI Noise Cancelling (ENC) Open Ear Wireless Headset for a few days now, and I’m genuinely impressed. First off, the open ear design is perfect for those who prefer situational awareness while enjoying music, taking calls, or on video conferences. It’s comfortable for extended use, which is a huge plus, especially if you’re on the go or working long hours.The AI-powered ENC technology is phenomenal. The headset cancels out background noise effectively, allowing for clear, crisp audio during calls even in noisy environments. The built-in DSP noise reduction makes a noticeable difference, ensuring that my voice comes through clearly to others on the line.The sound quality is excellent—rich, clear, and well-balanced. Whether I’m listening to music, podcasts, or making calls, the audio is sharp with a great bass response. The battery life is also impressive, lasting me through long days without needing a charge.Overall, this headset has exceeded my expectations in every way. It’s lightweight, stylish, and packed with premium features at a reasonable price. I highly recommend the Gixxted 03 for anyone looking for top-notch sound and noise cancellation without sacrificing comfort or awareness.

product_name: Gixxted Open Ear Headphones with Mic, Bluetooth Headset with Microphone, Dual Connect Bluetooth 5.3 Headset with AI Noise Cancelling Mic & Mute Function, Wireless Headset for Work, Sports, Drive
description: I recently purchased the Gixxted Open Ear Headphones after my last set continually disconnected while I was on conference calls from home, and I must say, I'm thoroughly impressed. I was really impressed with the fit considering I’ve never had an open ear model and was worried they would fall off, but they fit comfortably and are extremely light weight. It took a little getting adjusted to since I’ve been using the over the head models, but after a couple of hours, I didn’t even notice I was wearing them.The audio was excellent and whether I'm on a conference call, listening to music or connected to my iPhone sound reproduction is top-notch.It took less than 2 mons to set-up on both my MacBook and iPhone and I can easily switch between the two without issue. You just need to remember to stop whatever input you are using at the time before switching to the other device (i.e. Stop playing music on Spotify on my iPhone and then connect to Bluetooth on my Mac for the next call).Bluetooth range is impressive, providing a stable connection even when I'm moving around my house from the upstairs office to the kitchen downstairs.Battery life is excellent as well. I’ve only had these for a short time and have not needed to recharge after being on conference calls and listening to music all day long. I’m actually not going to change them until they run out of “juice” to see how long a single charge lasts and will update the review.Overall, I couldn't be happier with my purchase! They offer exceptional sound quality, innovative technology, over the ear comfort, and long battery life, making them a fantastic choice for anyone in need of high-quality wireless headphones. Highly recommended!

product_name: Gixxted Open Ear Headphones with Mic, Bluetooth Headset with Microphone, Dual Connect Bluetooth 5.3 Headset with AI Noise Cancelling Mic & Mute Function, Wireless Headset for Work, Sports, Drive
description: Initial impressions were it was indeed lightweight and comfortable. The whole product has a soft rubbery coating and is completely flexible.After using for a couple weeks, I found them very useful. The noise cancellation on the microphone works well. On calls, others have said they can hear me clearly.The speakers are also very clear and effective; loud to me without audio bleeding to others. Though, the speakers could have greater max volume – I found in a crowded or noisy environment, it can be hard to hear. I really like the open ear design and I found it adds a lot of versatility for this headset. I like being able to hear myself while speaking on calls, and with music, I am comfortable with them even while driving. In fact, though I haven’t tried it yet, I feel they would also be great for jogging.Battery life hasn’t been any issue so far, and bluetooth pairing was no trouble.After about four hours continuous use, I found the band wrapping over my ear becoming uncomfortable.Overall for me, they are lightweight, convenient and versatile, and plus with the quality noise canceling microphone, I find these to be a winner.

product_name: Gixxted Open Ear Headphones with Mic, Bluetooth Headset with Microphone, Dual Connect Bluetooth 5.3 Headset with AI Noise Cancelling Mic & Mute Function, Wireless Headset for Work, Sports, Drive
description: "Absolutely love this Bluetooth headset! The sound quality is top-notch, with clear highs, balanced mids, and surprisingly deep bass for its size. The noise-cancellation feature is excellent, making calls and music sound great even in busy environments. It's super comfortable to wear for hours, and the battery life is fantastic—lasting much longer than I expected. The Bluetooth connection is strong and stable, with no dropouts. Setup was a breeze, and it's stylish too. Definitely a must-have for anyone looking for a high-quality, reliable headset!"

product_name: Gixxted Open Ear Headphones with Mic, Bluetooth Headset with Microphone, Dual Connect Bluetooth 5.3 Headset with AI Noise Cancelling Mic & Mute Function, Wireless Headset for Work, Sports, Drive
description: These Bluetooth headphones are the best headphones ever invented!! They have the best sound and quality for the price! The connectivity is amazing and they have the ability for everything from music and sound design. They’re so soft and comfortable that you won’t even notice them in your ears. The durability of them is so great and they look great on your ears too the noise cancellation is so great too they fit perfectly around your head and they are soft you will forget that you’re wearing them that’s how softy and comfortable they are and you will be happy with them I definitely recommend them!!!

product_name: Gixxted Open Ear Headphones with Mic, Bluetooth Headset with Microphone, Dual Connect Bluetooth 5.3 Headset with AI Noise Cancelling Mic & Mute Function, Wireless Headset for Work, Sports, Drive
description: I have to admit that I was surprised by this headset.  Sound is better than the JBL earbuds I was using. Headset is comfortable. It is lightweight and fits well over my ears.  I am not sure about durability yet. I have not had them long enough for that. The microphone seems flimsy but so far is working well. The headset charged quickly and I had no issues getting it to pair with my laptop. I did some recordings on my laptop and the sound was very clear. Although the charging cable seems to work well, I am not a big fan of it since a universal cable cannot be used. I do wish the control buttons were a tad bit bigger.  Other than that, the headset is quite decent.

product_name: Gixxted Open Ear Headphones with Mic, Bluetooth Headset with Microphone, Dual Connect Bluetooth 5.3 Headset with AI Noise Cancelling Mic & Mute Function, Wireless Headset for Work, Sports, Drive
description: Ok so before I write this review I just wanna get this out of the way: If you are one of the "too long didn't read"(tldr) then stop reading and go back to eating your glue and watching tiktok. For the intellectual people who are willing to commit to reading more than a sentence this reveiw is for you. Okay now that, that is out of the way lets begin.So this product is around $70 which is a hefty price for a hands free headset. "Is the price worth it?" I can hear you asking; and the answer may suprise you.QUALITYLets start with the quality of the bluetooth. I've had the headset for about two to three days now and they have only studdered on me ONCE. You heard that righ, ONCE. It stopped the audio for one second and then went back to playing the audio flawlessly again so its bluetooth conection is really good.BATTERYThe battery life for the headest is also incredible as it hasn't even run low on power; still sitting on 40% or more after a 10 hour work day. So yes its quite impressive. The cord is unique to it however so try not to lose or break it, but even if you do the warranty for cover it. I belive it comes with a life time warranty but you should double check to be sure.MATERIALSo the headset is VERY sturdy, packing over the ear rubber hooks for support. Don't ever worry about it falling off; I work construction and go up and down ladders as well as duck and twist my body in werid angles all the time and it doesn't even budge. I also sweat like a hog all the time and their fine so I'd say their pretty water/sweat RESISTANT. There are only three buttons so the controls are very simple. The only thing complicated could be remembering the button imputs like double tap and holding it briefly.UNIQUE FEATURESOne thing I saw that stood out to me was that even with a hands free headset most cannot handle multiple calls without pulling out your phone but this headset can actually HOLD a call and SWITCH TO THE OTHER CALL and then back to the call that was on hold. Its VERY impressive for a hands free headset and would HIGHLY recomend you give it a try.NEGATIVESThere are two downsides to the product being that it's almost $70 and that the plastic rests on your inner earlobe and can cause it to become sore. The price is steep for a headset BUT if you're not on a tight budget and are looking for a headset for your job then you should REALLY try this.Overall the product is very good. A little pricy, but very good quality and can do things that other headsets can't.

product_name: Gixxted Open Ear Headphones with Mic, Bluetooth Headset with Microphone, Dual Connect Bluetooth 5.3 Headset with AI Noise Cancelling Mic & Mute Function, Wireless Headset for Work, Sports, Drive
description: I have owned this going on 1 week now and so far I am very impressed! I use this about 9 hours per day, and have been for the last 6 days. The speaker clarity is perfect and when compared to my old high-end jabra headset, you can't notice a different in sound quality. The noise cancelling capability also works great! I work from home and have my TV on in the background almost the entire day as well as two smaller dogs. I have asked several times on calls if they could hear the background noise and they aside from some barking when someone knocked on my door, they were able to block all other background noises.Product Quality: In terms of quality, these are super light-weight, much lighter than my old expensive headset, and much more comfortable to wear.Battery Life: I have not hit any low battery message or had the battery die in the nine hours I have used these on average per day. Each day after working I put the headset back on the charger.Recommendations: I know all lithium ion batteries will degrade over time, I wish that this came with either a 4 foot or 6 foot charge cable, especially where it isn't a standard USBC or other standard port. Having additional length, would make it nicer for my setup to charge between calls when/if the battery life begins to decrease.

product_name: 8 Pack Magnetic Cable Clips Desk Cord Organizer, LISEN Cord Holder for Nightstand [Smooth Adjustable] Adhesive Wire Organizer for Cords Under Desk for Home Office Desk Car Wall Desktop Nightstand
description: Small, good looking design, just large enough pad that I am confident that it will stick to a surface and not fall off. Has “LISEN” written across the bar, not obtrusive. The bar that snaps closed is thinner than on other products on offer, and the hole the cable runs through is perhaps a bit larger and that’s all good – less friction for pulling cables through. The magnetic closure holds perhaps 300 grams against gravity – would easily come free if you tugged on a cable.

product_name: 8 Pack Magnetic Cable Clips Desk Cord Organizer, LISEN Cord Holder for Nightstand [Smooth Adjustable] Adhesive Wire Organizer for Cords Under Desk for Home Office Desk Car Wall Desktop Nightstand
description: I like that these are strong enough to feel sturdy when the cables are in, but easy enough to open when needed. Works perfect for my needs. The sticky backing holding well so far.

product_name: 8 Pack Magnetic Cable Clips Desk Cord Organizer, LISEN Cord Holder for Nightstand [Smooth Adjustable] Adhesive Wire Organizer for Cords Under Desk for Home Office Desk Car Wall Desktop Nightstand
description: Very nice low profile clips to keep your cables organized in your car.

product_name: Power Strip with LED Desk Lamp, 3 Outlets 4 USB Ports(2 USBC) 4 Modes 5 Level Touch Lamp Small Desk Lamp for Home Office Bedroom Bedside, Study Reading Light, 5ft Extension Cord, Dorm Room Essentials
description: This lamp has no weight to it whatsoever, so whenever it needs adjusting, it requires both hands. I got it on a lightning deal and for the low price, it’s fine. Two out of three of the modes are very similar, so it’s really just the option between warm and cool light. It’s nice that it can fold up when not in use and the charging ports work well. Because of how lightweight it is, it can get tricky when trying to charge multiple things at once and adjust the angle of the light.If it’s on a significant sale, I’d say scoop it up for an easy, portable light source. Keep in mind though, the cord isn’t very long, so double check if you also need an extension cord.

product_name: Power Strip with LED Desk Lamp, 3 Outlets 4 USB Ports(2 USBC) 4 Modes 5 Level Touch Lamp Small Desk Lamp for Home Office Bedroom Bedside, Study Reading Light, 5ft Extension Cord, Dorm Room Essentials
description: The box containing the light assembly had three partially removed shipping stickers.  The base of the light assembly was missing one of the rubber feet so now it rocks back and forth on my desk.  The old shipping labels makes it  look I bought a used item.  The description prior to sale did not say used or refurbished. This is not a good business  practice and is NOT acceptable.  Please respond.

product_name: Power Strip with LED Desk Lamp, 3 Outlets 4 USB Ports(2 USBC) 4 Modes 5 Level Touch Lamp Small Desk Lamp for Home Office Bedroom Bedside, Study Reading Light, 5ft Extension Cord, Dorm Room Essentials
description: Works well but I don't like that there is no physical button to turn it on and off. I'm just guessing everytime I'm trying to turn it on in the middle of the night. Other than that no issues.

product_name: Power Strip with LED Desk Lamp, 3 Outlets 4 USB Ports(2 USBC) 4 Modes 5 Level Touch Lamp Small Desk Lamp for Home Office Bedroom Bedside, Study Reading Light, 5ft Extension Cord, Dorm Room Essentials
description: You get what you pay for! I wanted a desk lamp for work and this is more like a nightlight. It looks nice and sleek. It’s easy to use, to brighten and dim, but it doesn’t get very bright. I like the appearance of the plugs doesn’t distract. I didn’t return it in time so now I’m using it as a fancy extension cord.

product_name: Power Strip with LED Desk Lamp, 3 Outlets 4 USB Ports(2 USBC) 4 Modes 5 Level Touch Lamp Small Desk Lamp for Home Office Bedroom Bedside, Study Reading Light, 5ft Extension Cord, Dorm Room Essentials
description: Bought this for our son's dorm room to have on his study desk.  You can't adjust, rotate, reposition, or angle the bulb piece of the lamp without the whole lamp tipping over.  The base is lightweight plastic that weighs nothing, so it just falls over if you try to move it with one hand.  If you need to change where the bulb is shining, you have to use two hands - one to hold the base down, the other to swivel the bulb end.  This might be fine if it's right there next to you, but with our son's desk setup up, it was on the bookshelf above, meaning he has to stand and reach and do it with two hands.  Just too inconvenient.  We went to Walmart and bought a metal clamp-on lamp with a bendable metal neck and it's perfect.

product_name: Power Strip with LED Desk Lamp, 3 Outlets 4 USB Ports(2 USBC) 4 Modes 5 Level Touch Lamp Small Desk Lamp for Home Office Bedroom Bedside, Study Reading Light, 5ft Extension Cord, Dorm Room Essentials
description: Okay for brightness /medium- not as much light as I like even on the highest setting, it does get warm. Because the base is light it tips over with mac charger. Great look, great extension cord and outlet, great mobility.

product_name: Power Strip with LED Desk Lamp, 3 Outlets 4 USB Ports(2 USBC) 4 Modes 5 Level Touch Lamp Small Desk Lamp for Home Office Bedroom Bedside, Study Reading Light, 5ft Extension Cord, Dorm Room Essentials
description: Even turned up as far as the light would go. Was not bright at all.

product_name: Power Strip with LED Desk Lamp, 3 Outlets 4 USB Ports(2 USBC) 4 Modes 5 Level Touch Lamp Small Desk Lamp for Home Office Bedroom Bedside, Study Reading Light, 5ft Extension Cord, Dorm Room Essentials
description: The light flickers often, and it gets hot really fast. I don’t know if I’ve just gotten a faulty lamp or something, but I don’t want to buy another one to find out. Save your money.

product_name: Power Strip with LED Desk Lamp, 3 Outlets 4 USB Ports(2 USBC) 4 Modes 5 Level Touch Lamp Small Desk Lamp for Home Office Bedroom Bedside, Study Reading Light, 5ft Extension Cord, Dorm Room Essentials
description: I’ve had it since 4/23 and as of 7/22 it stopped working. I really loved ir but that’s a terrible lifespan.

product_name: Power Strip with LED Desk Lamp, 3 Outlets 4 USB Ports(2 USBC) 4 Modes 5 Level Touch Lamp Small Desk Lamp for Home Office Bedroom Bedside, Study Reading Light, 5ft Extension Cord, Dorm Room Essentials
description: Like the plug inside, thought the lamp was larger than it is

product_name: Power Strip with LED Desk Lamp, 3 Outlets 4 USB Ports(2 USBC) 4 Modes 5 Level Touch Lamp Small Desk Lamp for Home Office Bedroom Bedside, Study Reading Light, 5ft Extension Cord, Dorm Room Essentials
description: Pros:- Adjustable light temp and brightness- Multiple Outlets for powering devices- USB A and C port for chargingCons:- Base is a tad too light to support the weight of the lamp arm when the arm is tilted forward. However, this isn’t an issue if you keep it tilted at 45 degrees or higher, which will be the case most people.- The lamp arm does not swivel, but that’s kind of expected considering how light the base is.Honestly these cons are just me nitpicking. I’m really happy with my purchase so far.

product_name: Power Strip with LED Desk Lamp, 3 Outlets 4 USB Ports(2 USBC) 4 Modes 5 Level Touch Lamp Small Desk Lamp for Home Office Bedroom Bedside, Study Reading Light, 5ft Extension Cord, Dorm Room Essentials
description: Good features and good light - I especially like I can plug other devices into it.

product_name: Power Strip with LED Desk Lamp, 3 Outlets 4 USB Ports(2 USBC) 4 Modes 5 Level Touch Lamp Small Desk Lamp for Home Office Bedroom Bedside, Study Reading Light, 5ft Extension Cord, Dorm Room Essentials
description: Lamp is great. Small and very functional. Great.

product_name: Power Strip with LED Desk Lamp, 3 Outlets 4 USB Ports(2 USBC) 4 Modes 5 Level Touch Lamp Small Desk Lamp for Home Office Bedroom Bedside, Study Reading Light, 5ft Extension Cord, Dorm Room Essentials
Power Strip with LED Desk Lamp, 3 Outlets 4 USB Ports(2 USBC) 4 Modes 5 Level Touch Lamp Small Desk Lamp for Home Office Bedroom Bedside, Study Reading Light, 5ft Extension Cord, Dorm Room Essentials
description: Purchased for my son's dorm room. Not that I had low expectations, but it was surprisingly well designed, innovative and very functional for the price. I like that it has different light modes and the outlets and charging ports are a great feature for a dorm desk. The only thing I might change is adding a little more weight to the base so that it doesn't move when a cord is shifted on the desk. I still strongly recommend it.

product_name: Power Strip with LED Desk Lamp, 3 Outlets 4 USB Ports(2 USBC) 4 Modes 5 Level Touch Lamp Small Desk Lamp for Home Office Bedroom Bedside, Study Reading Light, 5ft Extension Cord, Dorm Room Essentials
description: This little light is just great! It give a lot of light and love that this light also has built in plugs.  Very pleased.

product_name: Power Strip with LED Desk Lamp, 3 Outlets 4 USB Ports(2 USBC) 4 Modes 5 Level Touch Lamp Small Desk Lamp for Home Office Bedroom Bedside, Study Reading Light, 5ft Extension Cord, Dorm Room Essentials
description: I color and needed a small light for my desk. It works great. It is light weight. Just enough brightness for late night coloring.

product_name: Power Strip with LED Desk Lamp, 3 Outlets 4 USB Ports(2 USBC) 4 Modes 5 Level Touch Lamp Small Desk Lamp for Home Office Bedroom Bedside, Study Reading Light, 5ft Extension Cord, Dorm Room Essentials
description: I noticed last night (after having this lamp for a few days) that the top part and the base near the light settings and extra outlets got EXTREMELY hot after it was left on for a while. Like, I touched the top part and literally said "Ouch!" I had the lamp on the brightest setting, so that may have been the reason. I have one set of fairy lights plugged into one of the USB ports, but I can't imagine that made the lamp get hot.

product_name: Power Strip with LED Desk Lamp, 3 Outlets 4 USB Ports(2 USBC) 4 Modes 5 Level Touch Lamp Small Desk Lamp for Home Office Bedroom Bedside, Study Reading Light, 5ft Extension Cord, Dorm Room Essentials
description: Love this little lamp. It's very bright at its highest setting. And just what I needed for my sewing table. I love the multiple charging units and outlets. I am actually quite surprised of the durability of this lamp at this most affordable price. I am ordering a couple more.

product_name: Power Strip with LED Desk Lamp, 3 Outlets 4 USB Ports(2 USBC) 4 Modes 5 Level Touch Lamp Small Desk Lamp for Home Office Bedroom Bedside, Study Reading Light, 5ft Extension Cord, Dorm Room Essentials
description: This is exactly what I needed. Got my phone charger, my tablet and laptop all together and best of all, I put some light on the subject! Can't beat it for the price!

product_name: Soundcore AeroFit 2 by Anker, Open-Ear Headphones, Non-Intrusive Design, Adjustable Comfort, Snug Fit, Rich Bass, Hi-Res Audio, 42H Play, Bluetooth 5.4, Wireless Charging, IP55, Open-Ear Earbuds
description: I received my AeroFit pros almost 2 weeks ago. The sound was actually great, but did not fit secure in my ears so I returned. I saw a newer somewhat updated AeroFit 2 available and it got good reviews online so I decided to go for it. I received Aerofit 2s this morning. One bud will not work at all. I've done all the troubleshooting available to me. I'm just disappointed!! I feel I must return AGAIN!

product_name: Soundcore AeroFit 2 by Anker, Open-Ear Headphones, Non-Intrusive Design, Adjustable Comfort, Snug Fit, Rich Bass, Hi-Res Audio, 42H Play, Bluetooth 5.4, Wireless Charging, IP55, Open-Ear Earbuds
description: These are great. Just as comfy as those bone conducting headphones but sound way way better. Sound is just as good as my buds 3 pro just which is amazing for a out of ear headphones. Controls work perfectly, I'm surprised that I don't have any complaints.Battery and range are top notch too... oh yeah the price is not bad either.

product_name: Soundcore AeroFit 2 by Anker, Open-Ear Headphones, Non-Intrusive Design, Adjustable Comfort, Snug Fit, Rich Bass, Hi-Res Audio, 42H Play, Bluetooth 5.4, Wireless Charging, IP55, Open-Ear Earbuds
description: So I was having a problem with a different soundcore ear bud and there customer service was top notch and they responded quick and took care of the problem and refunded them so I could buy these ones, and these ones are just awesome great sound and great for calls

product_name: Soundcore AeroFit 2 by Anker, Open-Ear Headphones, Non-Intrusive Design, Adjustable Comfort, Snug Fit, Rich Bass, Hi-Res Audio, 42H Play, Bluetooth 5.4, Wireless Charging, IP55, Open-Ear Earbuds
description: Incredible sound

product_name: Soundcore AeroFit 2 by Anker, Open-Ear Headphones, Non-Intrusive Design, Adjustable Comfort, Snug Fit, Rich Bass, Hi-Res Audio, 42H Play, Bluetooth 5.4, Wireless Charging, IP55, Open-Ear Earbuds
description: The Soundcore AeroFit 2  are without a doubt a marvelous pair of Open Ear style headphones.  The design fits over your ear to emit sound ambiently so that you can continue to be aware of your surroundings.  The Soundcore AeroFit 2 has excellent audio quality and sound.  For an Open Ear design, they have worked magic on the music playback.  The Soundcore AeroFit 2 comes with an app that allows so many customizations of EQ, LDAC, and keeping your earbuds firmware up to date.  They are very comfortable and have a great design in wear.  The case is also qi wireless charging and has fast charging to power up your earbuds in 10 minutes.  Overall, an absolute must buy and in my opinion are leading in the Open Ear design language if TWS.  A absolute must buy that I highly recommend.

product_name: Soundcore AeroFit 2 by Anker, Open-Ear Headphones, Non-Intrusive Design, Adjustable Comfort, Snug Fit, Rich Bass, Hi-Res Audio, 42H Play, Bluetooth 5.4, Wireless Charging, IP55, Open-Ear Earbuds
description: I just reviewed another pair of open-ear headphones and found them abysmally incapable of remaining in the ear or producing quality sound.These are exactly the opposite. I had low expectations, but I loved them. They sound awesome. You would think you were wearing a $200 set of Jabras or AirPods or whatever. The sound is that solid and good. These are actually the first open-ear headphones that I would wear as my normal, everyday headphones without complaint. They're that good.  And they hold on well.Open ear have not only had lousy sound in my experience, but also poor volume. These have great volume. Honestly, except for the lack of ANC, these would be my favorite headphones ever, and I've owned and used AirPod Pros, Jabra Elite 10s, JBLs, Sonys and a host of others as a Vine reviewer for Amazon.If you are looking for open ear headphones, don't consider any others. These are the best out there--by FAR. They're fairly amazing.

product_name: Soundcore AeroFit 2 by Anker, Open-Ear Headphones, Non-Intrusive Design, Adjustable Comfort, Snug Fit, Rich Bass, Hi-Res Audio, 42H Play, Bluetooth 5.4, Wireless Charging, IP55, Open-Ear Earbuds
description: The loudest openfit earphones, comfortable, the app is good, sound is good, nothing open ear is better on sound tuning but they not that loud. The best for loud listeners

product_name: Soundcore AeroFit 2 by Anker, Open-Ear Headphones, Non-Intrusive Design, Adjustable Comfort, Snug Fit, Rich Bass, Hi-Res Audio, 42H Play, Bluetooth 5.4, Wireless Charging, IP55, Open-Ear Earbuds
description: I thought my pair was broken when the right earbud suddenly stopped working. Turns out to have been sweat build up by the open speaker. A gentle blowing had that fixed but it's best to use a low hair dryer. Just be aware of that, the Ip55 rating doesn't make it water proof.In short, I love these as they fit wonderfully. Audio is good for open ear headphones, (I gave back my Openrun Pro 2's for these) and I love the low latency mode. It's great with my Nintendo Switch and even COD Mobile on my tablet.Just temper expectations if you're used to traditional earbuds and headphones, audio will be no where near the quality. If you've used bone conducting headphones you'll know what to expect. (Albeit these do sound quite nice all things considered)

product_name: BolaButty Bluetooth Speaker, IPX5 Waterproof Speaker with HD Sound, TWS Pairing, BT5.3, Portable Wireless Speakers for Home/Party/Outdoor/Beach, Electronic Gadgets, Birthday Gift - 2 Pack
description: Great spund for a small portable speaker. Got this to attach to the handle bars of my Harley. It fit nicely with some zip ties.  I was able to hear the music nice and clear going down the road. Hooked up to my phone easily. The battery life on this speaker is amazing much longer than most speakers I have had before

product_name: BolaButty Bluetooth Speaker, IPX5 Waterproof Speaker with HD Sound, TWS Pairing, BT5.3, Portable Wireless Speakers for Home/Party/Outdoor/Beach, Electronic Gadgets, Birthday Gift - 2 Pack
description: So far, I love this speaker! It's has great sound quality, is durable, is easy to use, loud, has a good bass, and is overall a great product for a great price!I was getting overwhelmed trying to find a good speaker that wouldn't cost an arm and a leg. I'm happy I decided to go with this one. I love it.

product_name: BolaButty Bluetooth Speaker, IPX5 Waterproof Speaker with HD Sound, TWS Pairing, BT5.3, Portable Wireless Speakers for Home/Party/Outdoor/Beach, Electronic Gadgets, Birthday Gift - 2 Pack
description: There's nothing I don't like about this purchase. I ordered this morning and got them this evening. The sound is loud enough that I can use and actually hear at my warehouse job. I like that you can easily turn the lights off to save the battery. With a little difficulty, my husband and I figured out how to pair both speakers to my phone at once to where they're both playing. I won't actually be using them to play at the same time. I bought them to use one at a time at full volume at work. Once that one dies I'll use the other one at full volume. ...all in all, it's a great purchase, especially at this cost!

product_name: Jabra Enhance Select 500 OTC Hearing Aids, Audiology Team Care Included, Bluetooth LE Audio & Bluetooth Streaming for Calls, Music, Media (iOS/Android), Nearly Invisible & Comfortable - Gold
description: I ordered from Amazon thinking that it would be the best protection for me because I knew I needed a little time to work through whether this was the hearing aid for me. It didn't seem to be helping enough so I went to an audiologist-which took a little time. This isn't enough of a hearing aid for me. AND NOW I HAVE SPENT 1700. and have to spend another SIGNIFICANT amount. This is not enough of a return window and I am severely disappointed and upset.

product_name: Jabra Enhance Select 500 OTC Hearing Aids, Audiology Team Care Included, Bluetooth LE Audio & Bluetooth Streaming for Calls, Music, Media (iOS/Android), Nearly Invisible & Comfortable - Gold
description: I have tried everything I can to get the  Hearing Aids to work well.  I have adjusted, re-adjusted and adjusted some more to try to get them to work well.  After a lot of frustration, I decided to give up and return them.  Surprise! I missed the return date by 2 days!!! A shorter time than offered by the manufacturer, and something I never expected from Amazon. Guess I'm stuck with an expensive pair of hearing aids that don't work any better the $600 pair my friend bought.

product_name: Jabra Enhance Select 500 OTC Hearing Aids, Audiology Team Care Included, Bluetooth LE Audio & Bluetooth Streaming for Calls, Music, Media (iOS/Android), Nearly Invisible & Comfortable - Gold
description: Be aware!!!  Jabra advertising states that you have a 100 day trial period for returns, I paid for the premium package just for this. Surprise!!! Amazon only offers a 1 month return window, which I never did see when ordering, I’m not saying that Jabra has a bad product, I’m saying they don’t work for me and Amazon and Jabra need to be on the same page.

product_name: Jabra Enhance Select 500 OTC Hearing Aids, Audiology Team Care Included, Bluetooth LE Audio & Bluetooth Streaming for Calls, Music, Media (iOS/Android), Nearly Invisible & Comfortable - Gold
description: Did not work well with Samsung Z Flip4 phone. Had to return

product_name: Jabra Enhance Select 500 OTC Hearing Aids, Audiology Team Care Included, Bluetooth LE Audio & Bluetooth Streaming for Calls, Music, Media (iOS/Android), Nearly Invisible & Comfortable - Gold
description: I was excited about buying these (bought directly from Jabra) based on some of the reviews of the 300 when googling and this was supposed to be even better.  NOPEI gave them my audiologists graph and they preprogrammed for me (I like that they do that).Unfortunately, the higher pitched sounds were VERY tinny.  I contacted them via their app and said what the problem was and then uploaded revised settings.  The higher pitched sounds were even MORE tinny and louder, so much so that they hurt my ears.Maybe the pair they sent me were defective, who knows.  Either way, returned them and I’m back to using my Apple AirPods (programmed for my hearing loss).

product_name: Jabra Enhance Select 500 OTC Hearing Aids, Audiology Team Care Included, Bluetooth LE Audio & Bluetooth Streaming for Calls, Music, Media (iOS/Android), Nearly Invisible & Comfortable - Gold
description: I had these for a month and the right one goes out. I have sent emails and called. You can talk to a supervisor when you call. You literally have to wait on someone to email you back or call you back. The worst customer service I ever seen.

product_name: Jabra Enhance Select 500 OTC Hearing Aids, Audiology Team Care Included, Bluetooth LE Audio & Bluetooth Streaming for Calls, Music, Media (iOS/Android), Nearly Invisible & Comfortable - Gold
description: For years I wore an in-the-ear hearing aid. I thought an over-the-ear aid would interfere with my eyeglasses and not be very secure. Wrong on both accounts. I recently moved and my hearing aids were lost (with several larger things like a sewing machine). I could have returned to the same brand but decided instead to do some research first. Jabra topped the list in all the reviews I read. Jabras are small and easy to put on. They are so comfortable I forget I'm wearing them. Much more comfortable than the in-the-ear brand. Jabra has a nice solid charging case and I don't have to worry about fumbling with battery changes. (My old hands and small objects do not work well together.) The app is great for making sound adjustments and works best for me. I can hear the birds now. I didn't realize I couldn't hear birds until I played back a video I took one morning when I thought there was no sound. I was very aware that I could not clearly understand what people said and had to keep asking them to repeat or speak louder. This gets bothersome quickly for both parties. Jabras are a great investment. I'm not sure why it took 2 weeks from the time I ordered until delivery, perhaps it was a glitch. Look at the payment options and select the one best for you. Paying over time is a good choice and allows you to hear the birds sing.

product_name: Jabra Enhance Select 500 OTC Hearing Aids, Audiology Team Care Included, Bluetooth LE Audio & Bluetooth Streaming for Calls, Music, Media (iOS/Android), Nearly Invisible & Comfortable - Gold
description: They are pricey, but seem to be of good quality and support.  Very important to use the Jabra app to set up and use these. They seem to have a little trouble staying connected to my phone at times. Includes adequate documentation, spare rubber tips, filters and tools in a good sturdy box. Comes with set of large flash cards that will get you up and going in a very short time.Amazon's new (to me) totally automated Customer Service system is awful.  Finally discovered a way to  explain my concerns through the "chat" feature.  Never did I talk directly to a real person.

product_name: Jabra Enhance Select 500 OTC Hearing Aids, Audiology Team Care Included, Bluetooth LE Audio & Bluetooth Streaming for Calls, Music, Media (iOS/Android), Nearly Invisible & Comfortable - Gold
description: A year or so ago, I got sudden hearing loss in my left ear. After seeing my ENT right away and being treated, he wanted to see how my hearing was after a year before deciding on the next step. He was leaning toward cochlear implant, but after my latest test, he wanted me to try a hearing aid. The ones he offers are very expensive so I decided to try over the counter first.I ordered the Jabra hearing aids, and thought they were helping. After the Jabra Audiologist read my test results, without even trying any tuning,  she said I should send them back and go back to my ENT for a higher end hearing aid.That level of honesty is hard to find these days. They could have easily kept my money, especially since I thought they were helping.As far as the hearing aids themselves, they seemed really good. They kept a charge for a long time.

product_name: Jabra Enhance Select 500 OTC Hearing Aids, Audiology Team Care Included, Bluetooth LE Audio & Bluetooth Streaming for Calls, Music, Media (iOS/Android), Nearly Invisible & Comfortable - Gold
description: If you prefer virtual doctor visits over in-person, and like the idea of using an app on your phone to control your hearing aids, this may be a good fit for you.I thought my hearing issues were ‘mild to moderate’. After taking the Jabra online hearing assessment, turns out my hearing loss in one ear was ‘severe’ and the other ‘moderate to severe’. At the recommendation of a friend, I made the decision to give Jabra Enhance a try and it has exceeded my expectations.Highly recommend the premium support option for professional adjustments, as needed. By using their app, they can adjust your hearing aid settings remotely. Convenience and time-saving.Love my Jabra Enhance 500’s!

product_name: Jabra Enhance Select 500 OTC Hearing Aids, Audiology Team Care Included, Bluetooth LE Audio & Bluetooth Streaming for Calls, Music, Media (iOS/Android), Nearly Invisible & Comfortable - Gold
description: Great customer service

product_name: Jabra Enhance Select 500 OTC Hearing Aids, Audiology Team Care Included, Bluetooth LE Audio & Bluetooth Streaming for Calls, Music, Media (iOS/Android), Nearly Invisible & Comfortable - Gold
description: I have moderate hearing loss and have been wearing "behind the ear" style hearing aids for over 20 years. Before I retired, I had excellent insurance that provided a new set of professional hearing aids every 3 years.Since I no longer have insurance, and don't want to spend $6000 on replacement hearing aids, I thought I'd give these Jabre OTC Hearing Aids a try as I've always been impressed with the quality of their headsets.They came nicely packaged with a portable charging base and a full set of supplies. The documentation was well written and easy to follow.The hearing aids are just as compact as my Oticons, though the charging base is a little bulky.They paired easily to my iPhone and after a few adjustments, I got them to sound fairly good, though not quite as good as the Oticons they were replacing.My biggest complaint, and the reason I took away 1 star was the sound quality when streaming phone calls. The people on the other end said I sounded like I was talking in a tunnel. Not encouraging as I spend a fair amount of time on the phone. I have scheduled an appointment with a Jabra representative and will update this review if he is able to do anything to improve the sound quality.

product_name: Jabra Enhance Select 500 OTC Hearing Aids, Audiology Team Care Included, Bluetooth LE Audio & Bluetooth Streaming for Calls, Music, Media (iOS/Android), Nearly Invisible & Comfortable - Gold
description: These hearing aids are not "Plug & Play".  You have to download an app, activate them, connect with bluetooth, etc.  You also have to take an online hearing test, and it is highly recommended (but not required) that you have a consultation by phone with one of their audiologists, which I believe is free, but I never got that far.  You can adjust the volume through your phone on the app, and you can even use them as earphones if you want to listen to music.  The domes are comfortable, and very lightweight.  A lot of hoops to jump through to use them, but considering how expensive hearing aids are, it's not too bad.

product_name: Jabra Enhance Select 500 OTC Hearing Aids, Audiology Team Care Included, Bluetooth LE Audio & Bluetooth Streaming for Calls, Music, Media (iOS/Android), Nearly Invisible & Comfortable - Gold
description: I recently purchased the Jabra Enhance Select 500 OTC Hearing Aids, and I am thoroughly impressed! From the moment I unboxed them, I could see the attention to detail in both design and functionality. These hearing aids are nearly invisible and incredibly comfortable to wear for long periods.The audiology team care included in the package was a fantastic bonus, providing support and personalized adjustments that truly enhance my listening experience. The Bluetooth LE Audio feature allows me to stream calls, music, and media directly to the hearing aids, making conversations and listening to my favorite songs a breeze on both iOS and Android devices.The sound quality is exceptional. I can finally enjoy conversations without straining to hear, and the background noise reduction is impressive. Whether I’m at a noisy gathering or just watching TV, the clarity is remarkable.Overall, I highly recommend the Jabra Enhance Select 500 for anyone seeking a high-quality, user-friendly hearing aid solution. They have significantly improved my quality of life, and I couldn’t be happier with my decision!

product_name: Jabra Enhance Select 500 OTC Hearing Aids, Audiology Team Care Included, Bluetooth LE Audio & Bluetooth Streaming for Calls, Music, Media (iOS/Android), Nearly Invisible & Comfortable - Gold
description: These hearing aids are pretty impressive. They come in a case much like earbuds for charging, they're bluetooth, and the audio is pretty good. Most of all, these hearing aids are hard to see when you're wearing them, making the user feel less self-conscious. They also take up minimal space on and in the ear. They do come with a ton of reading material to get them programmed, but with some patience and probably some assistance, these are at a decent pricepoint and worth the effort.

product_name: Jabra Enhance Select 500 OTC Hearing Aids, Audiology Team Care Included, Bluetooth LE Audio & Bluetooth Streaming for Calls, Music, Media (iOS/Android), Nearly Invisible & Comfortable - Gold
description: These are very pricey compared to what I'm used to at almost $2000, however they're lightweight, feel very high quality, and have great adjustments via the app. Very cool how the Audiology team will adjust and help program them for you included in the price.

product_name: Jabra Elite 8 Active - Best, Most Advanced HearThrough Sports Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds - Comfortable Secure Fit, Military Grade Durability, Active Noise Cancellation, Dolby Surround Sound - Navy
description: UPDATE - The left earbud (and sometimes the right) is failing to charge.  This is a known issue to Jabra that they have failed to correct.  It can be improved by (not making this up) putting a little paper in the inside of the lid and then putting a rubber band around the closed case to ensure contact.  Ridiculous for a $200 set of earbuds. If you buy these get a warranty!———————-I’m a big fan of Apple and have owned many pairs of AirPod Pros and AirPod Pro 2s but they kept falling out of my ears…. I lost one at an airport, dropped more than one in the sink or toilet, etc.  I tried different 3rd party tips that didn’t work much better and compromised either the sound or the ANC or both.So, although I don’t think high-fidelity when I think Jabra , I decided to give these a try.They stay in my f***ing ears!  Hallelujah!  Years of crap sound because the buds never fit properly are over.  Not only do they sound better (because they actually fit) but I can sleep in them, which I do with earbuds every night.The ANC isn’t as good as the AirPos Pros nor is the Spatial Audio but I’ll trade both of those for a secure fitting earbud with very good sound quality.  Although I am not a sound engineer. I am a former professional musician and I have a lot of nice audio gear and speakers and even AirPods Max and these are really really good with pretty flat response but with good quality low end.Big ear hole people rejoice!  Buy these!

product_name: Jabra Elite 8 Active - Best, Most Advanced HearThrough Sports Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds - Comfortable Secure Fit, Military Grade Durability, Active Noise Cancellation, Dolby Surround Sound - Navy
description: I would probably give these 3 stars in earnest just for the very mid sound quality but, whatever, I bought these to sweat in.  They're good enough for the price.  But let's talk about the absolute state of this trainwreck of a case (because I have nothing better to do and need to vent).I keep my earbud case plugged into my laptop on my work desk.  I like a clean desk.  So, personally, I like to my earbud case sitting upright instead of just lobbed to the side like an afterthought.  But can you sit this case upright?  No, because the designers thought a rounded bottom would be perfect for this case, meaning it literally can't stand up.  And even if it did have a flat bottom, these geniuses also thought, "You know what, a charging port on the bottom of the case makes sense."So the case has to rest on its side.  Fine.  At least, from there, the case can be logically opened right?  Wrong!  If the case is resting on the side that shows you the indicator light that they're charged, the case opens into your desk, meaning if you're trying to flip it open with one hand, the case will be inclined to shut on you because of gravity.  So the easiest way to open the case is to position it face down on your desk, meaning when you take the earbuds out you have to remember to now reverse them so that they go to the right ear.You have no idea how much I don't want to be writing all of this right now.  I didn't know it was possible to be annoyed so routinely by the design of an earbud case.  What's most annoying is that my spouse also has a pair of Jabra earbuds and her case is designed the correct way that I assumed all earbud cases were designed.  This case somehow managed to screw up every single design choice that I took for granted as a user.Like I said, though:  Audio's okay.

product_name: Jabra Elite 8 Active - Best, Most Advanced HearThrough Sports Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds - Comfortable Secure Fit, Military Grade Durability, Active Noise Cancellation, Dolby Surround Sound - Navy
description: I have the 7-Active, and have loved them, but the case is not charging well, and quickly losing what charge it has. So I looked for a new case... no luck. The I thought I'd slightly upgrade to the 8-Active. Meh.In spite of the ANC which kind-of works, the buds themselves are transparent to outside sound regardless of eartips. I used Comply foam (which I've been using for years) and sound still penetrated through the buds themselves. This surprised me. The 7's block out sound better than the 8's? It sure seems that way. Maybe more microphones, means more openings for sound to enter. I don't know.Also, the ANC didn't really do that much good in blocking gym music or noise, let alone the monotonous sound of a fan or motor... which it should have.The sound quality is fine, but the noise is a dealbreaker.I will probably return them.

product_name: Jabra Elite 8 Active - Best, Most Advanced HearThrough Sports Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds - Comfortable Secure Fit, Military Grade Durability, Active Noise Cancellation, Dolby Surround Sound - Navy
description: I've had 3 of these ear-buds. All three failed in the right ear after about 3 months. Jabra did send replacements, but for them to fail in the same way and same ear bud, every 3-4 months is a major issue. Each time I mailed it back, I was out of having my earbuds for at least a week or two. I work out with them 3-4 times a week and shower with them, which they should be able to handle. Love them until they don't work.

product_name: Jabra Elite 8 Active - Best, Most Advanced HearThrough Sports Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds - Comfortable Secure Fit, Military Grade Durability, Active Noise Cancellation, Dolby Surround Sound - Navy
description: I like them a lot. They sound well, they have good battery, they're water proof, they charge fast, they fit well.There just one problem, they don't turn off in their case reliably, leading to them often not being charged. These earphones failed the most important thing: being able to put them away and safely assume they're off and charging. But no, I need to check constantly for the next five minutes that they're not connected to my phone via their proprietary app. Sometimes, just one will charge and the other is on till it dies. Its an absolute mess.I want to love these, because they get everything right except the most important thing, that none of us think to check when buying because we all ASSUME they'd get this fundamental aspect right.

product_name: Jabra Elite 8 Active - Best, Most Advanced HearThrough Sports Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds - Comfortable Secure Fit, Military Grade Durability, Active Noise Cancellation, Dolby Surround Sound - Navy
description: Sadly returning these. I had high hopes and was initially impressed with the charging case the headphones themselves. They seem like nice, sleek pieces of hardware but functionality and fit are another story. I lost my Bose sport earbuds (which they don’t make anymore) and am on the hunt for a replacement, which these looked like a good option. However I CANNOT keep these in my ears for the life of me. I’ve tried each size of the rubber ear pieces and with any movement these things wiggle out of my ear. And they CONSTANTLY/randomly pause audio, like the left one literally stops at the slightest movement, and I have to mess with it a bunch to get it going again. The right one too but not as much. And I don’t like that JUST the left will go out and the right will keep playing, and vice versa. It’s frustrating.Also the volume honestly doesn’t go as high as I like it too. I’m sure it’s safer for your ears/hearing but I like earbuds to go a bit louder, especially when running on a treadmill at the gym and trying to hype myself up.The Bose earbuds had a much better grip in my ear and never ever fell out, plus they get louder, and the audio doesn’t stop ever if the left one comes out, only the right. I did adjust the settings for this in the app and it didn’t make a difference. Going to be returning these and try one of the newer Bose models. Sad they didn’t work out.

product_name: Jabra Elite 8 Active - Best, Most Advanced HearThrough Sports Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds - Comfortable Secure Fit, Military Grade Durability, Active Noise Cancellation, Dolby Surround Sound - Navy
description: Having to repeatedly push the call from phone back to earbud was annoying.Any mechanical motor or engine causes intense interference.The battery life was amazing though. Credit where credit is due.The fit was pretty comfortable. Was a little put off by the suede silicone material the used in the charging case. Seemed like it would wear down quickly. I had mine for only a few weeks and it already had bare spots when I returned them.Connection distance to device gives out at around 65ft.Volume was less than where I would wish it to be. Not that it’s not a good thing, but sometimes I want to feel the music.For the price, I would go back to AirPod pro.I went a little more expensive and opted for the Bose ultra, have had them a week now, and so far the only complaint is sometimes the call still kicks back to the phone. Fingers crossed that they get an update to fix it, because the sound on them is amazing.

product_name: Jabra Elite 8 Active - Best, Most Advanced HearThrough Sports Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds - Comfortable Secure Fit, Military Grade Durability, Active Noise Cancellation, Dolby Surround Sound - Navy
description: I use to have jabra 65t elite few years back, I bought this one for the replacement I feel like there wasn’t much of improvement and the noise canceling is not as good as other cheaper earbuds, the most noise canceling is coming from the physical aspect of the earbuds since it’s inside your ears.
