product_name: Jabra Elite 8 Active - Best, Most Advanced HearThrough Sports Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds - Comfortable Secure Fit, Military Grade Durability, Active Noise Cancellation, Dolby Surround Sound - Navy
description: Without ANC on it magnifies outside noise.Easy to connect and comfortable.I was disappointed with battery life with ANC on. For sleep the battery doesn't last all night then the ear buds message me to let me know the battery is low and wakes me up.I'm looking for something I can use on standby without completely blocking ambient noise but not magnifying it either.

product_name: Jabra Elite 8 Active - Best, Most Advanced HearThrough Sports Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds - Comfortable Secure Fit, Military Grade Durability, Active Noise Cancellation, Dolby Surround Sound - Navy
description: I bought these to replace my Jabra Elite 75t that I had for about 4 years before the battery life went and the left bud stopped working. I was really looking forward to this but my biggest issue is that you can hear everything around you with the ANC on. In the 75t I was able to set ANC to high and could hardly hear anything outside. But with these the ANC is non existent. It sounds basically the same as the HearThrough setting. I've tried different ear tips to make sure it's not a seal issue, but it's definitely just not well programmed. I'm strongly considering returning these to try to find an earbud with ANC I can set to muffle everything.If you don't care about ANC, then the general sound quality on these is fine. I think the fit is fine as long as you get the right tip on and find the right placement in your ear. And so far the battery life good in the case and buds.

product_name: Jabra Elite 8 Active - Best, Most Advanced HearThrough Sports Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds - Comfortable Secure Fit, Military Grade Durability, Active Noise Cancellation, Dolby Surround Sound - Navy
description: Every review I read about these said that the 10s were a massive step up from the 8s. Being that I've learned that reviews are 1) very subjective, and 2) tend to push the higher priced/sponsored option, I decided to buy both these and the 10s and experience them for myself.  Here's my experience so far: -Fit- The 8s fit better in my ear than the 10s. Perhaps I should say more snug. I find them both comfortable, but the 8s fit a bit deeper in my ear and feel more secure.  The 10s have a triangular shaped ear tip, so finding the right tip size to get them to seal properly for ANC.  The 8s have a more standard style ear tip, so it's easier to get a seal for me.  The one downside is that there is ever so slightly more of that occlusion effect where it feels like you have something plugging your ears, but its very, very minor compared to my older 75ts.  I regularly worried about the 10s falling out, although they never did.  I never once worried about the 8s, and I knew they were secure always. - Sound - I'll acknowledge that the 10s sound a bit brighter, but they didn't have the same low end fullness that I like in the music that I listen to, that is until I tried the different ear tip sizes.  I found that the 10s were a bit more shrill on the high end, even after I EQ'd them.  The EQ certainly helped.  The 8s had fullness without the harshness, though weren't quite as detailed.  Listening to them side by side, I can certainly say that I heard just a bit more detail in the 10s, but it wasn't such a difference that it felt like a revelation like most of the big reviews were saying.  I could FEEL the music more in the 8s than I could in the 10s.  The 10s may be technically superior, but I liked the 8s better.  The 10s are closer to the AZ60M2, with a slight edge going to those.-ANC-  This was a weird one for me. Typically, I'm able to use the ear tips that come preinstalled as my ear tip size of choice.  With the 8s, I had no problem out of the box.  The ANC was very solid, and actually was among the best I've personally tried (Airpods Pro 2 are still the top dog here IMO, and I have no intention of buying the Sony XM5s or Bose earbuds, so I cannot compare to those).  Initially, I though the 10s ANC was weak.  Once I changed out the tips though, it was much, MUCH better than I'd initially experienced.  In using them side by side, I'd say the ANC is neck and neck, with a slight edge actually going to the 8s.  I'd read a lot of people claiming that the ANC on the 10s were so much better than the 8s, but that has not been my experience at all.  To my ears, they are almost identical.All in all, I really like these.  I thought the difference would be more significant given the price difference, but to me, they are extremely close. The question you have to ask is whether or not those minor differences are worth the price increase.

product_name: Jabra Elite 8 Active - Best, Most Advanced HearThrough Sports Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds - Comfortable Secure Fit, Military Grade Durability, Active Noise Cancellation, Dolby Surround Sound - Navy
description: I recently tried the Jabra Elite 8 Active earbuds, and they deliver great sound quality with impressive features. The audio is rich and clear, making them perfect for music and calls.However, I found them to be a bit too big for my small ears. While they provide a secure fit for others I am sure, I struggled with comfort during extended use. If you have larger ears, these may be perfect for you, but those with smaller ear canals might find them a bit bulky.Overall, I love the sound and functionality, but the fit could be better for smaller ears. If you can try them on first, I’d recommend giving them a shot!

product_name: Jabra Elite 8 Active - Best, Most Advanced HearThrough Sports Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds - Comfortable Secure Fit, Military Grade Durability, Active Noise Cancellation, Dolby Surround Sound - Navy
description: Let me start by saying that I am a fan of able. I am both enough of a fan and old enough to not only remember, but actually owned the Apple Newton. So, I really wanted to love the AirPods Pro 2nd Gen. But, like the first gen, no matter what tip I used, they just would not stay in my ear (my left ear was the main problem). You can see from the pictures that I even tried after market memory foam tips, but to no avail. And they would fall out just sitting at my desk, so forget about working out. As such, I had purchased a pair of Bose SoundSport Its for working out. They stayed in my ears, but were uncomfortable, looked crazy, and I didn't like the stupid wire connect them. I would get sweaty and it would stick to the back of my neck and just make me feel ... gross. So, I purchased the Jabra Elite 8 Actives because virtually everyone said they stayed put no matter how strenuous the workout was. And I am so happy to report that they absolutely do stay in my ears. I do have different size tips, one is medium and the other small, but that is really more for comfort. Really, they stayed in no matter which size tip I attached. For me, that was the most important thing, and they did not disappoint.However, I know other people may expect more out of them than just that they stay put. So, let me address a few things you might be interested in. First, the ANC is good, and if I hadn't had the AirPods Pro for a week before I got these, I'm sure I would have said it was top notch! But Apple really has done an incredible job with that H2 chip and ANC. The thing is, though, that I have a set of Bose over-ear QuietComfort IIs, that I wear on airplanes and such. Point being, that no earbuds are ever going to be able to touch those. And for daily wear, riding on a bus, or walking down the street, the AirPods were better, but not so much so that it was a deal breaker. Along similar lines, the HearThrough feature was definitely good, but once again Apple had the edge with its Conversation Awareness. However, I actually ended up turning that feature off when wearing the AirPods because I am a bit of a singer (I don't mean I'm good, I'm horrible, but that doesn't stop me from belting out the lyrics along with the artist). The singing would cause C.A. to kick in and the volume would drastic lower and outside noise would be let in. I know it may not so like much, but it is bad enough that the artists get the lyrics wrong every now and again when I am signing, to have C.A. wrecking it further was just too much. Transparency mode was very similar to HearThrough, both of them allowed enough of the outside world in that you feel safe running with it on, you don't have to run with just a single bud in (though both the Jabras and the AirPods support it).In terms of music quality, they are both very very good. I am not an audiophile so I can't tell you about the lows and the highs (well, I could, but I would just be making something up). So, when I say they were both very very good, I mean that sitting on a bus with ANC on and my music turned up, made me feel like I could have been at a venue somewhere with the artist on stage. But, for around $200, they both should sound pretty darn good, so it is no surprise that they do.Finally, if you are like me and virtually all your electronics are from Apple, then the AirPods are wonderful in terms of bouncing from device to device depending on what is happening. For instance, I could be surfing the net and watching a YouTube video on my MBP with the AirPods connecting to the computer. Well, if a got a phone call, and answered it, the sound would automatically jump from the MBP to the iPhone. And again when I was done with the phone call, it would jump back to the videos. This is a really cool nice feature that you definitely miss out on with the Jabras.With all that said, I know it seems like the AirPods beat out the Jabras in virtually every way. But there are a few things to keep in mind. First, the Jabras had better battery life than the AirPods. And that is important to someone like me, who spends almost all day at a computer screen with earbuds in. Second, while Apple did win, the differences weren't so incredible that I felt like I was dealing with an inferior product when I put the Jabras in. The only time it was noticeable was when I was trying to compare them and was going back and forth to hear the difference. Both of them are extremely capable earbuds and I think anyone would be happy to receive either of them as a gift. Also, the Jabras are much more durable. You can actual submerge them in up to (I think) 5 feet of water. Bluetooth won't work under water, so you can't swim with them, but they would survive a couple laps in the pool if you were so inclined.The last thing I would like to talk about is the touch controls. I never liked the touch controls on the AirPods, and the new volume by rubbing up on the little stalk was no exception. I found it didn't work all that well, and was just as likely to accidentally pause the song as I was to actually raise or lower the volume (which is what I was attempting to do). In truth, It was such a problem for me that after the second day I would just ask Siri to raise or lower the volume by 15% (or whatever). So, I much preferred the solid feeling "buttons" on the Jabari's, and I actually used those controls. Though, I had gotten used to using Siri to mess with the volume that I carried that over to the Jabras. Especially since it is much quicker to say, 'Sire, raise the volume by 10%" than it was to remember which side I was supposed to touch for raising the volume. To say nothing of actually holding the button down for a full second to start the volume change.In the end, I needed my earbuds to be able to. stay with me while I wailed on my pecks, and the AirPods just weren't up for the challenge. So, as much as I love Apple products, I returned the AirPods and kept the Jabras. This was made easier by the fact that I still had a pair of AirPods Pros 1st Gens. Sure the ANC is not as good, nor is the battery life. However, they are able to switch quickly from MacBook to iPad to iPhone and back again. That ability was the only feature that I felt I would really miss out on if I gave up the Pods. And with the 1st Gens able to do it, there was no contest. The AirPods went back to Best Buy, while the Jabras stayed in my ears.Oh, speaking of that, also I did want to mention that I found the Jabras to be incredibly comfortable. I often wear them all day, and I barely notice they are there. With the AirPods, since they don't stay in my ears, it was a constant struggle. And since I wanted them to stay in, I would sometimes push them in too far, or twist them around in weird ways with the result being ears that felt abused. And still the AirPods would fall out.

product_name: Jabra Elite 8 Active - Best, Most Advanced HearThrough Sports Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds - Comfortable Secure Fit, Military Grade Durability, Active Noise Cancellation, Dolby Surround Sound - Navy
description: So far is the best in ear noise canceling I have used.  Only ear buds I have had that allow me to mow lawn and be able to listen to what I want.  Also a very comfortable fit.

product_name: Jabra Elite 8 Active - Best, Most Advanced HearThrough Sports Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds - Comfortable Secure Fit, Military Grade Durability, Active Noise Cancellation, Dolby Surround Sound - Navy
description: I tried several upscale earbuds before settling on these Jabra Elite 8's.  They sound fantastic and though I can say some of the other brands sound a little bit better but all have really annoying controls that are hard to master.  The Jabras do one thing that the other never do and that is definite feedback when you select a function.  They use a physical button on each side that is covered by a waterproof silicone that gives you a clear detent when  it is pressed.  So you aren't ever trying to figure out where to press or pressing by mistake while looking for that "sweet spot" on a touch sensor.  In addition... you can actually turn these off without putting them in the case.  Just a short press on each and they sound a tone and turn completely off if you want to save the battery.  Turning them on is just as easy.  All other functions are clear and intuitive.  You can also configure different presses to do different things if you want.  I exercise in these often in a very hot climate and no issues with sweat.  I even shower with them and no problems at all.  I've used these for several months now and I consider them the best I've ever hand for for active earbuds.  You may have better results if you are just going to wear them around the house but if you are like me, frustrated by touch controls, I think you'll love these Jabras.

product_name: Jabra Elite 8 Active - Best, Most Advanced HearThrough Sports Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds - Comfortable Secure Fit, Military Grade Durability, Active Noise Cancellation, Dolby Surround Sound - Navy
description: I used to be a Samsung headphone person and was really nervous to make the switch to these headphones but I am glad I did! They do such a great job at locking out the town and they are super comfortable as well as stay in my ears really well. Plus I don't have to worry about if my sweat bumps the headphone while working out and stopping my music like it did with my Samsung headphones.  I have used them for a couple weeks now and probably only charged them once. They do have a little issue with connecting to my phone, at least one headphone does but I just put it back in the case and it works again. The battery life is awesome and it is super lightweight!

product_name: Jabra Elite 8 Active - Best, Most Advanced HearThrough Sports Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds - Comfortable Secure Fit, Military Grade Durability, Active Noise Cancellation, Dolby Surround Sound - Navy
description: First, off, I'm a Jabra fan. I love their products. I've owned no less than six Jabra products since 2018. They've forced me off of the workout buds for years, due to them going away from wings (the Jabra sport was the best bluetooth gym headphones of all time - RIP) and the promise of earbuds staying put with better coatings has typically eluded the reality of my experience.  These are the closest to having an ear wing or over ear hook. Whatever is about the shape of my ear canals, all headphones eventually get pushed out - worse with my left ear, but honestly it's both. I tend to only go with workout buds that have one of the above options. However, after a horrific experience with the 4's, I decided to try these. The verdict is that the Jabra 8 is almost great, but it still could use a wing. They stay in my ears better than any non-winged earbuds ever have, but they have two problems. 1) Not enough tip sizes. If you're going to force me into this style, at least give me multiple tips. My ears are tweeners. The large is a touch too big and the mediums let just enough sweat in on a really hard workout to push the buds out. 2) No fast forward!The sound is excellent. It can sometimes feel like you're listening to music/podcasts in a room full of pillows rather than a stadium but that's cool. The noise cancelling is not perfect but cuts out 3/4's of the noise in most environments. I still haven't totally mastered the headset controls. Maybe they're inconsistent, or my taps are but I don't always get the desired result when I double-triple-long tap to access a function I'm looking for.They're wearable for hours, with little to no discomfort. Certainly a well made device that fits well with an active lifestyle. I'm always in earbuds, and these serve multiple purposes for me. So, the versatility is great.If you happen to get them wet, then wait until they're fully dry to make a call. Something gets into the microphones and people can't hear you. If you're in a noisy environment, you'll be heard but so will your background. So, if you work in a busy office or outside then you may need a different option to reduce the noise.Overall, as Jabra is known for, a great set of earbuds, but come on Jabra...hook a brotha' up with some ear wings!

product_name: Jabra Elite 8 Active - Best, Most Advanced HearThrough Sports Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds - Comfortable Secure Fit, Military Grade Durability, Active Noise Cancellation, Dolby Surround Sound - Navy
description: First off, I love Jabra. I have the 75t and purchased the Elite 8 active with the intention of using it for swimming laps. The website advertises it as water proof. I tested it today, and by the second lap I started getting a high pitched squealing in the right ear phones, even though I had my swim cap covering them completely. I took them off, and a few minutes later I had clear sound again. They worked great for water running and kick board work. Just don't submerge them lap swimming. Sound is excellent!

product_name: Jabra Elite 8 Active - Best, Most Advanced HearThrough Sports Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds - Comfortable Secure Fit, Military Grade Durability, Active Noise Cancellation, Dolby Surround Sound - Navy
description: I am a marathon runner and recently had to purchase his product to replace my elite Active 75T headphones prior to the Berlin marathon.  My 75T headphones had stopped working. This was the third time the 75T headphones had stopped working over the course of the past three years. Most users would know that the 75T has these issues and often times it to find a replacement bud post warranty.I had to buy it soon rather than wait for this product to be out as my marathon was coming up in a week.  This is an early review as it has only been several weeks.  I also purchased it before the $20 price drop.I have used products from different companies, but prefer the in the ear styling without any ear hooks or adapters. I also like the strong bass sound and quality that these headphones provide.Pros1.  Secure fit in ear, smaller than the 75t but the elite 8 felt more secure than the 75t.  I2.  Prefer the Elite 8 design, and the clicking button is invisible.3.  Great sound for in the ear buds.  Base sounds great as expected.  I feel the quality of sound is better.4.  ANC (noise cancellation) works much better.  It worked great during airplane ride.  In the 75t I could not tell the difference between off and ANC but can tell with the Elite 8.5.  Durable:  I ran a whole marathon (just over three hours) and had no issues.  I threw water over myself and headphones had sweat and water and still worked well unlike the 75t that would cut out with water splash.6. Spatial audio is unique and probably more a personal thing and so won’t review that.Cons1.  Hear through:  every time I used it during a run it would go into off mode after a few minutes.  I would have to take a bud out of my ear and reinsert it for it to reset.  It could be a software issue.  It has less static than the 75t.  There were no issues when just sitting or light activities but that’s not why you get “active” model.2.  Off mode better for running.  ANC was actually noisier like wind noise and off mode made it better.  Hear through wasn’t working well during runs, so that may be significant issue.  I saw another review mentioning this and hope it can be resolved.Overall I enjoy the design and fit of the Jabra.  I was happy that sweat and water during a marathon did not affect the sound.  It stayed secure during a 3 hour run.I am looking forward to see how the durability is because the 75t was horrible.  The sound and fit is why it was worth the hassle.  It is an upgrade but I assume most 75t will switch when their headsets fail.  The four stars are more for the price and hear through issues when running.

product_name: Jabra Elite 8 Active - Best, Most Advanced HearThrough Sports Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds - Comfortable Secure Fit, Military Grade Durability, Active Noise Cancellation, Dolby Surround Sound - Navy
description: I generally thought the size of the overall buds was okay, though a bit on the large size. They stayed in my ears pretty well but feel the tips could be better designed because, unusually for me, I required the largest tips to get even halfway decent ANC but then the buds weren't completely stable in my ears. Using the smallest tips, I couldn't dislodge the earbuds no matter how much I crazily shook my head, jumped around etc. The medium tips seemed similar--even though didn't feel as stable, they stayed in. The large tips allowed the buds to fall out without even doing anything too goofy. However, ANC with the small and medium tips was lousy and only slightly better with the large tips.I liked the sound quality of these earbuds a lot, at least when in a quieter environment where I could enjoy it without ANC. I also think the battery life is very good--I wouldn't mind the buds having slightly longer battery life so they'd last for an entire cross-Atlantic flight--but that isn't a deal breaker. My main use would be at the gym or when running or working outside, so top priorities are good ANC, durability and decent sound. These certainly have the durability but being unable to get a good enough seal from the tips for good ANC, therefore unable to get good sound quality at the gym, is a deal breaker (I don't expect fantastic sound quality at the gym but good enough to hear music well and enjoy it). I would probably have been comfortable keeping these earbuds if they had fins for stabilizing them in your ear but, as they are now, I had to return them--the issue with falling out using the large tips, along with poor ANC unless wearing those tips is too much plus, when compared to other earbuds that fit well, the other earbuds had slightly better ANC. Obviously, my problems are mostly due to the shape of my ears and I would recommend these otherwise.

product_name: ORICO Extension Cord, Flat Extension Cord with 8 Outlets 3 USB Ports (1 USB C), Ultra Thin Flat Plug, Wall Mount, White Extension Cord 15 feet with Multiple Outlets for Home Office, Dorm, White(15FT)
description: The value proposition of this power strip is limited.On the positive side, its flat profile allows for placement in narrow outlets, and its compact square shape makes it easy to conceal. Additionally, the product includes a guide for wall mounting.However, there are several drawbacks. The spacing between the eight outlets is insufficient to accommodate bulky power adapters, rendering some of the outlets unusable. The discrepancy between the product images and the actual cord is misleading, and the quality of the wire feels inferior to competing brands and even to power strips purchased in the Philippines, which typically feature thicker round cord that convey a sense of higher quality.Furthermore, the absence of a power indicator light is an inconvenience, as users must either check the switch or plug in a device to verify that the power strip is turned on. This is particularly problematic for those who routinely turn off their power strips when not in use to save on their electricity bill.Finally, the power output of the USB ports is restricted, allowing only small devices like controllers and headphones to be charged, as they do not require significant amperage.

product_name: ORICO Extension Cord, Flat Extension Cord with 8 Outlets 3 USB Ports (1 USB C), Ultra Thin Flat Plug, Wall Mount, White Extension Cord 15 feet with Multiple Outlets for Home Office, Dorm, White(15FT)

description: Just what I need to condense my space. Like weight and easy to use

product_name: ORICO Extension Cord, Flat Extension Cord with 8 Outlets 3 USB Ports (1 USB C), Ultra Thin Flat Plug, Wall Mount, White Extension Cord 15 feet with Multiple Outlets for Home Office, Dorm, White(15FT)
description: This is my favorite outlet/extension cord in the house. It has openings for every kind of port. Just get it, it'll make everything easier.

product_name: ORICO Extension Cord, Flat Extension Cord with 8 Outlets 3 USB Ports (1 USB C), Ultra Thin Flat Plug, Wall Mount, White Extension Cord 15 feet with Multiple Outlets for Home Office, Dorm, White(15FT)
description: This is a great power strip/extension cord so far. Lots of convenient connectors, and it is arranged in a way that you can plug in those big blocky plugs without interfering with the other plugs which is nice. I haven't really used the USB ports on it, so I can't speak to them, although 15W (5V/3A) on the USB-C port is kinda disappointing, I was hoping for up to 20V/60W.The arrangement of plugs does make for an awkward wiring job, when you have devices plugged into it on nearly every side, its easy to end up with spider webs of cords going every which way, so I would not recommend this for a desk setup. It is nice for general extension cord, but not for a permanent setup where cable management is important.

product_name: ORICO Extension Cord, Flat Extension Cord with 8 Outlets 3 USB Ports (1 USB C), Ultra Thin Flat Plug, Wall Mount, White Extension Cord 15 feet with Multiple Outlets for Home Office, Dorm, White(15FT)
description: Discovering the ORICO White Extension Cord has been a real game-changer for me, offering a blend of versatility, durability, and smart design that meets all my power needs. Featuring 8 outlets and 3 USB ports (including 1 USB-C), it effortlessly handles charging multiple devices and powering my workstation without overcrowding. The angled plug saves space, and the generous outlet spacing accommodates various plug sizes, including those with bulky adapters. While it lacks surge protection, it's still reliable for everyday use, especially with the USB ports providing convenient charging options. The extension cord's robust construction and sleek white design blend seamlessly into any environment, ensuring both functionality and aesthetic appeal. It's particularly reassuring that the USB ports employ intelligent charging technology, optimizing power output safely.Moreover, the 25 ft length offers unparalleled flexibility, allowing me to configure my workspace or entertainment setup without constraints. The unit's solid build, sturdy plastic housing, and well-attached cord enhance its durability and usability. Despite my preference for an additional USB outlet, the ORICO extension cord remains one of the best I've used, ideal for anyone needing reliable, efficient, and flexible power management solutions.

product_name: ORICO Extension Cord, Flat Extension Cord with 8 Outlets 3 USB Ports (1 USB C), Ultra Thin Flat Plug, Wall Mount, White Extension Cord 15 feet with Multiple Outlets for Home Office, Dorm, White(15FT)
description: As someone who always seems to be in need of extra outlets and USB ports, discovering the ORICO White Extension Cord was a game-changer for me. This 25 ft marvel of modern convenience has truly transformed the way I manage power in my space, earning every bit of its 5-star rating.First and foremost, let's talk about versatility. With 8 outlets and 3 USB ports (including 1 USB-C), this extension cord has all my power needs covered. Whether it's charging multiple devices simultaneously, powering up my workstation, or setting up a temporary entertainment center, this cord has never left me scrambling for more sockets.Durability is another standout feature of the ORICO extension cord. The sturdy construction and high-quality materials ensure that it can withstand the rigors of daily use without any signs of wear and tear. I've had mine for several months now, and it still looks and functions like new, a testament to its longevity.One of the aspects that truly sets this extension cord apart is its sleek and minimalist design. The white color seamlessly blends into any environment, while the compact size ensures it doesn't become an eyesore or take up unnecessary space. It's the perfect blend of form and function.But perhaps the most impressive aspect of the ORICO extension cord is its intelligent charging technology. The USB ports automatically detect the optimal charging output for each device, ensuring fast and efficient charging without any risk of overloading or damage. It's peace of mind knowing that my devices are in safe hands.Last but not least, the 25 ft length of this extension cord provides unparalleled flexibility and freedom. Whether I'm working in a small office or a large conference room, I never have to worry about being tethered to a single outlet. The extra length gives me the freedom to arrange my workspace exactly how I want it, without any compromises.In conclusion, the ORICO White Extension Cord is a must-have for anyone who values convenience, efficiency, and reliability in their power solutions. With its versatile functionality, durable construction, sleek design, intelligent charging technology, and generous length, it's a 5-star product in every sense of the word. Highly recommended!

product_name: ORICO Extension Cord, Flat Extension Cord with 8 Outlets 3 USB Ports (1 USB C), Ultra Thin Flat Plug, Wall Mount, White Extension Cord 15 feet with Multiple Outlets for Home Office, Dorm, White(15FT)
description: This is a solid, well-made, and thoughtfully designed power “strip” that works well for computer-related needs, media/TV setups, and overall - wherever you want a lot of plugs - and plug options. The unit itself is made of super sturdy high quality plastic, and the cord is strong, flexible, and really well attached to the unit and the end-plug.I LOVE the options it has for cords - all of the outlets on the top face “out” AND they’re spaced a bit further apart than many, so you can plug in almost any electronic and style/size/orientation of electronic - 2-prong, 3-prong, the ones that go sideways, the long ones, etc. Aside from having a lot of outlets (8 standard!), the fact that there are four on the sides (total - and those are 2-prong) is fantastic, and offers even more flexibility. Of course it also has USB outlets - two standard and one USB-C… I love that, but the only thing I’d say would improve this is to add at least one more USB outlet… preferably one more B and one more C. That's a very small "want" though, and altogether it’s one of the best I’ve had/used and I would definitely recommend it.

product_name: ORICO Extension Cord, Flat Extension Cord with 8 Outlets 3 USB Ports (1 USB C), Ultra Thin Flat Plug, Wall Mount, White Extension Cord 15 feet with Multiple Outlets for Home Office, Dorm, White(15FT)
description: The ORICO White Extension Cord is a versatile and reliable power solution for both home and office use. With its 25 ft long cord, 8 outlets, and 3 USB ports (including 1 USB C), this power strip offers ample space for all your electronic devices while ensuring they stay powered and charged.One of the standout features of this extension cord is its impressive capacity and flexibility. The 8 outlets allow you to plug in multiple devices simultaneously, including laptops, desktop computers, printers, lamps, and more. Additionally, the 3 USB ports provide convenient charging options for smartphones, tablets, and other USB-powered devices.The inclusion of a USB C port is a particularly useful feature for modern devices that support fast charging. Whether you're charging your phone, tablet, or other USB C devices, this extension cord has you covered.Safety is paramount, and the ORICO extension cord comes equipped with overload protection to safeguard your devices against power surges and fluctuations. The built-in surge protector helps prevent damage to your electronics, giving you peace of mind.The long 25 ft cord ensures that you can reach distant outlets without the need for multiple extension cords or adapters, providing greater flexibility in arranging your workspace or living area. The white color of the cord adds a sleek and modern touch to any environment, seamlessly blending into your décor.Furthermore, the ORICO extension cord is constructed with high-quality materials, ensuring durability and long-lasting performance. The sturdy design and well-built construction make it a reliable choice for everyday use.In conclusion, the ORICO White Extension Cord 25 ft is an essential power accessory that offers convenience, safety, and versatility. With its multiple outlets, USB ports, and overload protection, it's the perfect solution for powering all your devices while keeping your space organized and clutter-free.

product_name: ORICO Extension Cord, Flat Extension Cord with 8 Outlets 3 USB Ports (1 USB C), Ultra Thin Flat Plug, Wall Mount, White Extension Cord 15 feet with Multiple Outlets for Home Office, Dorm, White(15FT)
description: Pretty standard basic power strip.  The angled power plug is always welcome to save some room.  Outlet spacing is good, so you won't have covered and unusable ports, and there are a couple of two-prong outlets on the side for wall warts.  Lack of surge protection isn't great, so be mindful of what you're plugging in, or when.  The USB slots are nice, but not high-powered for fast charging; that's ok for overnight or longer use though.  All in all, a pretty good strip.

product_name: ORICO Extension Cord, Flat Extension Cord with 8 Outlets 3 USB Ports (1 USB C), Ultra Thin Flat Plug, Wall Mount, White Extension Cord 15 feet with Multiple Outlets for Home Office, Dorm, White(15FT)
description: This review is for the "10 ft Extension Cord, ORICO Flat Extension Cord with 8 Outlets 3 USB Ports (1 USB C), Ultra Thin Flat Plug, Wall Mount, Long Extension Cord with Multiple outlets for Home, Office, Dorm Room, White" that I received via the Vine program.This is an okay quality extension core with multiple things going for it. It has a nice long flat cord terminated with a flat 45-degree plug. This makes it perfect for plugging in behind furniture or anywhere access to the plug is minimal while still having a long enough extension to get the business end out in the open. The plugs are arranged so that USB and other power blocks can be easily supported without running together. The USB plugs are a nice addition as well these days.There are a few design choices that keep this from being a 5-star device. These days, devices are becoming more and more power hungry, and the USB ports are not particularly powerful, nor do they support any of the usual fast charging capabilities. They'll do fine for low power devices or times when charging speed isn't a priority.The power plugs are nicely spaced apart from each other, but to get full use of the device, cords and plugs will come out of all but the one end of the device. This means that there is no way to neatly route cables from the plugs to their associated devices and the device with cords will take up quite a bit of space. A better design choice, in my opinion, would have been to extend the device and put two more plugs on top and forego the side plugs.Even with the above issues, this is still a solid device for desktop or around the house extension cord duties and I have the perfect place for it, so it will be put to good use.

product_name: ORICO Extension Cord, Flat Extension Cord with 8 Outlets 3 USB Ports (1 USB C), Ultra Thin Flat Plug, Wall Mount, White Extension Cord 15 feet with Multiple Outlets for Home Office, Dorm, White(15FT)
description: This power strip has a very flexible cord with seemingly no memory.  I love that!  The plug is very close to the wall so it would be great for any tight outlet or where you have some furniture right in front of it.  The spacing of the 2 slot outlets on the sides is very useful for all those power bricks that you inevitably have.  In my case, I wasn't able to use any of the built in USB outlets as all the things I have in my media center that use them are switched and this strip wound up being before the switched one.  I took a before and after picture and although both seem like a cluster, you'll have to trust me that it's way better now with this strip.  I can at least get in there without having to untangle spaghetti mess of wires.Only issue I had with it was that they only supply 1" mounting screws which are too long to use in most cabinet scenarios (don't want the screw going all the way through the panel).  That is a bigger problem than you would expect because the slots on the back of the power strip are so shallow that no common screw has a head thin enough to let the strip slide onto the screw.  I have a huge pile of hardware and it was really challenging to find shorter screws that would work.  They really should supply these with the strip and for that I'm deducting 1 star from the rating.  If you are not planning on mounting it, it's a 5 star product.  They do provide a sticker for mounting template, which was really nice.

It's easy to set up, connecting seamlessly via Bluetooth to its intuitive app, offering diverse customization options. The print quality is crisp and durable, suitable for various surfaces. It boasts an impressive battery life, lasting weeks on a single charge. With its competitive pricing and efficient features, it provides excellent value for money. Ideal for home or office use, the Lopevi Label Maker is a reliable choice for anyone needing a versatile labeling solution. Highly recommended for its convenience and quality.

product_name: lopevi Label Maker - Portable Thermal Label Printer, Bluetooth Shipping Label Printer,Mini Sticker Printer, Storage and Packaging Note for Office Organization,School,Home with 2 Rolls Paper
description: Don't let this printer's cute size and color fool you -- this thing is actually a pretty nifty thermal printer! The mobile app (iOS and Android) contains tons of templates for printing just about anything including barcodes, mailing labels, QR codes, ingredients labels, and more. You can also create your own templates with the app. The printer comes with two rolls of white thermal labels to get you started (one larger and one smaller), but rolls in other colors are available. Whether you want to label everything in your cabinets or crank out mailing labels, this thing will do it. We've started using it to create price labels for our retail shop and not only is it faster and easier but they look so much nicer than our old ones. We cab literally toss this in the pocket of our pants and print labels for new merch at the shop using our phones. Once you get started using it, you'll be addicted!

product_name: Eneloop Panasonic BK-4MCCA6BA AAA 2100 Cycle Ni-MH Pre-Charged Rechargeable Batteries, 6-Battery Pack
description: This is not my first pack of these Eneloop batteries by Panasonic. But as time has gone on, and things in our house run out of power with traditional batteries, I've changed over to these. So I ended up needing some more as the holidays arrive.These come fully charged via solar power which is awesome. They are easy to use, easy to charge and last a long time in our devices. they will have a very long lifetime, heck they will probably outlast me.They are more expensive, but if you read reviews on any other battery they will compare it to these, and for good reason, these set the bar, they are the golden standard to measure other by, so unless you simply can't afford them, then buy something else, otherwise buy these and be happy.

product_name: Apple Watch SE (2nd Gen) [GPS 40mm] Smartwatch with Starlight Aluminium Case with Starlight Sport Band S/M. Fitness and Sleep Trackers, Crash Detection, Heart Rate Monitor, Retina Display
description: Got for the exercise capabilities and because Fitbit was so bad. This device might be worse. If I take less than 20 steps no data will be recorded. This is an issue in my field where I chunk in ten to twenty steps several times within a minute.The workout app always self pauses.  I turned self pausing off and but I’m always hearing”work out paused”. Not very intuitive to use. I’ve been turning the device off to end workouts if it hasn’t ended the work out already from self pausing.Next to impossible to use their scribble board to type especially passwords.The less than “ Smart Stack” is impossible to edit. I’ve removed pictures from it several times only for it to be right there a few hours later. Suggesting I view photos… on a watch.I have not had a good start to this experience. Most everything is hard to use or glitchy. Will update if I find this more user error.Watch does tell time well. If it can handle the time change then it will have raised the bar from my Fitbit that could really only tell time until time change.I can’t download music to the device. Wouldn’t matter anyway. Constantly signs me out of Apple Music. Not integrated well at all. Not getting the point of this device. Lowered rating upon further use.

product_name: Apple Watch SE (2nd Gen) [GPS 40mm] Smartwatch with Starlight Aluminium Case with Starlight Sport Band S/M. Fitness and Sleep Trackers, Crash Detection, Heart Rate Monitor, Retina Display
description: I decided to get this watch while it was on sale during prime days to see if I’d even like an Apple Watch and if I found it more convenient for monitoring my Dexcom. I’ll say I love the watch and works great! It’s easy to use and makes everything super convenient not having to constantly check my phone. The only downside is the battery does not last and I find myself charging it twice a day, upside is it doesn’t take terribly long to charge it.

product_name: Apple Watch SE (2nd Gen) [GPS 40mm] Smartwatch with Starlight Aluminium Case with Starlight Sport Band S/M. Fitness and Sleep Trackers, Crash Detection, Heart Rate Monitor, Retina Display
description: It’s understandable that the battery is small and the watch does a lot but I’ve had it a few days and it spends more time on the charger (about 3 hours to charge from 20-30% to 100%) than I spend using it. Made sure to turn the brightness down as far as I can and remove anything that might be draining it, but it did not help. I might use the watch to tell time, start a walk timer, or hit the X to not answer a call, very little use. Clearly it’s working its little heart out in the background b/c the battery barely lasts a day. The time it takes to recharge just seems excessive. It has so many more features than I am capable of using. It’s fun and gadgety but my old FB which lasted years and did everything I needed it to do with only having to charge it once a week for about 3 hours was probably the better option for me.I could kick myself for not doing more research because there are other generations that have a better charging quality for less money. I purchased this during Amazon‘s big sale days in October and thought it was a good price & chose it b/c it was smaller but in retrospect, I should’ve gone with a different generation.Really just disappointed but hoping to see some benefit from keeping it.

product_name: Apple Watch SE (2nd Gen) [GPS 40mm] Smartwatch with Starlight Aluminium Case with Starlight Sport Band S/M. Fitness and Sleep Trackers, Crash Detection, Heart Rate Monitor, Retina Display
description: I am not very tec savvy but even a customer service rep couldn’t help.  I took it to where I got my phone and they are experts with the product since they sell them and service them.  It took her over two hours to get it set up.  She has worked there over 10 years so she is not a newbie.I like all the functions, but I have trouble seeing the icons clustered on the face of the watch.  I had to return to my phone place to get the find my app to work.  I think once I get it figured out I will really like it.Battery life is a little less than a day so tracking sleep and exercise can make it hard to figure out the best time to recharge it.  Not sure yet how long it needs to fully recharge.

product_name: Apple Watch SE (2nd Gen) [GPS 40mm] Smartwatch with Starlight Aluminium Case with Starlight Sport Band S/M. Fitness and Sleep Trackers, Crash Detection, Heart Rate Monitor, Retina Display
description: Giving it three stars due to the battery life. I could be a bit longer for sure. I charge my watch overnight but the wife forgets to charge it everyday. If it was 24hr battery life that would be the perfect combo to make a good SE.

The battery life is great and it’s very comfortable to wear according to him. The screen size is great and it looks great on. It’s super easy to pair and it’s definitely a great watch for the price. Very very happy with my purchase.

product_name: Apple Watch SE (2nd Gen) [GPS 40mm] Smartwatch with Starlight Aluminium Case with Starlight Sport Band S/M. Fitness and Sleep Trackers, Crash Detection, Heart Rate Monitor, Retina Display
description: My wife had the original SE for the past few years.  While it worked fine, the battery life had started to become reduced.  While the latest models just got released, this added the funtions she most wanted with fall detection and heart rate monitoring.  This model has those features and is at a great price point.

product_name: Apple Watch SE (2nd Gen) [GPS 40mm] Smartwatch with Starlight Aluminium Case with Starlight Sport Band S/M. Fitness and Sleep Trackers, Crash Detection, Heart Rate Monitor, Retina Display
description: I love love love it. Nice size and looks really clean and new ofc! It charges fast and stays charged for awhile. Went through 24 hours and was still at 51% brightness is good and it’s so easy to use! Definitely worth the money!

product_name: Apple Watch SE (2nd Gen) [GPS 40mm] Smartwatch with Starlight Aluminium Case with Starlight Sport Band S/M. Fitness and Sleep Trackers, Crash Detection, Heart Rate Monitor, Retina Display
description: Apple eco system is great, battery life is meh have a phoenix 6 sapphire from Garmin lasts weeks and this a mer day but it does sync great with the Apple eco system and security Apple offers.

product_name: Apple Watch SE (2nd Gen) [GPS 40mm] Smartwatch with Starlight Aluminium Case with Starlight Sport Band S/M. Fitness and Sleep Trackers, Crash Detection, Heart Rate Monitor, Retina Display
description: I bought the Apple Watch SE 2 with a starlight white band and case during Prime Day and couldn’t be happier. It’s a great value for the price, especially if you’re already in the Apple ecosystem. Pairing it with my iPhone was a breeze. The watch is both stylish and functional, perfect for workouts or a night out. I debated between the LTE and Wi-Fi only models, but ultimately decided that Wi-Fi was sufficient. Even when I go for a jog, I’m usually back to my phone within a short time. If you’re looking for a reliable and affordable smartwatch, I highly recommend the Apple Watch SE 2.

product_name: Apple Watch SE (2nd Gen) [GPS 40mm] Smartwatch with Starlight Aluminium Case with Starlight Sport Band S/M. Fitness and Sleep Trackers, Crash Detection, Heart Rate Monitor, Retina Display
description: Bought this for my wife so far she loves it ,although we had a scare because of her older Iphone generation did not want to pair up with her newer watch's settings . She updated the phone settings & luckily they now can communicate with each other. What a scare, so be careful & carefully review your present iphone's compatiblety.

product_name: Apple Watch SE (2nd Gen) [GPS 40mm] Smartwatch with Starlight Aluminium Case with Starlight Sport Band S/M. Fitness and Sleep Trackers, Crash Detection, Heart Rate Monitor, Retina Display
description: Didn’t realize this watch is not able to setup cell service. Meaning no data plan. Meaning you always have to have your phone with you. Which is fine I guess because it will save me $20/month. Otherwise, I really love this watch. I used to be a loyal Fitbit customer. But my 3rd one stopped working and the app has less and less features every year. But I digress. The iWatch has helped me start caring about exercise and my steps again. And it seamlessly works with your iPhone. It’s so nice being able to take calls and see notifications. Watch is great just a little disappointed about the cell service situation because I would have liked to go on walks without my phone. But it’s a good value so it’s worth the sacrifice.

product_name: Apple Watch SE (2nd Gen) [GPS 40mm] Smartwatch with Starlight Aluminium Case with Starlight Sport Band S/M. Fitness and Sleep Trackers, Crash Detection, Heart Rate Monitor, Retina Display
description: First off I would recommend this watch. Kind of wish I would have gone with a bigger face.Glad it is not any smaller than it is.Set up was super easy. Just make sure that you have upgraded to iOS 18.0.1.I suspect that you will like what they have done to the phone with this update.I am sure that I have yet to figure every thing out.I also recommend getting a protective case for it also as I have read that the face scratches easily.I like that there are numerous watch faces to choose from.When this watch runs out of juice I will be looking for the next SE watch that is available for purchase.

product_name: Apple Watch SE (2nd Gen) [GPS 40mm] Smartwatch with Starlight Aluminium Case with Starlight Sport Band S/M. Fitness and Sleep Trackers, Crash Detection, Heart Rate Monitor, Retina Display
description: I had a second generation Apple Watch (for 8 years) and it fell and broke beyond repair. Since I was not willing to pay what an actual Apple Watch costs these days, my son found this one for me and it is brand new.I paired it with my IPhone and it has even more features than the one I previously owned. I am extremely happy and satisfied with it. Highly recommended for those who want an Apple Watch but don’t want to spend as much.( Bought new bands and case for protection)

product_name: Apple Watch SE (2nd Gen) [GPS 40mm] Smartwatch with Starlight Aluminium Case with Starlight Sport Band S/M. Fitness and Sleep Trackers, Crash Detection, Heart Rate Monitor, Retina Display
description: Purchased this Apple Watch for my dad who is completely new to any kind of wearable technology and he loves it. Took a few minutes to get set up and synched with his iPhone which was seamless! The Watch has a handy intro process that helps anyone acclimate to it and get settled. I'd highly recommend this watch as a gift for any occasion, especially for those who don't need the latest & greatest in technology but want something functional, durable and still smart.
